column6: Love Vineapple! Delicious hummus, great mulled vine - a very charming Brooklyn spot.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful space with large indoor seating area and outdoor seating. I love that they offer coffee in mugs and glasses instead of only disposable cups. They offer a lot of food and are a bar in addition to coffee and pastries - I'll have to come back!

Great local brunch / coffee spot. Perfect to bring family or friends visiting. Not on the main drag in BK Heights which was nice to have some attractions on a side street. Decorated so cute on the inside with their fun pineapple theme. Would also come back for a coffee to go. Seems like they may have a night life too with their loaded bar. Will be back!
No comment
No comment

Cute little cafe that has a few tables outside and more tables inside than you'd anticipate at first glance. Good brunch option in the area. They do jazz nights on Sunday which I've been meaning to go to but hasn't yet.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for brunch with friends. Cute spot. I ordered an Arnold Palmer to drink and love that it came in a cute pineapple glass. The drink was also delicious, just the right amount of sweet. For my entree I ordered the Shakshuka. It was a different take than I'm used to on this dish. The marinara sauce in place of the roasted peppers and tomatoes gives it a much different flavor. Still good just different. My boyfriend got the burger which was awesome. I would definitely return to try some other items on the menu.
No comment
No comment
Great local spot! Very busy, but good. The egg sandwich is great! Crispy bread and really good tomato jam! And the eggs aren't dry!
No comment
No comment

Sizeable space and really cute vibe. The place had plenty of different types, but mainly people working over a coffee, light food, or drinks. The cafe had a busy yet calm, quiet vibe that made me feel like I was out and about amongst people yet able to keep to myself and do my own thing. Really good vibes.

Went on Valentines Day to grab coffee. It was super cold so we ended up staying there. They had a Valentine Day mixer so they had to close the area early for the event but they let us stay till the very last minute and didn't rush us. Its super cute inside with exposed brick walls and fairy lights hanging from the ceiling. The lattes were AMAZING! We got hot lattes with vanilla syrup and one with oat milk and another with whole milk. I really wanted some latte art and the barista actually told us he didn't know how to but he still tried and it looked so cute!
No comment
No comment
Was served nuts after letting server know of the allergy. Be cautious if you have any serious allergies. Wait time is very slow

I loved the vibes, coffee, and community support here. This cafe and casual restaurant combo has live jazz on Sunday nights and great happy hour deals. My friends and I stopped by for brunch after skating in Brooklyn Bridge Park. We waited around 40 minutes for our table and ordered coffee to start. They serve Devocion coffee here, which means it's strong, smooth, and hits hard. However, I didn't really like my B.L.A.T. The bread was over toasted, so that each bite tasted like crunching on a crouton. It was very dry and I peeled it back to reveal a quick drizzle of sauce. I asked the waiter for more sauce and he brought back a whole cup of it which helped. The sandwich also didn't have much bacon. The thin strips of bacon and meager amounts meant that most of the time I was crunching through a lettuce, avocado and tomato sandwich. This made me sad because I love BLTs and have never had a bad one.
Grabbed brunch and the reviews on the environment didn't miss. The breakfast burrito was good and the portions was just right.

I do not normally take the time to write reviews, good or bad. But my experience at Vineapple was so outstanding I feel the need to share. While the food & drinks were really good, our service was outstanding. Our server Claire made our brunch experience so lovely even though the restaurant was packed & she had to service the whole restaurant practically alone. Claire was attentive & took care of us even though we saw she was the only server working. She didnt even make us feel like she was too busy for us even though she clearly was slammed. Everything was great & I cant wait to come back & hopefully have Claire as our server again!
No comment
No comment
Good vibe, ambiance, food, and coffee but their tipping system is crap where the server holds the device while the options to tip are between 20-25%. Very awkward and pressured situation.

Good food, good service, and a really cute atmosphere. I  made a reservation for 8 people about a week out and they were able to accommodate us no problem. If you find yourself in downtown Brooklyn, definitely check it out.

Vineapple Cafe knows how to do brunch right. The service was super friendly, and quickly changed out table from outdoor to indoor when it started raining. The cold brew was served in an adorable pineapple shaped glass, but most importantly, was rich in flavor. My egg scramble with olive toast was delicious. I also enjoyed the bite of my fiancé's mortadella sandwich, which was similar to those we recently ate in Rome. We also split a rhubarb scone - yum!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was the cutest little Cafe I've been to in a while. It's so peaceful and quiet. Didn't eat food, but I  worked on some of my assignments for my business (15  years old with a business, not to brag) and I ordered a frozen coffee. I'm not one for strong coffee but every sip I had was amazing. It had a dark chocolate aftertaste,  with a tang of sweetness. 100% recommended!!!! Also very kind employee's!
I loved coming for trivia night! Drinks were good, they had some interesting cocktails. The host of trivia was fun.
Wow, their famed frozen mint lemonade is the bomb to have on a sunny spring afternoon in a backyard with good company.  If you aren't sold after reading that, you are definitely a weirdo.
No comment

Delightful little spot to have brunch. We came in late morning and were sat in the garden area. Our server was prompt and very sweet. We ordered the large charcuterie board, the corn chowder, and a breakfast burrito with smoked chorizo. All the food was amazing. The charcuterie board could easily feed three. I would definitely make a reservation if you plan on sitting outside as the outdoor seating is limited. If you can sit in the garden, there's great artwork painted on the walls outside. It was a very pleasant experience indeed.

Worth a stop in. Friendly service and a delicious delicious oat milk mocha enjoyed outside on a beautiful weekend morning. The place was bustling during on the weekend and everything that came from the kitchen looked spectacular. Especially as COVID cases rise once more, consider coming here for a nice weekend brunch to enjoy the sun and good vibes.

Horrible service and shitty food; host was unwelcoming and ignored us then told us to seat ourselves at the hightop when 2 regular tables were open the entire time we were there. Food took nearly 30 minutes to prepare and was very mediocre.
No comment
Terrible service. If they're hosting a party just turn around and go somewhere else. You will wait 30 minutes for someone to pour you a beer. Very disappointed.
Great place to eat. Very cute ambience. Fast food services and quality was pretty good 4/5
Came just for some drinks but would like to try their dine in menu sometime. Quite unique and an obviously popular spot for many people.
No comment

I came here on a whim one day and I was in a situation where the other 2 people I was meeting with were running extremely late. I explained the situation to the person seating me and even though the place was a bit busy, they still seated me and checked on me frequently until the rest of my party arrived. I looooved the music choice and the food and drinks were very good. The ambience was the cherry on top.

We were on the hunt for some good tiramisu for dessert, and wandered in at the end of the day. After looking through their menu, we also wanted to try the apple bread pudding. We were prepared for the staff to tell us that they had sold out of their desserts for the day, since their dessert display in the front looked empty. But the main server sat us down and was able to serve us our desserts. This little cafe was so cute and cozy with its pineapple decor. I recommend popping for desserts and cocktails in if you're with some good company.

Vineapple cafe was a great place to stop for a drink and pastry. The staff was very friendly and the outdoor seating was nice. My morning bun was buttery and delicious and the matcha latte was perfect as well. After 3PM all the pastries are 50% off which I think is awesome! I would def come again.

Came here for brunch one weekend and had a great time. They have a really cute backyard area with cool art and plants. The drinks were very tasty and lots to choose from. I went with their eggs Benedict and thought it was done very well. Loved the  prosciutto and their sauce was clearly fresh. Will come back for sure.

Vineapple Cafe's ability to reinvent itself during the pandemic is very impressive as it transformed from a regular coffee shop to a full blown restaurant/bar/coffee shop. I've had the pleasure of stopping by here a few times to enjoy a nightcap and recently dinner. There are outdoor seating options out front and in the backyard - a great spot for a casual hangout or date. The menu is creative and the service has always been excellent. Bread pudding dessert is a must try!

Cool, casual café that's perfect for a coffee break or lunch date. I was meeting a friend in Brooklyn and we met up here for lunch. Seems like a local hangout with some people working on their laptops and others having a leisurely coffee break or lunch.
I had their breakfast sandwich with avocados, which was overall good, but wish they had more meat options other than pork.

This is my favorite cafe/bar/restaurant in all of Brooklyn Heights. The staff is super friendly and the coffee and food are both great. They also have a surprisingly excellent cocktail program. Would highly recommend to anyone in the area.

Attended a private party here for a wedding brunch this past weekend and it was wonderful. The whole restaurant was reserved for our party and we even had a little patio space outside in the back to spread out. I love how they commit to the theme and had pineapples everywhere. The coffee was GOOD! Strong and hot - just how I like it. They were generous on the amount of food they kept bringing out and everything we tried was delicious. It's a really cute restaurant and I look forward to returning.

What an awesome spot. Inside and outside seating. Dinner menu was on point. Soup was so tasty and the bread was also. Farro bowl quite fresh and healthy. Service was good. Would come back for sure. Bar menu looked nice as well.

I was really excited to check out Vineapple's Halloween special -- There were three special drinks on the menu and one special entree which I got for the night. We ordered the 3 for 20 charcuterie board with truffle cheese, prosciutto, and parmesan. The board was very tasty -- the parmesan and prosciutto in particular had very rich, aged flavors. The drink had a nice presentation, and was extremely strong in a not good way -- the other ingredients in the cocktail did not come through. While the pasta presentation was great (the noodles were black!) and there was a decent carb to veggie/protein ratio, the serving was quite small and lacked flavor. It tasted like butter noodles, with a lack of depth. This was my third time coming and my summary of Vineapple -- drinks okay, food subpar, but would go again for the charcuterie appetizers.

If you like a quant and cozy ambiance and outstanding food that is wholesome, fresh, and delicious, the Vineapple Cafe is for you! Further, the staff is also top-notch and will really impress you. And in my own personal experience, if there's any kind of an issue, they will see that you are taken care of. Lastly, the Vineapple Cafe is located in an extremely beautiful part of Brooklyn: Brooklyn Heights. My partner and I often take a walk on the very picturesque Brooklyn Heights promenade before or after lunch or dinner at Vineapple Cafe. The promenade has without question, breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline!
HEALTHY, TASTY food. Super nice staff. Enjoyed the meal at nearby Cadman park = Perfect setting.
Cute spot for coffee but I wouldn't go back for the food. My egg sandwich would have been better (and a 1/5 of the price) at most bodegas around the city
No comment
Met a friend there and had a delicious breakfast burrito and coffee. Great outdoor area and backyard. Sat inside evenly spaced from others. Service was great!
This place has such a cute vibe. There's an outdoor garden and dining in the front too. Love the cocktails here and the dinner was amazing too.
No comment
No comment

Great service, nice atmosphere to get brunch. Only get the egg scramble with toast if you want to be a total beast All day, I had 3 people come to my table to ask me what elegant brunch I got, safe to say they won't be disappointed!

Quite a busy brunch spot on a quiet set of streets named after some fruit. I had my pup with me so we sat in the garden area. Even though the service wasn't good (took about 20 minutes for the server to come by to take our order), the cocktails came out quickly and the Eggs Benedict wasn't bad. Price is pretty standard for the area. Menu was your standard brunch fare with items such as avocado toast or a breakfast sandwich. This spot was nothing special and I would probably just take a coffee or latte to-go if I were to stop by next time, although Joe's Coffee Company is also close by.
No comment

Why is the staff so rude? Every time I come in, I am given SO much attitude by the register staff. I feel bad to leave a review like this, but I am really upset over being treated so inhumanly by a wait staff. I get it, service jobs are tough, but I have left Vineapple crying twice.
Great neighborhood vibe. Looks like a coffee shop on a cute old building but it is so much more! Excellent high end fare served in the back room!
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Delicious! Amazing place, the food was delicious! Recommended place and stay in the garden or inside. At the menu did not have coffee options, but they have a lot.

this is the only restaurant in all of NYC that serves salads that are turning yellow and spoiling. I wonder if this even compliant with health inspection. Just don't order anything with salad. Everything else should be fine.
The food was surprisingly good. We had a salad, entree and dessert. Everything was delicious. The drinks were well made and the staff was helpful. Would love to come back to enjoy the outdoors patio.

Wanted a fun brunch spot for myself and 3 teenage girls, this was spot on perfect. Both sweet and savory options, delicious smoothies and great coffee. The atmosphere and decor were perfect, looking forward to going back!

Great outdoors seating with a beautiful garden backyard. The food was amazing. We had the wild mushroom crostini, spicy soppressata and chorizo, asparagus and artichoke salad and honey roasted carrots and cauliflower. Everything was delicious and tasted like quality ingredients.
the food was delicious and the presentation was stellar! we ordered cocktails, a meat & cheese board, and the squid ink pasta. delightful atmosphere with personable staff!

We had our wedding at Vineapple, and I can say with 100 percent confidence that if you are looking to host a small private event, you will be absolutely thrilled with the hospitality and flexibility of the team at Vineapple. Jennifer, Chef Diego, and the rest of the team bent over backwards to help us create the perfect menu for the evening, and it was all executed flawlessly. Our guests could not stop raving about the food and drinks. Beyond this amazing night, we have eaten at Vineapple several times; the menu is fabulous and there's something for everyone. We especially love the Sea Drift cocktail, the burrata crostini, and the paninis.
I attended a holiday party here and had light bites...house made hummus,,,hot chocolate etc.  we're delicious.  Nice staff also.  I plan to come back for brunch.
Love vineapple, love the food, the seating options, the vibes, not the coffee and not the prices.

Can only comment on the coffee and service.  If the good looking sweet guy with the mini locks makes your coffee you are going to be happy, if the bitchy blond with mask and glasses serves it to you the experience diminishes considerably.  Vineapple - Please move her from the register!  Her negative stink bitch attitude is too much to deal with in the morning (actually it is always too much).  She really should be in the back and not dealing with customers.  I have sent many people there because the coffee is great and the male barista is spectacular (great latte artist) and they all come back complaining about that low energy asshole that took the order.

Nice spot, beautiful street, unique menu, was surprised at the service. Obviously this is a popular place and two out of our group really liked their food, several others didn't care for it, sometimes that happens. A few opportunities on service, we asked for several things during our meal and the server forgot both at two different times and never came back, didn't ever refill drinks or ever check to see if all was good with our food. I'm sharing examples in hope it helps. Also surprised that the owner told a previous reviewer they're going to hell, yeah I just read that.

Friendly neighborhood coffeeshop/cafe. have come here for coffee and pastry as well as brunch and was satisfied both times. They have a nice outdoor setup for Covid times. just be sure to read the menu carefully. The eggs Benedict have avocado, which I am allergic to. Fortunately the waitress replaced the entree for no charge which I didn't expect and even though it was my error in not reading the menu carefully.  The scones and muffins are delish also. I'll definitely be back.

We had our company event here last night, and we were all blown away: the food was delicious; the drinks were yummy; and all the staff from the amazing bartenders to hosts and servers were super attentive, friendly and a joy to be around. And the backyard space was perfect for our party!! If you're looking for a space for your party, look no further -- this is the spot!
This place is just super lovely! That's a pity I didn't notice it before. I will come here again for sure!

Amazing spot! Such a great addition to the neighborhood!! Amazing breakfast and great drinks to choose from. Best part they are dog friendly, even brought out our little guy a puppy snack. Thanks Vineapple!!!
No comment
The gentleman with the man buns and beard was extremely helpful and sweet. 5 stars truly.
My favorite coffee shop in Brooklyn heights. Cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. Great lattes and their egg scramble is amazing.

$6+ latte (12 oz). Really!  To add insult, listed as $5.50 on the menu. Just list the actual price including any cc fees on the menu. Then I will know what choice makes sense - and this does not. $5.50 is bad enough!
What can I say, they never disappoint. Always delicious, always beautiful presentation, never watered down.
No comment

Vineapple recently underwent a complete re-branding and I'm all here for it; a great choice in the neighborhood if you're looking for an excellent brunch experience, or simply want to catch up with a friend over a fine hand-crafted cocktail. There are several different food menu options for anytime of the day, but their tapas and small plates to share seem to be the hit at Vineapple. Seating is available out front on the street, indoors, and out on their large backyard patio. Servers are friendly!

I would definitely come back again. I found this cafe after visiting the brooklyn bridge in the morning and I'm so glad I did. I got the breakfast sandwich with bialy and a hazelnut latte. The sandwich was very flavorful and satisfying. The latte wasn't too sweet either. My brother enjoyed their almond croissant and hot chocolate. I would recommend making reservations to enjoy sitting inside their cute cafe, but their outdoor area was also quite lovely. They are also dog-friendly
Spectacular food and atmosphere. Family owned and a great chef with a superb team. Can't wait to go back!!

We placed our orders during happy hours and were charged regular price for the food and drinks. The food and drinks was good but still not an excuse. We told the cashier and he said I'll give a discount next time.

One of our favorite restaurants in the neighborhood! The food is terrific, healthy and yummy. They have the best gluten free bread as well as gluten free pastries and oat milk and almond milk. This is wonderful for me since I eat dairy free and gluten free. The atmosphere is lovely, and the staff is great!
Love this place, great vibe and the food quality is fabulous! Definite recommend for bestie dates, partner dates etc.

I was here this morning and our server was very rude. We sat out back because they said they had heaters, but none of them worked. Our server had an attitude the entire time and made us feel like we were being a pain for asking for the heaters and a water bowl for our dog. Also at the end he asked for our card to pay but we never saw the bill. So we asked to see the bill and he kept repeating our bill total amount and again made us feel like we were being high maintenance for asking to see the bill before paying. It was very awkward.

Very good food for dinner but an extremely limited menu. The chefs are very talented and could probably do good to branch away from just Italian. The drinks are innovative and well executed. Will come back especially if the menu is longer.

Adorable little brunch spot with outdoor seating out front and in the garden in the back. Delicious brunch menu got the eggs Benedict and it was lighter with a side of arugula salad. Shared a pitcher of bellinis and that were heavy on the cava! Wonderful all around, will be back!

I finally made it to Vineapple and was very pleasantly surprised. They have a full bar, from which you can order a very good dirty martini, among other things. Try the charcuterie combo for appetizer, then one of their flatbreads. The main menu is a bit limited, but definitely worth sampling, fir instance the chicken skew. And, if the season is right, make sure to reserve a table in the backyard. Though the inside is also very charming (if you are fully vaccinated, in covid times).
Great place for brunch in the neighborhood esp. love the breakfast burritos. I would come back more often if the service wasn't so surly!
No comment
No comment

What a perfect addition to the neighborhood. There is just nothing like it. Great coffee shop AND bar AND restaurant in one! The lattes are perfection. Most of the cocktails I've tried have been great (I loved the fall special with the egg white... and the holiday coquito... and the spiked cider...I could keep going). I haven't found a bourbon cocktail yet that wowed me but it's not stopping me from loving this place. All the food I've tried so far has been delicious (butternut squash soup especially) and the staff is all very friendly. Not sure if they're still doing it but when they first opened, they had musical Mondays where they would play showtunes inside and it made this theater gal very happy. I love their backyard and I look forward to eating inside once it's safe again. Everyone should be lucky enough to have a Vineapple in their neighborhood.

I am thrilled that Vineapple was able to reopen during Covid. The new menu is simply divine!  The choices are creative and the food is super fresh and delicious.  I have been 3 times since they reopened and brought a friend for brunch this past Sunday. We were both so happy to be seated in the adorable back garden.  The service was top notch and our food (avocado toast on Caputo's olive bread and the prosciutto and tomato jam panini) was incredible.  There is nothing like it in Brooklyn Heights!  I am officially a Vineapple regular.
Vineapple has become my new "local". Great backyard space, solid food and good libations.

A total neighborhood gem. Great sandwiches and coffee. Pleasant seating area outside on a quiet street. Really nice staff. You feel like they appreciate your business. Definitely will keep coming and I hope they expand their menu

What a warm and friendly staff. I highly recommend this place for a delicious brunch, happy hour get-together or daily coffee run. The frozen cocktails are a must. The wine, meat and cheese selections are a perfect date night treat. You can tell the owners really put their heart and soul into every detail. Their backyard is one of the  most serene outdoor patio dining spaces in NYC. We love visiting this charming establishment!

Loved Vineapple!  Such a cool ambiance - especially the urban backyard - and delicious food. Staff could not be more accommodating - we showed up with extra people for our brunch reservation and they were welcoming and helpful.   Highly recommend for a great brunch experience in beautiful Brooklyn Heights.

Amazing food, solid drinks, and a fresh, fun atmosphere - this restaurant is a great spot. The food is amazing. I would extra-recommend it as a date spot because its low key and comfortable, but you still feel like you're in a special place.
I've eaten here a few time now and the service is unmatched! The food is just as good as the friendly staff, which is to say.. EPIC! Don't skip over this quaint little gem in Brooklyn Heights
Love this spot. Super cute and charming cafe and cocktail bar. Dinner was also surprisingly delicious. The steak and truffle Mac were to die for.

Such a cute little spot! I can here on a whim with some friends and we had such a great experience. We ordered some spiked ciders and their banana pudding and it was such a great choice. The staff was very sweet and attentive even when they got really busy. Definitely coming back here!

I like you Vineapple Cafe, I like you a lot. You have really set the bar high and I'm afraid everything that comes after you will appear to be miserable. This place is a real treat whenever I visit the area! I love your coffee! The workers were very knowledgeable and kind. 5 stars for the service and the overall vibe of the place.

I was so excited to see that Vineapple reopened. I loved it before and it's so much better now! Great coffee and pastries in the morning, cocktails and charcuterie in the evening.  It's my favorite neighborhood spot!
No comment

An all-around fantastic experience. By far the best egg sandwich I have ever tried. A very creative menu that reeled me in for more. The coffee was delicious. I loved the decor and the staff was very welcoming and friendly. Can't wait to go again.

This place really turned around with the new management. Really cozy space -- much needed for the hood. Great coffee and menu and the cocktails are awesome. The food is surprisingly creative and really high quality. Fun outdoor seating too. They are doing an excellent job with Covid protocol.

This is a favorite Brooklyn Heights eatery, recently reopened by new owners/management. Small and clean. They have a charming roadside section, and a good back patio, in addition to safe indoor dining. They recently changed their menu, which is why I'm not giving them 5 stars. The previous menu was absolutely fabulous! The new one is less so. The portions are quite small and the prices have gone up. Most importantly, they have eliminated their 71 Burger which was the best hamburger I've ever had. Please bring back the burger! It is truly missed. Thank you for being here, however, and we will continue to come by.
Since reopening, this place is fantastic. We love the food, ambiance, and service. They also take all the proper Covid precautions.
Great food! Wonderful service and friendly staff! Spectacular cocktails and a beautiful space. Vineapple is a gem.

Looks like a coffee shop, but it so much more! Our Valentine's dinner was such a treat due to their great service and delicious food. They also provided really tasty pre- and post-dinner mini cocktails in fun shot glasses. We ate outdoors and the weather wasn't an issue with their great space heaters and covering. Alex was attentive and warm even though we were extremely late. I'd highly recommend you try Vineapple out today.
My go-to spot. Great for all-day dining, and they have frozen cocktails! Staff is super great, too. Can't recommend it enough.

Vineapple Cafe is back! And better than ever. I was always a patron of Vineapple Cafe, and was very upset when they temporarily closed - now they're back with a revamped menu, cocktails and as always the best coffee! Will be back soon!
got a cold brew with an extra shot of espresso and loved it! just strong enough for my liking and definitely got my day going. had a splash of almond milk which was perfect!
Friendly staff. Coffee and panini were yummy. Lovely neighborhood I enjoyed walking around.

Excellent all day café with ample outdoor space nicely appointed with plants/flowers. Comprehensive coffee menu with pastries as well as some hot breakfast items. Have never been later in the day but they serve beers/cocktails/wines served with bar snack type food (charcuterie, soup, salad) - and a daily happy hour. My favorite place for coffee in BK heights.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Pretty solid Georgian food, but value might be better at Ubani. We tried Chefs Megruli with the smoked cheese and preferred the parts without the smoked cheese. I think the smoked cheese detracted from the dish, the original is better (and I am a lover of smoked cheese). We also had the lamb kebab mtsvadi which was well seasoned but also well done. I prefer my lamb more medium but maybe this is just the style? They didn't ask how we like the meat cooked. The honey cake was dry, not my favorite. I'm between a 3 and 4 on this review, I'd give them a weak 4. The host was very friendly and the wait staff was slow at refilling our waters but friendly as well. We came for an early dinner around 6ish, the restaurant really filled up by the time we left

Wow, have never tried cuisine from Georgia (country not state) but not did I leave impressed! Try the dumplings, the Georgian pizza, the Georgian salad, the skewers... left very pleased and pleasantly surprised. Atmosphere was nice and so was the service. No complaints. Would come back
Food was great, portions were well sized and all delicious. Service very warm & friendly. Can't wait to come back! Don't sleep on the mini mushroom dumplings!
I'm so glad we took a chance and went to this new Georgian restaurant. Not only was the service great, the food was spectacular.

Delicious food and excellent atmosphere, as well as exceptional service. We thoroughly enjoyed sampling Georgian cuisine and discovered we had to come in a few times to try different things in the menu. A definite NYC must.

The food is so delicious. Each dish was better than the last.  If you're looking for a brilliant and authentic Georgian meal in midtown Manhattan this is the place to go. You cannot go wrong with Aragvi     Enjoy :)

WOW! I visited for the first time today and the food was stunning, just delicious! I haven't been this excited about a new restaurant is ages, and the prices and portions are good for midtown and the service impeccable. I can't wait to try more of the menu!

They just opened in January 2023. Everything is brand new. Service is fantastic. Food is awesome. Ordered Khinkali with pork, a kind of Georgian dumplings, and Adjaruli, like a pizza but with considerably more cheese inside.

I really liked the restaurant decor - tastefully done. I had the chef's dumplings (thinkhali) which  I found a bit salty for my taste. For the price it should have come with a side or something. I will go back there again to try something else different.
Delicious freshly made food, excellent service, reasonable prices, nice spacious dining room
Aragvi is a great new spot to get dinner, every dish was delicious and we tried many that were new to us and loved them. We will be back to try more!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I was really expecting the cream puffs to be mind blowing but there were quite average to me. They are definitly really cute which I understand why there was so much hype surrounding this dessert shop. However, I found my new goto place for iced vanilla lattes. I had a iced vanilla latte 2 years ago and the cafe shut down. Ever since then I have been trying to find a vanilla latte that tasted close to the one I had and I was alwyas disappointed. This cafes vanilla latte is amazing and I am so glad I decided to give it a try.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I love cream puffs, so naturally when I saw a new cream puff spot opened I had to try. The space is cute, a decent size and there are a few tables inside for you to sit down and enjoy your pastries and puffs at. I tried the banana chocolate, tiramisu, black sesame, and ube. I'm a big fan of chocolate and banana so it's no surprise that my favorite was the chocolate banana flavor. The ube one had a very subtle ube flavor, the black sesame and tiramisu fillings were equally as good. The cream puffs are small enough so you can buy a few more to try and not be too full. Priced decently. Loved the texture of their crust. They're best enjoyed as soon as you purchase them so the crust won't get soggy I would think. I'll definitely be back to try their other pastries.

Such a fun snack and drink stop! The kids found this place online and we finally got a chance to visit. Very cute little cafe, clean and organized. Nice clean restroom for customers. They are doing very well handling the busy-ness of the cafe as well. No long lines. The food and drinks were all very good. We tried the unsweetened tea, a matcha latte, and a coffee latte. The food was delicious! We tried 2 flavors of the amazing cream puffs, rose lychee and tiramisu. We tried a cranberry scone and a matcha cream filled croissant. We were impressed with all of the above and will definitely return!

Butter Dose is a cute bakery that sells not only pastries but savory food. They had a bunch of options and everything looked so good that I had trouble choosing. I went with one of their pastrami crossant sandwiches and I thought it was pretty tasty. I also enjoyed their matcha creampuff, but I especially loved their strawberry matcha latte. It's so rare to find a place that's both cute and tasty so I was pleasantly surprised with this one. I'll most likely be back if I'm in the area!
No comment
No comment

Small underrated bakery specializing in cream puffs and this place satisfied my sweet tooth after dinner! The size of the cream puffs are pretty small, but I thought this was enough for me. These aren't too sweet and they're well flavored. I would've never expected an Asian inspired bakery from the outside! I'll definitely have to come back to try the other flavors and pastries. They have some small tables to catch up with a friend or do some work. The workers are really nice and helpful. I believe their coffee is by Coffee Project, so they definitely have quality drinks as well!
No comment

what a cute inside of the store! everything is bright yellow and has such a cute logo / design. the cream puffs are less than $5 and are all so cutely designed! we got the yuzu and strawberry sakura which was a seasonal puff. the puff pastry itself was not sweet but the filling was really light and creamy, and i loved the strawberry and mochi inside

I stumbled upon this place as I was walking through the neighborhood and decided to check it out since I was craving something sweet. As soon as you walk into this place it is bright, spacious, and the atmosphere is welcoming. Long story short I ordered one of each because my a** is greedy haha I was expecting the desserts to be very sweet, but I'm glad it wasn't which was a plus. When I normally eat a lot of sweets I feel disgusted but this left me satisfied and fixed the craving I had. I recommend anyone that is in the area to try this place out. I will return whenever I'm around.

cute little cafe in the east village with a unique variety of cream puffs, and other baked goods. the best part is that the flavors were subtle and didn't taste overwhelming sweet. only con is that they were tiny ):

The place is so cute with all the yellow. Staff was really nice and helpful. Appreciate all the different flavors of cream puff. 3.75 each but personally for me they were small and the cream was super sweet. I got lychee rose and strawberry Sakura!!
No comment

Made a quick stop during the afternoon with a friend. The outside of shop is easy to spot and the interior is even cuter. It was pretty busy so all seats were taken, they had a good selection of pastries which looked yummy but I went for their cream puffs. I got a matcha and tiramisu cream puff and they were both really tasty. The to go box was adorable and by the register they have free stickers that you can take! My friend and I each took one. I want to go try the rest of their pastries next time k go!

Never went into the actual store so this review is based purely on the desserts, but got a box of these from family and their cream puffs are fabulous y'all! We tried the chocolate banana, sesame, lime (key lime?), and tiramisu flavored ones and they came in a cute box - and decorated very nicely too. They're small but tasty and make such a nice gift.
No comment

Amazing new find in NYC. This bakery is gorgeous and the staff is so nice and friendly! The cream puffs, cookies and muffins were incredible! This place is a chocolate lovers paradise! Definitely will be back to try all their other beautiful treats!
No comment

This recently opened bakery in east village is so cute! The interior is really brightly decorated and there's a few tables, although they were all full when I came around 4 PM on a Saturday. There were a decent number of people inside, and some of the flavors were sold out. We got the black sesame and seasonal strawberry Sakura cream puffs, and they were both really good. I was surprised because only the cream on top of the puff is flavored, and the filling inside is just vanilla, but the flavors still came through. I especially loved the black sesame, since the flavor was really rich and strong. The strawberry one was solid, but I couldn't really taste the Sakura. They're pretty small and a little expensive for the price, considering you can get larger ones for only one or two more dollars at Alimama or Bibble and Sip, but I still really enjoyed them. Definitely want to come back to try their drinks and other baked goods (the croissants, cookies, and scones all looked amazing as well)!

Unique seasonal cream puff flavor: strawberry sakura! I wish I could finish it in more than 3-4 small bites because it was great! The iced strawberry matcha latte was also good, but I wish the strawberry flavor was a bit stronger.

New cafe in the east village/ Union Square adjacent. Great/friendly service, super reasonable coffee, great tea options, and even better desserts. The cream puffs and scones were amazing, which not surprising when you consider that all things are baked by their trained pastry chef. To top it all off the vibe of the place is chill, great amount of seating, WiFi, and a clean bathroom. Perfect for a friend date, regular date,  to get some work in, or people watch from the window counter seats.

Such a cute little spot to get coffee/tea and dessert! The service was great and staff were extremely friendly. We got to try the rose lychee, black sesame, chocolate banana, and the yuzu. I also ordered the strawberry hot chocolate which was absolutely insane and the matcha latte. The cream puffs were as good as they looked and the strawberry hot chocolate was my absolute favorite. The cafe has great vibes too and I loved the yellow tables! Thank you for your hospitality.
Definitely worth coming here for some coffee and desserts. Great place to hang out and study as well. Great staff and atmosphere.

Really good lattes & goodies! Well-known for their cream puffs which I haven't tried yet, but the prosciutto croissant sandwich was so good! A bit small but nice place to study if you're okay with some noise :)

Cute new cafe that opened up near union. Loved the decor and interior design- super cute. Their drinks were mid to be honest- wasn't impressed by the matcha and hojicha latte. Their cream puffs were cute and okay- puff was fresh and the cream inside was tasty.

A cute cafe spot with nice decor! Went with some friends and the cream puffs were delicious. Their oat pistachio latte was creamy and strong in pistachio flavor. The service was quick and friendly. Would make plans to return here again!

The white male cashier at the front was very rude (basically threw the spoon at me when I asked for another utensil) and was not helpful when I asked questions.  It was a super cute place and the desserts weren't overly sweet which I liked, but I wouldn't come back because of the service.
Very cute new bakery.  Cranberry scone is a must.  Not too crazy about cream puff. Very tiny and pricy. Blueberry muffin is ok.  Excellent customer service.

I like the interior decor and pastry options however their matcha latte wasn't made well. Needs to be heated and stirred before adding to milk option to dissolve better. But still check out this shop for a cozy bright meeting

Super cute and aesthetic cafe! I saw a Korean's girl's tiktok, she said this cafe very much reminded her of south korea! it's small, with cute decorations. the coffee and a the pastries are delicious!!

WOW!! Let me just say, customer service is excellent and the treats are so so good. I was helped by a woman with dark short hair and she was so kind and engaging, even telling me about the bakery's menu items when I mentioned I had worked at a bakery. She also offered to make a couple things fresh for me that had sold out prior. She was so warm and delightful. Just because of that interaction I'll be back again. Kudos to her !

came in for a quick bite before an appointment and oh my gosh is it good. i got the chicken coleslaw biscuit and they warmed it up for me and it is a 10/10 it's such a cute and clean spot with great prices and service will be coming back
Really cute place and friendly service. Had the rose lychee which was refreshing and true to flavor. Would definitely come here again
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

BRUNCH WAS CRAZYYY!!! The kimchi waffle was amazing. Not that spicy, but so fresh tasting with an almost mochi like texture. The black sesame French toast was the perfect amount of sweet, with so many different components
No comment

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I went to Monarch for the first time the other night & it is such a cute, cozy spot to grab dinner. The menu is pretty versatile and they have a good amount of veggie offerings. The chicken ginger dumplings were some of the best I've ever had, and I loved their shishito peppers - the sauce is so yummy. The spicy pork noodles are great as we get into colder weather, but I think they could've used a bit more heat. Will deff be back to try their cauliflower!

Came here for brunch on a Saturday. We got a table no wait around 11 am. It did fill up a bit more by the time with left an hour or so later, but still not full. They don't take brunch reservations, but doesn't seem you would need one. The aesthetics of this restaurant are amazing. It is super cute and everything is photo worthy. The staff were very friendly and attentive. We ordered a vegan breakfast banh mi and the fig jam egg sandwich. To note the menu online is slightly different than the brunch menu in house. The sandwich's are super unique with a cool combination of flavors, but it feels a bit too much at once in a bite. I wish the banh mi was a bit less oily like it was dripping every bite. The breads though are delicious. I heard they are made in the restaurant so definitely get something with bread. A super cute place for a friend meet up or a festive celebration. Overall a good experience and curious to try this place for a dinner.
No comment

If you ever are in Brooklyn, this is a well-worth stop.  The food, the drinks and the service are all top notch. Load up on appetizers and course, prices are great. The drinks are some of the best I ever had. A rare combo to find find great food with equally impressive specialty drinks. Truly on par with any high-end restaurant bar in Manhattan.
4.5/5 stars. I just wanna say the spicy cabbage is amazing but what was even better is the KFC Korean fried cauliflower. Cute place too

such a cool spot!!! the moment you walk in to the restaurant, you feel a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of metropolitan. very unique dining space. my husband and i are vegan and were so blown away by the menu. we've only been a couple times for brunch (including today) but the amazing fennel raisin toast, maitake bao buns, hangry panda, the veggie sando and the mushroom edamame dumplings are absolutely delicious. the mushroom thai sausage is unlike any vegan sausage i've ever had--it's house-made and the star of the menu if you ask me! order a side of it and thank me later. we were fortunate enough to meet the owner during our first meal here and he was so kind. thankful to have this spot in the neighborhood and can't wait to come back for dinner!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

On a busy Saturday night with everything else fully booked around me, I was lucky enough to get a couple of seats at the bar here. Surprisingly crowded for an unassuming restaurant I had walked past many times, but looking at the eclectic foods + drinks menu, it started to make sense! The cuisine is truly pan-Asian, and the drinks looked really fun even though we opted not to order any. The crispy cauliflower was very flavorful and presented well, although it felt like it could have been cooked crispier. The bibimbap main had a great assortment of vegetables (radishes especially lived up), but nothing really put it over the top. On the normal side of things price-wise. Nothing too special about this place to make me come back, but a solid option surely.
No comment

I went to this spot based on the Instagram of a vegan girl who said they had a lot of delicious options. We made a reservation for 6pm on a Thursday but the place was empty when we arrived. I was hoping to sit on the rooftop terrace but it was closed (not sure when they open it but they had outdoor seating in the front available). The ambiance is very cute & I loved the plates/bowls they used. I got the sangria to start with which I didn't like at all, the menu made it seem like it would have a fruity taste but it was tart and not for me. They also had a special rum slushee drink that my sister got which she liked and said it tasted like a pina colada. My favorite items that we ate were the mushroom buns and mushroom dumplings. Both were delicious and had unique flavors I enjoyed. My sister also liked the chicken dumplings which I didn't taste since I don't eat meat. We also tried the cauliflower which had a nice crunch to it but the spice of the peppers was a little too strong for my liking. The eggplant dish was also decent. Overall I liked this spot and would probably go back to try some other dishes.
No comment

The table they seated us at was quite precarious as it was on the sidewalk with quite a steep tilt. This was probably not the best place to sit, as it sometimes was tough to eat without worrying something would slide or tip over. The menu looked really nice so I was pretty excited to order. We didn't get quite as many items as they recommended for our party size, but I was still quite full at the end. The food was tasty, although some of it had slightly overpowering tastes such as too much black pepper. I think I would still come back though.
No comment

We had the BEST dinner at Monarch last night!  From the amazing (and beautiful) cocktails to the fresh take on shishito peppers, sauteed bok choy, chicken dumplings and noodles with shredded pork.  Service was outstanding, especially behind the bar where I was offered a fabulous wine not normally available by the glass.  Oh, and it's  very attractive restaurant.  We'll be back!

Here's an honest review, I would love to give this place 4 or 5 stars but I can't. The food was good, but felt underwhelming. I had seen people rave about this spot on tiktok and was met with mediocrity. The place was nice and the staff was alright, never really checked up to see if everything was alright despite us being right in front of the counter and I had to wave them over to get anything else I might need. I know I probably sound like some snob but I'm really not just have a certain expectation for restaurants. I would recommend this place if it happens to be after 5 and you are in the area and need somewhere to go. I wouldn't got out of my way for this place. That's just me though, I implore you to try it if you are curious and write your own thoughts as they may differ from mine
No comment

Everything was delicious! The cod in coconut lime broth was amazing. It was aromatic and had a nice spice to it. I wish I ordered a side of rice to enjoy with it!! I also had the Brussel sprouts and kimchi fried rice which were also awesome. You have to finish off the meal with the matcha ice cream sandwich! They make the cookies in house and it is perfectly chewy and the ice cream is not too sweet. I highly recommend this place!
No comment

They have a nice location with great atmosphere. Tried the Mushroom and Edamame Dumplings, Korean Fried Cauliflower and Beef on Baby Bok Choy. Both dumplings and the beef was okay, nothing extraordinary. Out of the three I would recommend you to try the Korean Fried Cauliflower. This can be a nice place with your friends for dinner and drinks.
Absolutely delicious food, we got the vegan version of everything. Drinks were also incredible. Great flavor and menu. Service was also excellent. Very cozy vibe downstairs and cute decor.
No comment
No comment
Great pork belly buns and chicken ginger dumplings. Lovely, airy and relaxed space. Friendly and fast service.
Some of the best Asian food I've had in Brooklyn. Everything we ordered, the spicy pork noodles, the cod, the calimari - it was all incredible. The cocktails were excellent too. Check this place out!
Intricate flavors, great detail, everything was honestly amazing. But Spicy sauce made me choke.

The food here is great! I think my favorites were the Korean fried broccoli and the Chili cabbage but really nothing disappointed you. The staff were all very nice, the music was good but not too loud, just enough to bring a nice energy to the place.  The drinks were excellent and the bartender made a point to chat with me while I was alone at the bar waiting for my friends.
No comment
Fantastic vegan menu, so flavorful. Brussels sprouts and cauliflower bao are two of my favorite dishes in NYC

Went to Monarch for dinner the other day. The Garlic Chicken and Chicken Dumplings were great, along with one of the cocktails. Would say one of my favorite places for Pan-Asian food in the city. Would definitely go again.
No comment
Wonderful dinner and drinks.   The team was super helpful and the food was great.   We loved the calamari, pork buns and bimbimbop!  Definitely try it!
The outside does not give this business enough justice. I absolutely loved the food, the Brussels sprouts were amazing. I would definitely recommend.
No comment

Good service and the drink was really nicely made. The dishes were a hit and miss. The Cauliflower was awesome, as were the pork belly buns. Malaysian noodles had almost raw potatos - when I was expecting chicken and the chicken in this dish was cooked with no marination it seemed. Chicken dumplings came out cold and dry and the crab Rangoon lacked crab. Frankly, I would go back for the pork belly buns and the Cauliflower but would be afraid to order new dishes.
No comment

So happy I now know this place exists! Such delicious food, especially the cabbage, pork belly buns, chicken dumplings and the pork noodle dish. Will be back to try more for sure. Our waitress was also friendly and super helpful with recommendations :)
No comment

My friend and I had the good fortune to snag two seats at the bar last night on a fully booked Friday evening. I have been wanting to try Monarch ever since it opened, and made a point of going once I found out it was under the same ownership as Rabbithole (another favorite neighborhood staple). The interior of the space, designed by one of the owners, has a casual elegance that is both warm and inviting. Every dish on the menu sounded tempting, so we decided on a sampling of small plates including crispy brussel sprouts, Korean fried cauliflower, and pork belly steamed buns that were our standout favorites, however, everything that came out of the kitchen was notable. To compliment this fine fare, we were served we were served an array of artisinal cocktails, personally curated for us by the talented mixologist behind the bar, Alex, whose conversation was as intriguing as his artistic concoctions. It was such a memorable dining experience, I am already looking forward to my next visit!
Fantastic food and a good option for a large group dinner where you can share a bunch of pates and try everything. They have a vegan section as well if that interests you.
No comment

We have come here a few times because the food is very good.  The issue I have is the service. The host had no idea what was going on and seemed rather frazzled when we asked if there was availability. He said no. Then said come back in a half hour and within 10 minutes called and said there was a table available which is fine.  Our waiter explained the several dishes is the best way to go but didn't give any recommendations or seemed to care at all. He never checked in with us. They brought the food all at once and when I questioned this he walked away.  He seemed overwhelmed with too many tables.  No one bussed our table. We stacked our own dishes and when I asked the waiter to take the dishes away he ignored me.  So we stacked it ourselves and it was never bussed.  He could have cared less.  The bartender when we came in was frazzled , the host was frazzled and the waiter seemed to not care at all.  So incredibly disappointing for such a good chef.  You really need to do something about your staff.  This isn't the first time it had been this way!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was a delicious culinary mix of chinese, korean, japanese and thai cuisine. Everything that was brought out impressed the table, notable winners were the kimchi salad, cauliflower, and coconut cod. The waitress and staff were so warm and inviting, the atmosphere was comfortable and un-intimidating.
No comment

Recently went to Monarch Theater restaurant with my brother before attending a concert in Williamsburg. We sat upstairs and the vibe was awesome. Service was attentive and all the food was spicy and delicious. We started with Steamed Shrimp Dumplings w/ XO sauce ($9) and Pan Fried Ginger Chicken Dumplings ($9), both of which I would highly recommend. For entrees, we both got the Szechuan Chinese Sausage, soft poached egg, dandelion, black garlic oil ($16) which was outstanding ramen perfect for a cold November day. Would definitely go back!

The fish curry was super disappointing and flavorless, very tiny bits of fish in a lukewarm broth. The Brussels sprout dish was good but for a meal that ended up being $70 I was super unimpressed, a bit of a bummer! 3 stars for our super chill waiter though.

I would have given five stars for the flavors of the food. First the place itself is nice.  We sat downstairs. It looks like there is an upstairs as well. Service was good and friendly  we ordered the Cod. Fried calamari    Some dumpling and a noodle dish.  They all were delicious.  Some of the better food i have had. The location  is perfect    Next to to my favorite Honky Tonk. Skinny Dennis.  Two complaints. It was cold outside and the restaurant was drafty. Also. The portion of Cod. In the dish was lacking.  Easy fixes.  Can't wait to come back and do a five star review

Came here on a Friday night and it was a little dead despite the trendy decor. The portions are a bit small for the price but pretty typical for the area. The menu is a mix of experimental Asian fusion dishes-- playful and fun to look at but not always satisfying. I enjoyed the crab Rangoon and pork buns. The cocktails were good. Would probably come back for a drink on the terrace when it gets warm.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Boyfriend took me to Monarch for my birthday dinner. The food was solid though pricey, which was to be expected in Williamsburg. The staff incredibly gracious and attentive to us upstairs when it was a few people and then even as the crowds grew on a Saturday evening. What really perturbed me though was the showing of a "classic" movie called The Good Earth (1937) that was essentially yellow face. Yeah, the white actors playing Chinese people won Oscars yet that doesn't account for the offensive display. We couldn't hear the film, thankfully, but we were right in the direction of viewing in the corner upstairs. Basically a front-row seat to something incredibly offensive. It'd be one thing if, perhaps, the owners were of Asian descent showing this film in mockery but I highly doubt that would be the case. Seeing that the owner often responds and he appears white that is even MORE disturbing to me as a patron and as a person of color to have to see yellow face alongside my dining experience of Asian food. Talk about appropriation. I think there should be way more respect for the diners and the food served to not show movies like this whether they're perceived as classics or not. That alone was enough for me to drop this to a 3-star rating. 4+ stars for the food but -10 stars for the lack of awareness.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Seriously the best place. I dream of the Brussels sprouts and the sesame noodles are everything.

We went here on a whim because it was near the Knitting Factory.  Everything was delicious - food and drinks.  The service was warm and friendly.  We will definitely be back.  Don't miss the eggplant in bean sauce, chicken dumplings, crab rangoon and the cocktails.
No comment

Simply delicious food all around at this gem of a restaurant in Williamsburg.  From the dumplings to the rice dishes to the spicy pork noodles to the wine selection I was loving all aspects of my experience at Monarch Theater.  The service was on point and the environs was very chill... (the music choices were odd - but oh well).  Will definitely return.
No comment
Minced pork noodles were some of the best spicy chili noodles I've had in the states and everyone was super friendly
Great ambiance. Nice terrace overlooking Metropolitan Ave. The sweet and sour pork belly is the best thing I've eaten this year.

Found this spot while trying to find a new place in the neighborhood to eat. And I'm glad I did. Everything was excellent. Sat at the bar and had the  chicken dumplings and spicy pork noodles (Dan Dan style) by recommendation of Jesse the bartender, who provided great service throughout.  I usually like a dipping sauce with dumplings but these didn't need it. Fantastic flavor and texture. The noodles were also excellent, but I prefer food spicier so Jesse hooked me up with some chili sauce and Sichuan oil. Perfect. Finished with the yuzu pie which was like a key lime but less sweet and yuzu flavored of course haha. One of the best desserts I've had in years. I'll definitely be back.

Such a great place - beautiful and cute, with flavorful and creative asian dishes. agedashi mushrooms were the best, but the Sichuan noodles were definitely tasty. The cod was less up our alley, and the dumplings were meh, but the atmosphere made up for it.

This place is SOO good. Great atmosphere (which is always important to me), AMAZING food, and v yummy cocktails. Came for brunch and got the chicken laksa, one of each of the dumplings (the edamame was my favorite), crab rangoon (had SO much crab in it) and everything was delicious. Will def be back to sit on the cute patio upstairs for dinner one evening!
No comment
Great ambiance and great food with plenty of vegetarian options. I highly suggest the spicy cabbage, the roti, the eggplant with black bean sauce, and the cold sesame noodles.

Stopped by for a last minute dinner and was extremely impressed by both the food and the service. Monarch nailed every dish that we had, the crab rangoon dumplings and pork buns were incredible. Our waiter Donado was also really great and helpful. We will absolutely be returning to try out the brunch and for more dinner.

I'm a huge fan of this place. The food is delish - everything is super tasty and shareable. I'm also happy that some things are actually gluten free that you wouldn't expect. Cocktails and atmosphere are great both inside and outside. Wait service is friendly. My fave dishes are the calamari, strings beans and cod but there are many good ones!
Love this restaurant the food is amazing!! Just be sure you can handle spice if you order one of their spicy dishes. The pork bellies were amazing!! Definitely recommending to all my friends!!
No comment

Fantastic place! We had the calamari (with amazing chilli sauce), the cod in coconut sauce, and the eggplant, all of which were tasty. But the highlights of the evening were definitely the crab rangoons and the pork belly. Be sure to get those!  The interior space is very nice and the outdoor patio takes it to the next level. Overall great experience!

I usually don't post reviews  about anything but I felt I had to with this new restaurant. This is my new favorite Asian place in the neighborhood. Amazing food and service as well. I loved the atmosphere. Every dish was perfect. Can't wait to go back again!
Super interesting food, beautiful rooftop patio, the owner took care of us and made sure we had a nice experience! Will definitely be back.

Best pork buns in Brooklyn. Great place solo, with a date, or with 8 friends. Waiters were super nice and enthusiastic about the food, with lots of knowledge on everything. Super cool vibe, the owner Lawrence even said hi to us and remembered us from his other restaurant Rabbithole, one of our favorites! Going back tonight and can't wait!

We walked in here on Friday night since we lived near by and saw that it had a great atmosphere.  We Started with the mezcal cocktail and gin cocktail, both amazing, not too sweet just the way we liked it.  Beautiful presentation.  For food, we wanted to try everything recommenced, so ended up ordering the spicy cabbage, chicken dumplings, and pork buns as appetizers, Eggplant and Pork Dan Dan Noodles to share as mains followed by the Yuzu Key Line Pie!  I definitely recommend the spicy cabbage, dumplings, and Pork Noodles, as well as the Yuzu Key lime pie, since it was suchan eye opener with the Yuzu and an amazing nutty crust.  Great food and drinks near home.  I'm so excited.  Thanks again!!

I discovered this restaurant walking around my neighborhood and love the patio on the 2nd floor. It has a great ambiance and is a wonderful date night spot. The pork buns are my favorite and I order them on seamless now when I am craving them.
No comment

Experiencing the chic ambience of Monarch restaurant for the first time, I thought now here's a vibe I have never felt before in hipster Williamsburg.  Living half a block away during its multi-year construction, I had occasion to watch its transformation from raw theater space to comely eating establishment.  Your servant has been there twice thus far, tasted about half a dozen dishes, sipped three glasses of wine, and been disappointed only...not yet.  I suggest you bring someone you want to impress and act like you've been there before.

We love the Rabbithole, so had to check out their new restaurant.  Such a cool space and the food is amazing.  We went with a group and ordered a bunch of dishes to share, which worked out great.   We had the dumplings, eggplant, onion roti, rice noodles, sweet and sour pork, and the cod and it was all amazing!!!

Food is super tasty and polished. So many delicious flavors! The ambience is also great-- good for a date night. Soft lighting and cozy space with clean and airy vibes. Even had some awesome gluten free options, like the fried squid that is coated in cornmeal. Will be back :)

A wonderful new spot that me and a friend just happened to stop into. Not only was the service impeccable, the food and cocktails were tasty, too. The pork buns were packed with flavor and the broth in the Szechuan noodle soup was so wonderfully balanced. Would totally recommend if you're looking for a lowkey spot for dinner.

Super excited about this new spot. They let us in at 1040 to order full dinner + beers when closing was at 11 (SO NICE OF THEM). Big fan of Rabbithole and the aesthetic/food/service was just as on point at Monarch. Ordered the chili cabbage salad and the spicy minced pork noodles, both delicious. Can't wait to come back

My bf and I decided to have his birthday there, and we had a lovely time! The food was all very well prepared. I'm usually pretty picky when it comes to Asian fusion restaurants, but this one is an example of an excellent one! We had the laksa, mushroom and the dumplings. The flavors were all unique and nothing was off one bit. The waiter took his time to explain the entire menu to us. Great experience!

Slow Service Bad Quality. We sat down at 7:35pm and didn't get our drinks until 8:10pm. Everything from the tabletop to the plates was made of plastic. The dishes tasted cheap and microwaved. Sake is way overpriced - $14 for 3 ounces. Such great potential for the space - what a waste.

Amazing food and minimal beautiful decor. We tried the pork belly buns, shrimp dumplings, cod coconut curry, schezuan Chinese sausage noodles and couldn't get enough!  I also loved how simple the menu was! Extensive cocktail menu as well and note that this is meant for sharing.
Swung by last night for dinner and oh my.... the food was delicious! Lots of different flavors/textures I have not had before and it was affordable (shocking). Will definitely be coming back.

I took my boyfriend and his family here for dinner and I was really nervous! I was really nervous for 2 reason; 1) his parents are very picky eaters when it comes to dining out 2) it was my boyfriends birthday so, of course, I wanted him to enjoy it! Fortunately, EVERYBODY really loved the food, drinks, and ambience of the place. My boyfriend ordered the sweet and sour pork, his sister and dad ordered the cod in coconut lime broth, his mom ordered the eggplant, and I ordered the spicy minced pork noddles and everything was delicious! We had the opportunity of sitting outside on the rooftop since it was a nice day out and the weather was perfect. Our waitress was really friendly and answered all of our questions. I do want to inform you if you are looking for a place that serves big proportions then I wouldn't suggest this restaurant since the proportions are not big. However, if you are looking for a place to enjoy the experience, drinks, and cuisine meal then this is it!!
No comment
THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. Great service, kind staff, amazing food. The drinks are delicious as well as the  dishes. 10/10 recommend. You MUST try the corn crème brûlée!

No comment

Really cute and delicious Busan cuisine! The raw scallops and the sea urchin dol sap were my favorite. Definitely a must try! I do wish the portions were larger because of how these dishes were priced but overall was satisfied. Service was great as well!
