This tapas style restaurant was absolutely divine. While the dishes doesn't necessarily remind me of busan, each plate was so good and bursting with flavor. The beef tartare had fried onions and chewy baby octopus bits with a sesame sauce. My favorite was the pork soup and glazed eel. The soup was comforting and the meat was so tender, perfect with some white rice. The glazed eel was crispy, spicy, and sweet but watch out for the little bones inside. I wish there were more avails for reservations because it takes about 3 weeks to get a table that's not at 9 or 10pm.
No comment

I really like the vintage yet modern feel of this restaurant. I was really hyped to come here after seeing it everywhere on social media. It definitely did not disappoint! We got the scallop diy gimbap to start and it tasted so fresh and I loved the apple kimchi that went with it. We also got the yook hwe and the flavors were great but the portion was so tiny. The dol sot al bap was good but I probably wouldn't get again. The spicy pork and squid was great, super tender pork and crispy squid paired together was amazing. Overall I think their food is really tasty and really fresh. However, my only complaint is that the portion sizes are pretty small for the price you're paying. I would go with a larger group next time so that I can try more dishes!

I made reservations about a week before I came. I liked the dolsot which is creamy rice with fish roe and the corn creme brûlée dessert. I thought that the eel eggplant was good but it was too fried for my taste. The portions are on the small side for the price. They also give a complimentary salad. I would recommend the corn creme brûlée the most. The service is great and it's a small restaurant with a dark ambiance. I could see why this place has four stars because of the uniqueness of the food and the service is good, but the food is not extraordinary.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The service is exceptionally friendly. The dishes came out at lightning speed. There were no misses in anything we ordered. The decor really does remind me of a hometown restaurant in Korea. Chefs kiss to this new addition to EV! I would gladly come back for more.
No comment

Ariari is a new staple restaurant that features Korean food from the Busan region. I loved everything I ate here! The seafood soup was soothing and reminded me of a home cooked meal. My favorites of the night were probably the seafood pancake and soft shell crab. I know you can't really go wrong with seafood pancake but it was extra fresh, fluffy and crispy here. The soft shell crab was light and airy, paired perfectly with the sauce. I also recommend getting the octopus as a starter because it was refreshing. I would probably skip the sea urchin cream bibimbap next time, I found it lacking in flavor. For drinks, I got the Maesil (more fruity) and my boyfriend got the Gochugaru (like a spicy marg). We both loved it! Service was great as well and I'll definitely be back to try more things on the menu.
No comment
No comment

Be sure to make a reservation if you want to try this place out! My friend and I came right when they opened at 5 as walk-in customers and they only had a table open for 45 min before the next reservation so we really hurried through the whole meal. Despite that though, the staff were all very attentive and all the food we ordered came out so fast - we were shocked by the speed! Food was delicious and I'm a huge fan of the mak-hwe and yook-hwe. My friend and I hope to come back again one day for a slowed down meal and really enjoy the drinks and food!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Ariari definitely lives up to its hype. Stellar service and good ambiance, they played old kpop songs which brought me back to my childhood. Food is also great of course. We ordered fried soft shell, beef soup, egg dol sot and scallop DIY roll. My favorite was the egg dol sot and scallop roll. It was so fresh. I would definitely come back to try out other dishes as well. It is a tapas place so per person, it was recommended to order 2 dishes which adds up $$$ but honestly it was worth the price.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I will dream about the fried chicken here every night from here on out  so glad we happened to get a table because we didn't have a reservation, but we figured we would ask. Every dish was divine, but my favorites were the fried chicken, seafood soup, and raw fish appetizer over ice. Cocktails were great too! A gem, anyone who loves seafood/Korean food should give it a try!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very cute Korean tapas spot in East Village. We didn't have reservations on Tuesday at 7pm, so I was thinking if there's possibility, if we got lucky,  if, if, if..... So... when we talked inside, the girl who was host I believe, super sweet and told us if we can finish by less than one hour, there was a table available, so my fast eater mode was on. We sat down and ordered like bomb, the service was very fast and the staffs were super friendly. We got 5 dishes, they're definitely enough for 2 ppl. I also liked their cocktails, very cute and delicious, I like the Korean features in them. My favorite dish was soft shell crab, so juicy and yum. Only one thing I wasn't really love is the sweetness in pretty much all the food, I mean maybe that's the Busan flavor, I'm sure who love sweet would love the food, but don't get me wrong, I do enjoy the food and drinks, and we finished less than hour. Next time I'll make sure we have a reservation lol...
No comment
No comment

My friend made a Thursday night dinner reservation for ARIARI after seeing the dolsot al-bap dish on TikTok (lol), but I was happy to join after hearing it was from the team behind Palpal and LittleMad (both delicious!). Stepping through the door, I was instantly transported out of East Village and onto a train to Busan - the brown leather chairs, dark-wood wall paneling, and narrow street-facing window were clever design touches that created a handsome vintage vibe. With Busan-inspired seafood food I had never encountered, every single dish we ordered was uniquely umami and strikingly sharp. I loved the mak-hwe, which was thinly sliced raw fish (amberjack, yellowtail that night) served as ssambap lettuce wraps. We also ordered the lotus root salad, salmon hwe-muchim, spicy pork with fried squid, seafood stew, and pork soup. Both soups had harmonious layered flavors, and were comforting on a cold winter night. Since the secret of how delicious this place is already out, I cannot wait to take others to this new East Village spot and try the rest of the menu.

First time visiting Ariari and it was great! A great place to try a bunch of different dishes and drinks with some friends. The staff is incredibly attentive and kind, they even explain what everything is if you're not too familiar with the dishes like me. Would definitely come back and recommend to anyone in the area that wants to try some creative takes on Korean food.
No comment

Honestly the best Busan cuisine I had in the states. I'm born in Busan and they really did an amazing job of recreating the dishes. The raw sashimi was straight from Korea which made me feel like I was actually in Korea. Other hot pot and side dishes like soft shell crab was the best fried food I had in nyc. From all the hot pots, I recommend the pork soup because it taste just like soup you will have in Busan. I'm literally going to ariari every two weeks because I live their food. Seriously I recommend this place with my heart:
No comment

My family and I were so excited to try this restaurant! I never got a chance to try Taj Campton restaurant before it shutdown so I was excited to hear that Chef  was going to work a new project! I love this food and it's cool seeing it highlighted with fine dining.

My friend and I made an early dinner reservation for opening weekend and we're so glad we did. Our whole experience was amazing - the greeting, prompt service, food taste/presentation, and vibes. They play really OG Korean music and the ambiance is perfect for a date or girl's night out. My top picks for the seafood were the salmon hwe-muchim and the fried soft-shell crab. We mainly tried to stick to the seafood items but the unexpected winner of tonight's meal were the chicken skewers. Soooo juicy, soft, and flavorful. They had so many fun cocktails to choose from and we ordered the Omija and Maesil. Perfect if you want something on the sweeter side. I loved that I felt full but the food didn't feel heavy. We'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu. Make sure to RSVP - the restaurant is small and gets busy very quickly!
Had the uni cream rice, soft shell, shrimp soba, oysters and beef tartare. Overall good taste but portions were small. Great service and really cute decor!

We had a good experience at Ariari! We really enjoyed their cocktails and the food was also good. The waiters were very friendly and pointed out one of the guest's food restrictions. I recommend for dates or gatherings with friends!
No comment
Best fried chicken ever!!! Amazing service. So great how nice the staff is. Delicious food. And loved the music.

I wish I tried the whole menu ! My top 3 were : the beef tartare, followed by the beef soup & eel. Service was quick & very attentive. The corn crème brûlée was honestly one of my favorite desserts ever!

Such an amazing experience and easily now my favorite restaurant in nyc. The vibe and atmosphere is warm and inviting and the music is SO VIBEY, i love it. But most of all what took my breath away was ALL the dishes we ordered. Although I've been to a lot of variations of Korean restaurants, there's noting like this that comes close. The food is fresh, unique, new, and feels like I transported to Korea. The mak hwe - so fresh and the pairing with ssamjang and chojang is perfection. The lotus root salad and octopus hwe - the flavor in these are just amazing. The white kimchi on the octopus hwe goes so well together. I normally don't eat yukhwe but my friends ordered it and I tried it and it was SO GOOD. The fried dishes were great and the batter is so light with delicious dipping sauces. We got the spicy pork and grilled eel for the main and wow...! The grilled eel is my favorite and it's a must try. The dolsot Al bap goes without saying. It's creamy, has the right enough umami and can taste the creamy flavor of the uni cream. For the soups we got seafood and pork and you can tell they aimed to make these the star of the show. The broth is so refreshing and probably one of the best Korean soups I've had. For dessert, both the corn crème brûlée and bingsoo was amazing - loved the white chocolate on top of the corn crème brûlée and loved the consistency. The bingsoo was refreshing and the best way to end the meal. This place is alllll worth the hype. 10/10!

I went with my friend for dinner on the grand opening day, and our expectations were exceeded! The food is amazing - reminds me of the food back in Busan. You can't find anything like this at any other restaurant in NYC. The atmosphere is cozy and aesthetic, and the service is also amazing. The waiters and waitress explained the dishes thoroughly and attended to our needs frequently. My friend and I felt welcomed. I've been raving about this restaurant to all my friends and I will personally be coming back!

Aside from having great service, this Busan inspired spot serves flavorful, fresh dishes that make you want to come back for more. The stars of the show for me were the Yook-Hwe (Beef Tartare), Glazed Jang-eo (Fried Sea Eel) and Corn Crème Brûlée. Will definitely be returning for round 2!!

This is more like a 3.5 than a 3. We had high expectations and left feeling like we didn't order the right things. Some dishes like the spicy pork and soft shell crab were amazing but others like the pork soup and lamb stuffed pepper was just ok. The waiter encouraged us to get a soup so we were disappointed at how unflavorful it was. Maybe it was an off day? I think the hype made us expect more but overall it was still a good dinner!

Great service and ambiance but the food overall was WAY too sweet. I've tried quite a number of their menus to conclude it, and it's definitely too hyped up. It's alright to visit once but I personally wouldn't go back for the food. It's still worth trying if you're curious about Busan food!

Wait staff was kind and attentive and the food was so good! My friends recommended the fried soft shell crab and the dolsot albab which were both delicious. I also had the lamb stuffed peppers and the octopus. There were some open tables for walk-ins when I was there but I still recommend making a reservation as it's not a very large space.
One of our favorite brunch place in NYC. Came back for the second time. Food is absolutely lovely.

Came during the soft opening week. The vibes in this place are very chill, cozy and welcoming. My friend and I loved the ambience and sets the mood for the amazing meal you will have. Every dish was presented beautifully, and tasted as good as it looked. Started with Yook Hwe (beef tartare), Seafood Pancake, and Fried Chicken, which the fried chicken was super juicy with a delicious sauce. For mains, we had the Steamed Monkfish and Seafood Stew- both phenomenal choices. Monkfish was meaty, tender and flaky with perfect aromatic sauce. The seafood stew was flavorful with a nice kick, and was light without being overwhelming. They gave us a huge lobster claw, which cooked to be the most tender lobster I've ever had. For dessert, we had the Omija Bingsoo which was unique but a little too sweet for my taste. I felt this meal in my soul. It took Korean food to another level for me and it was so comforting.
Go to this restaurant. You will be rewarded. The food is one of a kind. The service is warm and informative. The atmosphere is ideal. My new favorite place in New York.
This place is a gem. Unbelievable food and incredibly fresh. The service is fantastic as well. I'll be back for sure.

EVERYTHING was next level. So well done and beautiful presentation.  The staff was beyond friendly and accommodating. New favorite place!  Brunch on Sunday was so fabulous that we had to return later in the week for dinner. It will NOT disappoint!
No comment
No comment
No comment

For a place to grab a drink and some snacks, I would definitely recommend Cool world. The oysters were top notch: good mignonette sauce and tomatillo hot sauce served with them. The fries, which I was wary of given they were pretty thick, were actually delicious. Super hot and crisp on the outside but somehow still tender potato goodness inside. Seemed a bit chaotic service-wise but they were very apologetic and ultimately it didn't impact us much.
Good ambiance. The wedge salad was SOOO good. I was pretty full by the time the French onion soup came so I can't fully judge it
No comment

Been here a few times, last 2 times were not great. First bad experience alerted management and they did acknowledge the mistake. Had dinner here last night. Ordered main course, side of fries, then oysters. Fries came first. Then main course, then oysters while I was working on the rest of the meal. No one helped clear the table or make room. Only when I got the bill did they take the oyster shells away. 3 bad oysters (were they preopened)?
Cocktails were delicious and so were the fried duck balls. Everything else is alright - not bad but not exceptional. Kind of pricy for what it is.

Came here during the NY marathon today and was such a let down. Ordered the soft eggs thing and it was terrible like soggy eggs even when I specified I wanted well done , it was not , also had no chicken when they said it did. Food took forever . My friend didn't order a sauce and they charged us for it. The waitress was very confused when we had a bill with two different charges which was very odd. Bad experience, would come back but only for drinks.
No comment
No comment

This is such a cool space and a great location, but there's so much turnover for some reason. Had high hopes that this chef would stick, but unfortunately, it just wasn't great. Awesome service but we had the potato app with cabbage on top which was okay but sort of strange--heavy on the acid and sort of like sauerkraut. Then the halibut was good, but about three bites. The portion was comically small. The waiter agreed and brought us shrimp cocktail and Brussels which was so nice, but they were so overpowered with spice that we were coughing and just couldn't eat them. Such a bummer bc it's lovely for so many reasons, but the food was just a miss.
Incredible. The dishes are decadent but light!  Flavorful without being overwhelming/distracting. Great service, vibrant crowd. Incredible chef.

Excellent fresh spot with a simple, yet unique menu that does not disappoint! The chicken and waffles were on point and all the sides were fantastic. Great cocktails too! The chef clearly ads his own flare to familiar flavors, and the care shines through. Definitely recommend!

Had a birthday dinner here last night. Food was great. It is very loud but I am also very loud so it worked out. But the STAFF- incredible. Truly charming and lovely in a neighborhood that doesn't always give the most welcoming of vibes. Brooks the bartender and Ben our server- truly lovely. Will be back asap. Get the rolls and steak frites!
Stylish and cool, great food and stellar drinks situation. Great addition to the 'hood
Scallops were awesome, as well ass the wedge salad and the mussels! Our cocktails were great and the wine program is nice - had a delicious sparkling pet nat. Great staff too!

Came here for my birthday a couple weeks ago. I love the ambience and location is great, however I don't think I've ever waited so long for a meal in my lifeIt's a new restaurant so I am sure they're working out some kinks but the service was wildly slow. There was about 3,000 servers working but no one was really working? We were in no rush and I'm not an impatient person but after waiting an hour for our first appetizer I was a little bit like y'all good back there? Food was okay. I ordered the fish which had a nice flavor but it was just a quarter sized slab of fish swimming in broth. I asked for some rice on the side to eat with it bc ur girl needs substance, but after 40 minutes of waiting I canceled it and ate my lil fish in ab three bites. Is this how the Williamsburg girls stay so fit? I also got the salad that had savory granola on top which was v weird and soggy. Anyway! I have no idea what I'm talking ab and I never write reviews but thought I'd share. I would come again bc I love the interior designers & drinks are good but I wouldn't come hungry lol‍
it was the best dinner i had in nyc. highly recommend. michelin quality at a low price
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

They say they specialize in eel, and they are not lying - food is amazing. I've been here a few times and would definitely recommend it to any eel lovers. The vibe is also very trendy, casual, and peaceful!
No comment

Let's gooooo! This spot rules. Exactly what you want from a Japanese izakaya style restaurant. The seared tuna small plate was soooo goooooooood. Katsu curry was also so rich and flavorful. I would avoid the pork belly which was a bit over cooked and uninteresting. They have a great selection of sakes including three pairings to try. The space is not big but is very inviting and cozy. 5/5!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely enjoyed Benemon! It is a small Japanese restaurant that we found last minute when I was craving Japanese curry. This restaurant was very cute. We tried their sake flight, beef tataki, chicken katsu curry and yakiniku Don. Everything was delicious. We both enjoyed the beef tataki, it had so much flavor and it was quite tender. The curry was so good just wish it had spice levels, none the less it was delicious! The yakiniku Don was a little sweet for my liking but still good. I would definitely keep this in mind next time I'm in New York!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I could not say more good things about this place! Everything I got was delicious and had soooo much flavor. For apps we got garlic beef, karaage and the black miso chicken. I would have loved to put a scoop of rice in the delicious sauce from the miso chicken. For an entrees I shared the Yakiniku don and katsu curry and both were so tasty. In the yakiniku don the beef was perfectly seared and had some crispy edges. I would definitely recommend this place!
No comment

This spot is awesome. It is small, quaint, homey, and very specialized service. From the moment you open the door, an aroma hits you in the face like you are walking into an Italian Grandmother's kitchen. Two adjectives I kept using throughout the experience--delightful and delicious, everything was wonderful.

Service was awesome, we should have ordered 2 appetizers (they are small). We had the shrimp tempura it was 2 shrimp, 2 green beans and 2 slices of squash. The shrimp tempura was perfect, fresh oil taste and the side of salt was a nice touch. Chicken katsu with curry and rice and namban don was ordered. Both dishes were very tasty and portion size was perfect. The place was dark and busy, my only gripe was the music was a little too loud, American pop music playing. I guess I was hoping for more of a Japanese vibe. It was a very nice dinner. Go here and eat!
No comment
No comment

Great place if you don't have prior reservation plans because they usually have openings. The food is okay, largely japanese comfort food, but there wasn't really anything too special about their food. The prices are steep for what you get, and the portion size is a little bit on the smaller side (understandable though because it's in east village and the prices tend to run higher anyways). The atmosphere is beautiful though, I love the stones and the salt lamps they place on tables, it really illuminates the space beautifully.
No comment

Great cozy atmosphere. Friendly staff. They have a great selection of sake. The food was delicious and reasonable as well. I got the oyakodon and beef tataki. The beef tataki was soft and tasted great. The place is small so I wish they took reservations.

Swung by around 8pm on a Saturday and the wait was 15-20 minutes. Enjoyed the pork belly as an appetizer then got the chicken katsu curry which was incredible. Very pleasant experience overall. Will be back!

Highly recommend this place! Came here with a friend and we split one small plate and two of the bigger dishes. The portions are perfect for sharing and it's definitely great to come in a bigger group and try lots of things on the menu! They have something for everyone and the flavors were so great. The space is very cute and cozy and the staff were all helpful and great! They don't take reservations but we came on a weekday around 6 pm and were seated immediately. I will say it got fairly crowded by 7/8 pm so get there early if you can and don't want to wait!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The classy ambiance here is 10/10. Drinks and food 10/10. Service was so friendly as well! We ordered a couple cocktails, as well as a sake flight, the server was extremely helpful and walked us through the different flavor profiles of sake and we loved how the sake flight came with a little informative brochure on what we were drinking. The hot squid had a nice modern twist, it was flavorful and very reasonable serving size. The assorted tempura was perfectly fried and delicious as well. Would love to come back and try the rest of the menu!
No comment
No comment

Fantastic and intimate Japanese restaurant in East Village area! Stopped by here with a friend for some small bites and sake. The service was well polished and welcoming. Split 3 dishes and all were amazing. Definitely recommend and would come back again to try more of the menu!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I get it, inflation is causing price increase, but this is ridiculous. I came here to order a 6 piece karage ($12) and three orders of curry chicken rice ($19 each). Half of the plate was sauce. The food was okay, they service was okay, but it was over priced. I cannot believe we are paying $20 for a plate of rice and fried chicken. That's literally what it was. I'd rather go to abiko curry. Food was okay but not worth what you are paying for. I spend almost $100 this nonsense.
Went here with friends. The curry sauce was the best I had in a long time! Also the service was great.
No comment

I liked the inner-tenderness of the karrage. The fried karaage skin wasn't bad, but when it came to the ten-don it was kind of obvious that the frying part could use some more work. Happy that they even have the anago ten-don option, but hoping that it would taste closer to that of Japan if I visit again in the future!

Great Japanese spot! Came here with a friend for dinner on a weekday around 7pm and got seated right away. We split a bunch of things. To start we got the Kara'age Fried Chicken and Tuna Tataki. My favorite was the chicken, the spicy mayo was perfect with the juicy chicken. The tuna was also pretty good. Afterwards we got the Yakiniku Don (beef) and Unagi Don (eel). I liked the unagi more, but I'm also biased towards eel. The portion of eel was also huge! The yakiniku was pretty good. It kinda reminded me of Korean bulgogi. Overall, great dining experience. Glad I got to try this place!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amazing sake selections, recommend to try the sake flight with 3 different sakes. Food are fantastic, ordering plenty of small dishes to share. Recommend the tuna tataki and salmon.

This place is cute and small, offering Japanese small plates. I have been twice for a casual dinner with friends, a good place to eat in peace and have a nice conversation with excellent ambience. The food itself is good but not mindblowing. I liked the karaage, deep fried soft shell crab, and unagi don a lot, but I thought the tofu hijiki salad and creamy baked salmon were just okay.

The Unatama Don was something I'd never really had before. Basically, eel, mushroom, onion, and egg are all smothered over rice with a sticky soy sauce. It was so good and you definitely get your money's worth. Would come here again and the portion size was great as well.

Would definitely recommend the fried soft shell crab and karaage. Curry tonkatsu don was good but portion was a bit small and beef tataki wasn't anything special. Still enjoyed it all though! Service was great.

I was really pleasantly surprised by the yasai yuzu shio! I wasn't sure if I would like yuzu in ramen but now I'm obsessed. The broth is light, warm, and comforting. The seasonal veggies they put in are also really fresh.
I mean how can you not like this place. Best Sushi in NY. Fish gets flown in from Japan. Service is always good.
No comment
No comment

Cute and delicious Japanese restaurant. The Unagi Don was really delicious and it was a big eel. The garlic steak was tasty, very tender, and it had black pepper in it so making it a bit spicy. The soft shell crab was extremely good and very juicy. The restaurant was a bit crowded and loud, and sometimes it was impossible to hear my friends speaking.

This place was amazing. We exclusively ordered the small plates and shared. The anchovy potatoes and the beef tataki were our best bites of the day. Pair that with a sake flight and you will not regret it. We only make it out to the city a few times a year and we very diligently choose where we are going to eat, and we will 100% be back here. With all our friends. 10/10 recommend.
No comment

So many great dishes at Benemon. We especially enjoyed the eel over rice, chicken nanban over rice, and the beef curry over rice. The appetizers were just okay. I would and will get the shrimp and eel tempura over rice next time instead.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Probably my favorite unagi don bowl in the city . Fair prices, attentive service, beautiful interior and exterior accommodations, and friendly/knowledgeable waitstaff. I have been coming back and will continue to bring friends and family here as this place is truly one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in the city.
No comment

Benemon is a solid Japanese comfort food spot in the East Village area. They offer a variety of small tapas dishes, as well as larger donburi dishes (rice bowl). We tried the Karaage, Unatama Don, and Katsu Curry. All of them were pretty delicious, but nothing too unique. Karaage and Katsu were both crispy. The Unatama Don was something I've never really had before. Basically eel, mushroom, onion, and egg all smothered over rice with a sticky soy sauce. Portions are a solid size here so good to try a few different things.
No comment

Absolutely amazing una tama don, the eel mixed with the egg and the sauce was perfect. One of the best dons I've ever had. Would come here again and the portion size was great as well. The ambiance is also a great spot for a nice dinner with friends - dimly lit with a calming himalayan salt candle. They also have great sake selections!

We were in the mood for some donburi. This place hit the spot. The shrimp and anago tempura donburi was excellent. That tempura batter stayed crispy after sitting on the steaming hot rice and after we poured the sauce over it. That really impressed me.m because some places don't make it right and soggy tempura stuff is horrible. The yakiniku donburi is (obviously) a yakiniku version of a gyudon. It was very tasty. Other than that, friendly staff and clean place, which is always a plus. I'd return for some donburi. I'll also try some karage and some other things next time.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I was excited to find this hidden gem upon yelp search. Fair warning is that it is 11 min walk away from 8th st station-NYU, which can be little far given the weather outside. However, I can tell you it will be worth the trip! I tried soft shell crab as appetizer and pork katsu curry ($15.5) and unagi don ($29) as main dish. The portion size is very filling, and taste was great! I just wish they have miso soup, and keep the inside little cool with fans/AC, as it was very humid to eat the food due to weather. I enjoyed the food itself. Please come check this place out when you are nearby and want to have some homemade style Japanese food.

Feels very warm, in a good and bad way; dimly lit, and cozy, but also stuffy on a hot summer afternoon. The beef Curry is a must, but the Oyako Don was bland (ask for some Sriracha sauce for your own good). Nice service, and overall satisfying -- good, even.
No comment

Always solid food and drinks whenever I come here. Cocktails are not strong but very enjoyable and easy to drink. The rice bowls is well portioned but if you have an appetite/eat well, I recommend getting your own. All the dons I've tried are good and worth so an option is getting different things to share!

My date brought me here after I told him I had eaten at pretty much every Japanese places there ever were in NYC -- I stand corrected. Benemon was a vibe- dark dim restaurant with the exposed bricks was a touch of romances and mystique! Food was fresh, well seasoned and delightful- every bite tasted like walking on cloud 9- I was in heaven. Presentation was on point and couldn't have asked for a lovely dinner date spot.

The menu was promising but the taste fell a little flat.  Our group of 5 came for a bite before a show nearby.  Only 1 person had been there before but we were trying to find restaurant with a good variety of offerings for our group within walking distance of the theatre.  We each ordered a donburi and had the pork belly and edamame for starters to share.  We also had cocktails.  My drink was the yu-agari yuzu which was refreshing and tasty enough if you like yuzu. The sake menu is extensive so come here for the sake cocktails if you like sake.  The apps came out quickly but the pork belly was room temperature and I am not sure if it was supposed to be cold or not.  The pieces were very thin and small and although there was smokey smell to the app, the flavor was bland and the pork belly didn't have any melty mouth feel that you would expect from pork belly.  It tasted more like bland undercooked bacon. You have to dip it in the sauces which accompanied the dish on the plate.  So by the time you dipped the pieces into the mayonaisey sauce or the black kaimi sauce, the small plate was a mess.  The kaimi sauce was supposed to be spicy but it wasn't at all. It tasted like a plum sauce to me and I was wondering if they had made a mistake and put the wrong sauce on the plate. The white mayonaise substance was also off.  I wish I took photos but we were in a rush.  The edamame with peroncino while I could see a reddish sprinkling of chili pepper flakes/powder over the beans, it too was too mild if you were looking for something with a kick.  My una-tama-don turned out to be anago, which was specified on the menu given to us at the table but did not mentioned on the online menu.   An "all natural eel" is all it says online. So if you are looking unagi as mentioned in the name of the dish, don't be surprised if you will actually be served anago instead.  There is a big difference in the taste of the two types of eel.  I prefer unagi much more. Kind of disappointing.  My donburi was also tasteless and very soupy, so much so that we had to ask for a spoon to eat the rice.  The server apologized for not have given spoons beforehand. The eel pieces were generous but just placed on top, all curled up. It would have been nice if it were cut to more manageable bite sized pieces or flattened our like unagi so then we didn't have to bite off pieces from the large curls. It's not easy to break of pieces with chopsticks with slippery anago skin on. Because the donburi was so saucey from the "broth" which is something "between a corn starched sauce and soup, I couldn't taste the rice which to me is an important part of a donburi. You should be able to taste the quality of the plain rice as well some of the rice with some sauce from the topping if plated well and in the right ratio of rice to topping. Instead, all the rice was soaked in a bland sauce.  The "soft-cooked egg" was nothing more than a raw egg cracked over the donburi.  Again, like the pork belly spp, my rice bowl was served at room temperature so the raw egg was just adding to more soupiness of the bowl because the rice was not hot enough to cook the rice. If the rice was piping hot and topping also hotter, mixing in the raw egg might have thickened and made the donburi richer and tastier.  It left me unsatisfied because the donburi wasn't served at the right temperature. I really had hopes for Benemon but didn't really find the food to be comforting as someone wrote or as I had hoped. For $21 for a simple donburi and $16 cocktail, it was not a cheap quick bite either.  The concepts on paper are enticing but the execution needs work.  The service was good but they don't take reservations on the weekends so plan ahead and expect to wait if the place is already full or if you have a large party. I can see why they don't take reservations because the place is small but as promised, they did seat my party of 5 quickly when everyone arrived because we all arrived early. Had we not been trying to make a show, I think my group would've loved to hang out a little longer but I don't think the place is conducive to lingering unless you sat at the small bar which only has 4-5 seats.  I would go to a more traditional Japanese restaurant for good donburi and katsu but come for the sake later in the evening if that's your thing and if you want a cozy intimate place for a drink.

came here with my sister and her friends. my sister said it was highly rated and that there was limited amount of seating so we ran over as soon as it opened at 5pm. there is definitely limited seating but more than 6 - probably closer to 20? we were the first ones there but it definitely got more pack by the time we finished eating around 6. the staff is very attentive and knowledgeable. the restaurant is very stylish and fit the mood. the appetizer was okay... the tuna tasted like pizza haha, the chicken was nothing special, the steak was the best out of the 3. i personally got the pork katsu whereas my sister got eel donburi. they definitely give you the perfect amount where the price point meets the food quantity & quality. the drinks were delicious and one of the best cocktails i've had in awhile. overall, i recommend ! i personally don't think it's the best thing in the world but for the price and quality, it was definitely a hit!

The overall experience was good! We came here on a Friday night around 6:30 and wait around 30 minutes which wasn't too bad considering how crowded the restaurant was. The staff were friendly and apologize for the wait. The food were pretty good and definitely worth the try. We ordered the beef tataki, tuna tataki, hot squid, yakiniku Don and katsu curry. We enjoyed all the dishes, but thought the sauce for the tuna tataki was quite overpowering which kill the natural flavor of the tuna. Also, the don was too oily to my liking. I definitely recommend the drinks. I had the white clouds and it reminded me of a milk foam tea.

I love this place, it's cozy, delicious and unpretentious -- a total hidden gem. We especially loved the karaage. The sake selection is extensive but not intimidating because it's well-explained.

Cannot say better things about our experience here! We came on a Tuesday night around 6:30pm and were seated immediately. They have a great spacious outdoor seating. Our waitress was so attentive and nice! We started with tuna tataki and tofu fire which were both divine. I got the pork katsu and let me tell you this was the best katsu I've ever had outside of Japan. My sister got the chicken tempura donburi which was equally as delicious. Also COVID wise, the bathroom was sparkling and there were even toilet seat wipes provided for extra sanitation!! Above and beyond and can't wait to come back!

Really like the food here! I'd recommend getting a few plates to share if you're coming with a group. The food was flavorful and reasonably priced. Only con about this place is that it's dimly lit and they didn't have the AC on during a hot summer day.

The vibe is nice at this restaurant but there definitely are a couple of hiccups and areas for improvement. Firstly.. the wood facade of this restaurant is cool but I think it's making the restaurant damp and possibly moldy? You can smell it if you sit near the window area. It smells like a basement. Second.. we brought a cake over to surprise our friend for their birthday. Mid way through dinner the waitress asks us when she should bring the cake out.. LMAO. So much for the surprise I guess... thirdly.. nice selection of sake, the apps are good, now the rice bowls.. honestly not worth the money especially since teriyaki eel isn't that expensive and it just didn't taste that good. Felt like I could've made better at home.
Delicious katsu curry and the service was excellent. I can't wait to return and try some of the other dishes.

Was craving some donburi and went to Benemon. They have such strange hours imo (5-10pm) but it's all good. Pay attention while you're walking because I almost walked right past it( they didn't have an obvious sign) The una tama don had nice meaty pieces of eel and was perfectly sweet with the sauce and caramelized onions. My friends aid the katsu don was really good but got soggy a little quickly because it was under the eggs. I also was surprised it didn't come with any miso soup or anything. The starters are really small plates but the potatoes and Brussels were delicious. I didn't really taste the anchovies, only Parmesan. I really like that the menus are on the side of each outdoor table because you can easily refer back to it, but it minimizes the amount of people touching it. The waitstaff is really sweet as well. If you are eating indoors you need to show proof of vaccination, but not if you're eating outdoors. Their menu isn't super expansive but they have a few good vegetarian options like vegetable curry!

Looks fairly low-key on the outside but a really lovely Japanese small plates bar. Maybe a bit less casual compared to a proper Izakaya but vibe is still pretty nice. Sake selection is pretty good and they have some preset sets of sake if you aren't really sure what you want. The smoked pork belly is very smoked in flavor, maybe closer to ham is taste than to bossam or kakuni. Really tasty but potentially not what you would be expect. Fried soft shell crab was crisp in pleasant way, I would recommend especially if you are drinking at all. Aside from the small plates, Benemon does a variety of curry bowls and donburi. I had the shrimp and anago ten don. The tempura was pretty good, especially considering this isn't a specialized tempura shop. The tentsuya sauce was a tad thick, not really great for mixing with the rice but goes with the tempura. Overall, not super pricy but a really nice spot to chill and have a quick dinner with some sake.

Great Japanese comfort food! It was a hot summer night so we made a dinner of small plates. The absolute stand out was the Black Miso Chicken, one of the tastiest, tangiest, moistest chicken dishes in memory. Also loved tuna tataki, and their shrimp tempura was very fresh and crispy, and served with salt on the side to dip into (recommended). Friendly staff, too.

Hada a wonderful evening on Saturday at Benemon. We came right when they opened and sat down at a two top near the bench. Started off with Junmai Itami Onigoroshi Genshu. It arrived quickly and we had it put on ice.  It went well with every item on the menu. The service was efficient and friendly. I really enjoyed the Tuna Tataki, Karage and salty pork belly. The pork belly was good wit the spicy mayo from the garage too. We had a second bottle of sake, Kannihonkai Junmai Genshu Ultra dry to finish off the meal. Benemon is a great spot for some heart and belly warming Japanese comfort food. My friend and I came here late-ish after drinks on a Saturday night because we were still hungry from the unsatisfying dinner we had earlier. I'm not too great with alcohol so I needed some food that had substance (not just small dainty bites) to really soak up the alcohol. My friend and I both got rice dishes. It has the right balance of sourness in it so it makes you feel cool down in the summer hot breeze. Their creamed salmon is a bit too greasy though. We both love our Dons. However maybe due to what's going on, they don't have sashimi, so we didn't get a chance to taste their scallop sashimi. Hope they can have it soon.

You can tell that they use fresh ingredients and that they cooked everything fresh. We had the black miso chicken, Kara aged fried chicken, and their Japanese katsu pork curry, all 10/10. I recommend having the plum wine it is soooooooo delicious, I wanted to buy a bottle to take home but it's a specialty so that's not available. They also have a bunch of great sake options, we had the Souden Junmai sake, delicious! Please come here :~)

Benemon offers superb Japanese comfort food. We came here around 6 PM on a Tuesday night and was lucky enough to avoid the crowds. My group of four shared a few dishes among our table- gobo sticks, fried chicken, scallops, garlic beef steak, and the Una-Toma Don. The portions veered on the smaller size but was still shareable. We ordered just enough food, but definitely had room for dessert. The food was incredibly delicious, each item was impressively prepared. Atmosphere- trendy, intimate, dim lighting, fairly small inside, great service. Benemon is another reason to venture to the East Village food mecca.

Nice and cozy place for relaxing on Friday night! The appetizers are great. Fried chicken smells good but is a little oily. Una tama don has an raw egg in it which made my stomach upset. I may try other kinds of don next time.

Excellent service and the food is stellar as well. Came here for Sunday brunch and got the tuna tataki for appetizer and the una tama don set. The una tama don is essentially eel with onions, mushrooms and soft egg on top over rice. The sauce was delicious and this is definitely a very rich dish, great for when you're super hungry. There were at least four big pieces of eel which is very generous for the price of the set. I would definitely come back again to try the other items. It's a great little spot that's tucked away in east village.
No comment
No comment
Food is really good but doesn't worth the value. Price-tag way too high for rice dishes. They don't even give you enough rice.
Super cute Japanese restaurant! The fried chicken and una-tama don are both tasty! Very friendly service, and there is no wait during brunch.
No comment

We found this place tucked away on a quiet side street. But once we got in, it was very alive inside. The tight space creates a very intimate environment. The lighting and all the decorations contributes to the cozy atmosphere. We got two bowls, one beef bowl and a fried pork curry bowl. The beef was very tender.
No comment

I expected the place to be full, but it was pretty quiet most of the night. We came on a thursday night at 6pm (early i know). to start, my cousin and I shared the fried chicken, and garlic beef. Both were good, but the fried chicken was definitely better. for our main course, we shared the pork katsu curry and the eel and egg over rice. I'm not a BIG fan of eel, but this was delicious. HIGHLY recommend it. They have one option with more eel, but i enjoyed the egg and onion mixed in. The katsu curry was decent, not great. The pork was a little dry. Maybe it would be good to eat this piping hot. We shared the black sesame pudding for dessert: not too sweet, with strong black sesame flavor.

Came here for lunch and it was absolutely delicious. My friend and I both ordered the una-tama don, which has eel and egg. Everything was tasty, and in terms of quantity is it's not the biggest piece of eel, and I felt full but not stuffed after (ie. Some guys might not find it's enough food to feel completely full).
Simply delicious ! My friend took the terriaky Don awesome and I took a bowl with shrimps and fish marvelous. All with a draft beer. We will definitely come back in August :)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The restaurant itself was great, loved the decor, the food was quite delicious (save for one aspect), and the service was wonderful. I read the reviews and decided to order the highly-rated eel bowl for lunch. My one-star review is that somehow everyone failed to mention how the eel came with sharp tiny prickly little bones in it??? I did notice the eel was a little uncomfortable to chew on when I was at the restaurant but thought maybe that was my imagination. I also didn't want to seem like a bother complaining so I mostly ate the rice, egg, and the mushrooms (which were fantastic btw!). I took home the eel leftovers and it wasn't until the next day when I tried reheating it that I discovered it was just full of tiny, prickly bones! Definitely a choking hazard!!! Either way, be warned that there will be bones in the eel bowl so eat at your own risk. Very disappointed that I paid $25 for a dish full of bones.
No comment
No comment

I had never had food like this before, but I really enjoyed it! The raw beef and rice dishes were delicious. They also had a really extensive Sake collection. Definitely a good place for Friday/Saturday night!

Great Japanese comfort food in a small, chic restaurant. We had the steak appetizer which was phenomenal - perfectly sliced medium rare steak in light sweet sauce. The donburi was fragrant and filling, and pork katsu rich and smooth. Katsu was slightly dry but the curry was great.
No comment
Chicken Katsu curry was amazing. Service was pretty good as well. Went on a Wednesday night around 7 and we were seated immediately.
No comment

Small but great interior restaurant.Kara-age fried chicken,Shimp tempura,Salmon carpaccio are so good. The server was so kind,my friend left her wallet and camera bag in restaurant but server ran to return her,thank you! Love their service and quality of food and drink).
No comment
The whole eel! Friendly for meat lover especially eel lover. But the rice is kind of dry so it is a bit hard to digest. But the eel is really delicious...

Went to this restaurant SOLELY on Yelp reviews, which failed me miserably.  I really rely on Yelp reviews, but they are hit or miss.  This restaurant was definitely a miss.  We ordered beef bowls, pork bowls, shrimp tempura bowls and a beef curry bowl.  All the dishes were heavily salted.  The beef curry was 90% gravy and 10% beef that was too chewy and tasteless (crack open a can of dog food and serve it over rice!).  The tempura seems freshly fried, so that's good right?   Will not return.  Would not recommend.  Sorry.
No comment

A cozy little spot in prime East Village. I came here with a bunch of friends after work and it was the perfect place to wind down. The vibe is low key, and their small plates are perfect for sharing. The star of the show, out of the four we ordered, was the salty pork belly. It was perfectly seasoned, with the perfect amount of seasoning.
FIRE. Benemon is just awesome food at a reasonable price. Vibey, lowkey, and tasty. Great place to chill for a lil date or just catching up with a friend.
No comment
Amazing menu offering from small tapas to share with main entrees. Happy Hour options are really good too.

Benemon is a great place with great food. However, I did not have the greatest experience because the waiter forgot to put my order through. I was with a group of 7 and everyone else got their appetizers and entrees. We waited about an hour for all of the entrees to come out. And I kept waiting thinking that my entree was on its way. However, we asked the waiter my dish was and he completely forgot. He did not put the order through. I had to wait another 30 minutes for my dish to come out. All of my friends finished the drinks, appetizers, and entrees and I did not even get a bite of what I wanted to eat. I could not even try my other friends' dishes because they were meat based all and I am pescatarian. At this point I waited for a bit over 1 hour and 30 minutes for my food to come out. If it wasn't for this experience, I would easily given 4 out of 5 stars.
Food is so delicious, went on the lunar new year time. Service is  good with delicates cooking skills.

Had a pleasant, light brunch at benemon. The vibe is very charming and intimate. We ordered the karage chicken, crushed tofu hijiki salad, tuna tataki, and gobo sticks. Thoroughly enjoyed each small plate in its simplicity and clean flavors. I am a lover of tofu and would come back for the crushed tofu salad lightly dressed with a miso lemon vinaigrette and hijiki. The karage chicken was so moist and crunchy. Overall, a great light meal to start the day.

This is a great find but you should go early or you will queue up and they don't take reservations. Go before they start going downhill due to popularity. Places always go downhill once they become trendy
No comment
Food is really tasty. Like the don with chicken and the soft shell crab meat are tasty too
No comment
No comment
Really good food. We tried a bunch of seafood and vegetarian dishes and were really impressed with how clean and delicious everything was. Highly recommend.

Cute little restaurant in the E. Village. It's a great date spot. It wasn't too crowded for a Saturday night although we got there around 9:30pm. We ordered a bunch of tapas to try as many dishes as possible. I would say the Tuna Tataki was our favorite dish that we ordered. The Cajun spice was a different take on this dish. The Scallops Aburi were very refreshing. Beef Tataki and Miso Chicken are good choices. The Tofu Fire is the usual Agedashi Tofu with a little spice. Skip the Anchovy Fried Potatoes, they skimp on the cheese and just taste like any average potato dish. Not very flavorful.
It's a little bit expensive and you may need 2 bowls and 2+ small plates, but the quality is nice. Good sake here! Recommend for drinking.
No comment
Unagi don is very satisfying! Good pair with salad, pickles and sweet white beans. Sencha is also good taste! In general, feeling blessed in the rainy day having this
No comment

Every dish here was amazing. We got the tuna and miso chicken for appetizers, eel and beef dons, and pork katsu curry. Super flavorful, and perfect combination of spices. Would come here again! Great atmosphere.

We went about an hour before closing and were very lucky to be seated at the bar right away on a weekday. Food was delicious. We ordered the beef tataki, salty pork belly, fried chicken, unagi-tama don, and a couple beers. It was so good we have to go back to order other things on the menu.

Saw good ratings for this place so we tried it.  NOT disappointed at all!  Had sake flights, the scallops , salad, steak , and mushroom and eel don.  Everything was amazing.  I will come back again and again to taste the whole menu!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really enjoyed this place. Skip the appetizers and go straight for the rice bowls on the second page. We got the tuna and the scallops appetizers. Tuna was particularly yummy but both were a lot smaller than expected. Not really worth it. Rice bowls were all spectacular. We got the eel, the beef, and the chicken. Definitely not lacking in flavor! Great service and dark quiet ambiance. Will come back.

Fairly affordable, no frills Donburi spot close to the dance studio I go to. I tried the Una-Tama Don which had eel, shiitake mushrooms and soft cooked egg. At least an 8 out of 10 on the umami meter; I couldn't stop eating it and I found myself trying to savor the eel as much as possible by eating it in small portions. The meal actually turned out to be very filling. The waiter's personal favorite was the yakiniku beef don which I plan to try next time I'm finished with my dance class.
One of my favorite places to go for Japanese comfort food. I usually get the Nanban Don rice bowl and small plate of pork belly - SO good. The sake selection is great too!
No comment

No comment

Tendon was quite good, katsu (pork) curry was okay - nothing to write home about. I do appreciate benemon not just having "japanese tea" and allowing me to choose from sencha, hojicha(i think), and something else (tbh i only got the sencha both times i went so i don't remember). The black miso chicken was also quite nice. I do wish they had desserts :(

Love this japanese comfort food style place!! they have the BEST donburi's i've ever had! I don't think i can ever look at the donburi's the same anymore lol. They set the bar pretty high. The egg they drop on it is so silky and cooked to perfection. I liked their uma - mama don the best. Katsu don was good too and so was the popcorn chicken one. My least favorite was the beef donburi (it was a little on the dry side) and i must say their curry dishes weren't good. The curry flavor was super strong and nothing too impressive. Stick with the donburi's and their appetizers! Their karrage was one of the best i've had too - always very crispy and tender.
No comment
No comment

The first time I tried it was a year ago and I really disliked it. My don was really wet at the bottom and slightly cold. This could be because we came in a group of 17 and so it was really difficult for them to bring everything out in a timely manner. When I visited again yesterday I ordered the unagi don and was pleasantly surprised. The eel was huge and the sauce to rice ratio was great. I tried my friend's katsu don and it also tasted amazing. I would also highly recommend trying the shrimp tempura since it does not feel greasy at all and was really light and crunchy. Would highly recommend for a nice intimate dinner when the weather is warmer since the ambiance is great.
No comment
No comment

Pretty neat place. Benemon offers a good variety of Japanese small plates as well as donburi bowls. I'm a fan of the toppings-to-rice ratio for their bowls. The venue itself is pretty small and can get pretty busy. Service is pretty spotty as well, but the food speaks for itself.

Got the black miso chicken and roasted potatoes to start. I got the oyakodon while my partner got the katsudon. The roasted potatoes were soft but not mushy. The black miso chicken was a disappointment. It almost tasted like hoisin sauce. Could not really taste the miso much (maybe that's how it's supposed to taste). Both our main dishes were decent, but nothing to write home about. Overall, it's a decent restaurant, but individual dishes could be a hit or miss.

Came here on a Friday night around 7, and waited 20 min to be seated. We ordered the salty pork belly, tsukimi tori don (popcorn chicken), and yakiniku don (beef). I like the taste of the beef donburi, but it was definitely too oily for my liking. I can see how this is a "comfort" dish!

Una-Tama Don lunch set！score 8.5/10--rice top with eel+egg+mushroom+onionthe eel is tender and flavorful! the sauce is rich and sweet, but a little bit too sweet for me after I finished half of the don. And I'm the only customer there today during lunch time haha. The only thing that disappointed me in the restaurant was the smell of currybut definitely wanna come back for this don:)
No comment

I came here with my sister and LOVED it. I didn't expect much from this place to begin with so after having a few dishes I was blown away. I ordered the Tuna Tataki which was seared on the outside, the Salty Pork Belly had a smoky flavor to it and it just melted in your mouth, the soft shell crab came with an ichimi ponzu dipping sauce which I didn't like that much so I dipped it in the Black Miso Chicken instead. Every dish had a powerful flavor which I really enjoyed a lot. It was super flavorful. Last but not least we ordered Una-Tama Don which was unbelievably good. I would definitely come back again to try the other dishes.
Favorite brunch spot! We are regulars and can't get enough.  Every single order is divine.  You can't go wrong.

By chance stumbled by this place on a Saturday night. Easy to find seating at around 7 pm. Open space with big windows and modern decor. Staff was very friendly and seated us quickly. She gave us some time to make choices and made some recommendations. We ended up getting the Tuna Tataki, and two donburi bowls. The donburi bowls looked like they were the most popular choice. Tuna tataki was nicely seasoned and in a miso ginger sauce that was yummy. The una tama don was a tad salty but the flavors were good. The shrimp and Anago ten don was also delicious. All in all, a good place to check out. Not terribly memorable and not somewhere I'd crave but a decent place to bring friends and enjoy some sake

Came across this place a few times while walking in the city and their eel over rice is so delicious and looks so amazing. I don't know why people haven't noticed it, perhaps because it can be slightly tucked away, but if you love eel and you want a place that seems authentic for it, they do a great job! Come very hungry!
A little noisy. Order the Pork Katsu Curry and edamame peperoncino, with a glass of hizo otokoyama. The curry is a little bit salty. The edamame is really good with hizo. Slightly crowded.
No comment
it looks really good but I haven't tried it yet looking forward to it. I give it a five star because it has craft sake.!

Picked this randomly with my bestie. It was on such an odd quiet small street but the ambiance was wonderful. The service surpass my expectations. Very attentive and helpful when I asked what brand was their plum wine. The food was delicious and the appetizers were amazing. The whole meal left me very satisfied. I will be coming back

Great price, above par comfort food. We were three persons, had Edamame which was toasted with garlic and chili flakes, Tofu Hijiki Salad, Oyako Don, Katsu Curry and Yakiniku Don and a few drinks. Total came out to about $72 total. Food was solid, totally reasonable for the price, especially the Yakiniku Don which was very good. Don't expect the super-expensive "omakase"-type quality that's popping up around town for those who can afford it. That's not what this place is about. You'll get great comfort food at affordable prices. Well-designed bathroom faucet a plus.

The food is spectacular! Benemon is a place for Japanese comfort food, and it holds! The service is on point, the servers are very polite, and attentive. My favorite would have to be the Nanban Don, and the Vegetable Don. If you love Japanese food and could use some comfort, Benemon is the place!.......P.s They also have some chill tunes, that just adds to the experience.
I like the eel bento in this restaurant, both the taste and the amount is amazing. A very good place for date or friend reunion.

Was looking for a meal last Sunday while out with my mother, grandmother, and family friend. The decor was very nice, the restroom was clean, and the service was good. There was no wait time. We really liked the small dishes served with the entrees & my grandmother especially complimented the rice. Would absolutely come here again.
Be sure to order the kara-aged fried chicken, it's the right amount of crispy and tender. The appetizers are great. Their unagi don is the best!

One of the few places that offer delicious unagi dons at a reasonable price in the city! I ordered a shrimp and anago ten don and it was certainly delish. They are generous with their portions but that didn't take away from the taste! My friend who is Japanese said the una tama don she ordered is 10x better than some other sushi places that offer similar food. The staff was very attentive and constantly refilled our water too. I would return.
No comment

This is perfect spot, if you want some hit up some oyakodon. It was perfectly cook. The chicken is juicy and perfect amount of rice to fill you up. The plus is sake selection is good. Enough to choose, but not enough to confuse you with. Would I go back here again? Yes, please. Give me more oyakodon and some salted pork belly. So good!!!
Great find! The food was great, scallops and tuna tataki were standouts and when coupled with some sweet sake you can't go wrong. Affordable and amazing service, looking forward to coming back.
The food was fantastic, will definitely come back there.We stayed there with friends and family for the first time. The meet was really excellent!
I got the unatama don and it was incredible. It tasted super authentic. Also, the service was very good and our waitress was extremely attentive.
Been here 4 times already. It's in a quiet neighborhood, do remember to get a window seat. Love the karaage chicken and katsudon, probably the best in nyc (that I've ever tried so far)
Great service and tasty food! The unatama don was sooo good! The fluid egg yolk and full piece of eel made the best combination.
No comment
Having tuna tataki starts off the weekend - it is as fresh as this weekend can be. The salty pork belly very much reminds me of Chinese smoky sausage but it is not as salty. Fresh and delicate

Walked in on a Saturday night around 7 without a reservation. The two of us waited at the bar for ~10-15 mins and were able to get seated after enjoying a glass of plum wine. One of us was hungry and the other wasn't too hungry, so we ordered two small plates and one bowl of curry to share. Everything was tasty and interesting. The black miso chicken was flavorful and tender, but a bit too saucy and salty for me. The walnuts added a nice crunch and nutty flavor. The creamy baked salmon was surprisingly very good. The skin on the salmon was crisped to perfection and the salmon was fully baked without being dry. The cream sauce added a nice flavor to balance that of the salmon. The winner of the night was the curry though - which at only $15 is a great deal for the amount you get. The pork katsu arrived in "meat stick" shapes, which was unexpected but interesting. The pork wasn't greasy or overly breaded. I love that it came with two radishes to complement the heaviness of the rest of the dish. Throughout the nice the service was very attentive, efficient, and friendly. Would love to come back to try the chicken katsu curry, beef tataki, and unagi don!

I had some friends visiting from out of town so I took the to Benemon and it did not disappoint! The food and drinks were delicious and the presentation was great! We ordered 3 small bites and and entree, we left filling satisfied. The atmosphere is dark and feels authentic. It's also very close to all the bars off of St Marks, so it's easy to go from dinner to bars in the East Village. They literally thanked me for finding that spot and were very pleased with their dinner.
Excellent Japanese bowls with a cool vibe. The unagi don is out of this world. Also try the yuzu iced tea!

Awesome lunch and dinner place. My fiancé and I come here every weekend - they have the best yakiniku don, shrimp and Anago ten don in don and Una tama don. Reasonably priced and hip atmosphere. Attentive staff as well. Highly recommended!

I went here with my family a while back and became obsessed! This is my go-to spot when I have visitors or if I'm going to be in the east village. The food is the best and the service is good. Just a great experience all around. Highly highly recommend.
No comment

Had a great meal here with a couple of girlfriends and it made for the perfect mellow Sunday night. The fellow that tended to our meal was very nice and provided excellent service. The unagi don we got was huge and perfectly prepared. The salads delicious, soft shell crab yummy, beef tataki wonderful. The only thing I didn't care for was the salted pork, just a bit tough, but it was so minor compared to how amazing everything else was. Highly recommended! Especially the service!

This place is a hidden jewel. We tried Tofu Fire, Tuna Tataki and salty pork belly as starters. I love Tuna Tataki and Tofu Fire!! For don I ordered Una-Tama Don and it is beyond expectation. My friend ordered Katsu curry; it's good but may not be as amazing as my Una-Tama Don. Craft sake is highly recommended too. It's pink, named Ai No Hime.
No comment
No comment

Very nice Japanese Tapas restaurant. Price is not expensive. They don't take reservation and it is crowded after 7pm.  We ordered the Ali No Hime sparkling sake and it was awesome.  Food and service are good.  Donburi (Japanese rice bowl) is delicious.   We had the Una-Tama Don and it was also tasty.
Amazing flavor and tasty! Wait staff was excellent. Really enjoyed the dining experience. It's a small place about 12 to 15 tables.
No comment

We found this place by mistake, but so happy we did! Affordable Japanese comfort food. We ordered many small dishes edamame, chicken, steak and fried spicy tofu. We also had katsu curry and eel donburi. Everything was fresh and savory. Beautiful presentation, small restaurant and attentive waiters.

Cute location at the heart of East Village for some quality Japanese rice bowls ("Donburi"). On the pricier side of Japanese food, but definitely reasonable and fairly filling without feeling like you are going to explode. Service was superb and the dimly lit restaurant definitely had the ambiance for a cute dinner scene. My friend and I ordered the Tsukimi Tori Dona and the Una-Tama Don. Both were plated beautifully and so so good. I really enjoyed my visit and if I would definitely suggest to anyone who enjoys this type of Japanese comfort food. Defintiely will be back when I'm in the mood for some rice bowls!
No comment

Food here is pretty good. Not a whole lot of options, but scallop sashimi was really fresh. They pair it with an herb or a lemon and it really brings the flavor of the scallop out. Also ordered the oyako don, which was really good. The sauce was very flavorful and tasty. Everything melded with each other nicely.
No comment
No comment

Benemon is one of my favorite EV spots. The service is quick and the waiters/hosts are always warm and welcoming, and the ambiance is lovely. Most importantly, the food is delicious. I've gotten the Tsukimi Tori Don almost every time I've dined there, and it never disappoints. The Una Tama Don is also a good one! Once Benemon opens back up, I'll be there!
Fantastic place. Amazing food, super service. Great environment. Truly one of the better Japanese meals I've ever had in NYC.

Solid Japanese comfort food. I ordered the katsudon and my friend got the unagidon. Both were good and surprisingly filling. Flavor profile is definitely on the sweet side, but I think this is true for a lot of Japanese food, and I personally didn't mind.
I had a Una Tama don, and that was one of the best foods I ever had in NYC!! Perfectly cooked unagi are matched with egg! I would come back to try another food.
No comment
What a nice place. The food here is excellent (I loved the Tsukimi Tori Don and the Unagi Don) and service is very attentive and friendly. I would come back anytime!

Very impressive. I'm very pleased to find this place. I had Tsukimi Tori Don Lunch. First I thought it's too strong flavor but realized thats because It's meant to eat with runny egg yolk. Small portion to my big appetite but I agree that it's a perfect lunch portion. Well done. I will definitely go back.
No comment
No comment

Lovely space in the E Village - great service. Really enjoyed the salty pork belly appetizer - it melted in my mouth. The curry was delicious. The prices here are super fair, especially considering how lovely the space is and how pleasant it is to be there.
No comment

Found this place when they first opened and have been coming back ever since. We were walking around and everything had a wait, we stumbled in here only to be seated right away and had the best dinner. The tuna tataki makes dreams a reality! I've never had to wait more than ten mins for a table, which is weird because it's so good. One of my favorite random finds in NYC by far.
No comment

The service at Benemon is truly excellent.   They constantly check on how you are doing and if yoo need anything.  Pork tonkatsu was excellent.  So was the chicken kara age.  Some of the food items like the yakiniku don is a bit too sweet for my taste but when I brought this up, the owner was extremely apologetic and insisted on giving me a big discount.   Great service truly sets this shop apart from their competitors.
No comment

Came here for lunch last Monday just when it opened. I got the yakiniku don lunch set and my bf got the pork katsu curry lunch set. I love lunch sets! My lunch set was $15 which I think was reasonable for the portion size. It came with a miso soup, some pickles and a dessert. The restaurant was very rustic looking and nice ambiance. Wait staff was nice but we had to ask several times for tea. Other than that, will be back again. Great comfort food!

Been here on many occasions and the food is top notch. Top favorites are the chicken curry and unatama don. Ambiance leans closer to a place you'd bring a date, but works well for groups too. Chicken karaage is above average. I think they've added more items to their menu than my last time here, but definitely a spot worth visiting and re-visiting in the future.
Just came back from Japan so we still had the craving and was looking for donburi..:it was a great find and we will definitely be back!  The place is comfortable and food was good too!
The service was average or slightly above average. Had the dish with shrimp tempura in it--It was very bland. Granted, it might be the dish I chose but hopefully the other dishes are not bland.

Small place, and dimly lit. Food was on the small side (as everyone else stated). Had the yakiniku don(sliced beef with rice). Too much sauce, very overbearing.  Tuna tartar was ok, not outstanding. We had to remind the waiter to bring a plate a few times.
No comment

Benemon is known for their donburi dishes, eel tamago bowl is their signature dish, try Una Don for a more simple dish: huge piece of eel and rice. Eel tamago comes with less eel but also has eggs and scallion as well. Kara-age fried chicken is a great appetizer

Great Japanese comfort food which we hadn't had before. We were on a vacation to New York City and noticed how good the food was in the Lower East Side. We really likes our appetizer choices including the tuna and fried chicken which was awesome. We also enjoyed the gobo sticks which is sautéed but burdock root. We asked our waiter what it tastes like and he said burdock root. Lol, you just have to try it and see for yourself. You won't be disappointed and it only costs $4. For entrees I also recommend vegetable curry and the Nanban Don. All five of us really enjoyed our food. This is one of my stepbrothers go to spots in the lower east side. Great service and food definitely deserve there current 4.5 star review. If you live in the area and haven't been yet, get on it!

So first of all, I am vegan. Their menu is 85% meat and sea food, but the remaining 15% got me coming back there over and over again. Of course, you have to take breaks, because eating the same dish is a bit boring. But their tempura is to die for. And tofu salad. So vegans, yes: you won`t find a lot there, but what you will find - will be good!

Overall, the food was great, but pricey. The Karaage was really juicy and well-seasoned (although the dish was a little small, like 6-8 pieces). The Una-Tama Don was delicious and a good portion, but expensive. The Curry Katsu was also great, but again expensive. I'd say overall, it's worth a try!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has unique Japanese food that I haven't seen anywhere else. They specialize in comfort food but their appetizers have healthy options like the tuna tartare. We got the natto curry and unagi-tama which were both savory and delicious. Ambience is also cozy as well. Highly recommend!

This is a regular don and appetizer Japanese tapas restaurant.  They've got items like curry katsu and tataki.  On the whole, very average across the board.  Everything was exactly as anticipated, nothing better, nothing worse than expected.  Prices were also extremely average.  Ambience was nice, service was... ok, I had to spend some significant effort to get the attention of our waiter, who just wasn't very nice or attentive all evening.

I used to love this place. On 3.24.18 the host had us wait 45 minutes (no problem, got a drink next door) and said we were next up and then as we were ready to sit...someone strolled right in front of us and was seated immediately. The host stopped us said someone who lives upstairs and has a "good relationship with the boss" will sit down instead of us. We asked how long the wait would now be he said "I don't think it will work out tonight." I unfortunately expected this. It was clear the past two times I have been here that service levels and food portions have gotten worse and smaller. A few parties at the bar turned to me to say they had been waiting 30 minutes to take their order so not to hold my breath. Too bad...please tell the host to at least apologize when he is giving up a table to his friend.

Three stars for their good service, tuna tataki, and the una-tama don (large pieces of eel with rich soy sauce) that my friend ordered. I ordered a Nanban Don, crispy chicken tempura glazed with a sweet, rich nanban sauce... Or should I call it the crispy chicken and mayo over rice... If you are expecting to have an authentic Japanese food, I won't recommend this place.
Yummy Japanese place that specializes in don and fried chicken! Both were super yummy!! Small place, so expect a wait. Pretty cool atmosphere though.
AMAZING food. SOOO GOOD. Quick service, small place but beautiful intimate atmosphere and not too loud. Very pretty decor. Nice servers too! 10/10
No comment

Awesome Don in this restaurant. It's rare in New York to have such a close taste with local Japan ones. Besides, the speed of cooking and service are fae beyond its price. Wish to have one close to my home...(sad)

EXCELLENT FOOD N SERVICE great place to take someone special, doesnt fit that many people (optimal number to go with is 2-3), their donburi is probably the best donburi in the city for sure, safe to say everything on their menu is good, and ofc the staff is just so wonderful and sweet, very attentive, my water glass was never empty for more than a few seconds
No comment
No comment

This place is just great! They don't accept reservations but you can just walk-in and wait for a table at the bar. Every person in this restaurant is extremely friendly. I would definitely recommend sharing the small plates but make sure you also take a curry next to that because you wouldn't want to miss that!
Came in for lunch, good choice if you are eating alone, chill and sweet

Nice place the atmosphere is pretty nice, the tables are very cramped but has a cozy feel.  The service is wonderful and love their selection of craft saki. Now to the food, first warming they definitely bring fresh hot food, so much so I burned my mouth on the potatoes in anchovies. The steak in the app small plate menu was very well prepared, probably the highlight of my evening. We did the bowls for dinner, I got the shrimp bowl and just wasn't a huge fan. The chicken and steak ones looked more appitizing so maybe next time. But the place is nice I would return but not anytime soon as the area just has so many other places worth trying.
The food was delicious (although the beef tasted a little fatty). Good flavors and each dish was diverse. Good service and very good atmosphere for conversation. The bathroom was zen and clean.

Cozy little place perfect for a quiet Japanese dinner in the East Village.   The Tapas style dishes were delicately prepared and the unagi donburi complemented well.   Very pleasant experience would definitely recommend.
No comment
Wonderful donburi. Not to loud. Calming atmosphere. Great place to stop when running errands in the area. Definitely a place I would recommend to travelers or friends looking for a place to eat solo.
No comment

Went here on a Friday night, didn't have to wait too long for a table. Maybe 20 minutes or so. Had some sake at the bar so that was nice. Food was excellent. Service attentive. The atmosphere is very nice with big open windows into the street. It's a hidden gem of the area. I would expect it to be busier than it was!

Waiter seemed annoyed with my stroller, but the waitress was very nice. Ten don was really good, fresh shrimp and eel. Una don was one of the best eel dishes I've tried. The pork belly was ok, the sauce was ok, very small portion.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came for dinner and shared a bunch of appetizers and we each got a rice dish. Reminds me of cheap lunch special Japanese places, which was disappointing because the other reviews and pictures made it seem like something else. Not worth a special visit, but fine for an ok meal.

Absolutely lovely! I had the tsukimi tori don and the crispy chicken with the shiitake mushroom mix was very flavorful with a hint of sweetness. Ambiance is very nice. Service was wonderful. I highly recommend!
