Enjoyable Japanese comfort food :) Service was quick and courteous. Dined there on a coldish rainy night with a party of four and left happy. Mission accomplished!
Cute place to get donburi's in the East Village. We ordered katsu, unagi, and oyakodon as well as pork belly for the appetizer. We all liked it but agreed that there was a little too much sauce.

A warm, intimate place to have traditional Japanese comfort food. My fiancé and I had our first date here and have come back several times, including to get engaged! The food is great, especially their weekend lunch options. Staff is wonderful and the owners are so sweet!
My husband and I are craving for Japanese comfort food. We are glad we found this place and they just open for lunch this weekend. Great place and great food.

We came here for an early dinner. The sake sampler was just ok. The scallop sashimi was great. We also had teriyaki chicken, katsue, and tempura. Also their signature desserts: black sesame pudding and honey flan pudding.
Really liked this place. Good quality & great food presentation. Came here for lunch and everything was separated in small side dishes.

Very happy with this place! The food is absolutely amazing. You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. We each had a chicken don bowl and the baked salmon to start, which was melt in your mouth creamy. The don bowls have the perfect amount of food in them and you can tell that all of the ingredients are very fresh. Prices are also reasonable here as well. Plus, kudos to the staff. Everyone was very nice and I even asked if the heat could be turned down and they turned it down! :D Definitely will be coming back. Great place.

Was very pleasantly surprised by this place! I've walked past it a few hundred times and finally went to dinner with a friend on Friday night. We were seated right away and had great service with even better food! It started to get quite crowded but no one rushed us to finish our meal. I had the Nanban Don and it was fantastic - so flavorful - I totally recommend it! We also got a bottle of sake (can't remember which one exactly), but it was also fantastic. The portions are quite big, too.
No comment

This is not my summer restaurant spot.  It's my autumn / winter / raining / anytime it's cold and I want hearty and comforting asian food spot.  My favorite is their eel bowl with the egg and a nice glass of warm saki. They also have this homemade tea that is light and sweet and non-alcoholic.  If I lived around the neighborhood, this place would definitely have me as a bi-weekly customer.   Good food  at prices you wouldn't mind paying for a casual dinner.  This place is a definite must try and then a return to try again.
No comment
Good food! A little bit too sweet though. I went at dinner time and the lighting was pretty romantic.  Fun staffs, I got a cat drawing on my receipt  :P

Was in the village, seeing a show with a friend, and randomly walked in. for a late night snack and a drink. Oh boy....I am so glad we did.Started off with a small bottle of chilled, unfiltered sake, But it was their comfort food, that just blew me away.The garlic beefsteak just melted in our mouth, with an incredible sauce accompanying. The tuna tataki was rare...delicious. The black miso chicken was delicious...and the tempura was light...not greasy...and so enjoyable. I should mention that all these portions were tastings....somewhat small portions....but a few nice bites for each (if you are a couple), and most reasonably priced ($10 or so). I am actually looking forward to going back....and having a proper dinner there. Thanks Benemon !!!!
Benemon has great lunch sets. I really enjoyed the pork katsu don. I can't wait to come back for dinner and try their various sakes.
No comment

The other stuff didn't impress me too much but the eel don (not the one with the egg, just the regular one) has the LARGEST piece of eel I've ever seen with $26, at least in east village neighborhood. What's even better is that they don't give a too much rice so that you don't feel you have had too much. The taste is a little bit on the sweet side, but if there's a day you really want eel, come here for this huge one!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really enjoy this place! Came here after a long chilly walk in the neighborhood. Was greeted by friendly staff and offered a big table away from the door. Started with some warm sake, which was great. They have a good selection of sake and the food is delicious. The Una tama don is a must! It's a nice combination of sweet and salty while also feeling hearty, which was perfect. I do wish it had a little bit of a chewy and/or crunchy topping. The bunny yuzu is super light and refreshing.
Typical bar atmosphere, nothing too special. Food was creatively presented but just simple dishes that are nothing special. Wouldn't cone here again just for food

I have a severe allergy to soy. Usually I have consistent problems eating at restaurants. Upon arrival, I informed the staff of my allergy to soy and they were more than accommodating. The servers worked with the chefs to come up with a marked menu that was hand delivered to the table with options for me. The owner also came over to assure me of things that I would be able to eat. Excellent service and I would recommend to anyone!!

I'm dumbfounded by these positive reviews. While the space is pleasabt enough, the food was universally terrible. A burdock root "fry" was nearly inedible, and I love burdock--hard and chewy as tree bark. A hijiki salad was just some spring greens and mushy tofu with little hijiki in evidence. Scallops were greyish, rubbery and room temperature, and their version of chicken kara age was gristly chunks of meat in a plain batter--McNuggets would have been more appetizing. It was a real bummer on a first night in New York.

Benemon is a quaint little dine in restaurant with many different options for rice bowls. I came here with my boyfriend and we got the Curry Katsu Don and the Yaniku Don. The curry was great! I was a little surprised when it came out because the pork was more like nuggets than a filet, but the meat was tender and there was just the right amount of crunch. The curry was flavorful and sweet. The Yaniku Don was really sweet, but the portions were a little small. The dish came in a bowl with high sides so it seemed even smaller. My boyfriend left hungry, but the quality of his food was great. Service was very fast. Our food came out within 15 minutes of ordering. We will definitely be back!
No comment
No comment

Delicious little gem in LES! I heard so many good things about this restaurant and I finally decided to try it out for dinner. It's a little restaurant with a romantic/candlelight vibe, which I believe would be nice for a chill date night. We ordered the famous una-tama don, and it was delicious!! The portion is on the smaller side, but very filing. Just go and you will love it!
No comment

Not a bad lunch spot. For those who love to combine quality sake with Japanese comfot foods, this is your spot. Had the eel lunch set. Incredibly tasty and well priced. Dessert options are limited to dessert sake and black sesame mousse. Space is cozy and intimate but slightly out of the way.

Stumbled upon this place on a Saturday evening with the boyfriend. We were looking to try something new for dinner and saw reviews were really good for this place so we gave it a try. Upon entering, very strong distinct smell of curry. We like that they have a large good sake selection. We got the shirakawago lightly cloudy sake which was amazing. For entrees, we for the una tama don and  ten don. The una tama don was amazing! Every bite just makes you wanna take another bite. From the eel to the egg, the mushrooms and rice cooked all so perfectly and just even sauce that it's not too overwhelming. The portions are pretty big too. For the ten don, it was just okay.. wasn't much flavor to the tempura. Wish there was some egg or sauce to the rice. It was just tempura over white rice. Overall definitely would recommend a friend to this place, and I'll be back with my bf for the una tama don again!
Food was OK but portions and pricing were not up to par, even if it is a tapas-style spot. There are other places much better than this in NYC.
Definitely gonna come here again! Very tasty! donburi! Appetizers (especially tuna tatami) was very savory! However, the portion size of donburis were kinda small...

The food was amazing, as was the service. I went on a Thursday night and waited about 25 minutes for a table for two, at 7:30PM. The staff is conscious of making sure people who are waiting are comfortable. Felt really authentic and high quality. Food was seriously amazing and I will definitely come back.
Very cozy with a warm and inviting interior. The staff is always friendly and the service is good! The food is also affordable and tasty.
the katsu don is way too sweet and the pork cutlet is not very crispy. The price is reasonable but small portion. Good place to have weekday lunch

The ambiance of the place is perfect for an evening get together with friends, family and even a date-night. Their food was worth the price because of how delicious it was. It really fills your stomach. The service was really good too, and the servers were very accommodating and nice.

Great place to impress a date, especially on a summer evening.  Large open storefront lets in the fresh air while you kick back in this cozy little eatery.  Really scrumptious Japanese cuisine with interesting twists.  All plates are quite small so keep that in mind when you order.  This is not exactly an inexpensive place once you factor that in but it's reasonable for the area.  Plan on a short wait during peak dinner hours; seating is a bit limited.
Not sure where the hype comes from. The food is good, not amazing and the portions are tiny for the cost and ingredients.
This is an absolute gem of a restaurant. The staff was super nice and knowledgeable and the ambience was super cool. It's the best Japanese food I've had in ages, I highly recommend Benemon!

Great service, and surprisingly large portions for the price! Restaurant felt hygienic (which is high up on my list of importance), and the food was well-made. Everything was not overly-salty, which was a pleasant surprise for a Japanese restaurant. Rice wasn't the freshest, so minus one star for that (you can get ill from old rice). They have some vegetarian-friendly options that are more than just salad, which I appreciate. My only warning is if you check their health inspection, apparently there is some bare-hand contact with foods that will not be heat-treated. So there's that, if you care about that kind of thing.

Came here for brunch/lunch on the weekend and definitely a fan of the don sets. It came with cole slaw salad or soup, pickled veggies, and sweetened beans. The salad and pickled veggies were a perfect compliment but I wasn't crazy about the beans. I had the unagi don and it was delish. Loved the taste of the egg and mushrooms in it. Cute restaurant tucked in East Village and I would try again for dinner. Great spot for comfort Japanese food in the city and reasonably priced.

Went here for date night and I absolutely love the ambience, it is very romantic and intimate. We ordered the gobo sticks and edamame peperoncino as our appetizers. The gobo sticks were delicious very crisp but not at all oily with a very unique flavor. The edamame was amazing, I've never had edamame that was so packed full of flavor before! It was spicy and savory. Definitely get the edamame if youre coming here! For our main course we got the chicken katsu curry and the yakiniku donburi. The chicken was very crispy but not at all oily or dry. The sauce was rich and savory. The yakiniku was very tender and sliced very thinly and packed full of flavor from their marinade which was sweet. The shredded pickled radish on top added another level of flavor and texture to the dish as well. I would love to come back here to try more of their dishes! The service here was amazing and they always checked up on us to see if we needed anything but also never rushed us.

One of the best dinners I've ever had. I've told all my friends to check out this spot and they agree--the unagi over rice is done perfectly. The unagi was the perfect, and was complemented by the spongey egg cake and dimensionality of flavors. Just big enough to make me perfectly full, but it stuffed. The fried chicken was delicious too!

The quality of the beef and service here are exceptional. I had the yakiniku, while my husband had the eel bowl. Both were amazing - we recently got back from a trip to Japan and were blown away by how the quality and taste of the food everywhere we went were top-notch, so lowered our standards a bit once we got back to NYC, but Benemon really takes us back. Ambiance is pretty nice too, the wait staff so very attentive. Highly recommended!

Hidden gem! The chicken katsu curry was to die for! Amazing flavors and quality ingredients. I'm not an expert but it had a strong cinnamon taste which I loved so careful if you re allergic. Great price tag and cozy spot! Perfect for a date.
No comment

The atmosphere is lovely and the wait isn't terrible, even during prime time on a Friday. The rice bowls are both varied and traditional and it's pretty affordable for New York deliciousness. The seared Tuna share plate is lovely!

The plum wine is really good since I prefer sweet wine:) the shrimp tempura is ok for me b/c I sensed a little "fishy taste" there.  Katsu Don is really good in spite of the taste and size.  UNA Don is ok, I would say it's not the "astonishing" eel meal for me but considering the price and size, it's not bad.  Kara-age is good, soft fried crab is also good.

First time here and we loved everything about it! The place is welcoming as is the entire staff. Food is unbelievable! We ordered the beef tartare, anchovie potatoes, smoked pork belly app and they did a great job executing. All full of amazing flavors! Pork katsu curry and their eel bowl were the meals that also impressed! My hats off to the chef/cooks for performing. Great selection of sake with taste descriptions so it makes it easy to order which you feel you'd enjoy. I will definitely be coming back! Great job to the crew!
No comment
Great little family owed place with a chill, but nice atmosphere. Great rice bowls and saki.

I ordered the Tsukimi Tori Don - super flavorful and perfectly cooked! The service was great, and the decor of the restaurant was lovely. Would def come back to try more of the donburis or even the curries.
This place is great! Chill atmosphere. Large selection of delicious sake. The food was amazing! I ordered the Yakiniku bowl and even though I was so full I couldn't stop eating!!!! Incredible!
No comment
Great place to eat. Got nice and cozy seats by the window. Great Japanese food. Have a variety of food. I would say it's a good Japanese comfort food haha

Met a friend here for dinner.  We had an array of appetizers as well as drinks.  The food was great, the ambience was intimate w/ dimmed lighting and quiet conversations around and the service was great - very attentive.  Will return!  Thank you.

Tasty brunch with the kids.  Heard about this place but didn't sound like a good place to take the kids for dinner but late brunch on a Sunday was fine.  Our son loves katsu curry so always on the look out for good katsu curry.  Will be back.

I learned of this restaurant through Yelp.  It is relatively new and already had pretty good ratings to begin with, so I decided to give it a try.  We ended up ordering two small plates; I think it was the salmon and the beef plates.  The atmosphere was very intimate and added a nice touch.  I made a reservation and apparently my gf thought I lied about making reservations just so that we wouldn't have to wait.  But no, I did make a reservation.  So we got seated instantly.  As for the food, I was captivated instantly and knew that I would want to come back here again to try their other plates.  The service was excellent too, the waiter was very attentive and gave great suggestions.  I would highly recommend everyone to stop by and try Benemon out.

I was so excited to try this place after reading reviews here about how amazing this place is. My husband and I ordered the 2 popular eel dons, one with egg and one without egg. We also ordered the homemade tofu for appetizer. The tofu was delicious. It was perfectly soft and savory. However, I have to say I was very underwhelmed by the dons. The eel didn't have enough sauce on it and didn't taste that great either. We had to ask for extra sauce on the side. The son with the egg was good but not worth the price they charge you. It seemed like a good place for a date but I just wouldn't come back here again. There are so many good Japanese places in east village for me to go back to a mediocre place.

Wow this place is a hidden jewel at east village area. I came at happy hour time with 2 people. Each time we order a scallop sashimi (3 whole piece) we get a 8$ drink for free. The scallop is from Hokkaido. It taste sweet with lemon and sesame leaf. This dish is highly recommended even without the free drink. We also order a Katsu curry, shrimp tempura and beef tataki. The quality of every dish here is beyond my expectation. I will come back again with more friends.

It wasn't as good as I hoped. My friends agreed the una-tamadon was kinda fishy and oddly still had the eel skin attached.  The fried chicken don was good.  The garlic steak appetizer was under seasoned. And lastly, the tuna was just OK.  I probably wouldn't return because nothing stood out.  We did get a decent bottle of white wine for $40.  It was far from the train station for me and a long walk.  The pictures look better than the food actually tasted.
The food is just so good. And the sparkling sake is the best. I really enjoy the environment.

Great Japanese tapas/comfort food. Ordered the tofu, pork belly, vegetable curry, and Katsu-don, which were all delicious.  The ambience is pretty lowkey--feeels like a wine bar--but the presentation and service were all really nice. Definitely should order sake when you're here.

This place is relatively cheap but the quality of food is just okay. My noodles were over cooked and lacked flavor. The chicken appetizer was a small portion and came w an overly salty sauce. I guess this place is aimed toward college kids who just want a quick meal
Cute place! Great service and expansive sake list. Overall the food was ok, nothing extraordinary that I would come back for. If you're in the neighborhood, its a decent choice!
No comment

I found this little gem shortly after moving to the LES and I love it! The nanban don is my go to and the tuna tataki! The services are very nice, the ambiance is dim lighting so its great for a dinner with friends or a nice little date! Also the place is always very clean! I suggest it!

Finally a Japanese establishment that sells something else other than ramen and sushi! I found my ootoya replacement! They have amazing apps and I still drool over that creamy baked salmon dish! It might be tooo creamy for some people but if you like alfredo it's a Must order!! They also have amazing sake flight totally worth the money as they were much much cheaper than had we ordered them separately. I ordered nanban don and my friend order oyakudon. Nanban was a little dry but I think the oyakudon is decent. They still can't compare to ootoya but is good enough. I like the vibe, the staff(super friendly) and the food!  Recommend to come in small or big group!
No comment
Refused to seat me because I was with my service dog- who is a legally registered, trained, and uniformed (meaning she was wearing her service dog vest) medical alert animal.

Went with a couple of friends on a rainy day and had a great meal. We split the anchovy potatoes and pork belly to start. Both were really good! I ordered the oyako don and it was delicious, but the portion size is a bit small. My friends ordered some of the other bowls, and felt the same way in terms of the portion size. We left still a little hungry and went to get dessert after. While the food is good, portion size could definitely be bigger. Would definitely come back though!
No comment
Relaxed vibe. Doesn't take reservations but not too long of a wait! Great tapas to share and extensive sake selection.

5 stars - I really enjoyed my experience at Benemon. Great food, atmosphere, and service! I went with a bunch of people and got the Katsu Don and it did not disappoint, probably one of the best Japanese meals I've had in the city. Highly recommend!

So glad I walked in and ate here.  The food was amazing.  The small plates are great as appetizers per person or if you want to share small portions tapas style.  The real dishes are the rice bowls.  Each full course item is served on top of a bed of rice, which by the way, is perfectly cooked.  The portion sizing is phenomenal for the main dishes and delicious as well.  Best curry bowl I've had at a Japanese restaurant.  They excel in all areas of food as well, whether it's seafood, chicken, vegetable or beef, there is an option for everyone.  In addition, the desert options, two, caramel custard or a black sesame mousse.  We got both, and they were also extremely well made.  The dishes were portioned for one person but if you're looking to just have a nice small dish that you want to share or have on your own just as a dessert but not make you explode because it is a giant portion, those are perfect, otherwise, get two for yourself!
No comment

A great new addition to the neighborhood!  The atmosphere is sleek yet cozy, with each plate more delicious than the last! I shared a bunch of small plates and entrees with friends.  The dishes were generously portioned and delicious!  Plus, they have a great happy hour special of a draft beer and fried chicken appetizer is a steal!  Highly recommend the smoked pork belly appetizer and the eel donburi.  The service was friendly and attentive.  A great place to enjoy a meal with friends!

Delicious Japanese rice bowls (donburi) and small plates. I had the BBQ Beef Donburi which was amazing and the beef garlic is an excellent small plate. Great new place to check out in the East Village.

A Japanese restaurant run by an actual Japanese family... imagine that. Everything came out hot and well-seasoned and very comforting. The portions were quite generous and it's just a great value considering the quality of service, the tastiness of the food, and the modern decor.
No comment

Food is absolutely amazing. Everything we ordered came out fresh and hot. Fire tofu was delicious and the garlic steak small plate was definitely my favorite. If you go during happy hour, you get a side of fried chicken bites with your beer! Even the chicken was moist and flavorful. The best part was the service, such genuine people greeting and making your experience that much better. The owner is a really sweet lady who really is so lovely. Def coming back!
So so delicious! Curry is spot on and the custard is to diiiieeeeee forrrrr! Lovely ambiance and top notch service too.

Benemon is a cozy spot with the perfect atmosphere and lighting for an intimate date or a fun night out with friends. I had the Tsukimi tori don, which was amazing. I was also impressed with the drink selection. Many Japanese restaurants in NYC serve Sapporo, maybe Kirin, and a bunch of domestic standards like Bud or Coors. Benemon has Prohibition Ale and Stone IPA (and more) on draft. Beat that!
No comment

I made a reservation on valentines day and I was the first there. They had a nice interior and a full bar. The space is quite small so I feel like if I had come later in the night (I was there right when they opened) it might have gotten loud/crowded. My date and I shared the curry pork-katsu. I was really disappointed because the curry sauce was off, it didn't taste like traditional curry sauce. However, the pork-katsu itself was nice and we also shared the popcorn chicken app and that was really good. Although, the tea they give you in the beginning tasted like ass. So overall, it was so-so; I probably won't be coming back.

I had the Salted Pork Belly and the Una-Tama. Both were ridiculously delicious. Also, was there for happy hour so I received the Japanese Fried Chicken special with my beer, which is literally the most amazing special you could ever as for. Great service and atmosphere as well.

Great atmosphere and delicious foods. Wonderful services. We had brunch on Sunday  at Benemon and the lunch menu are a great deal. The right proportion size not too much. I would come back again with my whole family again. Sunday is better because of easily available parking spaces around the neighborhood .
A pricey place-but great memory: my bf and I had our last dinner here before he left and started another part of our long-distance relationship:.)

Food was decent, ordered the Tsukimi Tori Don which was good but it was too wet of a dish with too much sauce. I liked the chicken and shiitake which both had a very robust taste but the dish itself was nothing unique. The Nigori sake was in fact excellent and the reason why this rating is 4 instead of 3 stars. The restaurant is very cute and service was great.
No comment

This magical little restaurant lit up my soul making me feel like one of the cold nights snuggling into my warm and cozy bed letting me feel fuzzy from my head to my toesies. Also the food is impeccable.
I was craving eel so I ordered the una-tama don. Craving satisfied.

Came here last night to celebrate a friends bday, everything from the service to quality of food was on point. Krista took really good care of us and was very attentive. We ended up closing the place because we were having an awesome time! Will def come back.

I was very impressed with Benemon! We got a bunch of small plates to start. The edamame and black miso chicken were particularly delicious (we had to get a second order of the edamame, it was a table fave!). Most of us got donburi bowls. I got the Unagi Don was so impressed by the quality and portion of fish. Usually when I get it I am disappointed by the size of fillet because you spend a lot of money and then get a measly portion. At Benemon, it was longer than the bowl! It was extremely yummy and filling and I will most definitely come back! Everyone cleaned their plates and praised the quality and portion of the food. The staff was very friendly and courteous as well. The sake selection was great. I got a sparking sake which was absolutely delicious (I'd never had it before).
No comment

Benemon's menu consists of dishes that are each a beautiful and considered composition of flavors, infusing traditional Japanese comfort food with a contemporary air. Their small sleek bar is also well stocked and well staffed. Seek out this understated jewel for a truly enjoyable restaurant experience.
Very comfortable restaurant! Good food and great atmosphere. Would come here for lunch with friends.
No gluten free options available and not willing to modify any dishes to accommodate. Had to pay full price for our drinks and pack up to find other restaurant to eat

It's always great to find a place with comforting food that puts a smile on your face. I ordered the Una-Tama Don set. There was a generous amount of eel for the price of the dish. Every bite (rice, egg, eel and mushroom) was absolutely delicious. The negative comment I have was the dessert which was included in the set. It wasn't much taste and the consistency was very light. I would definitely recommend this as a date spot: not just for the food but for the environment; i love the exposed brick and wood furnishings as well as the window walls located at the entrance.
Stopped by on Sunday evening, had several small plates, Don, and saké. Will be back soon!

There's nothing better than the food here! The curry is probably one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. The food is not only well flavored but fresh. The servers are total sweethearts and I especially loved the black sesame dessert as it's my favorite flavor and impossible to find at many restaurants. The atmosphere is beautiful and I love the candle lighting. I can't wait to go back again!

I would said this is a pretty average Japanese restaurant. I ordered the katsudon and my friend got the the eel. The eel was actually pretty good, but my katsudon is not as great as the eel. We also order some wine to drink, makes the atmosphere decent. Overall not bad but no the best.

Donburi has always been comfort food for me, glad to find this cozy gem in LES. Ordered tofu salad w arugula, una tama don and popcorn chicken don. Very generous portion of eel, perfectly cooked eggs over rice, delicious. Popcorn chicken was alright, lighter flavor, chicken was not really crispy. Tofu salad was a highlight, tofu so soft and creamy, almost felt like cheese. Also had a Sake Flight, a good selection of smooth and dry sake.
No comment
Service is really good. I ordered Una-tama don and the portion of the food and ratio of rice and sauce, eel is nicely matched. Also, their Sesame mousse is great.

Been here twice in 2 weeks because I really, really love the Oyako Don they serve! At 13 bucks, it's as good of a chicken don as you're ever gonna find. Beef tataki was great but it could have been better served warm, rather than slightly cold. Overall just really good service and a nice cozy restaurant to go to.

I LOVE this place! The curry was delicious, my favorite beer was on tap, and I felt soooo taken care of. We stayed so much longer than we should have--but we were having such a good time!!! I can't wait to go back!

Honestly this place is great! Went with a group of 5! They accommodated us well.  The flavor of the food was by itself is more than enough to have us go back. The service was spot on. The interior was well put together and the atmosphere was welcoming. Had the chance to chat with the owner and you can tell that they put some solid work into the place. Overall would recommend this place and will return.

This place is great! My favorite was the Tuna Tataki and garlic beef steak, but everything else is delicious too. For desert, I tried the custard pudding as well as the black sesame mousse, they're both very yummy, and the black sesame mousse has Japanese black sugar as sauce, very genuine flavor. The service was awesome too.

Delicious Oyako don. Kids enjoyed that and the tempura. Appreciated the happy hour special- got to try scallop sashimi and a delicious sake. Tofu salad was delicious. Service was attentive- water was not ice cold which I loved. Green tea was hearty. Close to Stomp.

This place is really great. They offer a happy hour special where you get fried chicken with any draft beer. My friend and I had a couple of the small plates, including the black cod and the salmon. The black cod is particularly delicious -- good marinade, nice crisp skin, and obviously a quality piece of seafood. The place had a nice quiet ambience too. Would be good for dates.

The service was very good, but the food did not meet my expectations. Nothing was wrong, but nothing was great. My wife and I both grew up in Tokyo and go back frequently so have pretty high standards when it comes to Japanese food.
No comment

Good comfort food and environment. Prices are fair and reasonable, although nothing really spectacular but it is a great place for a gathering with friends on quality times and relaxing conversation, or for lovers to have some romantic moments that would make time pass so fast. We celebrated my wife's birthday at the restaurant and I recommend the eel don, very delicious.

Cute place, but on the small side. Definitely an intimate vibe. Come here for the donburi, the una-tama was amaaaazing while the nanban was just alright. The appetizers were all good but nothing special. They're also very tiny so I recommend ordering a few and sharing.
Really good restaurant. Tasty food and cute interior, id love to start a franchise in la! My girlfriend and I had a great time contact me we can be great.

Best don place in New York hands down. I only came here twice and tried two of their dons, namely eel over rice and beef over rice, but I was completely blown away both times. They really nailed it. I wish they put in more rice though since one don is not really big enough for one person, but flavor-wise this place is absolutely stellar.

Yummy eats.. The small plates were crazy good.. soft shell crab (crispy crabby perfection), tuna tataki (beautifully seared), and my favorite of the small plates - the garlic beef steak (OMG sooo good.. cooked rare, juicy and so tender..  like butter).  For entrees we had the shrimp ten don and the una-tama don. The shrimp ten don was ok, I am not a fan of tempora in general so it was probably not a good dish to select, I will say though that the tempora coating was light and crisp.  The una-tama don was absolutely delicious! I wish I had a Japanese grandma who could make such a yummy comforting bowl of una-tama don for me.. seriously. The staff was friendly, though the place was crazy busy and some things took a while to be served (ie. our drink order and I asked for a glass of water multiple times before I actually got it).  I'll be back for that garlic steak and una-tama don for sure! :-)

We ordered the sake flight, anchovy fried potatoes, simmered vegetables, una-tama don (eel with egg) and tsukimi tori don (popcorn chicken with egg). We sat at the bar and the service was very pleasant. The food itself was hot, delicious and comforting. The anchovy fried potatoes were bursting with flavor and the simmered vegetables were a great compliment to the protein heavy entrees. The rice bowls were both really good. The eel wasnt overly seasoned and the popcorn chicken was perfectly cooked. We dined on a weeknight without reservations. Other than bar seating the entire place was booked so be sure to call ahead.
Great food, good portions. Did you know the owner's son built all the decor himself?
No comment

Came here on the recommendation of a friend to celebrate an anniversary with my boyfriend and we were NOT disappointed! It was absolutely wonderful in every way and helped create the most perfect and memorable date night. From the delicious sake that the super accommodating server recommended, to the beautiful exposed brick and drop lights that created such a sweet and intimate atmosphere - everything was good from start to finish! I would highly recommend the edamame drizzled with olive oil, salt, and hot pepper flakes to start and one of their amazing rice bowls. Not to mention the staff were SO nice and made sure our date was special! Will definitely be returning to this lower east side gem!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Enjoyed the food and atmosphere very much. Very friendly service, but although I told a server they don't need to wait for the appetizer to finish to bring the entrees, they served the entrees before the appetizer. That was a small thing though. Missing one star is because the desert menu is weak - there's no other choice but one - black sesame mouse, it was good but very small for the price (and when I asked for the menu they just told me what the it was so I never knew the price until the check came). I have to say the main dishes were very good though, if I live near by I'll be a regular.
I would definitely revisit this place. I got Una Tama Don. If you like eel, you must try this!
No comment

First time dining experience was A++. We didn't know what to order so asked for suggestions, all were amazing. The salted port belly and tuna tataki to start, I loved the tuna! For the main course we did Nanban Don & Tsukimi Tori Don... not a piece of rice was leftover. Cannot wait to come back!
No comment

I was very impressed with the meal I had. Thankfully it was not a busy monday and we were able to get a table around 6ish. Waiters were attentive and gave good recommendations. We had the edamame, beef tataki, pork belly, anchovy fried potatoes, kara-age fried chicken and gomadare salad for our apps and salmon carpaccio, ten don and chicken katsu as our main dishes. Overall food was really good. Service was pretty fast. Didn't expect them to push out the dishes that quickly. Only gripe was the tea wasn't free.

I absolutely love Benemon.  The service is fantastic and on point.  The portion size of the plates were also very generous.  Not to mention the quality of the food is top notch.  It is the perfect spot for a date night - the layout of the Benemon is beautiful.  It is one of my favorite places in the city.  Highest recommendation possible!
No comment

I loved this place! The staff were extremely attentive and the food was tasty. I especially liked the vegetables and the creamy dill salmon. The miso cod was okay, though it didn't compare to Nobu's. Best of all, the owner chatted with us at the end of our meal and gave us a free custard dessert, which was absolutely heavenly -- very light and sweet.
No comment

Love this place! I tried a lot of different things - the shrimp tempura, edamame peperoncino, kara-age, anchovy fried potatoes, and the yakiniku don - all delicious! The ambience was perfect, and the service was extra friendly. Can't wait to go back and try everything else on the menu!

I've been here twice and both times the food were delicious. My favorite dish was una-Tama don. Even my bf who normally doesn't eat shiitake mushroom (it's chewy to him) thought the mushrooms on this dish was soft, tender and juicy. We also ordered edamame, soft shell crab, creamy salmon, katsu don, Oyako don. All the dishes were full of flavor. And the prices were very reasonable. I will definitely be back. This place doesn't take reservation, but it's not a problem for me. I came here at 6:30pm both on a Friday (4 people) and a Monday (3 people) and were seated immediately.
got the oyakodon here. nothing special, but a very solid, tasty, filling bowl of food. not a small amount of food, but would order a drink or an appetizer to share next time.

Love this mom-and-pop place for its authentic Japanese bites and doburi/curry dishes! Ryu and his family always greet guests with warm smiles and unique, delicious delicacies that are hard to find elsewhere. This isn't your typical Americanized Asian food - it's a real bite of Japan. Highly recommend for a meal with friends to share the ever-changing menu of appetizers.
No comment

absolutely incredible food. the tuna tataki, the black miso chicken, and the karage were ordered, re-ordered, and then re-re-ordered. service was great, vibes were great (lovely hip-hop playlist), can't wait to return.

Originally had a reservation at top thai greenwich (very sweet staff btw). Regret coming here. The two male staffs can be more kind when talking to customers. First to arrive but cannot be seated even though my 2 other parties were a minute away walking (the place is not full). I don't mind waiting to be seated until all parties are here, but please smile to your customers  and add a few please and thank yous. For a Japanese restaurants,  expected more mannerism. While we're waiting for the four dons (rice dishes), a friend brought hard candy sweet from DR as gifts for us. Had no intentions of opening them and eating it. They were sitting on the table wrapped while she explains to us what they were. I took a crumb size to just try it, partially opened it. No problem putting them away and they were going to be put away but again, please do not talk to us like we are children when telling us to put them away. The only staff that smiled was a female staff. The food was OK. I enjoyed mine. Had high expectations for this place. The food looked pleasant. The staffs were not.

Came here on a weekday with some friends. I chose this place because of the high rating and expected the food to be amazing. Long story short, the food was alright - nothing to brag about. I had the kara-age, eel over rice, and the pork katsu curry. I wish they all were a bit more flavorful. They didn't taste bad just not as good as the ratings suggest. But the atmosphere of the restaurant and service was really good.

Great restaurant! We've been exploring Japanese restaurants for the past 6 years in New York and this is definitely among my top 10!! Ordered tofu salad, tsukimi-tori don, tuna tataki and una-tama don~~

this place was okay. maybe i need to go back and try different dishes. portions were small. customer service was just okay. it is tiny. you will def be all up in someones else conversations and they will be up in yours.

Food is spot on - their garlic steak appetizer, curry katsu and katsu don are delicious. Prices are reasonable too. There's a long wait on Friday nights and weekends. Usually pretty empty on weekdays. For some reason, there's a funny crayon smell everytime I dine there - not sure what it is exactly.
This place is the best Japanese home restaurant in the city. All their food is good. The only weak point is that some dishes are little bit burnt so if they can improve on that it would be perfect.
Great prices, cool ambience, good food. New EV spot or me.

Delicious meal, nice atmosphere and friendly service.  Had the Godadare Salad, Tofu Fire, Kara-age chicken, Katsu don and the Yakiniki.  Kara-age was tender and juicy but not quite as crispy as I would have liked.  The other 2 apps were perfect -tofu fire was one of the best fried tofu dishes I have had and the salad was light and perfectly dressed.  The katsu don was wonderful with a slightly sweet sauce.  The yakiniki was more savory with very slight seasoning so you really tasted the tender beef.  Our waiter was super friendly and helpful, but seemed a little harried even before the restaurant got crowded.  Looking forward to coming back here and trying the popcorn chicken and the garlic beef dish.
Great food,  perfect ambiance,  humble family owners.  Highly recommended Japanese home food

Amazing lunch option. Very well done food when compared to the best of east village. The setting is very cozy in a wabi sabi way. The price is similar to other Village restaurants but the food was more artfully prepared, more flavor.
Simply delicious! And a lovely environment with exquisitely delightful people serving and managing. We'll be back!

Came here with a date on a cold winter night and a giant bowl of perfectly cooked Japanese rice here really hit the spot (ambience was super nice too). The happy hour deal with the kara age was a great added bonus. Wait staff was super nice. The highlight though was the dessert. I'm still not sure what I ate but it was the most delicious thing I'd ever had. Really need to come back to try their extended menu.
Great space with an awesome atmosphere! We sat at he bar and the bartender was great. Amazing food and great sake and beer selection. Will definitely be back!
It was way too salty so I really could not eat after few bites............ they should use less than 50% of whatever they are using now for donburies.... appetizers were fine though...
Great ambiance! Cute date spot. Such a good happy hour deal: draft beer and fried chicken for $6!! Food was amazing

Not sure what the hype is about. Ordered the beef tataki, crispy pork belly, and Una-tama don to share. The beef tataki is pretty good. The sauce was very refreshing. The Karaage was completely flavorless, and the coating was not crispy at all. The pork belly is surprisingly lean, and I personally prefer the fattier ones. Nothing special about the una-tama don either. The eel was not fatty/tender enough. The atmosphere was great and service was attentive. They have an extensive selection of sake which we didn't get to try, but we are probably not going back since the food was mediocre.

They need to work on their reservation system. I made a reservation for my anniversary dinner and they overbooked and had no seats available when I arrived on time. I shouldn't have to wait twenty minutes after my reservation time.
The best don buri you can get in NYC. In fact, I don't think there is another place like it anywhere nearby.

I went to Benemon last week with 2 friends and the meal was GREAT!  We tried the kara-aged fried Chicken (DELICIOUS), creamy baked chicken, beef tataki and the katsu don.  For dessert, we had the black sesame mousse which was also great.  The space is very small, but it was cozy and intimate.  I would definitely recommend Benemon!
So yummy! Everything we had was delicious. I loved the tuna tataki and the Katsu curry was some of the best ive ever had and I know this stuff. Anyways, totally worth an eat. Enjoy kiddos!

After some serious yelping my friend and I decided upon Benemon for a quick Saturday dinner. We made our decision upon three criteria; price(broke with expensive taste), proximity(it was raining and trying to not buy a metro card this week - broke) and reviews. The service was good. The restaurant has a good set up, nicely decorated and a pleasant atmosphere. The menu read very well. We ordered the vegetable curry and Oyako Don. Unfortunately the food was distinctly average. It wasn't bad just wasn't particularly good either.

I rarely give a five star but then I thought I really don't have anything to complain about... The service is prompt, we waited for about 15mins on Friday evening, which is more than reasonable in Manhattan. I went there on a unagi hunt, and I left satisfied!! I had the unagi donburi, which contains a whole eel, some seaweed and plain rice, simple elegant and delicious!! We also had beef tataki, which is a must try, my bf just kept shove them down his throat that I have to go in there and fight him... and he's a picky French man who doesn't usually behave like this lol. The fried chicken is decent, i've had better but it's still one of the good ones. They also have a good selection of sake which is a bonus. What I really like about this place is that you can either just have a quick bite (like a donburi then go) or sit down to enjoy some drinks and good food, it's not a lengthy menu but there is enough to choose from and all the things we had were good quality. Will definitely come back when I have a unagi crave!
Ain't cheap but it's good. Beef Kakuni and pork belly were delicious; my main course of Katsu don was great, but the curries looked really good too.
Very good food, cosy place and people are very nice there. Very interesting Japanese food with a selection of sake. This is a new place in a quiet street but I recommend it.
We had a really nice dinner here. The atmosphere is lovely, the waitstaff is warm and helpful, the food was delicious, and the prices were reasonable. We really enjoyed it. Will definitely go back.

This is a lovely place! The décor is very pretty - subtle, soothing.  The food is delicious! Service is friendly and attentive - feels like home away from home.  Loved the small dishes!  Will be coming back OFTEN.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food is really good. The portion is on the smaller side. Excellent service! Cute ambiance,  good for brunch, lunch, or dinner.
No comment

Does not look (nor is it) fancy but the vibe was right, staff was cool (thank you Luis) and my nephew and I had a great time. Spicy feta app, grilled octopus, moussaka, and salmon platter just made for a delicious night. I've ordered from them on the past for take out, but being there was a great experience. Pictures are attached apologies but that spicy feta cane out first

This place was exactly what you need ! The service, the good and the ambiance was perfect. I sat at the bar while RUBEN was bartending and the drinks were perfect, strong but smooth. The music was good, and the food was good as well. Service is where it all starts and the whole team was smiles. If I lived in this neighborhood, this would be my neighborhood bar. I will definitely be returning ! Thanks for the hospitality Medusa, thanks to RICH as well.
Great food ! So delicious. Place and music wonderful. Thank you! I'm really recommending

We had put a reservation down for a party of 7, and they accommodated us accordingly even though it was last minute. A solid selection of appetizers. We ordered the Spanakopita and Zucchini Chips for appetizers. I went for the white fish which was phenomenal. Tad bit on the pricy side but the drinks are good, staff are nice, and the decor is modern and hip. Quiet Greek version of Miti Miti across the street (same owners). Will be back!
No comment
No comment

Last night we were celebrating a birthday of someone who needed to sit outside- they gave us a heated private patio! All of the food was outstanding! Almost everyone in our party had a food request/severe allergy , and our server handled it was care, precision, informed us of the ingredients and was able to give us veggies instead of bread- flying colors! Even my old-fashioned drink was divine!! We also had to split the check betwn 6 of us, and she cheerfully did so although it was quite complicated. We will all absolutely will be back here!
No comment

Decided to come back for more and brought the fiancé and he loved it as much as I did! We ordered the Greek Mac and Cheese which was wonderful! We also got the Loukomades (Donut dessert), which is a fried donut hole with honey and walnuts. They were both very good and so much fun! Definitely a place to go to if you want something different!
I have no complaints. I came hungry and left full. My food and drink was good. The aestheic and layout was nice too.

Really liked this place. Went for lunch and had the lunch special with a friend. We both had gyros (me, chicken hers, lamb) that came with pita chips or a salad if I remember correctly. Carb-lovers we chose the pita chips. We also had the icy Aphrodite (frose) for drinks which were quite good. Servers were kind and attentive. Their decor was cute. Would go back for dinner.
Very fun and laid-back spot! Looove the design and theme! The food was delicious and the service was great. Would definitely come back for more

We came here by chance looking at the high reviews and decided to give this place a shot. Came here on a Thursday evening and there were about 3 tables occupied. We sat outside in the patio section and the service was very good. We ordered the Branzino and the Greek plate with a lot of different veggies, my favorite being the okra with a tomato sauce. The food was just alright- nothing spectacular but the server who was the bartender as well was very attentive and kind.

column3: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: The food and drinks here were really good.  I really wanted to give this review 5 stars but had to knock one star because of the service.  When we first got there we were able to choose any table to sit at.  Then our server came over to tell us that happy hour was going to end in about 40 minutes so if we wanted to order we should.  So we ordered a frosita and a sangrita.  We waited about 10-15 minutes and still no drinks and it seemed like our server was preoccupied with something else that they had forgotten about us.  Another table had come in and sat down and somehow ordered drinks and got their drinks which led us to then get the attention of the host to ask where our drinks were.  They finally brought our drinks over but I don't think the drinks were correct.  She handed me my drink and said margarita and I was like no is this the sangrita and she was like yes. I took a sip of it and it was definitely a margarita. I couldn't be bothered with asking for another one after already waiting 15 minutes for our drink order that they just pour from a slushy like machine.  Maybe it was an off day as they seemed to have something going on - just wished that they were a bit more attentive.

We came for a late dinner on a Friday night and had a great experience. We got the pikilia (all 5 dips), the saganaki, and the octopus. Everything was delicious! The black truffle tarama was our favorite dip - unique and absolutely delicious. Their pita is also very good and fresh tasting. The saganaki was very tasty, though I do like when it's served very hot and soft, and that's not the case here. The octopus is good and it's a healthy serving size! Brandon and Nini were so friendly and pleasant. It was overall a great experience and we'll be back.

Delicious Greek food in a beautiful, hip, and capriciously decorated setting with great outdoor seating, close to Barclays, and open late late! We tried the dip sampler which comes with enough pita for two but enough dip for five! If you order just for two, be prepared to save the dips to slather all over your entree (which probably comes with more pita) or just get extra pita and have a dip feast! I was floored by the black truffle fish roe spread - I wish I had a huge jar of it at home to put on everything. Tzatziki was nice and thick, spicy feta was rich salty deliciousness, eggplant was fresh and smoky, and the beet hummus was light and sweet. For entrees we got the lamb platter and the salmon platter - I ordered my salmon rare and it came out perfectly. Sashimi quality in the middle! And it was a huge filet with a nice layer of skin. For sides, I preferred the spinach rice over the Brussels sprouts - it paired better with the meat and you get a delicious dill and feta salad on the side anyway so no need for more veg! Also shoutout to the pita which comes hot, soft, and doughy in the middle - could have made an entire meal off of it. Wonderful summer feasting.

Got take out from here last night and it was delicious! We ordered 2 American Lamb Gynos with sides of French fries. We didn't have to wait long either which was a plus. Our food was still warm and fresh by the time we got home - the French fries were so good! Looking forward to going back.

What a great place for a boozy brunch. The price was great. I had the $25 boozy brunch. I had the mimosa. There was such a variety of flavors. I had the passion fruit. I started off with the Grilled Halloumi Cheese. It was delicious.  I then had the Greek Omelette with feta,vegetables and loukaniko pork.  The food was great and so was the service. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because it didn't put me over the top to justify at least 4 stars. For me to give 4 stars it would have to impress me. This review is a bit complicated because it didn't come across as a totally Greek restaurant. It had a little Spanish flair to it. If you look at the menu it has Carne Asada gyro and platter, Lamb Empanadas and Sangria. All Hispanic dishes or descriptions. The food was decent not impressive. If you're going to be a certain ethnic food restaurant then be that all the way. It's like you have an identity crisis with what you're serving. I don't know if it's because they're trying to please too many people but if I go to a certain ethnic type of restaurant then I want to experience that ethnicity's food and no side tracking. Come to find out that the owner is the same owner of two other Hispanic restaurants in the same area. So I see where they get the influence from. If you're a Greek restaurant then keep it Greek. If you're a Colombian or Mexican restaurant then keep it totally Colombian or Mexican because that's what I am there for. To experience their native cuisine. The service was good and attentive, but again, the food didn't put me over the top like the Greek restaurants in Astoria. I just wish that I didn't have to go all the way to Astoria.
No comment
No comment

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: No comment
No comment
Have always loved this little spot on 5th Ave. good good and delicious drinks - worth your time!
Great food and great serviceHad a great lunch with my brother.   I will definitely be coming back.
No comment
Best Greek food in park slope. Food is always fresh and fairly quick. I would say it's worth the money, even if it's a tad overpriced.
No comment

If you're in the area, you must stop by here for dinner. We came here in a Sunday night and they seated us right away. The ambiance is casual but very playful. We ordered the Greek fries pastitsio (Greek baked pasta) and the lamb platter. I felt like I was eating from a green grandmother with the pasta, it was soo good. I ordered the frose with ouma. My first time tasting it and I would compare it to licorice that's slightly fruity. Overall a good experience, I'll be back
No comment
No comment
No comment
Fantastic on site catering and service by the Medusa team and Sean, more food than we could handle, great diversity and friendly staff! Highly recommend

Saw all the good reviews so i decided to try this place out for lunch.  I am a huge fan of pastissio, this was just ok.  I am not used to it not being in lasagna shape, this was more like a loose ziti dish.  A bit on the bland side.  For a lunch portion at the price I paid, i was expecting a side salad or pita with it.
No comment
No comment
Food was to die for and the service was even better! Hugo was amazing. He anticipated my every need and was super sweet. Definitely try the cocktails too!
No comment

The staff at Medusa are a pleasure and go above and beyond to make sure every meal is above their standards of quality. Alvaro was our favorite. He was so lovely and helped us chose the best selections for my party. (I'm very picky with my food!) Happy Hour discounts. Everything is freakin' delicious! Check it out and see Rich.  The manager even made sure my party was happy, which is a rarity in Park Slope. Definitely check it out.

Medusa is a welcomed recent addition to the family! I already frequent Bogota and Miti Miti. In the height of the pandemic, I took my sister to Medusa to dine outdoors for her birthday which was amazing. On a whim, we decided to go back last night and it was perfect! Nini, our waitress, was amazing. She was SO sweet and gave the best recommendations. For food, we had the zucchini chips that came with an amazing tzatziki dip. In addition, my sister had the carne asada gyro ( Mini's recommendation) which was BOMB. I had the Hercules gyro, which contained American lamb, pork sausage, and chicken, and came with both marouli salad (so crisp, flavorful, and fresh) and fries. The meats were so well seasoned and balanced. For drinks, we got the mastiha mojito, Mr. Purple, blood orange margarita, lesvos + homos, and frosita. Ended the night with free shots as well!
Brandon our server was amazing. Brian the bartender makes great drinks. Highly recommend this place good ambiance and excellent service.
No comment
Kind staff, wonderful food! Whole table was very happy with their gyros. Cocktails also reliable.

Great food and lovely service. It's spacious so I felt like my friend and I could have privacy. My friend and I had the grilled octopus platter, and the massouka. Both very well seasoned and we didn't have to wait long for the food either. Coming back soon!
This is a great restaurant that is under appreciated.  Food is excellent, the restaurant is gorgeous and service I outstanding. We love it and come here often and are never disappointed.

Stopped by with some friends for an early bird dinner. The waiters and waitresses were very nice and attentive. And the waiting time was reasonable as there were not as many customers at that time. The amount of their fries and vegetable salad was big enough for 3-4 people to share. My dish was salmon with spinach. I cannot judge if it's authentic or not, cause I am not very familiar with Greek food. To me, it's just OK but not impressive at all. I have also noticed that their menu is not vegetarian-friendly, as there was only one veggie dish (eggplant) available in the entrees.
No comment

I was looking for a quick pre comedy show dinner and I'm very happy I found this place. The service was great and very quick when we mentioned we were in a rush. The food was delicious. I'm a vegetarian and loved the halloumi gyro (with fries). They have happy hour all day during the week and we were happy to take advantage of that fun perk. Definitely would recommend for a casual dinner and some great Greek food.

This place was a delight. I am suprised how empty it was! The food was ok but the staff made our dinner amazing. Nini and Brandon made sure oir drinks were exactly what we wanted and brought our food oit in a timely fashion. I would definately come her again

This place was so good! The food and service amazing. Will definitely be back! Came here with my father and sister and we were in love. We got the authentic greek salad to start and the dip sampler! We were full just off that!! If you like truffle, the truffle hummus will make make your taste buds dance. We also got the half roasted lemon chicken, pork platter and lamb platter. So so much food and flavor. We had left overs enough to feed us again the next day!!
Unbelievable time here tonight. Great local crowd, fresh and delicious food, refreshing well-poured drinks, and unbelievable service. I believe we had Brandon - what a guy!

Came here for brunch with the family and had an amazing time. From the start our hostess was very friendly and accommodating. Let's us move our table outside since it was so nice out and was easier to get a proper seat for the baby joining us. Drinks were solid for a brunch spot everything you'd ordinarily expect and done well. The dip sampler is great for a group good with sharing. A lot larger portion than I had expected so plenty for everyone. Fresh crudite and pita to dip with, we ordered extra cause it was so good. Personal favorites was the spicy feta and was pleasantly surprised by the black truffle Tamara. I normally don't like truffle but this was subtle enough to not overpower the tastebuds. My only complaint is I wish they had just a regular hummus as not everyone is a fan of beets and the flavor can be a bit much. For a main I went with the brunch gyro and loved it. So much flavor, and was able to use some of the remaining spreads to create some delicious unique bites along the way. Sooooo much food though. Will be back for sure.
No comment

I placed an order through a food delivery app for pick up. Food was ready upon arrival. Ordered the moussaka and the squid ink truffle infused dip with a side of pita and crudite which came with a small side of greek salad in two separate containers. The moussaka was underwhelming. The layer of bechamel was thin and lacked a depth of flavor and heartiness I expected. The squid ink infused truffle dip was tasty and I would have appreciated a bit more texture. It was well infused with truffle and the pita was a good pairing to that. The reason for the rather low rating is due to finding mold on the tomato that came with the salad. It was a big turn off and I could not help but double check and wonder about the food quality for the rest of meal. Really hoping it was an off day. I will not return.

Love this place- Brian the bartender is THAT. GUY. He makes great drinks and especially delicious shots that are exactly what you want-the right amount of alcohol to make a shit worth it, none of that wincing from a harsh plain spirit. The drinks are fire and the food is also great. Maybe surprisingly, the fries are top tier here

Nice spot. Good date spot. Good service. Food was tasty. Greek food was good. Need more vegan options as far as protein, but the sides were amazing. I particularly liked the spinach rice. This place was clean and neat. Very nice spot to grab a bite and converse.

Nene and Brandon!!! They are the best!!!! Seriously the food here is the best! Great customer service! We were checked up on several times and taken care of in the best way! Thank you so much for the best service
No comment
Great food, fantastic service, and a relaxed vibe. Will certainly be back very soon.
We stopped by for a drink here and the vibe was amazing! Brian, the bartender, was fantastic and the drinks were sophisticated and delicious! Highly recommend! We will definitely be back!

Went here on a Friday night & ordered the hot aphrodite and fried calamari. Both hit the spot. I had my dog with me & there was plenty of outdoor seating. Glad that the weather was great. Check them out for all day happy hour. You won't regret getting one of their drinks! Also, the fried calamari was fried to perfection & seasoned perfectly.

Amazing food, like really amazing fresh food, but the service was terrible. Food took 40 mins to come out, And we specifically asked for the app to come out first, but everything was brought to us at once. I had to ask for our waters to be refilled and for my margarita, as I saw it sitting on the bar counter for over 10 mins after it was made. The bartender was sweet she tried to step in, but our server wasn't attentive at all. Only time he came to us was to take our order. The other servers were attending their tables frequently yet we were neglected the entire time. Not sure what the reason was, maybe inexperience? Either way, very disappointing as the food was great. Not sure if I would dine in again.
No comment

Brandon was our sever and the food was absolutely amazing! Service was phenomenal and the vibes immaculate. We found this place a few months on Instagram and have been dying to go. Quick service, great portions and such friendly staff. Be sure to ask for Brandon! Well definitely be back as soon as we're in town again!

This place is fabulous and you'll love it's the fish is to die for and such good portions. Hugo the waiter and bartender is the sweetest. He knows the menu so well and always knows what to suggest. The rest of the staff is so nice too. Great meals here! I get the branzino. You'll love it.

Medusa was a choice made because my wife and I enjoy great GREEK CUISINE which I assure you this WAS NOT IT I ordered the branzino which btw is one my favorite fish and she ordered the baby lamb chops medium well. My branzino was tough the capers were old her lamb chops were served medium rare we had to send it back to be cooked more well to make a long story short I have been sick ever since I left the restaurant that was this past Wednesday evening it's now Saturday I'm starting to feel better. I definitely will not give these guys a second chance. I'm sorry.
Nene and Brandon were amazing! we are definitely coming back. Food here is amazing, great service, and overall great experiences! Checked in with us and was a friendly environment!
I went here for the first time with my family for my birthday and we all loved it! It is a really cool atmosphere with great Greek Food! I highly recommend it!

We loved this Park Slope find! It's got an eclectic, colorful decor, a delicious Medusa Brunch Burger filled with things I've never had on a burger before--including tomato jam made in-house--a killer spanakopita, and decadent, spongey Nutella loukoumades baby donuts. Not to mention, great service sitting at the bar with Brandon! Will definitely be back next time we're in the area.
No comment
The sampler of dips was delicious. The salmon was very flavor and perfectly cooked. The gyro platter was disappointing but the gyro wrap was good, although definitely need to order extra tzatziki.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We love Medusa!!! Not only is it a fun atmosphere, but the food & drinks are delicious and the staff is wonderful! When you go make sure to ask for Nini and go visit Brandon & Bryan at the bar. The gyros are delicious and although I always say I'll branch out and try something new, I can never stray from them. Looking forward to the warmer weather when they open the windows and bring tables out to the streets! It's the perfect spot for a night out or a fun brunch!!

Seconds after entering Medusa's doors after midnight on a random Thursday night, it was absolutely clear that we had made the right choice! The wonderful smells quickly transported us to another realm! Brian, our waiter and bartender greeted us with enthusiasm... and upon our request, he quickly and skillfully crafted signature cocktails using our spirits of choice. He was great with casual banter and helped us make our appetizer and entree selections which where all out of this world!!! The stuffed grape leaves are served warm, and although I didn't ask to confirm, their texture and flavor gave off homemade vibes; absolutely no words for the grilled octopus! Absolutely melt in your mouth tender and well-balanced flavors. On to my entree, a classic mousaka which was nothing short of mind-blowing, wonderful presentation, fresh ingredients, and layers of blissful complexity! Bravo to everyone at Medusa for creating such an aesthetically pleasing space to compliment our spectacular meal... thank you, Brian for attending to us so well! We look forward to returning soon!!! A+++
No comment
No comment
The food is amazing, and as a Greek person, that's saying a lot. Our server Marco made sure we had a great experience. It was such a blast!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great spot for dinner, delicious food and drinks, not too busy. The server, Hugo was very accommodating! I'll be back for brunch.

My partner and I had dinner here on a few occasions. The food here is excellent, and Hugo ensured they accommodated our low carb diet. In an area with plenty of food options, this place really sticks out in a good way. We're looking forward to eating here again soon!
No comment

Friday evening we decided to head over to Park Slope Brooklyn , our "go-to" neighborhood for great eats! This night we actually let Yelp reviews determine were we would dine. We knew we wanted Greek food. Medusa Greek Taverna Turned out to be an excellent choice. Greeted with a warm friendly smile , seated right away our Server Mariah introduced herself . Such a lovely person. The atmosphere was Chic, Cozy, Comfortable , and Classy! Started off with a White Sangria for me, and my boyfriend had frozen Sangria, OMG both yummy! Not starving, but looking for a lighter choice on the menu. We ordered Grilled Octopus with a bean paste that was "OFF THE CHAIN" delicious, Fresh beet salad with goat cheese, Fried Calamari, Greek Olives . Everything was so delicious, definitely recommend this place. 5 stars ***** Cant wait to return. Thanks for a great meal. M & J

We came here on a Saturday night and it was not too crowded with outdoor seating available.  We ordered the pikilia (sampling of five dips- highly recommend!), spanakopita, grilled octopus (delicious but small portion), mac and cheese with orzo (flavorful but wasn't a huge fan) and the lobster gyro.  Service was attentive and food came promptly.  Most portions were big and we left the restaurant pretty satisfied.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely phenomenal Greek food. Everything was super fresh and the service was great as well. We  had octopus and rotators. The octopus s was chaired to perfections and the potatoes and a delicious dressing. The village salad was fresh and very well dressed. The short rib melted in our mouth and deserts we had the custard  pie made to order was everything. These are the same owners as Miti  Miti and Bogata. The next restaurant should be Italian bc they just do everything so good.

The hospitality from the staff here is so incredible. They are truly great people trying to offer you the best dining experience you can ask for. The food was incredible and even though I barely venture to Park Slope area this is such a cute spot in a prime area with extremely tasty dishes. My host George was such a gem as well. He was very attentive, not only to myself but everyone he came in contact with. They do have both an indoor and dining area but I preferred sitting inside because even the decor and vibe felt overall amazing. I would definitely be back for some gyros and a quick bite when I'm in the mood for great Greek cuisine!
Insanely good food, fair prices, large portions. This is the second time I've been here and I can't wait to go back. George, the incredible waiter who took care of my friend and I, is the bomb.
No comment
Amazing food. Amazing drinks. Fantastic service. The food is always fresh and Marco provided phenomenal and friendly service. Can't wait to come again. Thank you Marco
I was disappointed with the chicken platter.  I ordered Horta which I thought were the Lima beans bit ended up being the spinach. The platter for $23 was really sad.
Love the Greek frappe. So far we had small plates and it was all good. We also ate outside which made us fell safe.
was starving late night in the neighborhood and stumbled on Medusa, so good!! Brian was an amazing server. Definitely recommend!
No comment

My husband and I have been trying to get here since they opened but due to covid we were it's been hard. Finally made it out and Mark made our experience worth the trip out from queens. I highly recommend this restaurant. We started off with a few spreads and grilled octopus ( the grilled octopus is a must), we then couldn't decide what we wanted for our mains so we order 3 different ones, lemon chicken was so good and the with a strong but not overwhelmingly taste of lemon, I will be coming back for this dish. We also got the braised lamb platter as well as an order of baby lamb chops which were cooked to perfection. I highly recommend a meal here and hopefully you get to have Mark as your server, he was nice, friendly and very approachable.
Great, flavorful Greek food that is cooked perfectly! Couple this with an upbeat ambiance, and you e got a winning combination. All very authentic and delicious.

Came into Medusa, had a great time. Tapas were delicious. Bartender Brandon was super knowledgeable. Ended up sitting at the bar with Carolyn from  Miti their sister francise, shes amazing.  So much fun.  Come hang out with these guys at Miti and Medusa.
Had dinner with my girlfriend yesterday. Staffs were very friendly and food was delicious. We will definitely come back!
Great spot to eat! a highly recommend the zucchini chips (they were phenomenal). Brian was a fantastic server and was basically running the place. My fiancée thought he was easy on the eyes.

Nini was our server and she was amazing. The food was AMAZING and overall we were happy with our food. I got the octopus platter! I ate every bite. The brussel spouts were to die for. Also, the drinks? Please get ourself one. I had the cucumber jalapeño margarita and yeah...top tier. But back to Nini, she is the best!!!

I love authentic Greek food and decided to try Medusa when in Brooklyn for a few days. Our waitress Nini was also greeting customers at the door and her service was outstanding throughout the experience. She added her personal touch by taking time to converse with us and make menu recommendations when asked. The octopus appetizer was excellent, prepared well and served with gabs purée and capers. We did not have entrees but the brussel sprout salad was sufficient for a meal, and adding grilled shrimp made it over the top. Take a look at the description in the menu and you'll see what I mean. My son had the grilled chicken gyro with very good pita bread. It's a small place and I enthusiastically recommend it. The menu selections include a number of authentic Greek dishes. I will return to Medusa to try more.
The atmosphere is so much fun, and the food and drinks are amazing. Really enjoyed the vibe! I sat at the bar, and the service was great. Our server Brandon was extra attentive and hospitable!
Such a pleasant surprise. Amazing food and great service. Such a gem. Will definitely come back.

Could not recommend this place more. Food is delicious, service was quick. Hugo is awesome. I had the brunch burger. You must get the lemon potatoes. It was relaxed when we went on a Sunday afternoon, but they also have bottomless brunch if you're trying to party! Go now!

I was recommended Froze' by a local barkeep, i was weary. Meet a group of 4, sitting for brunch I had the lamb gyro and grilled octopus with my right hand. Outdoor service but we have to adjust. We enjoyed rounds of rainbows drinks and i forgot where I was. It was awesome and the bartender Wes was a solid. Would recommend to anyone visiting the slope. If you're up for a great afternoon, cheers, great ambiance and a break from the gentrification. Stay free my people.

Absolutely LOVED this neighborhood Greek place. The Happy Hour wine special is unreal ($8 a glass), the food is delicious, and the portions are big! The team is also so kind - Taylor and Lenie were awesome. Will definitely be back!!
Love the food! The wait time for the food definitely needs some work. But it's good solid food and the atmosphere is good, esp for brunch.
Absolutely delicious Greek restaurant in the neighborhood, with wonderful hospitality! My very Greek boyfriend approves.
The baklava was ridiculous.  Who knew sausages and yoghurt could be so good.  Very friendly staff.
Amazing food! They seem to prepare everything from scratch, and the output is beyond what I expect. I go for the spanakopita each time I visit. 5 stars for it!
No comment

Extremely disappointing meal.  Greek salad was tired, tasteless and small (and didn't even come with warm pita like most other places), fries were mushy and cold, and spanakopita was greasy and flavorless.   Absolutely terrible.
Came here to get some birthday drinks and Apps. Nini and Hugo took care of our group! Truly a great place! They'll take care of you! A++++++

The food was amazing, so great to find this restaurant in my neighborhood with authentic food. The service was top tier, we were served by Nini and she was so attentive and knowledgeable! She recommended our meals, and we all enjoyed them. Can't rave enough about the food AND service!!!
SO YUMMYYY and amazing service. Get the platter and thank me later :) BRUSSELS SPROUTS TOOO. So unbelievable and friendly staff

Amazing spot with great food and ambience. We ordered the zucchini chips, grilled octopus and the grilled shrimps as the appetizers. The seafood was fresh and well seasoned and the zucchini chips were fried light and crispy. It was not greasy at all! For entrees, we ordered lamb chops and the branzino. They were cooked perfectly and even the sides were delicious. Overall, I love the food but we also love the service. Everyone greeted us with a warm welcome and we were lucky to have Brandon as our waiter. Great service. Highly recommend.
No comment

Without a reservation, we waited about 30 minutes to be seated on a busy Saturday night. Well worth the  wait. We all (4) shared the Village Salad, so fresh with great dressing. I ordered the Spanikopita, great Phylo crust. My husband ordered 1/2 roasted chicken, great portion size  and tasty. My DIL ordered okra and sardines, she loved it   My son ordered short ribs with orzo. His was delicious but disappointed with the size of the meat, about 2" square, lots of orzo. We also shared the Greek fries,  really good. With Three alcoholic drinks, total was $175 with tip. Rather pricey but we would r
Such a great find! Good food and service! Pita chips with the eggplant dip were my fave and the waiter Hugo was so sweet! Definitely will be back.

Best gyro in the area. Meat is never dry. Not that cheap tasteless stuff you get at some Greek places. They care about their food. Fresh ingredients and a solid menu. Cool vibe at the storefront and also strong on delivery. If you want Greek this is a good bet. Also recommended the spanakopita, the dips(some are better than others I could do without the favs dip) moussaka, pastitsio.
