One note I love the fried zucchini chips but I have had some times where it is too salty and not as crisp. When they nail it it's amazing! They could work on consistency, that being said it's always still pretty tasty.

Loved this new gem in park slope! I am vegetarian and found so many veggie/vegan options that I was blown away. Definitely recommend the zucchini chips. Would so return to try the 5 spread sampler; looked very enticing. Our server Mark was very courteous in the recommendations and went above and beyond to make sure we were pleased and catered to. Since I made a reservation we were given a nice seating. I loved the geek vibe and touch all over from the medusa at the entrance to the Greek statue models on the ceilings and the blue clean crisp bar setting etc. entire staff was attentive. The vegan baklava in the end was so yummy, packed 1 to go as well. The mocktail list is very interesting. I enjoyed the Trojan horse which had a smoky taste to it. Can't wait to return!
The food smelt so deli from the street it drew me in. It truly lived up to my expectation. The food was delicious! Hugo was just fantastic offering wonder suggestion.
The waitstaff (Hugo) as well as the food was exemplary. Each and every plate was delicious and the waitstaff were friendly and knowledge about the menu. The prices were so reasonable too!!
No comment
No comment

This place is absolutely insane! It is the new sister restaurant of miti miti, where I have been going for years. I had a feeling this place wouldn't disappoint. From the staff, to the food, everything was a great experience. It's extremely fresh and everything was delicious from the appetizers to the dessert; the octopus literally melts in your mouth. I will definitely be back

Ok, we came across this restaurant searching for greek   food. So we decided to come here and let me tell you!!!!!!!!!!!  Everything I oerderd was cooked to perfection, the grilled octopus the lamb chops, the fish , the bread, the drinks everything was sooooooooo good which is hard for me to find. And the server Brandon was so attentive and accommodating We loved him. I will FOR SURE be back again. 10 starts for me. Oh and very clean as well.

Excellent and creative drinks, awesome service!! Try Toula that bitch was the best drink I've had in a long time.carolyn from miti who is a server at the sister restaurant shes amazing  come over and enjoy it time have great service with nene eric and brandon a place too u  can call home
Marko and Ninni were amazing hosts and the food was amazing!   Lovely new restaurant!

Loved the food- had the moussaka, lamb gyro, and pikilia and greek mojito. Nice big servings and flavorful food. Brandon was our server super friendly provided great customer service. Would dine here again!

Get the zucchini chips! This place is so tasty and the portion sizes are great. I got the lemon chicken and my mom got the eggplant dish. Both were incredibly tasty. All of the desserts are made in house. Go here.

This place is a tucked away spot that is definitely worth a visit. I loved everything that we ordered, so it's really hard to pick just one thing. The hot Aphrodite, the Pikilia spread, the Okras, and the Spanakopita were amazing. Great service as well. If you are looking for authentic Greek, you don't need to look further than this gem.

Drinks are good but the food is not authentic Greek at all. Microwaved block of cheese instead of flamed saganaki, no traditional Greek wines. The waitress was sweet but she couldn't even pronounce the Greek entree names. Plus they kept the lights on as bright as a diner; definitely not conducive to a relaxing evening.
No comment

I was fortunate enough to be invited to a private tasting of this new restaurant through a friend and I must say they perfected the octopus appetizer the restaurant decor has you feeling like you are in a restaurant in Greece. The bar section of the restaurant is a great size to just go out with a few friends for drinks and apps by the bar. The mocktails are a must!!!! Try them all!
Delicious and fun! Went there for a friend's birthday dinner- our server, Marco was super attentive and made the evening special, along with the whole staff! Thank you!!

Got delivery a couple of times from here and it hasn't been great. Today I ordered a couple of gyros - both were totally soggy / left the bread inedible. I think you guys should really pack the bread separately. Also the salad that came with the gyro was truly just a pile of shredded lettuce with a sprig of dill in it. Hardly a salad. The lamb was tender / tasty. This place might just be better if you go in person.

We were looking for some yummy Greek food at a place that was COVID-safe with good vibes and Medusa was perfect!!! The dining out front was very warm and ventilated. The food was fabulous, as were the all day happy hour deals. Our waiter had great energy that made us feel so welcomed. Wow- we will be back soon!!!

Enjoyed a delicious meal and appetizers. The drinks are really great! Our waiter George was very friendly and provided wonderful service. The restaurant interior was very inviting and they took every precaution in regards to spacing and cleanliness. Can't wait to go back!

Came here with my friend for lunch, very nice ambiance super clean.  George the waiter was super nice, attentive, it was my friend first time having Greek food,  George took his time and explained few nice options. The food was delicious, portions are filling, we ordered zucchini chips was so good, spinach spanakopita, we also had desert and Greek coffee. This is my 2nd time here and I had very good experience

This spot has a great service team, especially our server George! He recommended excellent wines and food. The octopus, shrimp and lamb is on point! When we had a small issue with the cook on the salmon George took care of it right away and everything else we had was perfect!
No comment
No comment
Ordered delivery of gyro and baklava - fast delivery and delicious wrap. The fries on the other hand were ... well not good. Definitely will order from them again.

Went here last night with my boyfriend for a Saturday date night. Was waited on by a wonderful, well informed, very attentive waiter named George. Excellent food, excellent service and fantastic Greek wine George was happy to tell me about. Going to make this my go to date night place!

Came here for a bday dinner, and had an amazing experience! Our server was dynamic! We requested they play Beyoncé's Coachella album, and they kept it on Beyoncé for the entire evening. When Spotify switched in an R Kelly song, they immediately changed the song, showing that not only was the food and service great, but that the staff is conscious. The food is GREAT! Definitely get the lamb platter if you come here.
No comment
No comment

I wish i could give it more stars! We had a great time there with friends. You can order just about anything on the menu and not be disappointed -- it's all very good. My waitress was super friendly, very fast and my food was pretty darn good. I am a fan!

Awesome place with great food.  Seems to be an addition to Bogota and Miti Miti which are so tasty. Staff is super responsible with COVID precautions, we had George whose food suggestions and drinks were spot on and he was very nice. Spanakopita was perfect and the icy Aphrodite goes down real nice!

Stopped in for an early dinner and was pleasantly surprised with a wonderful dinner consisting of the sampling of spreads with pita. The feta and pepper spread being at the top of the 5 served, but they were all delicious (eggplant, pea, fish, tzatziki were main ingredients in the other 4). Greek village salad, which we ate along with the apps: Nice dressing, well presented and tasty. Chocolate mousse for dessert to share (as it's big) and coffee. I also enjoyed a mocktail. Wait staff were very polite and considerate. New restaurant sparkle. Worth a visit.

I went here on 4-7-21 with my girlfriend and the brussels sprouts were the best brussels sprouts I have ever tasted. It had the perfect amount of crips and a tiny touch of sweet... so tasty. The beet hummus was also impeccable and the margarita was spot on. The best part of this spot was the service. A young man with long black hair served us and he was truly pleasant and helpful and kind.
No comment

Horrible service. I don't know how this place is operating. Not professional at all. I ordered food from them for two people and  for the price I paid for, the portions were tiny. I called them and they said they would take care of me. I went in today to meet with the "manager" and they didn't want to do anything about it and barely would match the amount I spend. The front cashier guy was rude and told me he can't help me because they are busy. After speaking with the manager arif , they finally gave me some food complimentary. They were very rude and they even left the food outside on the floor for me like I'm a piece of a dog and told me to pick it up. SMH.We all want to support small businesses but not these kind. Don't waste your time but head over to greek xpress near prospect park. Never going back here ever again. Good luck trying to fight with the management if you're not satisfied or have any problems with your orders.
No comment

I heard that a new Greek restaurant opened not far from Barclay's so I decided to give it a try. Medusa is small attractive restaurant that has a lot of potential. I did not have my gf with me so I opted to dine at the bar. First problem is that the bar stools do not have a back's and are very uncomfortable. The second problem is that they do not have a winter awning, and every time  that the door opened I got blast of cold air. The staff are very hip, but not very experienced. Now to the food. Tzatziki sauce is good, not great. Mussel's were very good, and the Octopus was tender, but not very fresh. Lastly, The bathroom's do not have hot water, and I washed my hand's with ice cold water. I will return once the weather get's warm, and post another review.

came to medusa for a second time and had an amazing time the food was on point and service was on point i sat at the bar where i met carolyn from miti miti the sister restaurant and she was amazing told me all about the boozy brunch she was very welcoming i will definitely make a stop in to visit her great businesses

Ordered in for delivery on a whim and was very pleasantly surprised. The chicken with potatoes was incredible. So were the Greek meatballs. I will definitely order again. I almost gave a 4 star review because we ordered through Caviar and they suck, super high fees and they actually delivered to the wrong address and didn't even attempt to get it to us. Since that's not the restaurants fault I don't feel it's fair to discredit them I will never use Caviar again however.

LOVE this place. We have eaten in and also ordered delivery and both experiences were great. The food is amazing and the service is thoughtful. When there was a mixup with our order, they called right away and got it sorted out. Thank you!!!!
B. E. S. T. authentic Greek food I've ever had!  The salads were so fresh and tasty!  The calamari was so fresh and crispy!  The lemon potatoes are the best ever!

Food is superb. I ordered a Greek omelette with Greek cheese fries, and wow!! Pretty much restaurant heaven for anyone who likes a good vibe, awesome people and delicious food. Will definitely be going back!
Best Greek in the area for sure! Delicious and strong frozes! Fresh salads and love the chicken gyro. Gotta also get the baklava mmm

This might have been the best octopus I've ever had. The waiter George was so sweet and as a Greek family my mother and I loved that he spoke Greek and lived there for a little as-well. He was so sweet and made great cocktails also. The food was amazing and they have outdoor seating all COVID friendly with heating and what not. The best Greek place in the neighborhood.

Hi! I am new to Yelp just created it a few days ago and have officially joined the help team. Not sure if any bios was owners will respond because I didn't see many responses on the page. You guys should be more active. I live in park slope and often find myself passing by places that seem so nice, but never have the time to sit and eat at them. I was passing by the other day and decided to come and eat some lamb chops. I was greeted by Juan and Lillian. (Both great people by the way.) Lillian was my waitress and was very attentive and nice. She was able to answer all my questions and trust me I had a lot. I ate the Lavraki which was so good. The one star was taken off for the wait time because I ended up waiting around 40 minutes for my food. When the waitress told me it would take longer for it to cook I didn't expect to be waiting there for 40 minutes. I then ate the chocolate mousse which was okay. I wish it was served colder and was a more lighter and creamy texture. As for the lavraki it was great. Definitely worth the wait. I really love the service here. I can't wait to come back. I' definitely will ask for Lillian or Juan again thank you guys!

My partner and I had a great experience with outdoor dining at Medusa tonight. The heat lamps are perfectly positioned for maximum warmth. I highly recommend the Figalicious cocktail, a fun twist on an old fashioned with fig jam, and the Medusa Burger, which had an insane tomato jam. What can I say, this place knows its jams! To top it off, our server George had such a joyful and positive energy. Loved it.

Honestly I go to a lot of Greek restaurants and this one was just great!! It doesn't look like anything much from the outside but inside it's super cute, has a very chic vibe and the food was excellent. Every dish we ordered was perfectly seasoned. The lamb chops very just excellent and a good large portion. The zucchini chips are a must. We were served by Mark and he was a phenomenal waiter and host. He was professional and attentive and always willing to go above and beyond. Thanks Medusa for a wonderful Greek surprise in park slope.
Good service. Unfortunately the food is subpar, the branzino we had was dry and moussaka was a strange sweet taste.
Good flavors love the Medusa sauce but $15/$16 for Gyro is a bit too pricy for me.  Would go back for a more fine and dine type meal however where such a price point would make sense.

Got the zucchini chips, lamb gyro with fries, and baklava. All delicious, the zucchini chips being my favorite (seriously could not stop eating them). Also, our waiter, Ari, was great and created an awesome vibe while we were there.
Fantastic restaurant the food was delicious and the staff was active I would recommend this restaurant to my friends,the food quality was superb I would look forward to come here again

BEST NEW RESTAURANT IN BROOKLYN. This place is absolutely divine. The chef came out and greeted every table and we couldn't help but talk his ear off about how incredible the food was. The short rib with orzo was out of this world!!
Food was delicious and platters were huge! Brandon was friendly and accommodating :) We opted for indoor dining and felt very safe!

Celebrating the New Year with another delicious take-out from Medusa Taverna. We ordered items we had not yet tasted, (octopus, spanakopita, moussaka, okra, zucchini chips, baklava) in addition to their wonderful spreads and salads. We have enough for 3 meals! The portions are substantial. The octopus was divine.  Spanakopita was so light and fluffy.  Marvelous. Loved the zucchini chips. Warmed them in the oven. The other food remained hot. The packaging is top-notch. Everything in its own little tight-fitting container. Nothing leaked. So fortunate to live within 15 minutes of this superb restaurant. Truly authentic Greek food!

This place is amazing. Good food. Great for sharing with a bunch of friends on a cold rainy evening. Our server George was quite nice as well and very knowledgeable in helping us plan our evening. Really recommend if your itching for Greek or even more so just some good pita spreads and meats!

Best restaurant I've been to in a long time. Went to Greece about two years ago and since COVID I thought I would never experience the food again...I was wrong. Medusa has the best AUTHENTIC Greek food you can find. Only thing that compares to the food is the service. Again, having been to Greece the people there were so welcoming of tourist. The staff and owners of were so kind and generous. You have to go to this restaurant. Order take out and make a night of it. Once restrictions are lifted we are bringing our parents here. Best food in BK!!
Fabulous Greek food (don't miss the stuffed grape leaves) and terrific service. Ask for George; he's the best!

I ordered my beloved pastichio and couldn't even finish it. I've never tasted a pastichio that doesn't even resemble at all in taste, what the actual dish tastes like. Everything was unseasoned making the meat taste very unappetizing and the dish bland. My stomach feels sick thinking about the taste of the food. There were NO spices used. I'm so disappointed. The leftovers went to my dog.
We had a really good experience here! The customer service is wonderful! Highly recommend the leg of lamb platter with the bird del sprouts!

Excellent spot with great service! Outdoor dining is nicely set up and servers are all observing safety procedures. Loved the zucchini chips, grape leaves, meatballs, and brussel sprouts. Our server George was fantastic!

I ate there yesterday for lunch for my cousins birthday and everything was absolutely delicious. We had the assorted dips, calamari, Greek salad and fried cheese to start and then the delicious octopus and chicken for entrees. Yummy cocktails as well and our server George was super attentive, knowledgeable and sweet. Overall we had a great afternoon with great food and service. Thanks!

I have always enjoyed my delivery food from Medusa Greek Taverna before, but last night my food was so nearly inedible that I'm still mad at myself for eating as much as I did.   I have never ordered the moussaka from them before but I was really looking forward to it. What arrived was a takeout dish of lots of lukewarm potatoes, a small amount of  ground lamb and a few oversized slices of eggplant topped with an entirely loose unset béchamel slopping over the sides.  No spice, sauce or even salt, .   It was easily the worst moussaka I've ever had.  It seemed like they didn't actually have any moussaka when I ordered it and they just threw some ingredients in a tub and hoped for the best.  The Horta tasted a bit rancid as if it had been cooked in oil that was not fresh. I couldn't eat more than a bite of it. The meals redeeming feature was the Greek yogurt topped with cherries which was delicious as always. I don't know what happened to this restaurant, but this was severely disappointing. Desperately need a good Greek restaurant around here.

This place is great.  Ordered delivery and everything was dynamite.  We got one of the family combination dinners with the chicken and pastichio and the lemon chicken.   It reads as pricey but this was a very good deal.  Will become our Greek go to in the area.
As frequent travelers to Greece and lovers of Greek food, this was not Greek food.... it was disgusting and inedible though. And directly went into the trash. Time to order pizza....

At the end of a day when the whole shelter at home thing was really getting me down, I really really really wanted to try a new restaurant. I found Medusa Greek Taverna on Caviar. And I'm so glad I did. The food was DELICIOUS! And delivered far faster than estimated. The halloumi gyro was exactly the comfort food I needed. And the sampler of dips was so flavorful. So happy I have leftovers of all of them to keep enjoying. The food reminded of food I ate at tavernas in Athens. I'll be ordering from Medusa again, and can't wait until I can visit in person.

Great 1st experience, from beginning to end.  Cool vibe, welcoming door staff, good cocktails, terrific server (Andrew), great food...we'll be back.  Only thing to keep an eye on is that there's some overlap in the dishes (ie zucchini chips contain tzatziki...so, don't also order tzatziki).  We'll be back
Great unhurried service, good food, nice vibe. A great option in the Slope. I will be back.

Had a DELICIOUS meal here, super creative menu building on all Greek classics I know and love.  Ambiance and staff are great.  Spread sampler was a great way to start off, the Zuchinni Chips were amazing, Cypriot Halloumi dish incredible, Fish Plaki, Tsipoura, and Steak entrees were all excellent.  Will definitely be back soon.
Really delicious food (best Greek salad I've ever had) and amazing service. Highly recommend!

Delicious, delicious, and this is from a Greek American...the food was totally authentic and the standouts were the avgolemono (egg lemon) soup, the pasticio, and truly everything we had was fantastic. This is going to be our regular go-to!

Food was amazing and fresh--it was flavorful and full, yet light on the stomach. It was very well priced and maybe one of my favorite places in Chinatown--came back multiple times on my week trip to eat here. The service was alright, but you don't come for that, you come for the food. It was definitely a tight-knit community of workers that made the restaurant feel cozy and bustling.

So I'm split on this one. The modern glutton in me says "YES!! Congee with a modern twist"  but the grandma in my soul says "this isn't traditional congee." The taste of the food is modern but classic at the same time. It reminds me of a great bowl of hot congee eaten at a market stall in Guangzhou with my granny, but the locale is modern and chic. The congee was served piping hot and the taste was clean and simple yet deep and with lots of umami. Although, I wasn't too hungry coming in, I couldn't pass up mushroom filled rice crepes. The consistency was great, the taste different from the "traditional" but good. This place has definitely manage to bring congee into mainstream NYC.

stopped by this place in chinatown to try their rice rolls--they were sooo good. i had the beef & shrimp rice roll as well as their congee and lovedddd it. i would highly recommend stopping here for some comfort food! service and store ambiance were all right.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow! I stumbled upon this when exploring Chinatown & I came back to try it for lunch. There can be a line. So be patient. Also, it's cash only! These rice rolls are AMAZING! It takes awhile to make, but so worth it because it tastes so fresh. My favorite is the peanut sauce that you drizzle over the rice rolls. This was the perfect portion for just two of us. Also. My favorite boba spot is next door so double winning!

Amazing rice rolls! I simply ordered online and then paid with cash when I came to pick up. I got the shrimp roll. The shrimp was juicy, the vegetables flavorful, the rice roll nice and slippery, and the sauce added a nice touch of flavor. You really can't go wrong here and the price is such a steal.

Tasty and affordable southern Chinese rice rolls! Hot soy milk that tastes freshly ground. Would definitely come back. Waited about 15 min at 12:30 pm on Thursday but it was worth it. I used to think only Joe's steam rice rolls in Flushing had this quality, but now it's in Manhattan.
No comment

These rice noodle rolls are a great quick snack, with a variety of fillings. I especially love youtiao for rice noodle rolls, and they had a good execution of it, and the shrimp and chive came with juicy shrimp. The rice noodle is very tender and soft, but they're just too mushy for my personal taste -- they fall apart too easily, making it difficult to eat the filling and rice noodle together.
Absolutely fabulous!  Congee is amazing!  The portion is good for 2 people  to share.  Hard to find parking spot and the line is long though.

Only came to try the rice rolls after having a sub-par version in flushing the weekend before and needed to fill my craving. We tried a classic shrimp and pork version and a new to me fried dough version. Both were very good! Surprisingly, I actually think I liked the fried dough one best? Wish it had something fresh in it (scallion maybe), but it was really tasty. The shrimp and pork was good, but was hard to eat because they didnt section/cut it up. Also saw big bowls of congee around the room so I would like to try that next time!

I've been here a few times and I can't recommend this place enough. Their rice rolls and congee exceeded my expectations in terms of flavor. The sauce for the rice rolls is the perfect amount of sweet and salty to complement the rolls. They also give a generous amount of food and have very quick service. I've ordered Hong Kong milk tea and soy milk and this restaurant, and I recommend them both. The flavor is unrivaled. This place is cash only, so make sure to be prepared for that!

Cash only is accepted at Yin Ji Chang Fen Rice Roll.  Absolutely no plastic either credit or debit is accepted.

Very good service and nice staff.  Food is good.  Very chinese style.  Morning a bit crowded though.

Passed by and couldn't believe it's the same Chang fen place just like Canada when we visited last month so we had to eat here! Very good! The menu was a bit different then Canada but food tasted yummy. I love me some fresh Chang fen. Make sure to come early or there'll be a long line and it's cash only

Rice rolls were yummy but there were dead flies in the congee :( Waitress replaced the congee but there was another dead bug in the new bowl lol. Hopefully just got really unlucky.
Really great spot for rice rolls. They are a bit more expensive than what i'm used to, but great quality and really fresh. Their service is really fast and friendly too.

There was no wait when I arrived around lunch time. The server was attentive and checked up on us. The beef and chive rice roll was delicious! The rice noodle itself was soft and easy to rip apart. The dough rice roll was simple and delicious. The amount of sauce was generous. The congee was a huge portion and could be shared between two people! The red bean ice was alright. There was a little too much ice, but overall delicious.

The line outside of this Chinatown location was always long. Today my friend and I decided to join the line for this establishment and see for ourselves. The line was long but it moved quickly. We ordered a fish fillet congee, two rice rolls and warm soy milk drinks. The service was decent - our server informed us the wait time being extra long and made sure that worked with our schedule. We had a whole day to kill, so it wasn't an issue. The congee was generous in quantity, and with a few shakes of white pepper, it is creamy, smooth with a nice kick. The rice rolls were hefty in flavor and texture, although the rolls were too thin and very easily broken. The balance with the filing was off too. Definitely a place to get Cantonese food cravings fixed if the line isn't terribly long.
Known for the rice roll, you can't go wrong with the shrimp or the port ones. The service was good and the food came out quickly. It has a causal cafeteria-esque ambiance!
No comment
Restaurant and food felt very clean. Definitely recommend if craving some classic rice rolls.

I love their congee! Their rice noodle are freshly made here so that's a plus. The noodle was thin, unlike the thick rice noodles at dim sum restaurant. I would recommend this place if you want a quick and fast bite that is filling! They also have other Hong Kong cafe food items on their menu.

when i went to this location it was very busy and took a while to get seated. the food was quick to come out but the food wasn't very good. many of the dishes were over cooked and unflavorful. although, i have tried the location and Toronto, Canada and recommend that one much better.

I am very satisfied with the brunch. To be honest I am not a rice roll fan but this place converted me. One thing is that they only accept cash

Chicken and mushroom rice rolls here are bomb ! Congee is a miss tho. The pork rice rolls are good too. Beef rice rolls were a miss.

I always see a line here and wanted to see what the hype is about. I got the beef and chive rice roll which was extremely mushy and flavorless. The beef pieces were tender but I prefer the ground up version of beef rice roll. The congee was plentiful and decent but tasted better overnight after letting the flavors meld together. Also had the rice roll with peanut sauce which was good. The rice rolls are big but overpriced for what it is.

Passed this little gem while walking in the area. A hidden gem. They have huge pots of congee boiling all day, and huge portions of fresh rice noodle rolls! (Definitely better tasting then Joe's steam rice rolls) Super low prices for huge portions! I wish I lived near, I would definitely eat here every day. Love !!

This place was wonderful! Staff were extremely nice and accomodating. We went on a Monday afternoon and nobody was there when we got there so we had immediate seating. Menu was also really simple and prices were outstandingly cheap! $6-8 for rice rolls and same with their congee. I absolutely recommend coming here on an empty stomach and ordering both a rice roll and congee. They were both superb! Dishes came out quickly and looked amazing! I got the dough stick rice roll and it was perfectly cooked. The slight crisp on the dough stick went perfectly with the unqiue texture of the rice roll. Paired with the soy sauce, you get a whole array of flavors that all culminate into a gastronomical meal. The congee was just as tasty with the perfect amount of flavor and simplicity to each spoonful. I've had a lot of congee throughout my life (mostly in the Boston area) and I am usually unlucky with what I get (sometimes too salty, too spiced, too bland...you name it); but the congee here is just right and reminded me of an authentic dish you would get right from China. The curry combo was a little too much for me but if you are able to handle spice, this would be absolutely worth it. $10 for the curry combo was the most expensive dish we got here but even that is still pretty great pricing. The toast with butter and condensed milk wasn't amazing but it tasted like what it is: toast, butter, and condensed milk, and that's all I'd ask of it to be. Such a great restaurant with great prices. If you are ever in Chinatown, this place is a must try! I definitely recommend it!
No comment

Came here when we saw a long line out the door and ordered peanut rice rolls! So delicious and super thin rice sheets and the peanut sauce is nice and savory which pairs well with the crunch of the sesame seeds.

Best steam rice roll I have ever had period ! By the time I stumbled across this gem in Chinatown, I have spent three days in the big Apple trying out all kinds of hyped eateries yet no place can compare to this. Fresh, silky, rice rolls soaked in special sauce. The flavor is so well balanced. The service is good too. Definitely will come back for more!

Great food, service and pricing. Love the rolls and the Chinese donut roll is crispy and so yummy

I've tried a few rice rolls places in Chinatown but this was the best one.  The rice roll is silky.  The one with shrimp and pork actually has a good amount of fillings.  The one with special peanut sauce is legit.  The fish balls are good too.

The staff seemed to be more concerned with takeout than their dine in customers. The dough stick rice roll came out cold, but everything else tasted pretty good.

Amazing! We got the lai wan congee because that is what it's famous for. Next time we will get the fish congee because the fish was amazing! And my favorite dish of all was the rice noodle dish. I didnt like the cabbage in it but that's a personal preference. Gosh the sauce is superb and every dish was like $6-$8. It's so good. I could eat their rice noodle dish all day. The rice noodle itself was sooooo soft it basically melted on your tongue. And the beef was also incredibly soft.

Solid place for the rice rolls! I only ordered one plate so I can't speak for the rest but the beef and shrimp one was solid, the rice roll itself was very silky smooth. They packed it with a lot of meat and it seems like cabbage? I would've been okay without the chives inside. Plenty of sauce poured on top. The curry fish balls were also good but could be a bit spicier.

Amazing rice noodle roll spot!! So delicious, the shrimps were very sizeable and the chives are a great added touch. Pricing is slightly higher than other places but the rolls are also larger. In any case you'll want to order a couple, along with their curry fish balls!

Out of all the places I went to in NYC, this place was one of the best. Not only was the food delicious but the customer service was amazing. We came on a Monday around dinner time and was seated right away. The congee tasted like home and the rice rolls were fresh. I definitely recommend the beef and shrimp roll. Will be coming back for sure!

Disappointing rice roll.  I ordered the pork and shrimp but they must have made the one I was served before I arrived.  It wasn't hot however I could see steam rising from food 4 tables away.  The shrimp was tasty and the vegetables were nicely cooked but the pork had no flavor at all.  I've only ever had steamed rice roll that I could see being cooked and prepared and it's all about the freshness.  This time was different.

Yummy food!!  Friendly service.  I am glad it has dine in service, I could enjoy my breakfast during my travel.  I saw a lot of delivery orders, the restaurant must have good reputation in neighborhood.

I gave it 3 stars because they messed up on the boat congee, instead of fish fillets they accidentally added cha siew pork in it. The cha siew ruined it imo. The rice noodles was okay, very big portion.

Let me preface this review by saying that the only item I ordered was the dough stick rice roll. I'm sure other items on their menu are a lot better. Overall, I wasn't really impressed. The Chinese donut was pretty chewy and didn't have a nice crunch. It tasted a little old. I'd definitely come back and try other items but wouldn't recommend this item specifically!

Tasty, fresh and smooth rice noodles. I had the beef & shrimp rice noodles and the beef rice noodles. Both were good but I can do without the chives. Comes with the usual slightly sweet soy sauce. They also have congee but I didn't try that. They are currently open for pick up only. You have to place your order by phone or through an ordering app. There is an outdoor dining area too if you want to eat it there. Cash only!

I really liked this place. It wasn't fancy or pretentious or even rude. It was just good congee and steamed rice rolls. The service wasn't short or rude, it was just a quick smile, get order, and bring out the food. Thank you for warming our bellies on a cold day.

Wow.  Their pork with preserved egg congee is the best in Chinatown!  Amazing quality and taste - I've been ordering from various NYC Chinatown places for over 20 years and only this place's congee is perfection.
Ordered takeaway from here. Due to Covid you need to order ahead of time and pick it up at a make shift window. The rice rolls are exquisite! Really flavorful! I would definitely come back.

God I love this place so much! They specialize in Chang Fen and they are GOOD. I'd always order the shrimp and beef combo whenever I have Chang Fen but this one is on a different level. The beef was tender and soft and the shrimp very fresh and plump. The cabbage added a nice crunch. But the chives were the jewel on the crown IMO (yes I am biased and I love chives a lot) and what beat every other Chang Fen I've had. Got Yuenyeung as my morning wake-up drink and it did not disappoint. The aunties working here are super friendly. The restaurant was bustling on the Saturday early afternoon that I visited but she secured a table for me in less than 5 min wait!

rice roll taste great and expensive.cheaper version other places while congee tasteless not like in guanzhou.

This place always has long lines and my cousin highly reccommended it, but I never got around to trying it. When i saw the prices I said what kind of highway robbery is this? After eatting here I thanked them for robbing my wallet. The food is expensive but very good. The congee in comparison is a good value based on what everyone else charges for congee nowadays. The Chang Fen definetly is a bit more expensive than other places but its definetly really good. Highly reccomend trying at least once. The Beef & Shrimp and the Fried Dough Chang Fen were my favorites. The Pork is also very well made, not tough at all.

I came here during the afternoon while walking through chinatown. I decided to get the iced HK milk tea and shrimp in rice noodles. The waiters were so friendly and kind! The HK milk tea was refreshing and the perfect amount of sweetness. The caffeine also helped me stay up! The shrimp in rice noodle was soft, chewy and a nice slightly thick texture. The restaurant also followed COVID protocols. There were tiny signs on tables that had been disinfected and everyone was spaced out. My meal here was great and I hope to be back soon :)

Most certainly very special place. Reminded me of my childhood eating Chang fun with my grandparents at the market. Well done!
No comment

The rice roll noodles are to die for here. In my opinion, I think it's better than the joe steam noodles. When we stop by here they were only doing take out. You and order at the door or scan their QR code in front of the restaurant to order. One neat thing was it is a cash only restaurant but they accept Venmo! We ordered the beef and shrimp rice noodle, cha shui noodle, and hong kong milk tea.  They all hit the spot. Both the noodles includes some leeks in it which made it so flavorful. We will be back next time we are in Chinatown! I definitely want to try the congee and fried dough and would love to dine in once it is available again.

column3: 皇后區, 皇后區, NY
column6: The new staff needs to be trained properly. The waitress serve me the rice roll without any soy sauce on it, nor provide any water for the customer.  Great good but bad services.

Unfortunately due to the fear of Coronavirus people are avoiding Chinatown. Now the long lines to get into the restaurant is non existent. On a few recent visits during lunch it is empty. The Chang Fun is good. Its thinner then the ones you get at traditional dim sum places. The portions are big and they are stuffed good with whatever your choice of protein is. Becareful because you can easily over order. What I think they do better then the Chang Fun is the Jook(Congee). Its is delicious and they're relatively cheap. I keep coming back here for the jook. They also have good coffee. I particularly love the Ying Yang Coffee and Tea drink.Take advantage of the no wait.
No comment

True stars here are the immaculate service and the delicious congees. The rice rolls are really no better than other dim sum parlors around here. I particularly don't recommend the fish skins which taste very metallic.

Food was incredible and super quick! The rice noodle is excellent quality, same with the filling. If you have a low caffeine tolerance, don't order the HK milk tea. I drank the whole thing and couldn't stop shaking for the entire day.
Big fan of this place. Yin Ji serves up delicious rice rolls. They are larger in portion sizes, but prices are higher than nearby competitors as well.

We were really craving Cantonese food and this hit the spot! We ordered the combination porridge, fried doughnut noodle roll, and the special noodle roll and the classic HK milk tea. This is the classic HK breakfast we grew up eating! So delish and a reminder of our childhood days. Would definitely come back to at least grab their HK milk teas to go!

Food was alright, the cheurng funs were too soft for my taste, you can't even use a chopstick to pick it up...The congee has like no meat and barely any flavor. Overall place is overpriced, can get $3 and less cheurng outside.
No comment

One of my favorite rice roll / congee spot. It was great before COVID and even better during COVID. I have to commend them on their indoor dining protocols. Tables are distanced from each other and the cleaning of the tables is so thorough. They literally clean each table twice and clean even the back of the chairs - that's impressive.

We passed by on an early Sunday morning and saw that there was no line so we stopped by for breakfast. We ordered different churng funs and jook and they were all delicious. The rice noodles were soft and fresh, and the jook was well seasoned. Great place to stop by for a quick meal.

Fresh cheungfuns and a good portion - fresh & plump shrimp in it was a good surprise. The waitperson recommended the special congee with everything in - was a great choice and that portion was enough to share between two people. That hot HK milk tea was another great recommendation.

Not as good as what I expected. I was expecting to get more "street style" rice roll that I normally got in Guangdong, China but this is not exactly the same. The port pieces are too big. It doesn't have enough sauces. While it has soy sauce but there is no way to add sesame sauce. The eggs are usually cooked along with the roll but this feels like egg wrap.

Guang Zhou famous rice roll that came to NYC? Guess I gotta try it out. Get the beef and shrimp rice roll! My favorite one.  The food comes out pretty quick and when I went there was a small line out the door. The congee was pretty good there as well because it comes with a lot of ingredients in it. The curry fish balls were puffy and good. I got a beef rice roll and added egg but I feel as if I didnt really need to add the egg. The fried cruller roll was good too!

This is a new spot and I liked it. Some in my group got the congee and I got a beef and shrimp rice roll. I'm not gonna compare it to Joe's Rice roll because I hope both are really successful and there is enough room in this town for twenty rice roll spots because they're great!  My friends said it was expensive, but compared to other types of cuisine, it's still really cheap!

Very good rice roll, so this kind of rice roll will have more of a selection in what you want to have it in. They make this more complex with chives, sometimes eggs, and different types of vegetables mixed with the meat. If your around the area and want to try a high end rice roll compared to regular dim sum restaurants this place is the place to go. I came here during lunch time. There was a 10min wait but overall good experience. Price is $8 for a rice roll. That's more towards the expensive side for what your getting. Good experiences. Will recommend.

No comment

The hype for this place is real. The lines are always out the door, but their food is a solid 3/5 in my opinion. We got their shrimp with beef rice roll, as well as their shrimp with pork rice roll, and they tasted exactly the same. After a while we couldn't pick up which ones we were eating anymore. Don't get me wrong the meat inside the rolls were very smooth and tender, but there wasn't a big difference between the two dishes. We also got their thousand year egg with pork congee, maybe it's me, but I enjoyed that more than their rice roll. The place is brand new and very clean. Service is quick. Prices are very expensive for rice rolls though, I've never seen rice rolls priced at $7 in other similar establishments before. This place is worth a try, at least once.

So disappointed and definitely overhyped. Came on a Sunday afternoon and waited only about 20mins so not too bad. The food came out pretty quick. We ordered the pork & shrimp, beef & shrimp and dough stick cherng fun for 2 people. The rice roll was really thin on the dough stick which kept the dough stick really crispy. But the pork & shrimp and beef & shrimp orders were sooo disappointing. They don't skimp on the filling but the consistency of the rice roll is the main part of the dish here and it was so mushy. Good rice rolls aren't supposed to be this mushy!! (I can probably make better ones at home lol..) It looks silky and transparent but in reality it was like a pile of glob and just overall very sloppy. Had such high expectations but I will surely be sticking to Joe's.
No comment

This place definitely gets crowded during any meal time, including breakfast. It has a simple menu and people mainly come for the congee and rice rolls. The congee with preserved egg really hit the spot on a cold winter day. I usually only eat it when I'm sick, but this would be perfect for breakfast or a small meal. The rice rolls were good and they don't skimp out on the fillings, but it could be a lot better for the price it's at. Other places are much cheaper and taste about the same. Overall, quick and easy place to eat without any frills. I would come around 5:30 to get a seat for dinner. I don't think I would wait long for the food, but the line goes quick as people are there to just eat and go.

I love rice rolls, I can eat mad plates by myself. I'll share begrudgingly but not the liver rolls -- those I'll eat a whole plate of myself!!! GET THE LIVER RICE ROLLS.

3.5 stars. Yin Jin Chang Fen provided an authentic, friendly, and tasty experience. It is a very solid option in Chinatown to fulfill your steamed rice roll and congee cravings only phased by extremely long lines. I was able to try the rice rolls, sticky rice, and congee and everything was good. My favorites were the rice rolls which you can order in many varieties. Service was extremely courteous and food came out quick.

There was a long ass line on Sunday afternoon (1 hour wait). The Hong Kong Curry Fish Balls had 10 pieces/order and it was really good! The rice noodles were fantastic as it included lots of protein filling. The only downside was the abundance of green onions. Preferred the rice rolls WITHOUT the addition of eggs!!
No comment

The food is so amazing!!!!!!!!  A favorite for breakfast, lunch, snack, or anytime!   Love croutons rice roll and pork seafood congee.  Everything is freshly made when ordered.  Simply fabulous happiness

Friday night, the wait might be around 20ish mins give or take but it is most definitely worth it. Loved everything we ordered which was the shrimp chang fen, a giant bowl of pork duck egg congee/jook, and Hong Kong classic milk tea. One cool thing is that the milk tea drink container is served in a bowl of shaved snow so that there's no need for ice floating inside your drink meaning more Hong Kong milk tea in the container. Amazing food that was very well flavored and great texture. This is most certainly a place I will return to.

I've had congee and rice noodle rolls here for the first time and I was soooooo impressed. I randomly crave it, it's so good . The pricing is awesome because for the portion, it's a lot of food, especially the congee. Also for those of you who are south Asian and have never had congee before, it tastes like HALEEM  and absolutely delicious but strong on the ginger though in case you dont like that. Very pleased to have tried this place and def will come back again. Also they serve hot water which has now gotten me into drinking hot water instead of room temperature now, just feels better tbh

Came here 11 on Sunday which we need to wait around 25min. We ordered 4 different rice rolls and 3 different porridge which. R1 and R2 definitely my favorite. Their rice roll are differently roll compared to the onew we usually eat when we have dim sum. It a piece of rice roll with all ingredients inside. So yummy but the more you eat the more salty your mouth it is but probably to to the soy sauce that soak in the rice roll skin. The porridge which the shrimp is my favorite, the shrimp is huge. The fried fish skin definitely nothing special since it just taste like the snacks you brought in the market.

The rice rolls are not representative of traditional Guangzhou Hong Kong cooking. Ordered the Lainwan congee, mixed rice roll, and egg roll. None of these dishes were up to standard for a place that serves rice rolls as the so nature dish. The most essential thing about rice rolls is the ability to roll them neatly and texture. None of this was happening in my dish, and as I was eating the roll crumbled like tofu. I would recommend the congee that's loaded with seafood.
No comment
No comment

I simply loved my meal here. The congee with pork, kidney, and liver was a huge ass bowl of savory goodness, and the BBQ pork rice crepe my boyfriend got was a decent portion. We also got the mantou with condensed milk and curry fish balls. The mantou was hot and crispy on the outside. The curry fish balls were great in that you can taste the curry but its not overwhelming to where you can't taste the fish, and it's not the cheap kind (you know the kind that barely has any fish and is mostly flour?) I also got the HK milk tea and really enjoyed it's smooth texture and authentic flavor (Can vouch because I studied abroad in Hong Kong for a semester a few years ago). Everything was satisfying and at a good price (we only paid $22.75 for all of this!) Would definitely recommend 100%!

I have been wanting to see what all the hype was about. Famous chain from Guangzhou that specializes in rice noodle rolls 腸粉 which was good but everything else was just ok. Fried fish skin 炸魚皮 was not crispy and lacked flavor. The 艇仔粥 and 及第粥 bland. They charge twice as much as other comparable places in chinatown.

Solid cheap chinese brunch! Yin Ji Chang Fen is a successful rice roll restaurant based in Guangzhou. We got their signature congee, pork liver congee, rice rolls, curry fish balls, rice roll wrapped fried dough sticks, honey lemon tea and their classical Hong Kong style milk tea. Everything was delicious and actually tasted FRESH AND NOT FROZEN compared to the lower tier dim sum places around the area. Overall, this is a great place to go for congee and rice rolls. My cons are 1) they are cash only 2) the rice rolls are hard to share with friends; maybe ask for a knife.

Ordered delivery from this place and was very impressed with their packaging and quality of food. Everything was still steaming hot after delivery. The beef in the steamed rice roll is very tender and all other ingredients taste very fresh. Favorite is the preserved egg congee!

An excellent  fresh Cheung fun shop in Chinatown I found in a list on Eater. cash only

Absolutely stellar rice noodle rolls. Slightly different than some of the other kinds in Chinatown, but man these are good. Tried the shrimp and pork, marinated pork and beef with chives, and BBQ roast pork rice noodle rolls. I also got the Lai Wan Style congee. I could eat this stuff every day. And prices are GOOD. Get here early because the line can get long quickly.

Tried this spot for the first time during COVID times. They are serving take out only with cash payment, and appear to still have a dedicated group of customers. There is ample dining space right outside the storefront. I split two rice rolls with a friend - pork/beef and shrimp, as well as one order of the fried crullers. The rice rolls were piping hot when we got them, and there was a generous serving of sauce to accompany the order. The shrimp was the better of the two, but overall both flavors were good. The fried dough sticks were okay, tasted as they should. I'll be getting more rice rolls from here for sure.

Lost my bag here and the store said they haven't see anything. However, when I went back to the store, the bag was obviously there and the store just didn't give a shit. NOT RESPONSIBLE AT ALL. Shame for their service and will not recommend anyone to go.

They make the best congee and rice roll! Very affordable and quick service. I've tried pretty much everything on the menu now. My most favorite is pork liver congee. The liver is exceptionally tender. The congee itself is sightless bland. I always add soy sauce and chili oil same with rice roll.
No comment

I have to admit, Yin Ji Chang Fen Rice Roll was wonderful. The menu is impressive, I was overwhelmed with the choices. I have to admit, Lai Wan Congee was really outstanding. I think that I might have a new favorite dish now. Staff is very polite and can help you with everything. I would recommend Yin Ji Chang Fen Rice Roll.
No comment
No comment

I don't usually write review but have to make exception for Yin Ji. For someone who spent the first 18 years of my life in Guangzhou, China, Yin Ji has been an institution of local restaurant specialized in handcrafted rice roll. I haven't been able to travel to Guangzhou to taste it for a few years. Heard about the NYC Yin Ji so I figured it's a must-try when I was in town. From the second the plate of rice noodle roll put down in front of me, I knew I was in for a real treat as it looked like the real deal. And the taste of it confirmed my thought as well. I was almost moved to tears as memory of childhood and home rushed into my mind. The texture of the rice noodles and the favor of the fillings and soy sauce were all as close as they come to what I remembered. And of course I had to try the congee, which was on point as well! I could tell the owner and her staffs put their hearts into this restaurant and its outstanding food. This kind of handcrafted food takes a ton of time and effort to prepare it well but doesn't sell for high price. Thank you so much for the yummy and authentic food!
No comment

THE AMAZING CHENG FEN IN NYC! I've eaten here at least 10 times in the last 6 weeks... I'm obsessed. I've had cheng fen in Guangzhou and this is comparable! The porridge is also amazing, everything is so fresh and delicious. My favorite go to. THE BEST!!!

So much variety here! I love that you could get pig's blood if you wanted. The rice rolls were fresh, slick, silky, and slippery. The beef and shrimp filling were flavorful and generous. I only wished that the soy sauce marinade the rice roll came in also had some kind of house made chili sauce. That would really take it to the next level.

I RARELY ever wait for food anymore because I tend to think it's overhyped, but I would 100% do the 45 minute wait again to eat these rice rolls. They are INCREDIBLE and well worth the price; they're bursting with filling and the texture of the rice noodle is perfect. Order a ton of the rice rolls, the youtiao with extra egg added, preserved pork and century egg congee (make sure to add the white pepper on the side), and HK milk tea - you're all set for an amazing and delicious lunch experience.
No comment

I've heard so many good things about this place and I finally decided to stop by today. I got there around lunchtime on a Monday and there were around 15 people in front of me. The wait was around 20 minutes but it was so worth it! This place is known for their congee and rice rolls so I decided to order a few of each. The outside layer to the rice roll was so thin and tasty and I haven't had anything like it! The price was a little bit more compared to other places but it was definitely worth it. I ordered the iced soy milk and it was really smooth and silky!

No comment

You would think that the hype for this place would have died down by now but unfortunately for the customers it's still ongoing. I waited in line with friends for an hour to get some breakfast food. I ordered their fish congee and marinated beef, shrimp with chives rice roll, and Hong Kong Milk Tea. I wish the fish was softer, but at least it's boneless. I requested for no scallions or chives in my congee and said yes to cilantros, and they truly dumped a huge handful of cilantros in. That was quite an overwhelming amount and kind of took over the taste of the congee. I found it tasty otherwise though. Their marinated beef and shrimp with chives rice roll was not bad either, but was heavy on the chives. I also found their milk tea quite bitter but they do provide sugar at the table separately for us to adjust the sweetness ourselves. Another thing is that the prices for everything is more expensive than what you may find at a typical dim sum place. I spent $15 (pre-tax + tip) by myself on congee, rice roll, and a small cup of milk tea. Overall, food is decent but not enough for me to get on that one hour line again.

WOW!!!!! Absolutely delicious. I love rice rolls in general but these were especially good. The BBQ pork roll was a standout. The congee is also very yummy, especially with black egg. Definitely ordering from here again.

These wraps are amazing!!! And are way better than any offered in dim sum places. They are thin and soft but still chewy. I normally don't like these wraps and don't eat them at dimsum unless my friends order them, but this place has me converted. My group ordered the braised beef and the braised beef with shrimp. I liked the braised beef better. I feel like with the  beef and shrimp it was just too much filling. The sauce was very tasty too - I was nervous that it was going to be salty bc of the soy sauce but it was very balanced. Next time I would try just the plain wrap bc the wrap combined with the sauce was just so delicious!

No comment

This is my 4th attempt and I finally got it right. This is a rice roll place but I am not a fan with this rice roll with shrimp, beef, scallions and all these stuff in it. I felt like it took away how great their rice roll is. Their congee is amazing. I think it's the best in New York. The rice roll with fried dough was amazing as well. The milk tea was delicious and I can easily have another one.... overall I like this restaurant a lot and will definitely come back.

We stood on line outside for 8 minutes for lunch. We had the shrimp rice roll $6.95, beef & pork rice roll $6.95, pork & preserved egg congee $5.95 and dough stick $2.25. Both rice rolls were too soft & mushy, broke apart easily when picking up with fork. The congee & dough stick were nothing special. Not impressed, why the hype & lines?
No comment

Rice rolls are not as thin as Joe's at canal market but they make up for it with other great products. Congee / Fish Skin / Dough sticks are superb here and staff is friendly/attentive. Solid place for authentic cantonese breakfast. Do expect 15-20mins wait, although the lines do move fast.
No comment

DELICIOUS. This relatively new restaurant is SO good. The entire menu is different types of (1) congee/jook and (2) rice rolls/chang fen. My friends and I ordered a ton of different varieties, and they all came out piping hot and delicious! The restaurant is very clean, fairly spacious, and service was good. A new Chinatown gem!

This is our second time back at this restaurant in one week, and while the wait was a bit longer this weekend (especially right after Chinese school gets dismissed), the food was still delicious. We ordered two congees, two rice rolls, two drinks and the crullers for just under $35. That's quite a deal in Manhattan for some delicious Chinese food! We will be back to try some more of their dishes!

They are still doing takeout only and require some waiting time. I ordered egg Chang Fen, which costed almost 5 dollar and I have to enjoy it at near park. (Winter picnic!) however, it is worth, the rice cake tasted so delicious. Simple is the best I would say.
No comment

I decided to try this place out after reading the reviews and looking at the pictures. After waiting for 30 min, we got a seat; the servers were really nice and the whole system was quite organized. We ordered two 肠粉, one 粥, and one 奶茶. Everything was pretty good, the 肠粉 was very thin and tender and similar to the one I had in 深圳. At many dim sum places in America, the 肠粉 is very thick so I was really happy to find a place where they make it better. The 韭黄鲜虾肠粉 had so much shrimp in it and it also had cilantro and lettuce inside which I really liked. Their chili sauce was also quite good.

With empty stomach after waking up, we (my sister and my best friend) headed to have breakfast feast. We waited in line for 30min then we got to sit to order food. We had full table of food for just three of us, and had some to take home. We ate so fast because we were hungry and within less than one hour. We left with such full stomach, and we walked home where home is just few blocks away. By the way, I live in Chinatown hahaha. Love the food and will definitely going back there again for the congee.

Probably the best rice rolls in the city. Soft and not chewy. Expertly cooked. Try the rice rolls with the fried dough sticks inside!

We wanted to try this new place everyone was so hyped about. My friend bought me a soy milk and a rice noodle roll from here but maybe the expectation I had for it was too high. It disappointed me.  The noodle on the outside was decent but the meat they used different types of meat and they were pieces not minced. So the noodle was soft then u chew in very chewy meat and the meat falls all over the place. The soy milk was a watery soy milk nothing special. I dont think I would go back.

I came here twice. Once in the afternoon (no line) and another time at noon (a short line waiting for ~15min). The taste was good generally. The problem was, the first time, there was an egg shell in the congee and the second time, there was a piece of hair in the chicken with stocky rice. Every time there was unpleasant thing happened...
No comment
100% the best Chang fen place in Manhattan. The only thing I would complain is that my apartment is outside their delivery area, haha

There is always a long line outside so we had high expectation. But we were thoroughly disappointed. The marinated beef rice noodle roll, which is the main attraction of the restaurant and was highlighted in the menu as 'must taste', looks like two rolls pushed into one big fat one and it looks ugly. I had one bite and left the rest untouched. The Shredded pork and gold preserved egg congee is good but not extraordinary. I will not be back. Originally submitted Nov 1; resubmitted Nov 5, 2019.

To start off , there was a line to get into the restaurant but there is a staff that assist you with seat number . Took us 15 minutes to get in on Friday afternoon. Originally wanted to come here to try their rice roll but we did get congee as well . Congee was smooth and perfect, the portion was good to be shared among two people and we also ordered two rice rolls , we left full. The condiments you needfor congee and rice noodle were on the tables so you don't need to ask for it. Price is average. Sad that I didn't get to try their HK milk tea because I was going to get bubble tea afterward. Will definitely try their HK milk tea next time because the aroma of the tea is the only thing you smell when you're in the restaurant.

Food is good.  Chang Fen rice noodles is delicious.  Congee has big pieces of ingredients which is good.  Service is ok.  But make sure you bring CASH to NY Chinatown since many of the restaurants or stores don't accept credit card.
The service took a while but the Chang fen was so fresh and soft! Got the pork and shrimp rice roll. Don't by shy with the seasoned soy sauce bc it's not that salty. I'll definitely come again

I definitely recommend this place. It is a must go to when you are in chinatown! Everything was amazing from food to the staff members. You might wait for a little bit but it is definitely worth the wait!
No comment

The best rice noodle rolls in NYC! Noodle rolls have the softest texture and taste the best together with the sweet soy Source. The restaurant is a historical food-chain in Guangzhou, China for over half century and I'm really excited they open the first (probably) location oversea. Must-try in Chinatown!
Glad we had good timing of the USA opening of this chain rice noodle roll house. Definite recommend. Cash only.
GAME CHANGER!!  They now do take out.  Best congee ever to go.  They open at 7:30 am so you can grab and go for breakfast.
