No comment
Only one star for restaurant which take tax into suggested tip, end of discussion. Plus, the frozen milk tea is just a normal milk tea surrounded with ice, nothing special and not worth the price.
No comment

Though the line was long, the experience is definitely worth the wait.  Love their small rice wrapped in lotus leaves, it has a very tasty filling that was wonderful.  Their rice rolls are thin and freshly made to order.  Their congees (rice porridge) has so many varieties that we ended up ordering too much food.  Also love their Chinese fried dough!  It is also fried when you order them, crispy and wonderful.  Don't forget to try the fried fish skin,  best in Chinatown, thin and comes with a special broth that is made for dunking the fish skins.  BTW, the Hong Kong style tea with milk is something that I have long for, it is smooth and delicious.  Will make this a regular stop.  Staff is very attentive and friendly.  A wonderful place to stop for comfort and authentic rice roll and congee.

I still like my rice rolls from the old Tea Parlors but if you like the new gentrified places come here.  I'm not impressed with the cafeteria setting, I like my space.  Nothing special here but the repackaging.

I am very disappointed and furious at this restaurant.  I tried it the first time about a month before and thought it was alright and recommended it  to my parents to give it a try considering it was all the rave recently.  My parents went to order take out and got 2 noodle rolls and a congee.  My dad ate the congee and had felt an odd sharp piece he couldn't quite chew in his mouth.  Odd considering it was pork liver congee.... there shouldn't be any hard pieces at all! So he figured it may have been one of  his loose teeth that may have fallen out. When he spit it out, it was this metal rotting looking iron piece! I am absolutely disgusted that this was found in my dad's congee. He could have choked or maybe gotten metal poisoning if that's even a thing. We are never ever coming back to this restaurant. It's overpriced and they gift you with many surprising unedible gifts in their food apparently. Proceed with caution and make sure you chop up and thoroughly look through your food before putting it in your mouth! I really wish I could give this place 0 stars.

Sorry but this place was super expensive for just rice roll. Why would I come here when all the other dimsum restaurant serves the same thing and even better. The rice roll did not have a slight chewy texture, it was more like mush and the combination of beef, eggs and chive was weird. Good rice roll will be elastic and not mushy. And it was just too expensive. Not worth it and will not be coming back. The condensed milk toast was dried and stale and it was $4, come on now. $4 for toast and it was complete garbage. Pretty sure Ming sing or cha Chang tang has better toast. Also their fried dough with rice roll is extra crispy, didn't taste like it was fresh out of the kitchen, it tasted like they refried the dough until crispy and rerolled it. There was no dough in the fried dough just hollow and extra crispy. If you guys know what I mean when you fried French fries for too long and there's no more potato inside. That is exactly what it taste like.

Great food. Place is clean. Feel very comfortable eating here despite pandemic. Staff friendly and conscious keeping place clean. The rice noodle roll with beef and with fried dough are must have. I have congee with crispy fish. Haven't have that for a while. Highly recommended and would come back for sure

Finally tried this place out after first trying it this past summer in Canada. I was pretty excited as I'm a big big rice roll lover --- with lotsssss of peanut sauce. The chern fun was a-ok not great (not sure if it's bc it was cold by the time i got to work after picking it up). the fishballs aren't bad.i do wish they gave a bit more peanut sauce tho. the service was pretty quick. i placed my order on the phone after i got off the train and by the time i arrived in maybe 5 mins it was almost ready. i do admit it is a bit pricey compared to other spots where i got the same items for less. i probably will give them another chance when it's not winter so the food won't get cold too quickly

I know this place is special, a long established brand in GuangZhou, China. What I didn't expect was the fact they are beyond delicious in food. The way they maintaining high standards in quality and exceptional customer service was 2nd to none! You guys just turned a customer to a life long fan!

Got the pork and shrimp rice roll and the pork and preserved egg congee! Both were delicious and ended up being $13 between the two of us! It actually was enough food for 3 to split! Can't wait to go back =]
No comment

Nothing like the Yin Ji back in Guangzhou. Am very disappointed with the quality of the rice noodle roll. Also ordered some other appetizers  etc... Overall, the congee is the best among all. I hope the quality of rice noodle roll will improve but as for now, it's a no go.
Yoo dope ass food. Got to relive some childhood moments with that 1,000,000 year old egg in congee and fried dough stick. The rice rolls are huge unlike other places. Do it.
I am a cantonese myself, haven't had such authentic rice roll and congee. definitely coming back and definitely recommended!

My favorite dim sum dish in tons of varieties! Inexpensive, generously portioned, fast and friendly service. Also the congee helpings are HUGE so if you're dining solo and want to order the congee, come with an appetite. Also it's cash only but there's an ATM in the restaurant.
Clean and spacious spot for delicious rice rolls, congee and coffee! I appreciate their early hours. Cash only.

Tried this place because it is new. It's not that great - definitely not worth waiting on line for. It doesn't compare to Joes Steam Rice Roll and I like the Rice Roll carts on Grand/Bowery and the one on Elizabeth/Hester better than this place. They kind of rush/pester you to order and rush you to leave (kind of understand since there are people waiting) but it makes for an uncomfortable dining experience. We tried the rice roll with cruller and the cruller was dark brown - too hard - guess they had in oil too long. We also tried the egg rice roll with beef. The egg rice roll tastes weird - the consistency is mushy but a little rubbery. The HK milk tea was good though. They didn't have shrimp when we went (strange to run out of something so basic - can't you go buy some at the Chinese grocery down the street?) and they didn't have the Han Jin Bing - waitress said they ran out 3 days ago - guess it's not made on premise.   No line if you go before 6pm on Tuesday. There was a line 7 people deep by the time we left at 6:30pm.
No comment

Finally got a chance to try this place after seeing the long lines every morning. I came here around 4pm on a Friday and surprisingly there was no wait! I ordered the congee with the fried dough. My hubby ordered the pork with shrimp rice roll. We weren't a big fan of it. Reminded me more of an omelette. The pork was a bit dry. Congee was good though!

I was born in Guangzhou and lived in Guangzhou for 18 years. Yi Ji Chang Fen is definitely a childhood memory taste. But this one is not authentic. The soy sauce for the rice roll was way too salty. As I remember, the soy sauce is supposed to be less salty and a little bit sweet. The fried dough stick was not bad at all. Overall, I think people who had the YinJi in Guangzhou before will be disappointed this place.

Great food, I eat at Guangzhou a lot, but now I love the one at New York City, every time when I come here I has to wait about 1/2 to 45 mins, but worth of waiting. Noddle with shrimp, must, mike tea mush drink, congee mush drink. I am a return customer every week. Keeping the quality of the food, recommend!!!!

If rice roll is your jam, then this is your place. The rice roll with roast pork is superior, and the curry fish balls are very tasty.  However, the congee was just ok.  I've had better congee elsewhere.  So go here for the rice roll, but not for the congee.
No comment

It's worthy to wait, food is worthy to the price because it's full of fresh meat and everything is fresh and tasty. Sure no MSG because I am not thirsty after ate. Service is excellent, and place is clean. Overall, the best place I've visited.

Very clean restaurant with lots of little table communal style seating. Staff is friendly this is why they got 2 stars.  Food was only ok, not worth all the hype. We order the lan wan congee, beef and pork rice roll, curry fish ball and the fried dough. Let's start off with the congee, was good lots of things in congee but a little bland. Now the rice roll, pork was raw and the rice roll was not as smooth and I told the waitress, they didn't even to offer to change or take off bill. The curry fish ball was very tasty and the fried dough was as expected. I would not go again. Hope they make changes.
We are greeted with the friendly smile. Food is excellent. First time I had fried fish skin. It was delicious.

What a delicious meal... I just walked in without a plan... I had hunger pains and was I lucky!   Tried a congee dish (pork ) that was so delicious ... also curry dish !!!! Location is in heart of Chinatown across from criminal court (100 Centre street) can become very busy at lunchtime... prices are good and attentive staff... noodles are also great-authentic!!!!

This is becoming one of my favorite places in Chinatown! Their food is one of the best around here, especially the rice noodles. There's a variety of options to choose from and prices are fairly reasonable. I love the curry fishballs, sweet buns (which come with condensed milk!), and fish skin (along with soup). These are my top favorite dishes aside from the rice noodles. Would definitely come back here with friends!

I've heard a lot of good reviews about this place and thought I would give it a try.  I was craving rice noodle rolls, and ordered the beef & shrimp and bbq pork for take-out.  The rice noodle rolls were pretty big with a good portion of meat, shrimp, and vegetables without being too salty.  However, I thought the rice noodle rolls were okay.  The rice noodle rolls were on the thinner side and kind of soft, and a bit expensive.  I've tried a few rice noodle stands that had a good balance of chewiness and softness.  For anyone who wants to try, I say go ahead since it's only take out and you don't have to wait in long lines.
No comment

no wow factor. waited exactly 40 mins to get in. ordered their must eats marked on the menu. got their iced hk styled milk tea and it was only ok. tried beef & shrimp rice noodle, and the beef & pork with chives. also ordered a pork liver congee which was better than the noodles. noodles were sticky and toppings all fell apart. i didn't like the beef at all. there were no flavor in the noodles. i had to add the chili oil from the table. overhyped! will only return for snacks and drinks when there is no longer a line. will not come back for their well-known noodles. honestly, did not like how close we sat next to others. no personal space at all. not used to it!

We ordered the rice noodle with shrimp and pork with egg.  The rice noodle broke apart very easily.  We also ordered the combination congee.  While it was filled with many ingredients, it was not very flavorful.  Not worth the wait and price.
This place is amazing. Get the rice roll with fried dough stick (you tiao -crispy and amazing), and the porridge. It taste so good I literally want to cry eating this.

Good prices for the food. It was my first time trying Rice Rolls and congee, not my favorite but the food was decent overall and was good for trying something new. The service was good too, they were nice and the waiting time was 20 minutes.

The space is extremely small but the workers are so top notch efficient, two working in the kitchen to pull and roll the rice rolls and two in front, where one takes the orders and handles CASH only payment and other packs the orders. Going on a weekend, expect at least 30 minute wait so best to call ahead. It was worth the wait as it allowed me to go grocery shop nearby. The rice rolls come piping hot and are silky smooth; a good cheap meal!
Best rice roll and congee place! So glad they decided to open this in New York! I like the beef and shrimp rice roll. They are generous with the meat portions.
I ordered from this place last week and the rice rolls are yummy. The congee is delicious too. The food is so fresh. Thanks

Recommended to come try this place by a friend. It did not disappoint. HK milk tea was really good as were the beef rice rolls. Zhaliang is one of my favorite dimsum items and it was very tasty here! Will be adding this to my list of foods when I make another trip to NYC. Came a little before 10am on Sunday and there was no wait (party of 3).

Had high hopes for this restaurant given all the great reviews it has gotten, but was quite disappointed. Ordered the sweet corn, vegetable, egg and chicken rice noodles, as well as the chicken congee. I really liked the texture of the rice noodle, it was oddly comforting, but the sauce accompanying the orders, as well as the fillings, were all quite bland. The sweet corn noodle was canned corn that had been lightly sauteed and folded into the noodle. The egg and rice noodle combination didn't work for me, in both flavor and texture. The egg had been flattened into the noodle, so it was all just one glutinous texture.  Both the chicken noodle and chicken congee were combined with shitake mushrooms that were so overpowering in flavor, I simply couldn't eat them at all. Otherwise, the congee had a really nice gingery flavor that would have been perfect for a cold day.  I felt that there was no balance in the flavors of any of the dishes. Additionally, my digestion did not do well with this food. Not sure if it might have been the oils used in the cooking. Won't eat here again, but will continue the search for a good rice noodle.
The congee is very thick, yummy, and full with flavors, though chang fen is not that impressive.

This place has pretty good rice rolls! The order is quite sizeable so be prepared to share unless you're super hungry. I'm not sure it was worth the 30 minute wait but I'd come again when there is a short line/no wait.
No comment

Great food and really nice staff. I recommend this place. Long line so I decided to just order take out. They are do friendly and helpful. They told me what is recommended and it was so good. Ordered and ready promptly!

I've been wanting to try this place since they first opened. I'm glad I did! Very solid steamed rice roll (cheung fun) and congee!! Highly recommended! The food came with a lot of ingredients and flavors. The wait wasn't long either. Would definitely come back again!

The rice noodle here is very fresh and has a generous amount. The congee is very yummy too. Don't forget to order the milk tea as well which is very smooth. Highly recommend this place, we will definitely will back.

Food is amazing and AUTHENTIC. When I took the first bite of Chang fen, it felt like home. It tasted like something my grandma would make. The portions are very filling, though it may not look so at first glance. They give a copious amount of meat and filling inside the Chang fen, which gave it so much flavor and depth. I loved the service; waiters were friendly and welcoming. Atmosphere is comfortable. Would definitely go again and bring my friends/family!
return customer every weekend.  traditional food.  great quality, same like GangZhou one.  shirmp and vegetables was not over cook. milk tea not too sweet.  will come back

Love rice rolls in general, one of my comfort foods. Not bad here, definitely a different technique to making the crepes. Congee was standard. Food came out fast which is great. Always a line but I also see no one controlling how long someone sits at a table..like a single girl taking 100 selfies and pics of her food..............

Worst service ever received, one server would roll her eyes in front of the guests. The server would judge the guests in Cantonese, pretending no one can understand. If you are ok with being judged by the server, it would be the best to go in China Town.

Food is good, congee is very tasty, beauty is I didn't get allergic reaction (I'm allergic to chicken powder). We ordered 4 different rice roll, seafood congee, fried dough, fried fish skin, lemon tea. We went early right after they open door, so we don't have to wait inline. Service is excellent. Only negative is the lemon tea is very light, they are generous to put slices of lemon but the tea itself is not strong taste, so as the ice melts the tea become more lemon water. Worth to try!
No comment
The food is fair, love the fried fish skin. The staff so rush, collect the my bowl very quick, I didn't finish eating my congee.

The absolute best rice roll but the fish skin was just ok. Will not order the fish skin again. Congee was excellent too. Just delicious. Rice in lotus leaf was good. Will return. Waited 1/2 hour starting at 10:54 on Sunday morning on cloudy day.

I'm very excited that Yinji finally opened its branch in NY. It is an authentic restaurant famous for rice noodle roll (or chuengfen), a type of dim-sum that I like since childhood. We went there on Thursday evening and not surprisingly there was a waiting line there. We got our table in about 30 minutes and the wait was worthwhile. We were particularly impressed by the beef roll, barbecue pork roll, and egg roll. They are smooth and yummy. The thickness of the noodle part was appropriate with satisfactory portion of fillings. The meats were well marinated and tasty. Besides foods, the restaurant is clean and service is great. The manager is super nice, efficient and well organized. Good food plus nice people make this restaurant a must-go place. I will certainly go again.
Good quality rice roll at a higher price. I guess if you are willing to spend $30 for a good cheese pizza, you will not have problem paying $6.95 for the rice roll!

Truly a hidden gem! Not one to venture down to tribeca for dinner but would definitely go back for The Greek. They did everything right - service was top tier, drinks were great and food was even better. Everything came out in a timely manner and was so delicious. The table split dips and I can confirm we all had to fight for the last bite. Each dip so unique and packed with flavor we were left wanting more. For my main, I got the Santorini salad with grilled chicken and this is what hit home for me. I've never had such a well balanced, salad with chicken this good. The others got the octopus entree and Greek salads. All of us were extremely satisfied. Not to mention it's not overly priced for the quality of food you're getting and the ambiance. You have to go here if you haven't been already.
No comment

A surprise! It's felt a little bit chainish when I walked in but I was pleasantly surprised. We actually came to The Greek Tribeca after another restaurant where we have a reservation actually had some maintenance issue. This was within walking distance and we went for it. First off, the space is HUGE. It is a very large and very roomy and very nice space. It is ideal for a meeting or a quiet time with friends. We went during brunch time and the service was just right. The service staff were amazing. The fifth star is for them. The food was actually very good. I have been trying to eat a lot more whole. I know. Laughable. Me eating healthier! But! It wasn't hard here. I had a soup and pita and the egg scramble bowl. The eggs were actually amazing. With a feta crumble, avocado and tomato. It was very filling and I knew I was getting my macros! I also had the chicken avgolemono soup and it was also good. It could have done with a bit more lemon but it did the trick.

Get me to the Greek! Everything we ordered was excellent. The dips and pita were awesome. Delicious fresh pita. The grape leaves were amazing. The meatballs we inhaled. The chicken souvlaki was great. Been to Greece a bunch for work and this food is legit. I am a huge fan.

I think they call it the Greek, because they have a few Greek dishes added to their menu. But as far as authenticity and taste, it's far from Greek. The tzatziki sauce is pure dill taste (didn't expect that) and they had a Gyro on the menu, which was of Mushrooms (not lamb). The chicken Slovaki chicken chunks were seasoned with cayenne pepper, and the rice was turmeric rice. It's was aight. Nothing to brag about. That's a New spin on Greek food.  And the lemon potatoes were dry.
No comment

Came across this place while in Tribeca. Very cozy setup with great ambiance and music. The outside area would be really nice in the summer.  Was here for Sunday brunch.  The restaurant is vegetarian with some pescatarian options. We got the byond chicken souvlaki which was a fairly generous portion. The food is fresh and very tasty. Would definitely recommend coming here for brunch. We will probably come back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
It made literally no lasting impression so idk why I'd even leave a review? You'll forget you even came here

So being married to a Greek, we are particularly picky about true Greek dining in NYC and gotta say, hands down this place wins on all accounts. From reservations to service, food, drinks, we absolutely loved our experience. Had the avgolemono soup, truly authentic...horiatiki, feta was INSANE...pictures show the lamb chops and souvlaki. Both entrees very very plentiful. Will absolutely be back. Thank you guys for an incredible meal!

Ordered delivery, took a while but the food was tasty. Horiatiki salad, chicken souvlaki with rice, and a side of tzatziki were more than enough for my boyfriend and I. Baklava for dessert was good, too.

I did not know what to expect as I walked through a very interesting decor of non stereotypical expectations when thinking of a Greek restaurant.  Tom thought this through. I realized this is going to be an awesome evening.  I can't remember the order of my meal but I know I had the gyro that was nothing like what you'd taste uptown.  It was so full of mom's goodness that I didn't miss the meat.  Tried the haloumi.  Holy moly. Spanakopita. Shawshank redemption.  The food is fresh. Healthy. Stomach was thanking me. Service was A1. Friendly and beautiful. Definitely returning. Thank you. Thank you.

Amazing vegetarian greek food. We loved the diversity of the menu and phenomenal taste. The portobello gyro was my favorite. No mock meats, just whole food ingredients. Cute place, outdoor dining options as well.

Not good. The service was terrible we had to flag down our server to order more drinks and place food order. The menu is very heavy on vegetarian options but no one is our party was a vegetarian. There are only three meat prior a, turkey meat balls that were ok, chicken that was extremely dry and lam that we did not try. The spreads were just ok, octopus subpar. With so many good restraints in the area, this can be skipped.

Had the frappe martini and chickpea soup. The martini was super strong, basically straight up vodka. The chickpea soup was really great! Just the right amount of lemon flavor.
Great atmosphere and good location. I with my friends had good time here and our lunch was amazing! Greek food are super tasty, souvlaki  is my favorite dish now.  Service was great. Recommend!

Best food but beyond that the kindness, love and soul that exudes from this hidden gem is infectious. Ask for Anna or Vivi OMG these wonderful, beautiful ladies serving deliciousness. You will feel at home and the food .... orgasmic delicious'!! The drinks DELICIOUS and you can take your cocktail to go. Me personally I love everything KETO. So delicious,  I'm a food so when I tell you amazing yesssss!!
Great authenticate Greek restaurant in the village. Highly recommend if you are in that area. Pics are not the best because they are taken for outdoor dining during covid.

So happy there's finally a good Greek food place in Tribeca! The lamb chops were very well seasoned and tender! The grilled octopus was also very nicely done but the amount was on the skimpy side...the chicken souvlaki on a pita was a good portion! Will definitely be back!

Amazing food, atmosphere, and staff! Came here for the Valentine's dinner with paired wine tasting. We love everything including the oven baked fish, fried cheese, pita and dip(forgot the name but it had potato in it and a delicious creamy texture), baklava, and more! The waitress was very knowledgeable of the food and presented us a variety of curated wines- we tried many orange wines, and she let us swap anything we didn't like. The staff were quick to take our coats and switch out plates and utensils in between courses. The decor, especially the lights at night, we're beautiful. Overall a wonderful experience!

Really pretty location in Tribeca.  Great service and great food.  Love the chicken soup on a cold winter day.

Looove this place!! Everything is so good and fresh!!  And I have to get the yogurt before I leave.... .  Forever a frequent flyer!

My friend and I had the best lunch here yesterday! We're both Greek and loved chatting with the owners (originally from Thessaloniki, Greece). The food is delicious and so fresh! We ordered the spinach chickpea salad, spanakopita, and grilled halloumi pita. The space is beautifully decorated with great hospitality. We can't wait to return! P.S. end your meal with an amazing frappe (Greek iced coffee)!

If I was reviewing this based on food alone, I think I'd give it three stars. However, I had to bump it up based on the incredible service provided here. I went for lunch with my team from work - we got the pita spreads to share and I had the chicken souvlaki dish as my entree. The spreads were phenomenal! I plan on going back to get them and to try the greek salad when the weather is warmer. Personally, the chicken was a bit dry for my taste and I was sad they didn't have the greek fries when I went. Still, when it was time for us to pay the check, we were offered these delicious chocolates and were told we could take as many as we wanted! All was forgiven with the meal! As I said, I will be back to try the salad and would definitely recommend this cute joint to anyone in the neighborhood.

Came for a work team lunch.  Restaurant is perfect for large groups of 6-8 guests.  The interior was a little dark but has a pleasant warm and rustic feel to it.  The restaurant also has a large oval and round table, so it's great for large gatherings and conversation.  There are also many smaller tables for 2 people as well at the bar (entrance of the restaurant). Overall food was good.  The Greek soft drinks were a treat as well.  Would come back again.

Food is very good. The three dip appetizer is outstanding.  Fast delivery and decent prices. This is a good alternative to the usual mundane delivery options.

*Salad & bakery* review only The traditional greek salad was just okay. I was expecting it to be a bit better. I really want to support this restaurant. Nice inside and music nice. I also got two baked goods on the way out. They have a lot of gluten-free items. The orange olive oil cake was good, a bit dry. The blueberry custard muffin was good but hit some burnt after taste. Overall everything could have been a couple of notches better the day I went (1st time so was expecting 5 stars based on what I read). I am so sorry I had to leave this review. It is just NYC is expensive for restaurants and I felt like I maybe could have made this better at home. I am not in the restaurant business. Also they have a bunch of imported greek groceries they sell. I will have to ask my greek friend about the pricing on them. Overall they have great concepts here. My review is only for the food and I am sorry about that. 3+ stars and I say "wow so good" right away when I'm eating. I'm so sorry Greek.

Enjoyed a late night Sunday dinner at The Greek. The staff was attentive and friendly even though we did not have a reservation. Peter greeted us very graciously and made the evening a relaxed and fun experience. The food was genuine, authentic Greek cooking. It took me back to my childhood!!  Thank you again for a great night out.

Had an awesome experience at The Greek!  Went with a party of 6 and it was so fun to try a bunch of the different shared plates!  Overall everything was very authentic and delicious.  Some food highlights include: the spreads (all were fabulous and they come with homemade pita that is incredible), the mousaka, the horiatiki salad, the octapodi and the mixed grill was a fun way to try a bunch of different things!  All of the drinks we had were delicious as well - the minos cocktail was awesome and the wine list is very traditional and you can't go wrong!  Waitress was very helpful and knowledgeable.  Atmosphere is also really cool inside.  It's a fun place to do dinner or sit at the bar and have some drinks and snacks.  Highly recommend!
Delicious food with healthy and organic options. Very cozy!

Dinner was lovely - we enjoyed the lamp chops, ribs and meatballs immensely. The octopus appetizer was a joke for $23 because it only had 5 small slices (see my photos). I had better octopus at another Greek restaurant. I would recommend the aforementioned dishes but not the octopus.The interior design was warm and welcoming. We liked the seating though the lights were so dim, we were so sleepy after sitting there for 2 hours. We went to a bar afterwards.

Always always fresh and delicious! Never disappoints. The couple that owns this restaurant is so warm and welcoming. My hubby and I love this place and return frequently.

I came here for the food but ended up having a cocktail while waiting for my friend and I was blown away at how good this thing was. I had the Paris and while I'm not quite sure what was in it besides a piece of lavender sticking out of my drink it was damn good. The price for most of the cocktails ranges from 16 to 17. They have a selection of Greek hard liquor and beer. The interior is very cute, like some kind of garden tavern. My friend and I shared the platter for two. It was 62 for one sausage, two cheese filled meat patties, two lamb chops and two chicken skewers with a ton of fries. I don't think the price was justified but the food itself was pretty good and can't complain.  Service was good.
No comment

This place is wonderful!  I came here for dinner with 3 of my closest friends, and we had such a lovely evening.  The ambience is really nice.  We went on a Sunday night and they had live music!  Lovely music.  The service was excellent, and our waitress was very friendly.  The restaurant also has beautiful decor.  And the food!!! So good!  We started with the olives and the spreads, which were delicious.  The pita bread that came with the spreads was so warm and tasty.  We also had the horiatiki greek salad, which was also excellent.  The dressing was awesome and light. Get the gigantes!!! This was I think my favorite part of the meal.  Oh my gosh that dish had amazing flavor and consistency.  For our mains, I had the gemista (really yummy herb-spiced rice stuffed in a tomato and pepper), and my friends all got the branzino.  The branzino was excellent and large (not boring like sometimes a plain piece of fish can be -- very meaty and great flavor).   For dessert, we had the baklava (and they put a candle in it)!  It was AMAZING baklava.  The Greek is an excellent place!

The place has a great feel. Try the Paris cocktail nice and not overwhelming. I had the red snapper and the fish was delicious.  My friends enjoyed the lamb chops. The chocolate soufflé is perfect if you love chocolate.

I had the Melitzana Imam. That eggplant was cooked to perfection! So delicious, very healthy. Restaurant was nice and quiet inside so that's a plus considering how noisy it can be in a lot of restaurants. I like the décor too. Our server was attentive and friendly. Never felt guilty for asking for a drink refill or asking for extra condiments. Portions could  be a bit bigger but the quality was still great. My friend had the shrimp dish which she really seemed to enjoy!
Very nice Place ! Excellent Cocktails...Excellent Staff...Excellent Atmosphere ...Excellent Food ...Delicious !!! Perfect Easter Dinner !Amazing lamb.

We always order from here for takeout but we decided to eat there instead that night. Found a HAIR in my food.   GROSS. MGMT told me it was mine and I was trying to "get a free meal". If I wanted a free meal this will be the last place I would get it from. Avoid at all cost unless you want to be ridiculed in front of friends and family

A very chill and cozy place with amazing food. Great place for date night or dinner with friends...plus they have the best Baklava I've ever had! DO IT!!

I was recently looking to host a large group dinner (12 people). I had The Greek on my list of possible spots because of a delicious dinner I had there a few years ago. Peter, who works in hospitality at The Greek, was really helpful throughout the planning process. He helped put together a menu for a fantastic family-style meal, was understanding when the number of guests fluctuated in the days leading up to the event, and ensured that closing out the bill went smoothly at the end of the night. The food is excellent there, and it's a warm and cozy spot, particularly around the holidays. I wouldn't hesitate to visit The Greek again, whether for a large group event or to dine with a smaller group.

Is one of those hidden authentic New York City places that I wish I left close by. Once again amazing drinks and delicious food

I don't usually feel the need to write reviews, but the food here was so exceptionally over priced and mediocre, and the atmosphere so unwelcoming I am shocked at the high yelp reviews. Got the large spreads, nothing exciting. Got the large mixed grill, the stuffed vegetables, the Greek salad, the soup, meatballs, and the chicken skewers for a group of 6. Nothing was memorable. We ordered many bottles of wine and spent close to $900. (!!!!!) the waitress recommended $100+ bottles of wine writhing warning us... and then the lights started coming on around 9:45. Then they got brighter every 5 minutes. Ok you just upsold us extremely expensive wine let us enjoy it in peace? We had a reservation if you didn't want people to be in your restaurant past 10 then don't accept an 8 pm reservation. Do not recommend.

One of my favorite Greek restaurants and I love the neighborhood that it's in. I love to go for the lunch menu because they offer different plates. I like to order chicken souvlaki skewers with potatoes. Rice pilaf is to die for and you MUST get the pita bread with the different dipping sauces. Sooo good! The beefteki platter is amazing as well probably my favorite dish, but there are many good options to choose from. I usually get a sparkling wine that I think is called the Medusa but don't remember the name now.

Came here for lunch, place was not very busy, the service and restaurant are great. The food also was very good, very authentic in the flavors. Really enjoy our time at the Greek. 100% recommended!

I would give the place a much higher rating if it wasn't hotter inside that it was outside. The Bartender shared with us that it's been like that for several weeks and the manager Nicholas ignores the staff when they bring it to his attention. I did speak to Nicholas about it, and he was super nice and very engaging and apologized for the situation. However he definitely made it appear that it was a one time deal. The food was excellent. This hidden gem is conveniently located right next to the spa I frequent  and that's how I discovered The Greek. Their selection of superb cocktails, attentive service, and authentic Greek cuisine are second to none. I was impressed to get a response almost immediately from Tom to my request for reservation via Yelp . My friend/I had the " Archils Hill " cocktail , sea bass , octopus, & spare ribs. Oh, it just melted in my mouth. I will go there again after my next spa trip at Tribecca Spa of Tranquility. Try it both. It is a perfect combination of treating yourself and your date/pals,
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

very pretty, comforting and warm atmosphere. staff was nice and the food was very good quality. I really enjoyed their spreads as an app. delicious, great portion and variety served. the octopus was well cooked. For the entrees we had the mixed grill and moussaka. both very substantial and very well prepared. pides were ok. I would definitely say their lamb chops are a star. I enjoyed the feta cheesecake because it was not too sweet. only thing i would improve is a cocktail list.
No comment

came here with four customers after work event. We ate so well !! the octopus was grilled perfectly, the pita was fluffy and fresh. our waiter was friendly and always present. We had two bottles of wine,Greek yogurt for dessert, two orders of octopus, horiatiki salad, spanokopeta,etc. I ordered with abandon and have no regrets. dinner W tip was $690, I hope to be back again before the end of the year!

I've dined here twice and have to say that I will not be back. The first experience was unremarkable, but the second time around the service was horrendous. The server had the worst attitude, missed my main course, and repeatedly tried to clear our plates before we were finished eating. The food was good, but definitely priced more like $$$ than $$.

Very nice restaurant with pretty and intimate interior. Perfect for a date night. The food was absolutely amazing and the service exceeded our expectations. The owner is always there and makes sure you don't have to wait long time  before you get seated. Wonderful place, absolutely worth visiting!

Great food, atmosphere, and service! I tried the shrimp saganaki for an appetizer and the beefteki for main. They were both delicious. I was very full but couldn't resist to some amazing baklava! I wish I could add more than 5 stars. Definitely my favorite Greek spot in the area !
Good food, great service, and great wine selection.  The ambiance is cozy and friendly. I can't stop thinking about their moussaka!  It's a great place to spend a laid back night with friends.

It was the worst idea to celebrate my birthday there, i did have a couple of good dinners there in the past but this is for sure my last time there. There was no sparkling wine or water, must of the menu was not available and the service was just horrible!
Simply delicious!!!  My hubby and I had the mixed grill which was perfect for 2.  Our waiter, Arferly, recommended our main course and salad.  How please we were. Definitely will come back.
No comment
No comment

Such a cute place and great food! I recommended ordering the spreads and the baked feta cheese as an appetizer. I ordered the moussaka, which was extremely filling, and tried both the feta cheesecake and baklava for dessert. At this place, it's really hard to go wrong.

Half my family is Greek so I'm very familiar with Greek food and they know what they're doing at the Greek. They've always been very helpful at aiding me in picking a Greek wine (which I am not as familiar with as Greek food). I love the tyrokroketes (which are like giant tiropitakia with a twist) and the octopus is also really good. Would recommend getting a bunch of small plates and sharing rather than getting an entree. It's a good option when there's a long wait at Estancia next door.

Friendly service. Good food. It's easy to miss to the direction its store front faces, but it's worth finding. The grilled vegetables were delicious and had chickpeas mixed in. The bread was good and the green dipping sauce was awesome.
I loved ambient of this place! I visited Greece before, and I really liked that food. Food in this restaurant is really authentic!

Great food and space, however, there was live music during our dinner, which made it impossible to engage in any meaningful conversation. Once the live band took a break, the restaurant blasted loud music through the speakers. A few patrons, including our table, complained about the volume, however, the restaurant refused to decrease the volume. Although the actual food was excellent, I'm not sure I would return.
No comment

Amazing place! Every detail was great: starting from the fact that I called on Friday night and informed that we'll be coming in 20 minutes-they were able to find us a table that we did NOT have to wait for. Everything was fast-we came in, sat and ordered. Food came in normal time and was delicious: we had mixed grill and bronzino and dips and everything was delicious! It's not an affordable place to eat, but you definitely get what you pay for!

The Greek is certainly one at the top of the list of Greek restaurants I've visited. The romantic ambiance of the dimly lit interior makes it the perfect date night spot. If you're single, the hunky and courteous servers are great for entertaining the eyes. The carefully crafted cocktails were delicious, as were the dolmas...and everything else! Can't wait to return on my next visit to the city!
Very good food, service, and ambience! The restaurant was larger and offered a lot more seating than some of the photos that I have seen on line.
No comment

Prob best Greek spot in lower Manhattan always consistent the spreads and bread are insanely good.  This is a really good date spot, trust me if ur date hasn't been here she/he will be stoked on the place
Home of my favorite cocktail (minos) in the entire city.  Food is quite good too. A warm and inviting setting all year round.
Stopped for a late lunch on my own.  Took advice from waitstaff and experienced delightful food with superb service.
No comment
Absolutely incredible Greek food! Best I ever tried in Manhattan and Nj. The octopus was melting in my mouth and sort of a Greek salad was made with expensive Kumato tomatoes. Bravo!
Had such a lovely impromptu date night here. The staff and owner were incredibly friendly yet professional and super knowledgeable. Amazing service. Food and wine were delicious as was the decor.
No comment

We searched for a good greek restaurant and we were not deceived by The Greek. Everything was perfect, from the decorations to the food and service. We loved it. I would not go there with young children, it is a pretty sophisticated/cozy place. I would also suggest to make a reservation before, especially if you are going on a busy night. It will be worth your while!
No comment
The food actually blew my mind and wildly exceeded expectations. The cuisine could be best described as 'hearty Greek' and the setting as warm and cozy.
No comment
No comment

Fantastic experience from the bartender, whose name I regretfully cannot remember.  Just stopped in with some friends for a few drinks and some apps.  Food was excellent, cocktails were unique and and memorable, greek coffee was delicious and the service was off the charts.  Great atmosphere as well - would love to come back!
So glad I walked by this beautiful restaurant !!  The atmosphere was absolutely perfect , only tried one appetizer which was good !
Definitely pricier than '$$'. Mixed grill for two with a bottle of wine ran $160 before tip.
No comment
Good food on the pricey side. Watch out for waiters tricking you for today's special appetizers and later you find out that appetizer was for $30!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here tonight after trying most Greek restaurants and having a pretty high expectation, and I was not let down. Where to begin, the ambiance was spectacular.  The food- delicious and fresh. The quality of the food was only surpassed by its taste. I genuinely enjoyed every bite more than the last. One has to try the mix grill for two  (which can certainly feed more) and pair it with the Rapsani wine (we couldn't get enough) and the xoriatiki salad (it tasted like Greece!) However, what made the night was the general manager, Peter! From the first minute, our party felt welcomed, well guided, and very much appreciated. His recommendations were spot on and he surely knew what he was talking about. Can't wait to come back and really hope Peter will be there to greet us with his warm smile. He made a fan out of us.

The best Greek we have had in in the states.  Definitely worth the visit.  To see a Greek salad without heaping piles of lettuce and amazing tomatoes says it all.  They are the real deal and the drinks are awesome.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Came here last night for the first time and am hooked! Amazing atmosphere accompanied by some of the best Greek food I've had. Service was remarkable. We will definitely be coming back soon!
No comment

Stopped in for a few cocktails while we were just walking by and wow! Absolutely incredible cocktails. Tom was extremely friendly and attentive and the decor and layout of the restaurant was beautiful. Can't wait to come back the next time we visit NYC.

One of my favorite greek places in the city. A bit overpriced but hey, it's Tribeca and they do have good service and charming decor. Nice crowd and live music if you're lucky. I recommend the greek salad, cheese balls and the lamb!
No comment

No comment

No comment

I was skeptical and first because I'm a picky eater & I've never eaten Greek food before, but everything I tried was way above my expectations. I will definitely be coming back. We had a little bit of everything. The croquettes, grandmas meatballs, spreads, Greek fries, mousaka, kokinisto, & the mixed grill. Everything was great including the drinks. I would

I love coming here,... and the experience starts from when you walk in the door. Food is phenomenal and the service is even better.

I love this place...the vibe, the owner, and the food (the fried bread that comes with the dips is super addictive and I love the octopus).  This is my go to place for a casual social lunch or after work drinks.

So disappointing.  It's in my neighborhood, so picking up after work is appealing. However, today marks the 3rd time in a row that my chicken and rice soup came with little or no rice. Tonight, I even specifically said not to forget the rice again.  Frustrating.  I guess I will not be going back. It's too expensive to be this annoyed.  The food is good, but they don't seem to care enough.
No comment
No comment

Ive been to many greek restaurants and this was the first that i loved! The appetizers were a small portion so you can get a few different ones and share so you can really get a good variety. The main dishes are not to big but just the perfect size you will feel content not heavy and full! The food is so flavor full its not plain and the flavor does not take over the food! The deserts are great and just the right size!!!!! I hate red wine i really do but guess what i drank 3 glasses of red wine it was amazing i loved it! I cant say enough about the food and the atmosphere the decor is so warm and inviting. I cant wait to go back. It should be on everyones list if they love greek food and a cozy romantic atmosphere.
No comment
the food and atmosphere is amazing. I really enjoyed my time there. The drinks are something out of this world. This is a must try if you like Greek food!

Went here for dinner on a Monday night with coworkers and it was great! Food and wine were delicious;I highly recommend the spreads and the mixed grill - which was more than enough for three people. Will definitely be back!
No comment

Beautiful restaurant with amazing food. We started with drinks that were so creative and followed them up with the octopus and feta that were so delicious!  The waitstaff and bartender were all so friendly and warm. Loved the music too

We've been to The Greek before and had fantastic experiences, so maybe they were having an off night. That said, came here with my family expecting the usual experience and it was pretty bad.  Started with the hostess telling us she needed the table back within an hour and a half, which ok I get it but not a great way to start. Then all of the food and drinks we ordered were not good (Greek potatoes were cold, looked like frozen french fries versus the usual round potatos, other food bland and not great, drinks watered down) and the service was completely cold and indifferent to the point where it felt we were inconveniencing the restaurant. They also forgot our main course. Then took forever to pay when they had originally put pressure on us to leave on time. The worst part is on the way out we asked to speak with a manager and the hostess said he was busy so we expressed our frustration with her and she was completely indifferent and said "oh, probably because we're just busy tonight". I'm sorry - not a good excuse particularly at these prices. We had frequented The Greek but probably not going to come back anytime soon.
No comment
No comment

I will start my review by saying the food was very good. We had a 7:30 reservation and were seated at a high top at the front of the restaurant.  We were told we were being seated there so we would not be rushed because a large party was coming in at 9pm in the back of the restaurant.  At 9:00 the manager asked us if we could move to the bar because he needed our table for the next reservation.  We explained why we took this table in the first place (so not to be rushed) but he didn't seem to care.  He only offered to buy our drinks at the bar when we told him we didn't want to purchase another round of $15 drinks.  There are more professional ways to have handled this, especially after dropping over $300.  Too many restaurants in NYC so I don't have to come back.

I am uncertain how this place was so highly rated. We came here for our anniversary bc we wanted Greek food, but had a bad experience. The feta was bland, the olives were meh, we didn't get bread, the salad was warm, the waitress barely made eye contact, didn't smile and was very odd and unhelpful and would disappear for long stretches. The herb stuffed peppers tasted like a Midwestern version of Greek - it tasted like it was reheated from the frozen food section. We were seated without menus or appearance of a waitress for five minutes (we should've left) and it didn't get better from there. When I asked our waitress "K" why the salad was served warm she said it used to be served with ice cubes bc that is a Greek tradition, but now that it is warm outside they don't serve it with ice cubes. Please, someone, tell me what that means and how serving a salad w ice cubes is a thing that is appetizing. Maybe in Athens they can pull this bizarre practice off, but not at The Greek. Oh, they also did this strange thing - they replaced the silverware btw courses and put the fork and knife on these black cocktail napkins, like it's a high end place. It strikes me that these strange choices made by the owners or managers. I will say the runners were busting their ass. And my husband - ever the optimist - liked the spare ribs. I wish so badly I could get this night back, but I can't so all I can do is warn the next person to avoid this place at all costs.
No comment
No comment

I Went for lunch with two friends, the restaurant was basically empty, about 4 groups in total. The decor was nice and the menu looked good so we stopped in. The first issue was the drinks we ordered, they were made incorrectly unfortunately, our waitress was MIA 70% of the time so we just drank them as they were, however considering they were $14 each I wish they had been made correctly. The main issue I had was our food took over and hour to arrive. A salad, a sandwich and the chicken screwers were ordered, the restaurant was dead and it still took over an hour (I know this because I got a phone call after we placed our order and while waiting I checked the time the call came through and it had been an hour). The waitress wasn't rude but we didn't really get checked on and waiting over an hour for food is excessive. I would have cut them more slack if the place was crowded but as I stated it was dead. The food was good, the prices were not bad but not good either, it's on the high side for what you get. The atmosphere was nice and it really looked promising, however based off my experience I wouldn't return or recommend it.
No comment

Beautiful decor, it was very rustic urban chic. The customer service was fantastic. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable about the food. I kept it simple with a salad and chicken with potatoes. Everything was so flavorful. My favorite was dessert. I had ice cream it was delicious.I can't remember the name of the ice cream, however,  the flavor comes from a plant that only grows in one of the greek islands. This place is $$$$. However, I felt like the experience was worth every penny.

My favorite authentic Greek restaurant ever!! The hot Octopus appetizer great every time. Tender and flavorful fresh. The Lamb Chops delicious of like always. Juicy and tender paired with Vegas which was also great. Made my night, and will definitely be back. Thanks as always for an fantastic evening!
No comment
The best Greek food in the city! With amazing cocktails as well! Ioannis can offer you the best service! -He almost gave us a private show with his jazz hands-

Ofcourse I came for the minos cocktails, and my favorite cheese and spinach pies, I can have this every day!  the ambiance is pretty chill in that greek romantic way, nothing like a good decor to get a good date going ! Service was very attentive and never felt rushed.

Really nice place, not that expensive.  We got the dolmades which were really flavorful and a great start to our visit.  The main course took a little while to get, but it was worth it!  Lavraki which was moist and perfect.  We will be back

Seriously. Brilliant. I'll start with dessert which was halva with yogurt. So good. The drizzles were a bit more sweet than I generally like but this combination was so tasty it didn't matter. Also made for a great breakfast. I sampled a few sides: the greens, lentils and lemon roasted potatoes. All great and made for great heated up leftovers. Excellent service as well.

One of the best traditional Greek places I have ever been to.  Fabulous drinks (especially the Minos cocktail and the Santorini wine) and exceptional baklava.  I don't adore traditional Greek as a category so it doesn't quite enter my pantheon, so to speak, but it is as good as I have had in that category.
No comment

It's a very quaint setting with the waitstaff tripping over you. Feels like it's family run. Had the spreads, octopus, scallops and bbq skirt steak. All in the food was okay to good. The wine selection was challenging as it was all Greek. The first bottle that came out was corked and the second wine on the waiter's recommendation was not so good either. There are other choices in TriBeCa.

The Greek is such a cute and romantic restaurant in TriBeCa. The vibe of it is perfect for a group of friends or for a date. My friends and I went there on a Thursday night and waited about 15 minutes for a table. The hostess was so sweet and accommodating. The servers are attentive and made sure that our glasses were always full. The food is amazing too. The complimentary bread is fresh and delicious. We ordered the octopus and it was spiced and flavoured really well. The mixed grill came with a ton of different meats and they were all delicious. The lamb was so tender and the chicken was prepared perfectly. I highly recommend The Greek for its delicious food and great service.

Great Mediterranean restaurant. Pleasant service, good food and cocktails are on point! Service is AMAZING! Very attentive (probably too attentive) but it's better than being ignored. Definitely get their appetizers. All of them are great.

The food was delicious and sophisticated.  The service was excellent and the restaurant is very cool in its decor.  I was extremely comfortable and welcomed even as a solo diner. My only complaint is that the music is turned up so loud that everyone is yelling to have a conversation and that's uncomfortable.  Music = great.  Loud music = nightclub, not restaurant.

I don't want to write much but this place is just amazing!!! The food is 10 out of 5, the service, the atmosphere- everything at that place is just great!!! It was the best dinner in NY and I will be back there for sure. Recommend everyone to this amazing Greek place :)
Best Greek food I have ever had. Perfect ambiance, service and food. Well worth the money!!!!!
No comment
No comment

Delicious food, and the ambiance is wonderful. Cozy, friendly, and very hospitable. Service is top notch. They serve a small thoughtful menu of upgraded versions of classic Greek fare. I recommend the meze plate (various dips and pita), as well as the pastitsio, which is more tomato-ey than usual but really well done, and has a great presentation.
Very tasty food and really cute ambiance. The lamb chops were especially delicious. I also enjoyed all of the different spreads that came with the pita. I definitely recommend for great Greek food.
No comment

We really liked The Greek. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The food was outstanding and I thought the overall value was excellent. Cool setting as well. My only wish is that they had a few more beer/drink options.
The ambiance is perfect and the service is outstanding. We shared various plates of food that were entirely mouth watering. Definitely on my list to go back and have already recommended to friends.
Had a craving for octopus and this place did not disappoint! Great ambiance. The waiter forgot a dish and sent out the wrong one but the manager happily fixed the issue.

I went here Sunday with my boyfriend after hearing some good reviews and seeing some really delicious-looking photos.  The atmosphere is pretty cool and feels cozy.  Unfortunately the service is TERRIBLE. We waited a long time to even be served water and had to ask the hostess to go locate our waiter after he disappeared without taking our drink order.  When he finally returned (quite some time after the hostess went to find him) he was completely unhelpful at answering our questions and bordered on rude.  We ordered the spreads, the horiatiki and the Branzino.  The salad and spreads came out quickly.  The spreads (tzatziki, smokey feta, eggplant and trout) were all delicious as was the grilled seasoned bread that came with them.   It is a good sized portion for two people.  When the horiatiki came we noticed there were ice cubes in one corner of he bowl as if the waiter had spilled a drink into it and still served it to us.  We repeatedly tried to get his attention to point this out but he was impossible to call over.  We finally ended up picking them out.  This said it was a really tasty, well-balanced greek salad.  Once our apps were cleared we waited a LONG time for the Branzino.  When it came out it looked beautiful but was served with a very small portion of vegetables ( like four spears of asparagus and a couple broccolini leaves).  The fish was nicely deboned and perfectly cooked but a little lukewarm.  The vegetables were also well cooked but completely cold by the time they got to us.  For how expensive this place is (pricey even by Tribeca standards) it is not worth it.  The food is good and well cooked and the space is great, but once you factor in the portion size and terrible service isn't really worth the price.
No comment
Very cute restaurant! Food was delicious as well. My only recommendation would be to lower the Greek music just a little.

Really upsetting when you take a cab to go here and get to the restaurant when it says on yelp that it closes in 45 minutes, and the kitchen is already closed. Still with people in it, not right for a Michelin starred restaurant.

This is a fantastic little place with amazing food and delightful service. Tonight, I went with colleagues who hadn't ever been and everyone loved it. The Greek salad is perfect; the spinach and feta pies are flaky and flavorful and the chicken dinner was such a generous portion that there was enough for one colleague to take home a whole other meal for her husband. All in all, reasonably priced for NYC with such a balanced and curated menu that allows for each dish to be delicious.

The food was good but not great.  Our waiter was pushing the $100 bottle of wine and when we selected a 60 bottle he basically forgot about us.   Had to ask four times for bread and we just about threw the bread on the table. For an over $ 250 dinner the service and food did not match that fee.   Would never go back.

Dreamy atmosphere. Beautiful interior- rustic wall decor, cozy seating. Impressive mahogany bar at entrance, even a sexy bathroom. Strangely happy and charming staff, who were present at all the right moments, gracefully clearing tables and respectfully checking in. Petite paper menus- classy. Slightly gothic lighting lowered at appropriate time in the evening. Food delectably flavorful and varied. Shared the greek salad, grape leaves, grilled octopus, and keftedes (meatballs). Plus a bonus of the dandelion greens ("horta"), unusual lightly bitter addition. This was more than enough for two. Delightful smells of sage and rosemary coming from meats on tables nearby. Was busy early on a Tuesday night. Not in a location you'd accidentally stumble upon- so people must be in the know.

I have probably had the best meal of my life here. I knew this restaurant would be something really special after sampling some of their fare at a wine festival last spring, so I wanted to come here for a proper meal one day. I eventually came here for my birthday and boy, was I not disappointed. I shared the spreads and meatballs appetizers with my boyfriend, and had the moussaka as my entree along with some wine. Not only is the food out of this world, the decor is charming and elegant and the staff treated us like five star guests. I couldn't have asked for a more delicious birthday meal. I'm definitely not going to forget this place for special occasions in the future!

The Greek is awesome!  I have been several times and each experience is better then the last.  I like eating at the bar but have also sat in the restaurant. You can't go wrong with anything you order.  The bar is fun to eat at, as the bartenders are extremely knowledgeable and just a good vibe.  I'm a tough reviewer, so I can highly recommend.
Everything was above and beyond but the food... The sides was the best thing on the plate...tea was amazing tho!
No comment

Getting ready to go back to NYC and looking forward to eating here again. Last year the hostess was exceptionally accommodating as we got cold by the door and wanted to shift seats. The cocktails are very creative, delicious and potent. Loved them. And my wife and I are vegetarians and the food selection was more than ample and the meal was delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant.

I LOVED the atmosphere of this cute little Greek place in TriBeCa. The bartender was very pleasant and made the best drink combination of cucumber and mint I could ask for. Something about the atmosphere of young men and dim lighting just sets the mood for a girls night out. The portions are large and you will not leave hungry! I would highly recommend the grilled octopus. It was so good we ordered two! Definitely a good spot to just share dishes! Don't even think about leaving without desert though, try splitting a sweet piece of baklava and send your taste buds on a trip you won't forget it!

What a divine spot. My friend and I stumbled across this place yesterday, coincidentally on Greek Easter! They were full-roasting two lambs outdoors -- this place is legit. We had the $60 prix fixe for a festive dinner. Almost all the dishes were perfect: some of the pieces in the ensemble I didn't care much for (e.g., octopus, dips), but when they hit the high notes, they did with such perfection with the lamb and meatballs. I definitely want to come back here for a special occasion with a date sometime in the future. They ran out of dessert last night but I would need to come back for that. It's worth the trek.

Delicious and authentic Greek soups. Insanely delicious bread served throughout meal. While portions are modest, the prices are also acceptable. Nice interior, great attention from staff and the Greek coffee was the real deal. Can't wait to return.

Start to finish our meal was excellent! Nicholas, our server, had all his recommendations on point. From the bottle wine to dessert, it was such a treat. Best greek food I have had. Better than mom & pop greek places I have been to in Astoria; but also a lot pricier. So i guess it is a give and take, but totally worth the visit!
Walked into this place on Friday afternoon. The food was great , the staff was accommodating,  Peter the manager was a class act.  Will definitely do it again
The decor is so pretty and there is a wonderful attention to detail. This is a great date spot. We had the mixed grill and it was delicious (especially the lamb chops and chicken).
No comment

Have to love this place, lots of ambiance, packed solid with interesting folks.  I was here for a bite on a Friday night.  It was nearby my gym so I stopped off after my workout just to chill out and try a new place.  I sat at the bar - the bartender was fantastic making me really feel at home there an giving me some excellent advice on the menu as well as keeping my glass full.  Really a nice night out.
No comment

All in all a great meal. We had the bread and greek sauce platter and it was great--4 different flavors of sauce with bread. We followed this up with a kota chicken which was succulent and fantastic. Finally for cocktails we had the minos, a habanero drink which was great. My gf loved the ambiance here. Very quaint and rustic. Also the servers were pleasant and friendly. A great experience and we wil definitely be returning.

A group of friends and I just enjoyed a delicious dinner at The Greek Tribeca. The food and service were excellent. And the decor is lovely and comfortable. Furthermore, they very kindly accommodated a slightly larger group than planned. Peter, a co-owner was very welcoming and was present to make sure everyone in the restaurant was enjoying their evening. I'll be back.

Amazing atmosphere, food and drinks! Peter greeted us and made us feel at home. We only stopped for a drink but feeling so welcome decided on dinner... best decision we made!! A hidden treasure in the Tribeca, classic Greek food at its best! We sat at the bar to eat and Gabrielle took wonderful care of us for drinks and our meal, unparalleled service! Thank you to all at The Greek for a wonderful evening!

Fantastic place, perfect for dates or anniversaries. Ordered mackerels as entree, very fresh, and a moussaka as main dish. The moussaka is served on a clay pot and looks and tastes beautiful. For desert, I had Greek yogurt with almonds and honey. Would come again.

I went to Greece last year and my friend went to Greece 2 months ago, so we were craving for Greek. We were both pleasantly surprised during our time at The Greek. The restaurant has a very comfortable atmosphere with romantic ambiance. We shared grape leaves, moussaka, and baklava. I think the grape leaves were typical. I think the portion (5) is good, but the leaves would break and everything would fall apart once I had one bite. Nevertheless, the moussaka was on point. Not too oily and cooked in a clay pot. You could taste the different ingredients and I think it may have been better than the one I had in Athens. Baklava was good, but I really want to try to Feta Cheesecake next time. They also gave us 2 different kinds of chocolate from Greece with our check which definitely distracted us from the prices. I would say it is on the expensive side (definitely $$$), but I didn't mind too much.
No comment

This place is amazing! When you first walk in you hear the calming Greek music and see the beautiful decor! This place really made me feel like I was back in Greece! The food was amazing, I got the mixed grill main and grilled octopus for appetizer. The service was prompt and friendly. Will definitely come here again!

Awful experience.  Wasn't served a drink for 45 minutes, one server in the entire restaurant. The food may have been good, but completely ruined by the experience (and it was a birthday dinner).  Would never go back.  Emailed restaurant complaints and no response.

Nice place, EXCELLENT SERVICE, yummy food, and here is where i learned that the number of dollar signs indicating how costly a place is changes relative to the affluence of the neighborhood's residents. Tribeca is the most expensive zip code in nyc and this place should be $$$ or $$$$, not $$.
No comment

One of my favorite neighbor spots. There's not one single thing I do not like about this place. Everything is perfection - the food, the vibe, the decor.I come here at least once a month, and love that's it's tucked in TriBeCa, visited by mostly locals. Highly recommend.

It's rare to find a Greek place that is not just going to serve you hummus and grilled lamb chops. I do love me some gyro but having some authentic Greek food is great.  The Greek is just that.  The service was attentive and friendly and the food was amazing.  We had the octopus which was tender and flavorful. For the entree, I had the braised short rib.  I won't go into too much detail about the food because the menu was diverse and changes with available ingredients.  Seasonings and Greek accents come from Greece and fresh ingredients from local suppliers.  I would happily come back and expect something new to experience.
No comment
Gorgeous place, perfect for a romantic date. All our food looked and tasted great!

Everything was delicious. The food the wine...The service was amazing, everyone was so nice and helpful. My favorite part was the decor. The coziest and cutest interior. A great place for a group dinner or a date night.
Literally the best Greek food I've ever had. The Greek is an amazing atmosphere, professional staffing, great wine recommendations and just an all round great place to spend an evening.

What a Wonderful experience my family and I had at the Greek. Service was impeccable the decor is home rustic style which is welcoming. The food my god, from the starters to the main and let's not forget the dessert it was perfectly authentic. They deserve higher then 5 stars, I will definitely go again and its a must go!!!!! You won't regret it

My favorite little restaurant on the northern end of Tribeca. I've only been here for lunch a handful of times and it leaves me with every intention to go for dinner as well. The spread assortment and Octapodi appetizers are a must have. The atmosphere is warm and cozy, perfect for the holidays. Aside the scents of the delicious food, it just smells like Christmas in there during the winter!

This place is so perfect for a cozy chatty dinner over wine. Their friendly and attentive customer service would make anyone feel welcomed to the place! I've been to this place twice and each time I ordered the spreads which encompasses four delicious sauces along with pita bread (tzatziki, tarama, tirokafteri, melitzanosalata) as well as the feta psiti which is basically fried feta cheese with honey drizzled on top (yummy). I also enjoy the grilled octopus for sharing. They also have great wines!

Amazing food in the old Turks and Frogs space in Tribeca.   Food, wine and service is amazing.   I'd highly recommend the Fava bean purée, octopus, Lavraki and Lamb chops.   Can't go wrong.   A nice addition to the neighborhood
Some of the best greek food in the city and great decor! Go! (It is somewhat expensive).

A great, unpretentious yet high quality restaurant. The soft music played by the musicians really set the tone and everybody regarded one another as close friends. The service was attentive and friendly, and the food well prepared. A well run ship.

Absolutely love this place.! After just returning from a 3 week trip in Greece I can re confirm my love. The food is mouth watering delicious & the cocktails are even better. My constant go-to when craving some authentic Greek cuisine.

Been here before and the food is really good. However, I tried making a reservation for a business luncheon which of course was very important.  Although I spoke to a live person, they could not confirm a table and insisted that I send an email. So I did.  Overnight I got no reply and called the restaurant again to try and confirm and the response was that I would get a reply in 24 hours. Really?? I made other plans for my luncheon at that point. Very bizarre indeed.

Went for drinks and small plates with a friend Thursday night. Sat at the bar. Was greeted by most of the staff, big smiles, wonderfully homey. The food was solid, with the fried feta with honey, and the octopus stealing the show. Definitely a great neighborhood spot, meeting spot, date spot.

This place was just amazing. Food is authentic and delicious, the waiters were very attentive and kind, the environment was lovely and there was no crazy waiting time even though I did not have a reservation.

I enjoyed the scallops that were done just right. The portions are too small as others have said, at a price of around $30 for an entree. We had some hick-ups like a dish that was delivered later, and a forgotten glass of wine, but then again we were 11, so quite a large group. The restaurant has a charming interior, and they serve good cocktails.
No comment
We had a great dinner at the Greek. Service was warn and ultra attentive. Great ambiance wirh nice Greek music. We had the red snapper which was great. We will skip the shrimps next time

The name truly lives up to its reviews! My boyfriend and I went here on a Saturday night. The restaurant doesn't take reservations for parties of four or less, so we walked in around 8:30 pm expecting to wait. To our surprise we were greeted by lovely owner Tom who found a table for us immediately. Food and drinks we're done perfectly and the service was right on point. I got the Mousaka (which is one of their signature dishes) and he got the Paidakia. Both were delicious! We will definitely be back soon!

I cannot stop talking about my experience on Sunday night at this amazing establishment!!!! The ambiance the food the wine selection....EVERYTHING was top notch!!!! The manager I think his name was George checked on us repeatedly which made our experience that much better! 5 stars and two thumbs up!! I will definitely be returning!!!
No comment

Excellent food and atmosphere! Unlike many 4* and above rated this one not only did it have great food but was so clean as well!! Excellent standards and service! We had fava and cheese croquettes which were supreme! Add to that sfougat and dakos that were great as well!
No comment

This place is a straight rip off. A salad at panera that is 4.50 is 17 dollars here. saganaki is cheese. There shrimp had no cheese. The mixed grill was for 2...... It was a rediculous amount of money was really good for 1 and McDonald's after this meal was necessary. If you are made of money and don't care about being ripped off go here. If you care about the money you make and theb please stick to michelin restaurant they are still cheaper.

I went to the Greek on the recommendation of my daughter. We made a 7:30 reservation for 4. The waiter was courtesy, knowledgeable and engaging. The food was excellent. We run up a tab of over $400. No problem. We lingered for a bit after paying the check. A rude host, assistant manager came over and said "We allow two hours for a table. We need this table for another reservation. Could you please leave?"  There are many ways this could have been handled better. The Manager denied that he would send an employee over to say this. I don't believe that for a minute. Very embarrassed for my party and the incompetence of the staff. Oh, by the way, all night long the Chef/Owner was filming a show for the Food Channel. Light up, lights down, music on, music off. Camera crew in the already crowded restaurant. Mood and ambience were terrible. Never again.

I'll start off by saying that this place for food and esp service SUX!!!  I would've given it zero stars if possible.  We were a group of 5 that went for my brother's birthday late one sat evening.  I found the restaurant on yelp and saw the reviews so we decided to try it.  We got there about 10.30pm and they supposedly closed at 12am.  We started off by ordering a bottle of white wine that we had to ask the waiter when he was as delivering it as the appetizers had arrived.  Mind you the bar was right in front of the high top tables we sat at.  We ordered appetizers mainly and one main meat dish.  Only 3 of us were eating as the other 2 in the party simply joined for drinks.  The appetizers were horrible and tasteless. The only decent one was the croquettes.  For the main dish we ordered the lamb chops. Let's start off by saying they were cold, tasteless and flavorless. Since 4 of the 5 in the group are of Greek decent and one straight from Greece we know what Greek food should taste like.  During dinner we asked the obnoxious bitchy hostess/waitress if she was Greek and with a snotty tone she responds in English "yes I am".  I've never had a fellow Greek speak to me in such a manner ESP if you're of the same ethnic background.  On to dessert- the recommended feta cheese cheesecake was old and dry. The double Greek coffees were sooo sweet we sent them back for new ones esp since we asked for medium which is generally a hint of sweetness.  For all this garbage food it cost the 3 of us about $95 with tip.  A few weeks later I call the manager to complain of our experience.  He apologizes and asks that we visit again and he will personally ensure us a great experience.  So I should spend money again there I ask??? Doesn't even offer a $1 comp and he thinks I'll come back to try it again??? I wouldn't spend another $0.01 there let alone a $1.  This place is NOT only expensive, the service sux and the food is garbage!

We were apartment hunting in the hood and dropped by for an early dinner. Was absolutely fabulous from the moment we walked in. Warm hospitable service, delicious greek wine and food in a beautifully done-up space. It was my first Greek wine experience and I can't wait to go back for more. Started the meal with spreads - the feta cheese tirokafteri and melitzanosalata were my favs. Then came in the feta cheese & spinach pies or pites which were warm, crispy and just melted in your mouth. For entrees, we had the artichoke mousaka and the sea bass - I felt the mousaka was just okay, the husband loved the sea bass. Need to go back for some baklava and coffee!

Dinner was fantastic. Service, ambiance, & food are outstanding. Truly Mediterranean. This is the best octopus I've ever had. I've had it freshly caught & served, from different cultures/cuisines. It's an item I consistently order. It was perfectly grilled, tender with a perfect balance of herbs & acidity.

My friends and I were really surprised by how fantastic the food was here. We didn't really have any expectations, but were so impressed by the end of our very filling--and memorable--meal. The interior makes you feel like you've been totally transported to some Greek vineyard/home far far away from New York City.
