And the food, albeit a bit pricier than most Greek restaurants you'll find in the city, is worth the extra cost for the freshness of the ingredients and the overall taste. I especially loved the salads and the mixed grill option--which is great for groups. If you are planning to go as a group, I'd definitely recommend making a reservation.
No comment
Great ambience. Attentive Service. Delicious food. There's nothing these guys don't do well. We ordered a lot and enjoyed everything we ate. Excited for our next visit!

Such a great place in TriBeCa! We we're hungry and this place came up in Yelp search. When I saw it from the window I knew it's a winner. Charming atmosphere, stylish decor. We were greeted very nicely by hostess and even we did not have a reservation we were seated in 5 minutes. You also can eat at the bar and will fill great too. The food: so, so , so delicious! Great selection of traditional Greek mezes and variety of main dishes. We got salad, peppers with sea salt - great! For main course my friend had a seabass and I got octopus. We could not express how delicious it was. I would definitely come back to this place and recommend to my all foodi friends.

I had such a lovely time here on a Tuesday night.  The food was fantastic and the wine was superb!  Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the wine menu which was helpful as I'm unfamiliar with Greek wine.  A really cute, intimate restaurant.

I had an amazing time here last night with my girlfriend. The food and cocktails were really delicious and the space is very cool. They did a great job with a long narrow location and it felt very relaxing. The spreads were amazing. The sea scallops and the moussaka were especially good.

Came here for a quick bite to eat before meeting up with an out of town friend.  We got seated at a table for 2 in the back that was not squished in between 2 tables.  I was in love with the place immediately! Service was great.  Philip was helpful with our wine selection as I am not familiar with Greek wines. Started with a selection of spreads and I got the salmon special.  My boyfriend got the skirt steak.  Both were delicious.  I loved the live music as well.  It wasn't too loud and we were still able to have a conversation without raising our voices.  Just wish we had more time to try the desserts and more of the starters!  We'll be back for sure!!
It is a delicious place.  I can recommend the lamb without reservation.  However the salad was one of the best I have had.  The vegetables were so delicious.  A great place.

I probably would never have known about this place but for the fact that I am freelancing a block away.  A good find. Nice atmosphere, with mellow lighting, rustic decor, and tables spaced at a decent distance so you're not on top of your neighbor. Excellent, authentic dishes. Recommendations: Seven Star Shrimp, Dolmades, Octopadi, Keftedes, and a meze I can't remember the name of, but it was a ball of 4 Greek cheeses. Yummy. Nice wines, too. Service is attentive without being overbearing. There's not much in the immediate area, so glad I found it.
No comment

Came here for valentines day and was completely blown away. The decoration of the restaurant, the food, the service, and the wine are all amazing. My first review for such a great place. Will return for sure soon.
No comment
Sexy Greek escape with delicious food. Pricey but worth indulging if you have money and someone special. The octopus salad was wonderful!
No comment
Went here on Friday and had no wait for two! Great ambiance and even better service. Food was really great as well. The Greek salad and moussaka was delicious. So happy we spent our evening here!
No comment
No comment

A fun, upscale Greek spot in Tribeca. The ambiance is well-crafted and you dine with a very Tribeca crowd. It's mostly locals, which is also a plus. The food is great and you'll be happy with whatever you order.

New favorite place! Beautiful setting- rustic touches- superior and authentic service. The food is outstanding. We had the mixed grill for two and the feta cheesecake with strawberry preserve for dessert. The coffee (american filter and greek) is also great and is presented beautifully in a tea set. Love this place, will definitely be back soon for more!

Ok $15 greek salad considered of all of 4 tomatoes and 5 cubes of feta with a sprinkle of greens.  It was good but not that good.  It was wicked expensive for a salad.  Unfortunately they lost me on this one and I won't be back although they did get a Michelin 2014 rating.

My friend and I were roaming the streets of TriBeca looking for a place on Yelp  to relax and have a drink.  We walked past this gem of place and what caught my eye was the decorations.  As soon as we walked in I knew it would be a great experience.  Everything from the ambiance to the service is top notch.  Everyone is friendly, professional, and knowledgeable.   What was intended to be a drink or two turned into a full dinner and a greater time than I could have imagined!   Anytime I am in TriBeca The Greek is my first choice.

We battled...and I mean battled both pedestrian and vehicle gridlock to make our way downtown to dine at The Greek and it was well worth it. The food, service and ambience were perfect.  We had lamb dishes and the vegan mousaka along with spreads, olives and the meatballs.  Will put it on our list of "go to" TriBeCa restaurants.

This is such a  cool and charming place. The food is wonderful and the staff is so attentive. There are endless waiters in cool outfits whenever you need something. It feels way more quaint than you'd expect in Tribeca. Great date spot or casual meal

Loved the decor, music and food.  We had the lamb chops which were very delicious.  It's open past midnight and a great place to hang with friends or family and enjoy drinks like a tasty Greek draft beer.  The Greek music in the background was enjoyable.  An overall great experience.

I came here few months back for a birthday dinner and everyone loved the food. They were all friendly and great! We asked for extra bread and gave us more! No one was really rude and everyone seemed to enjoyed the food. We all ended up finishing most of it. 2 of us got the mixed platter for 2, lamb entree and fish entree. They were all delicious! I would recommend to anyone to go here! The atmosphere inside is casual/romantic? It is dim but not too much. At least not to the point where you can't see your food. Lol
No comment

This adorable neighborhood Greek restaurant is nothing short of amazing. From its decor to its authenticity, I'm adding this to my list of favorite restaurants in New York. The bartender (also known as "27") was most charming and his touch on his version of a Bloody Mary (add Lavender sprig) was just as delectable as the octopus, spicy feta dip and Greek salad.
The Greek, amazing place to have dinner.  The food, service and environment is awesome.  We tasted some good familiar foods, that brought us back to Greece.  I couldn't get enough of the Ouzo
GREAT FOOD, super cool rustic decor, excellent knowledgeable and friendly service, really great wine.

After a great meal last night (moussaka, mixed grill, striped bass, soup, wine, beets, cheesecake), we had a small snafu with our credit card (I won't go into details).  The owner was unbelievably apologetic and more than made up for the inconvenience.  If you're downtown and tired of the same old ubiquitous Italian fare, this place is the joint.  Cozy and friendly.  A great selection of Greek (yes Greek!) wines.  Even the tea (Greek mountain tea) was a revelation.  'Nuf said.

On my way to the cutting room, I stopped at a roof top bar to relax with a glass of wine. I met a very interesting gentleman Peter Young. During our conversation he asked what type of food I liked. It was like we were meant to meet at so many levels. He happened to be one of the partners in a Greek Restaurant. He helped me make reservations for four people. Upon entering the restaurant we began enjoying a pleasant music selection. The ambience was ideal for a relaxing evening it was very quaint and cozy.  The food was spectacular, offering unique options from which to select. The staff was very helpful with our selections of food, and we never felt rushed.   Peter sat down with us for an after dinner drink, thank you Peter for making us feel welcomed in your restaurant (home). We love hearing your stories about you father home in Greece. I highly recommend this restaurant. When visiting New York do not miss going to The Greek!!     Karen C

From the ambiance, to the drinks, to the service, to the food - definitely a 5 star experience. This was my first time really experiencing Greek food and it didn't disappoint! We ordered a bunch of small plates and the ones that really stuck out were the meatballs and the gigantes. I will definitely be making it back to The Greek soon!

A little bit away from the restaurant row in Tribeca but worth walking a few blocks over for! Very pleasant decor that reminds me of my recent trip to the Greek islands. Everything was delicious and fresh. The staff were well trained and memorable. Definitely recommend if you are in the area!
Food was definitely tasty and well cooked. The service was more 3 star than 4 star, but we liked the food and ambiance enough to lean towards a 4 star overall rating.
No comment

We came her for Valentine's day dinner. All I can say is Yum.  Everything was delicious. They had rose petals everywhere, we had a lovely greek white wine. The food amazing, the service was perfect and the baklava sealed the deal. Highly recommend.

The Greek is truly the most amazing restaurant in NYC! We walked into a fun, and genuine environment and it only got better from there! The cocktails were incredible -- try the bartender's choice. Then the food...to die for. We got the Greek salad, meatballs and fried feta. It was all incredible, hands down. What an outstanding experience -- Tom and Phillip are amazing! I will visit this place every time I'm in town from LA! GO NOW!
No comment
One of the best restaurants I've been to in Tribeca. Get the feta cheese / honey dish, it's incredible. Also really like their decor and ambience. Definitely recommend!

You cannot find a more welcoming place. They have wonderful food and drinks. The owner and his whole staff are Aces if I could give this place more stars I would. The atmosphere is beautiful and inviting.  You are not rushed here but instead very welcome to stay, hang out, and talk with the staff. Authenic Greek food that has been given an elegant twist without being pretentious. GO! Start off with an old fashioned, then some medouli, and follow with a special of the day and finish it off with the feta cheesecake (yes you read that right..Feta cheesecake)! The cheesecake is a must.
No comment
This place is excellent!! Everything is good, try the baclava it's the best you will ever have guaranteed. The staff is super nice and proffesional !
This place had a nice ambiance. Staff was friendly and authentically Greek:) I preferred the small over the entrees. Example: Dakos. Yum.

Very interesting menu, lots of authentic Greek food done right. I had the avgo sto fourno which was amazing. My wife had a salad with souvlaki (also a great simple dish). We had the gigantes for an appetizer which almost had us both full along with the warm pita. A little pricey (could that be due to the copious amounts of lunch time alcohol... perhaps) but well worth a visit. The service is very high quality, unobtrusive and very helpful.
Very cozy and nicely decorated spot. I loved the lamb chops and pear with pastourmia both were great.

Came here on a random night out in the city and what a pleasant surprise. The food was delicious, we had the lamb chops, greek salad, pita dips.. Very very good choice of dips. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The waiters had cute uniforms on. You didn't feel rushed at all. Great choice of music. Will def be back.
awesome ambiance and food. also great music. great for dates, double dates, and family dinners.

Always walk by the place on our strolls on Greenwich Street, but so glad we finally stopped in. The food is really tasty, we had the dips, the calamari and egg plant for appetizers and they were all amazing. For entrees we did a Greek salad and the chicken dish, which I highly recommend. The wine selection is limited, BUT they did a great job picking the wines, as the bottles we had were awesome and the best part is that they were reasonably prices. Finally, the service was excellent, they do a great job making you feel welcome and making sure you have a great experience.
No comment

The appetizers were really good, but the main course was not all that great. My wife and I ordered the mixed grill and the meat was very dry and really bland. The people we were with really liked the braised beef and chicken. The cheesecake was good too.
No comment
No comment
This is one of my FAVORITE spots in the city! You don't have to be a huge fan of Greek food to enjoy it! Try the fried feta, chicken, and cheesecake!!!
The Greek is by far my favorite authentic Greek cuisine place!!! Everything from the decor, service and food was spectacular!

This place is truly a little gem in Tribeca. The decor and ambiance creates the feeling of a really authentic family-owned Greek restaurant. Very comfortable and cute. The food is fresh and delicious.

Would never have found this place on the street, but so glad i found it online.  EXCELLENT service, great food and good atmosphere.  Loved the chicken noodle soup to start and had the lamb chops with string beans for entree.  Very flavorful and well presented.  Will definitely return!
No comment

We were feeling like Greek food and found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try, I had never seen or heard of it before despite living nearby, but it had good reviews, and I am so glad we did!! We didn't have a reservation but turned up around 7pm on a Thursday evening, they were very accommodating and we had a choice of the front or back of the restaurant. Come 7.30/8 the restaurant was almost completely full, a great atmosphere. We tried a selection of small plates - the spreads, stuffed grape leaves, the shrimp, oyster mushrooms, meatballs - the food was absolutely delicious (I recommend all of the above!), the service matched - some of the best food and service I've had in NY for a while. It's a little on the pricey side but completely worth it.
No comment

The Greek is the best Greek food you can find in New York City, hands down. Having moved to the city a few years ago from Greece, this place transports me back home. The food is delicious and the cocktails are amazing. Whatever you may order is amazing, from the spreads, the octopus, the cheese/spinach pies, the feta psiti (oven baked feta cheese), the mixed grill, the feta cheesecake, everything. I have been to various Greek restaurants in the city and this has by far the best authentic Greek food, in an beautiful ambiance with warm people (hostess and waiters). Will definitely go back soon.

What an amazing dinner!! First off I have to say I am a huge fan of Mediterranean food and this place could be my new favorite. We ordered Feta Psiti as an appetizer and it was insanely good. The feta is fried and served with honey drizzled over top, which amplified the flavor! When it came around to the entree, we decided on the Mixed Grill for 2. It was a great array of skillfully marinated and cooked meats with greek fries/chips. I honestly couldnt decide which  meat I liked more. We ended up ordering Tsasiki sauce to go with the mixed grill but I didn't realize it would be $6 charge per small bowl. Either way....the meal was great from start to finish!!
No comment

This is a wonderful restaurant with a great atmosphere.  It is cozy and romantic, yet not too quiet.  The service was great and we all enjoyed our meals, although I cannot say we loved them, hence the four stars.  We tried the fried feta cheese, stuffed grape leaves, and meatballs which were all good. My NYC friends who joined us were really pleased with the everything.  Prices were reasonable for a good NYC meal.

The food was amazing. The spreads selection was delicious and the bread was fresh out of the oven. The waitstaff was very friendly and attentive. I live in the area and will definitely make this a frequent restaurant of choice.

Took the wife here for our first wedding anniversary December 2015.  The ambiance was really nice, noise level was a bit loud for my taste but definitely bearable. Food was pretty good and the staff was good.  It was worth the money for me

I would've given this place 4 stars if it wasn't for the extremely small portions for very high prices. The ambiance and service was excellent. We were here on Valentine's day so they only had a select variety of dishes to choose from. The appetizer prices were steep - we ordered the calamari as well as the grilled octopus - $15 each for a small portion. For the entree, I ordered the scallops dish. $32 for THREE pieces of scallops. Didn't even come with any potato or bread or vegetables. The scallops were really tender and flavorful. However, $10 for one scallop is really expensive. My fiance ordered the brizola. For $35, the dish comprised of about 8 one-inch strips of steak with a side of potatoes. We left the restaurant hungry which was quite disappointing.
Delicious Authentic Northern greek style food :) I appreciated their fabulous service and the food was sooooooooooo tasty! Do not hesitate to dine here you will NOT regret it :)
the greek has the best authentic greek food! owner is very nice and the business is great and another must visit in tribeca.

Wow, was really impressed by how amazing the experience was! We tried the grilled feta with honey and Greek salad as appetizers and it's flavorful and well balanced. My main was a moussaka and it's probably the best one I tried so far! My friends had the lamb (phenomenal) and the shrimps (delicious)! Service was exemplar, waiter being attentive, replacing silverware between dishes and having great reco for wines. Last but not least it's a pretty romantic place !

Food was delicious, authentic and did I say delicious? Ordered the Lima beans and 7 star shrimp, very hearty. A lil pricey but a good dining experience, service was great. The one gentleman we assumed was the owner was wearing a Mexicue tshirt which was confusing ;) but after we asked him about it he provided the Mexicue guys guidance in the restaurant business. Obviously knows his stuff!
Beautiful and clean interior. Wonderful, healthy, fresh and tasty food options. Place is perfect for groups or a date night! I cant wait to come back!!!!
No comment
No comment

Loved this place! My husband & I were looking for a place to have dinner and came upon this place. We walked in and it was pretty full so we waited at the bar to be seated. We got drinks ( which were really good!) and were seated pretty quickly. The ambiance in here is amazing. There's candles and its a little dark and there's great music playing. All the staff was extremely friendly and the food was DELICIOUS! I had never tried Greek food and I loved it. I will definitely go back to this place whenever I'm visiting New York again.

As a Greek, The Greek did not disappoint. The ambiance is cozy and nicely decorated and all of the waiters are friendly and attentive. The food was amazing, we got the shrimp appetizer and the mixed grill with a side of lentils. The lamb chops in the mixed grill were literally perfect and the size of the plate was plenty for 2 people to share. I came on a Tues and didn't have to wait for a table, but I'm sure on the weekends this place fills up. They only take reservations for parties of 4 or more. I'm coming back for sure!!

Although it's a little pricey, the Greek food here is fantastic! It's a dark scene with a cool crowd - great for a date or a group to get a table. I haven't had anything bad here - I love the eggplant dip!

This definitely a great atmosphere and best experience I had. Besides being waited by the owner of the restaurant himself, the ambient and people here really know how to make you feel like home. The food is delicious and perfect spot to impress anyone you want to take out for a meal.

The Greek is a great cozy but elegant place for a wonderful meal or drinks at the bar. The food is prepared meticulously and I have now tried at least 2/3 of the menu items and have yet to be disappointed! Anastasio is usually there to meet you and makes you feel like you are in his home dining with his family. They also have a great wine selection and the desserts are to die for.  Favorites so far include feta cheesecake, the chocolate Napoleon thingy for dessert, the fava beans, octopus and beet salad for starters and the whole fish, veal steak and lamb shank for mains.  Definitely check this place out, you will be glad you did!
No comment

In order to be honest the Greek's "Greek" elements are mostly their wine list, some sense of hospitality giving free ouzo while you are waiting. Food is good but a bit overrated for my first full dinner visit (before I 've  only been at the bar) The ambience is absurd because it tries to be warm, cosy, industrial, and the result is a salad of badly combined ingredients. The remembrance is chaotic and reminds nothing of the restaurant's name "Greek". You don't need the stereotyped white and blue, but somewhere somehow the unique feeling of Greece. The patrons are the kind of people that apparently only know the generic kind of food and its byproducts that are presented as "authentic" or high cuisine in Manhattan. My experience was horrible due to the young Greek waitress one of the many that have arrived in NY after the Greek economic crisis. They have never tended tables before especially in America so they have limited capabilities and an attitude that is between don't push me too much, I am only doing this for some time. However because of the management's move to take the bill after what happened I am giving them five stars and I hope to return because their effort despite all the faults that I described above and they are according to my own point of view (that is not infallible) is worth supporting. Management 5 stars kitchen 3 stars. Service 1star.
Just ordered  a takeout.  Just opened up the octopus costing $23. These are the morsels we got at $23.00   For real?????

I went here for an anniversary dinner and had an amazing experience. Dimitri and the entire staff were fantastic, and the food was delicious. They have a great cocktail and wine list too. I will be back.
No comment

My girlfriend and I wanted to try something different and found this gem in TriBeca. Unless you are a table of four or more they do not accept reservations but we tried our luck anyway. I'm glad we did. Upon arriving we were immediately greeted by a host and seated within minutes. The seating is uniquely set up with a variety of bar stool and highball tables as well as low couches and round tables. The waiter arrived promptly and asked what we would like to drink. We said that we would like to start with waters and he gave us a funny look, smiled and walked away. At the point my girlfriend and I realized there were two SHOT glass sized portions of water in front of both of us. Fine. We weren't out to drink water that evening anyway. We both ordered specialty cocktails which were delicious but took 20 minutes to get to our table. We shared two appetizers (the grilled octopus salad and the spinach pie). Both dishes were very good. For dinner I had the broiled red snapper (watch out for the bones) and my friend enjoyed the chicken. I would definitely recommend this restaurant. The food was authentic and the service was good.

I love this place. It's up there with Locanda Verde and Marc Forgione for me. We stumbled across it when looking for a local brunch spot and it was perfect. Great food, service,  jazz music and amazing decor. They also gave complimentary Fava dip and dark chocolate at the end of our meal. So good it warranted my first review of a restaurant.
No comment

Very good spot. Came for lunch and was impressed. Started with pilos, croquettes and spreads. The croquettes were absolutely amazing--sweet crispy flavor blended perfectly with the cheese. The other apps were okay, but the croquettes were awesome. The sea bass was excellent, with crispy skin and nice seasoning. Had the lemon potatoes in place of the lentils and they were awesome. Will definitely come back.
No comment

Went to The Greek Saturday night for our out of town friends birthday. All 4 of us love Greek food. We met Peter and he was super pleasant and made some suggestions. Then we get to our waiter Adam and he was not interested in making our visit a pleasant experience. He was annoyed right from the start the we did not select the $100 bottle of wine he recommended (the one we choose was $68). After that he was totally disinterested in any attention to our table. We had to search for him several times.  He did not ask if we wanted anything else. At the early part of the meal we asked for additional bread (the artisanal bread was delicious). We asked once, twice, three times and then we called him and specifically said this is the fourth time and minutes later he abruptly almost throws a plate of pita bread on the table! Would definitely not recommend. The food was good but we also go to fine dining for the high end service.
No comment

i do not get what the hype of this place is all about. The service and ambiance is awesome but the food inst anything special. we had the short rib which was dry and the Moussaka which was way too creamy. the greek salad needed salt.

Completely love this place.  It's a little out of the way but it's totally worth the trip.  The ambience alone is worth it.  It's one of the prettiest places I've ever eaten at; the waitress told me that they had a designer from Greece come to work on it.  And the food and drinks are PHENOMENAL.  Last time I was there, we got the artichoke Moussaka which was delicious.  Highly recommend this place!

food is incredible. Like so amazing. Service was good but it was a busy night so a little slow. The hummus with capers is the best thing I've tasted in a long time. I would recommend this to any and everyone. A little bit more expensive than I thought. All the apps were above 10 dollars. Amazing cocktails too but still a little pricey. But the quality of food makes it worth it.

They could be nicer. Came here from a happy hour recommendation apparently ouzo is not on the happy hour menu. They could probably benefit from having a specific menu for happy hour. At least they honored it. It was just ok.

Food is truly amazing as is the ambience and service! This is easily my favorite restaurant in Tribeca. Favorite dishes are the spreads and Greek Salad to start along with the Octopus, which is perfectly cooked and seasoned. On to main courses, the lamb chops and Branzino are to die for, presentation and taste are both equally impressive! This restaurant is a must try, I promise you will be a repeat customer like I am!!
No comment

Delicious food and great ambience. Went there in a very cold and rainy fall night for a friend's birthday and we had a great time. It was the first time I tasted Greek beer, and was quite disappointed (but that's not the restaurants fault I guess). The octopus and lemon potatoes were outstanding. Very recommended!
The Greek is a solid neighborhood restaurant.  The food is consistently good.  Their staff is courteous and accommodating. The live entertainment is great on Sundays!
Excellent drinks and food. The price range is more in the $$$ area.
My favorite restaurant in the city. Amazing food. Amazing staff. Can't wait to go back.
We came here on a Thursday night for a work team dinner (about 10 people). The food was amazing, the staff exceptional, and the ambiance and vibe perfect.  Highly recommend this place!
I loved everything about this place from the owner to the food and atmosphere. The Cheesecake was excellent. Loving the grilled octopus. The spinach with feta was delicious.

Really incredible food and atmosphere. All homemade dishes. Literally grandmothers' recipes. The service is unbelievably friendly and accommodating.  I sincerely hope that this restaurant does well and gains traction for the sole reason that far too few restaurants in the city have this quality of food and service with so little facade and fake attitude. You can tell that the people here love their food, their business, and are ready to make you feel good whenever you come to dine with them.
No comment
We visited "The Greek" on 8/27/16. Amazing food, amazing service and amazing atmosphere! Will definitely come back on our next NYC trip!

We were looking for a great Mediteranian restaurant in Tribeca and read a few reviews of The Greek.   Everything was damn good.....perfection. All food was perfectly spiced and executed for a *****star rating. From the moment we here greeted to the complimentary chocolates served at the end, we thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
Delicious. The spanakopita was so flavorful. I had it with the combination plate of a Greek salad and grape leaves. True flavored of Greece!
Atmosphere feels like a club but with great food! Came here with group for birthday and they were very accommodating. Servers were excellent!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was my first visit to the restaurant and I can't wait to visit again.  The hospitality made me feel like I was in Taverna in Greece.  The staff were friendly, professional and down to earth.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting.  Great for hanging out with friends and it also has a romantic side so you can come on a date. Everything I ate tasted fresh and amazing. The complimentary dips were fresh, homemade and fantastic.  The lemon potatoes and grilled octopus with bacon were to die for.  I also really appreciated the extensive Greek wine list.  Two of my favorites were on the list.  And lastly I loved the Greek spin on the halva.  It was served to perfection with the Greek coffee.

Came here for lunch with a friend and loved it. We split the large meat sampler platter, which the waitress claimed was going to be too much, but it wasn't. With the exception of the chicken skewers, all the meats on the platter were fantastic! I particularly liked the beef burger and the sausage (surprisingly). And of course, the lamb chops on there were prepared so well it just fell off the bone--amazing. The beef burger was stuffed with cheese so it was extra aromatic. The salad it came with was very refreshing and they were super generous with their homemade chips. Friend and I swore we wouldn't eat them, but they were too good to pass up. Definitely stop by here for lunch! Cute place with lots of variety in seating options and because it is in Tribeca, it's never insanely crowded and never has a wait. My only complaints would be that the waitresses didn't seem to know what was going on much and the AC is cranked up way too high in here. I was freezing.

This is Greece, in America!  The food is so flavorful, the décor is right out of Greece, the music is as relaxing as it gets.  Our waitress was attentive, fast, and anticipated what we would want before we thought of it.  I love this place and will make it a regular dining locale.

After cocktails at Maco, we took our girls night to The Greek--which did not disappoint!  The atmosphere of the restaurant was welcoming, and made us feel like we were truly in Greece.  Unlike many restaurants in New York, I could actually see and hear my girlfriends while we ate, which made our experience that much more pleasant.  We knew we were in for a treat when the complimentary pita and hummus were delicious.  If a restaurant takes that much care with standard nibbles, their actual food is usually ten times better!  We ordered the fried feta cheese for an appetizer, which our waiter served with a drizzle of honey.  It.  was. incredible.  I ordered the scallops with pomegranates, which was light and deliciously flavorful.  I tried a bit of one of my friends moussaka, which was beautifully seasoned and prepared.  I did not try our other friend's Cornish hen, but she raved about it.  Our waiter must have read my mind when I mentioned wanting dessert (my companions were too full), because The Greek serves each guest a mini bar of chocolate along with the check.  What a perfect end to a lovely meal.

This place is awesome!! I only had appetizers and drinks but both were amazing. The Manhattan here is so well done, I love it. We tried almost all apps, and they were all so delicious and yummy. Would totally recommend and will certainly be back. Plus, the ambiance here was absolutely gorgeous and the people here were so nice and friendly.

Wanted to love this place but they screw you at the bar service. We ordered the medium krya plate and were not given enough bread to finish the dips.  When I asked for more bread the server (demetri) told me he didn't want me to sit and order bread all night w my $20 appetizer among other things. Food was decent but someone must be impressed w their Michelin recommendation because I wasn't.  Terrible service from him a they gave up 2 stars for that.  The Hostess was delightful.

So pleasantly surprised at how beautiful this place was. The decor and lighting is just so inviting. Staff is professional and attentive. Food is inventive and new. Nice way to start a night in the city. Check the dips out they're not to be missed.
No comment

I ate at the Greek last night with my partner. Saturday night. Had been there before and love the decor and delicious food, particularly the small plates. However, I will not go again on Saturday night. It was so loud that my partner and I could not talk to each other. We asked to give us the rest of dinner to go and left. Tables are too close to each other, impossible to have a private conversation. They tried to squeeze as many tables as possible in a small space. Again, amazing food but poor dining experience.
This place was great. Wonderful service, delicious food, beautiful ambience. I'd agree with the other reviewers that it should be classified as $$$ instead of $$ but it's totally worth it.
The freshness and quality of food at this place makes it a must check out restaurant in NY. Great vibe and really buzzy so will definitely be back.
just discovered this neighborhood gem and I'll be back. the staff are friendly and aren't afraid to make recommendations. The dips to start and the shrimp were amazing!!!

Came for dinner late on a Sunday evening, no reservations-the restaurant was off the beaten path and very charming. We started of with some Greek wine - The Santorini white was a phenomenal recommendation. For our appetizers we had the horiatiki salata, 4 traditional spreads, and octopus -all great!! For our main entrees we had the lamb chops, *cooked perfectly*, and the whole Red Snapper. AWESOME FIND! The entire experience was amazing, We felt very taken care of. THANK YOU!

Great food.  Great wine-list.  Owner & somm helped pick out two standout wines for the price (~$100 average, which I felt would be on a NYC wine-list elsewhere for $120-160).  When we had issues with one wine being potentially oxidized, they quickly swapped it out for a fresh bottle.
No comment

The best dinner I've had in a while! Their dessert was amazing too - so far, I've tried the feta cheesecake and the bourekia, and both were incredible! The Greek salad had the best veggies - I didn't even know produce of this quality existed in NYC. The fried feta with honey was decadent!

I always stop here for lunch after workout  at Superstar gym. They also have healthy choices. Good cozy place with good service. It is more neighborhood place you can enjoy your food without tourist crowd.

Had a wonderful dinner celebrating wife's birthday. Warm service without any affect, delicious mezze dips  and warm, home made grape leaves for starters. Mediterranean sea bass filets over lentils was a big hit for main, and a surprise gratis cheesecake, more savory than sweet was a great finish. Hospitality is the name of the game and you can find it at the Greek. Three $ signs is more like it, but it is Manhattan and nothing is skimped on.
Just about the best Greek food I've eaten in this country. Octopus, salads, lentils, mixed grill, Retsina. Every single item was perfect.

Appetizers were great. Entrees were bit disappointing though. I don't usually eat lamb, but it was actually quite good at this place. Overall the food was bit salty for us. Nice atmosphere and decor. Our waiter was awesome.

I like the Greek but I went Thursday night with another couple and we ordered 4 entrees and 30 minutes later the waiter came back to tell us that they ran out of all of them.   We ended up eating entrees we really didn't want and it turned out to be a challenging experience.  They did comp us on 3 of the 4 entrees but the experience was pretty weak.  We have been there before and have liked it but this was pretty out of bounds.  If you go please ask the waiter to make sure they have what you are ordering so this does not happen to you.
Best lamb chops that I ever had.  I don't think I've ever had Greek wine but it paired perfectly with the lamb.

We love The Greek TriBeCa! The atmosphere is cozy Greek and TriBeCa cool...it takes you back to rustic Thessaloniki. The owner and staff make sure to take care of you as if you are a regular.  The appetizers are authentic and well executed: the tomatoes in the salad are sweet and tasty like you cannot imagine in the US, the spreads are delicate yet flavorful, the cheese and spinach pies are like a Greek Yiayia's (grandma). Everything on the grill is properly done from the fish to the steak to the outstanding lamb chops. And to finish, try the creative feta cheesecake; not your typical Greek dessert or your typical NYC cheesecake, but the epitome of the fusion of both.

We had a wonderful evening out with my bf. I am greek and he is not. I can appreciate the good food and we loved the Cretan Lyra and the live music. Kind people wonderful crowd. The ouzo was perfect the mixed grill amazing, the cheese and spinach pie like I make them and my bf was so happy! Thank you people of "the Greek" for the 5 star experience!

We went two nights in a row- seriously! The signature cocktail is made with the spiced honey syrup they use in the baklava and it's deelish. The food is divine. Lamb shank like rich, moist and falling off the bone. I had grilled octopus and beet salad. Both were fresh and very tasty. Lovely staff.
No comment

This place is fantastic.  The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, with plenty of space.  The food is fabulous, and is pretty authentic.  Everyone who worked here was friendly and attentive.  If you come get the meat sampler so you can try everything.  Pro tip: dipping fries in tzatziki will change your life, man.

In the past three months I have lived in the Greater New York City Area there is no doubt this is the best restaurant I have been to in NYC. Be prepared for a long wait on a Friday night, but it will be worth it.
Loved the service and the owner was very hospitable. Good job guys, keep it up!

The Greek has the most authentic greek food I have ever tasted. Not only is the ambiance and design beyond anything I have ever witnessed, the food is delightful. Even the basic Beet salad is to die for. I have never been to Greece but I would imagine that this is exactly what the food tastes like. The desserts are also perfect. It was really an experience. I would recommend it to anyone!!
Very good authentic Greek cuisine.  Everything was perfect.  I was truly impressed.  Bravo.
No comment

This place is amazing. First of all, its beautiful - warm and elegant and rustic. The food is amazing. They give you delish mezze type dips when you sit down, toasted fluffy pita. The food was perfect - authentic but not too greasy or garlicky, as some greek food can be. I will be coming back often... a great neighborhood spot and 100% worth a visit

I walked by the Greek while in town and decided to try it for lunch.  It's as if I was home, eating at my mother or pethera's house.   This is Greek cooking at its finest - simple, fresh, and authentic; it's the first time I've seen tsai vounou on the menu in the states, which was perfect on a cold day.  Can't wait to return.
Great cocktails and wine recommendation to start; fresh and delicious Greek salad; the octopus appetizer and pork shank entree were both excellent. Outstanding service, very comfortable and clean.

Went for lunch on my last day in Tribeca before returning to Chicago.  What a glorious experience.  The Greek salad (ripe tomatoes, cucumber, feta and arugula) was fantastic, the artichoke with fennel and bechamel, fabulous, the octapodi...stupendi and the pork belly with orzo utterly delicious.  The ambiance was beautifully Mediterranean and the music very soulful.  Tom was especially helpful in setting the stage for a wonderful dining experience.  Thank you for such a wonderful summer afternoon meal!

Incredible food. Everything is on the menu is on point.  From the salads to the meats to the dips.  EVERYTHING is good.  The service is excellent and the drinks are strong!  This is a great spot to meet friends and pig out.

This restaurant hits all the good spots. The food is delicious; the service is impeccable. The prices are somewhat higher than what they should be, but the overall dining experience is great.  The flava beans are phenomenal. So is the lavraki fish. The waiters are knowledgeable about Greek wine and offer options which may make you reevaluate your opinion of Greek wine. Try the Vinsanto dessert wine.

This place is like one of your favorite record albums where you love every song because they hit it out of the ball park.  Every single dish we had here was terrific and some were sublime. Starting out with the spread, the crisp bread was perfect with the best tzatsiki sauce we have ever had. The salad was quite possibly the best Greek salad as well; the feta cheese was perfect and it was all fresh and crisp. We also enjoyed the mixed grill and the highlight was the lamb chops which were sublime. The artichoke moussaka really transcended any moussaka we have ever had. We also enjoyed the lamb guvetsi and the octupus and the chicken dish. We had a party of 6 and our delight in the dining experience was unanimous. Every plate was finished clean. The desserts were lovely as well; we enjoyed the feta cheesecake, baklava and chocolate cake. The service was fantastic and the waiter really selected everything for us and clearly succeeded in making a great impression. No trip to NY can occur without coming here for a meal for me in the future!

Just had a surprise birthday dinner here and the owner and everyone there were so accommodating and wonderful. The surprise was executed perfectly. The food and wine were great too. The pancetta entree was amazing. Everyone at the table also tried the octopadi appetizer and loved it. Everyone also kept saying how pretty the restaurant was and asking me how I came to find it. Definitely a gem tucked away in Tribeca.
Beautiful.  Love this place.  Exactly what a restaurant should be.  Great food, atmosphere.  Go now.

What an absolute gem. Fantastic service, absolutely delicious food, and decent prices (considering the rest of the neighborhood). The warm bread and hummus served first is your first sign the food's going to be amazing. I had the Greek coffee, which was some of the best coffee I've ever had. I had the cheese-stuffed pepper and the Greek salad, which were great. The space is really cozy and beautifully decorated. I can't wait to go back here.

I was in the city and wanted Greek food and my boyfriend and I came here and it was such a great choice. I loved it the mood the food and the service. If you would good feel comfort food this is the spot I recommend this place hands down. Just the drive was bad to come in the city but great
The food here is great. One of the tastiest salads and hand cut real CHIPS not pathetic fries. All they need now is Taramasalata and I will be in heaven

Everything about our evening was wonderful. We had reservations and arrived early, party of five, the manager made us feel welcome and genuinely glad to see us, what a nice concept!  The Greek is cozy and feels warm and welcoming. What an extensive menu and we relied on our waiter Dimitrios to guide us in selections based on our wines which were very good. Our table ordered a variety of plates to all share so we could try many things. The standouts were the baby octopus (amazing smoky and grilled flavor, best ever), scallops were perfectly seasoned and tender, stuffed eggplant was delicious, lima beans were flavored with the most amazing herbs. Oh, forgot the bread they served and the four dips were outstanding!! Best bread ever with the fava spread, feta spread, cod and the best tzatziki I have ever tasted. The desserts change frequently, we shared two desserts a feta cheesecake with a fig glaze topping and this was the best cheesecake we have ever had. The wait staff and manager were friendly and helpful, all with a lively fun atmosphere and music. Our group of friends kept discussing this meal for days and I would highly recommend going, we will again on our next trip to NYC.
This place orders by checking on a paper. No dim sum pushing carts in this place. Lots of variety, very similar to Golden Unicorn on East Broadway. Very clean.
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

It's very rare to find a dim sum place that offers dim sum in the evening. My friends and I (a large party) came here to celebrate a birthday and we had a great time. The dim sum is very good, especially the bean curd roll and we were hooked onto the coconut pudding. The waiters are very nice and the service was fantastic. The atmosphere was very welcoming and the lighting was a plus. One thing I always check is the cleanliness of the plates and utensils and I was extremely pleased. Overall 11/10 would come again!

Latest outpost of dim sum palace, that's open late. Been to the 2nd ave location and the concept is the same. You order of pictionary menu of dim sum and some more hearty options, like chow fun with beef.  Tried a bunch of meat and veg options, including XLB. The wrapper was thick and chewy but broth and filling was otherwise tasty. Steamed ribs were mostly bone and cut unevenly.   Service was fine, place wasn't busy around 6. Would I want to come back? Probably if I was around late at night otherwise plenty other dim sum options.

Newly relocated Dim Sum Palace is one of the few places that open early for breakfast and closes late for after hour's karaoke. We were given a private party room in the basement due to the amount of people in hour party. The staff was friendly, the food came out quickly and without missing a single order. Overall the food was excellent. However, the only thing I would change is the texture and thickness of the rice rolls. Definitely returning here the next time I'm in Chinatown and the mood for Dim Sum.

Went here recently for some late night Dim Sum with some of my bros. We ordered what felt like was practically everything on the menu from turnip cake to beef chow fun. Everything came out fairly quickly and was fairly tasty. I would say how newly renovated the place would make one distrust the quality and authenticity of the place but it was all in all a good experience breaking bread. Would definitely go back again considering that they're open until 3am according to their sign, which is getting rare these days to find an establishment not trying to close earlier especially in Chinatown.

We were craving Sticky Rice Wrap so we ordered them from Dim Sum Palace. The order came super quick! The Sticky rice was enjoyably chewy with a slightly sweet taste. Our wrap was filled with savory chicken. It also game with a ginger sauce that brought out a burst of flavor. Overall, delicious and well fulfilled craving.

Awesome spot! Spacious and so many menu options. Speedy service too. Delicious variety of soup dumplings. Even the sautéed veggies were so simple but garlicky and tasty. And beef and fried rice were great. Also loved the duck for the buns. So tasty. Great spot for large groups

This place was surprising. I figured a new dim sum place in Chinatown with locations all over the city would be questionable. But they really delivered, love the shrimp quality - doesn't skimp like other places you may go to nowadays. The location is super convenient, but just know it's not a cart place. You order off a menu, and if you're trying to grab a quick bite, it may take a little longer than you may be planning. But the food quality is more than worth it. Great service with the pro level dim sum waiters you know and love. Bustling and loud location full of people from the moment they open the perfect environment for yum cha.

Had both dinner family style for Chinese new year and family dim sum. For dim sum the food was hot and picked from a menu - like that it wasn't cold food rolled on carts as usual. Variety of food was good too. And really enjoyed the dinner option too esp the lobster sashimi!

On their website, they said there's half price dim sum happy hour between 3-5pm on weekdays. When I walked in at 4pm, the hostess had no idea what I was talking about. So I only grabbed a menu and took some pictures.  But I still plan on eating there with my family this weekend. Seems like a nice addition to division st
The food is good quality and taste better than other dim sum restaurants in my opinion.
Excellent dim sum from pork buns, scallion pancakes and beef chow fun.  Everything fresh and tasty. New restaurant addition to this chain is well worth the visit!!

Went for New Year dinner.  Food was delicious!!  The duck was so juicy and the skin very crunchy.  The staff made into pancakes that were so tasty.  Shrimp with caramelized walnuts, so plump and sweet.  Steak was amazing tender.  All our hosts and staff very friendly.  Will definitely come back again!!!

The dim sum did not need to go this hard... but it did. I've had good dim sum in my lifetime but this was extremely consistent and had the best sauces I've ever had? Their chili and sweet soy sauce hiiiiiit. Their turnip cake was perfect. Hope they have a great opening!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Got a new design, the waiter or waitress. horrible the green tea matcha wasn't even green, it was gray or black because they used a random ingredient to replace the green tea matcha. But they didn't mention anything about changing ingredients, the service was great food was below average. They need better cooks in order to get a five star. Also, where warm clothing it is really cold no matter where you are.

Was eager to try this new place; had enjoyed dim sum at the previous tenant, Sunshine. We thought the dim sum was delicious. Everything comes out hot and fresh, and they have items on their menu that are different than the usual array. And your tea, served in a beautiful glass teapot that filters the leaves, is regularly replenished and stays hot. Only reason they are not getting five stars from me is the service. Everyone was nice and we got the right things, but they were obviously shorthanded. No sauces, no spoons to eat the Xiao long bao with. And the two doors, when both open, bring a blast of freezing air into the dining room, so some tables were literally in a stiff breeze, and pretty much everyone in the dining room had their coats on. We'll definitely come back, but would probably come back at opening time so they aren't backed up yet, and would make sure to be sitting a long way from the door if it's a cold day!
No comment

Looks like they have a few locations so must have something about it. The shumai were my jam. The pork ribs also was solid but not my favorite. The cold carp fish dish wasn't my thing but I love to try authentic dishes. The reason you come here is the dumplings and the soup dumplings were delicious. The bread type pork dumplings were my favorite. I think they were pan-fried and lovely. This place is in the 4 star range and like I mentioned... come for the dumplings and enjoy!
No comment
I went in for lunch today and ordered the wonton soup and Peking-style noodles with pork sauce. Both were really delicious, even compared to some of the best Chinese restaurants I've eaten in in NYC.
No comment
No comment
Has the flavor of Shanghai dish but I was disappointed since the duck still has feather roots! Looks bad! And the eel dish has too much more onions 90% than eel 10%!
No comment
No comment
The food was good but the portions were tiny for the price. The food didn't look very appetizing but the flavor was good. I'd order again but would double my order of pork and string beans
No comment

The food here is DELICIOUS!!!! The food has always been fresh and tasty! However, it might take a little extra effort to make and changes and/confirm your order because of the food being so AUTHENTIC...it is a language barrier. The staff was sweet and patient. Although we could hear someone yelling in the kitchen every now & then.. All we were greeted with were smiles!  enjoy the meal!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We were a party of 3 and it was super quiet on a Sunday. We ordered the Shanghai soup dumplings and the pan fried shanghai soup dumplings. I'm used to getting 6 or 8 in a portion so it was strange to me that it was only 4 for a portion. The pan fried soup dumplings were something I never tried before, so my group was excited to order it. The bottom was crispy, but the filling was unfortunately lukewarm at best and the dough was thicker than one would expect for Shanghai dumplings. The steamed soup dumplings were hot and flavorful, but again the dumpling exterior was more doughy and not the expected light and thin exterior so that threw me off.
Not authentic Chinese. Food was so bland. The dumpling had raw meat. Overall wasn't what I expected at all. Don't understand the reviews here.

Yesterday evening my husband and I decided to come here for dinner and drinks. We chose this place since we were in the area. We wanted to try a new restaurant that wasn't too busy. When we walked in, there were about 3 or 4 small groups dining. The other half of the restaurant was empty, and that's where we were asked to sit. One of the female employees immediately handed us our menus and served us water. The other female employee was taking table orders and chatting with customers. After about 5 minutes, we were ready to order. We waited and waited, and waited some more. We looked around, made eye contact with both employees, but no one ever came over. After a few minutes, the employee who had served us water approached our table only to refill our glasses and walk away. We decided to give the staff additional time so I went to the restroom in the meantime. When I came back, I learned that the server still had not come to our table. We had waited a total of 25 MINUTES before deciding to leave. In addition to service being is terrible, the restroom smelled very filthy. This lack of cleanliness was definitely the deal breaker. That's when we decided that we needed to leave. All of this was a definite sign that we were not meant to eat there. Having two customers wait that amount of time shows how inconsiderate and unfriendly the staff can be towards their customers. Don't come here. There are better places with better service in the area.

Wow at this price it's pretty good. Only downside is that chicken was kinda soggy. I'm not gonna call it diarrhea chicken like the other restaurant I went to cuz the flavor was just right. Added additional star cuz it had healthy balance of broccoli

We made a reservation and they didn't honor it. Showed up on time and they gave out table away. 30 minutes later and still haven't sat down. I'll let you know if I ever get a table! Pray for me! Go to Chinatown for this instead, many more restaurants and they honor reservations and save tables
Good food, tasty and affordable. Portions are generous. Not a fancy or trendy place, but clean and cozy. I would go back!

Recommended by a local when I asked for somewhere yummy to eat. We went at prime dinner time and was still able to get a seat no problem. The food took a little bit to get to us but it was delicious and my bf and I both agreed we would eat here again if we were in NY!
It took them forever to finish a takeout. Not to mention I preordered already.... I waited for more than 25 minutes to get my lunch. How on earth is this possible?
No comment
I ordered an take out on Jan 12, 2022. The service guy mistype my order, and refuse to do anything to fix it. Never come back again!
No comment
Really great little spot by Washington square park. Xiao long bao (both steamed and pan fried) are flavorful - more so than your standard. Noodles with pork were good too. Would definitely go back!

It might be the specific day, it might be just me, but the food here just isn't meeting the expectations of an established West Village Chinese restaurant. The sauce on the ribs were a little off, the soup dumplings were nothing special, the scallion pancakes were meh, and the noodle dishes weren't up to par.

We randomly stopped in here one Sunday afternoon after seeing a sign advertising their pork xiao long bao (pork soup dumplings), which is a treat I can rarely pass up. Of course we ordered a few sets of the dumplings along with the Shanghai salted meat with vegetable rice and the dry-fried green beans with pork. We later ordered the crab soup dumplings just because we could! Each dish was delicious. Next time I plan to try the other signature dishes. I have a feeling you can't go wrong ordering from here and this is your chance to get a taste of cuisine from the Jiangnan region of China (the menu mentions several cities in the region including Shanghai and Wuxi). They offer other more well-known dishes like kung pao chicken and orange beef, which I'm sure are very tasty, but I think before I went for those I'd like to try the Wuxi Pork Ribs and the West Lake Fish. The place had a relaxed, casual feel and seemed to welcome people there for any occasion. We saw a couple groups of four to six people and a few couples.

I don't recommend. Waited for 30 minutes for my take out order, they told me after 30 minutes they could not make it and I had to cancel through the ordering app. I asked if we could come back later to pick it up? No, they can't make it. When I asked why didn't you cancel it before, they said they can't do it on their app. So don't waste your time, they can't handle a 2 person order at peak time...

Cute little gem with simple but well executed eats. Cozy atmosphere and attentive staff. Easy to walk by and get and indoor or patio table. The spring noodle soup and ribs were standouts. The spring noodle soup had a delicious mushroomy broth and amazing noodles. The ribs had fall of the bone meat in delicious sauce. Would come back here in a heartbeat.

Ok despite spending an inordinate amount of time asking for the soup to not have bacon  it arrives a very long time after( not the promised 15 minutes)  replete with BACON.  The shrimp cooked in their shell were so small that it was ludicrous to try to peel them    Topped this off with some of the worst peanut noodles in nyc.  The dumplings were great but not enough to ever have me deal with this restaurant again

Tipsy Shanghai is the New York sibling of a restaurant in Shanghai that was started in 1905. So with that history you would expect amazing flavors and unique Shanghai dishes. Unfortunately, the food at Tipsy Shanghai can only be described as bland and some of their menu items are more American Chinese (shrimp with lobster sauce, sweet & sour chicken, etc) than truly Chinese. The restaurant itself is very nice and the service is good, but the food is simply bland. We were hoping for something special and left being disappointed.

A few friends have recommended this place to us, and we finally decided to order a delivery for dinner tonight. However it was actually a disappointment. The noodles taste ok but we waited one and half hour for the delivery(which is also annoying), so as you can imagine, all noodles stick together and became a soggy pancake. The ribs and zongzi are both very disappointing. Sour taste. Feels like they are spoiled. Our favorite is the sweet sticky rice. It has the right amount of sugar and well balanced with red bean paste. Everything with the sticky rice is just good, opposite of the other dishes unfortunately.

After my first time here I can say the food was indeed quite delicious and that's alone did it for me. The service however was honestly really not that great and i like to think I'm a patient person who's worked in the industry. Upon arrival there was only one woman working the whole restaurant and other than my party of two was a table of 4, 2 and another 2. We were seated at 6:30 and didn't receive even our drinks until 7:48! We asked for two beers and two glasses of water and only got the beers, the food took over about to come out and it all come out at once, delivery orders were going out before the tables were taken care of and other tables were being served before us despite ordering after. I would come back for the food 100% I just have to make sure I don't have plans closely after dinner.

My friend and I went for outdoor dining and both got kung pao chicken - delicious! Also the waitress was hilarious, an awesome bonus!

While spending the cold afternoon in the village, I was heavily craving spicy noodles or soup, and Tipsy Shanghai appeared to be the right restaurant to satisfy my craving. I'm so happy I found this restaurant, and will definitely visit it again the next time I'm con the area! The only unfortunate drawback is the minimal options for vegetarian and vegan diets. Nevertheless, our server was very helpful and the kitchen altered a couple of items into vegetarian dishes. The stir fry green beans are absolutely fantastic and spicy, with that "kissed by the wok" flavor essential to this dish. Plenty of outdoor seating, very clean, and 100% in accordance to Covid regulations.

Came here with a friend for dinner because we were craving for Shanghainese food and many online reviews told us Tipsy Shanghai is one of the best in the area. But aside from an interesting retro decor, good service and having many authentic items, the food tasted very bland and lacked any serious flavor. Both the pan fried xiaolongbao and the shredded bean curds (tasted pre-frozen?) in chicken and shrimp broth didn't really hit home for me and were very unimpressive. The pork ribs were just okay because many of them are the tough, dry pieces of meat not attached to the rib bones. The presentation of each dish, however, made them slightly more appealing but the taste is very average for Shanghainese food.

I am not a big fan with the crab one, but I love all other food. Their bao are so juicy and flavorful. The staff was friendly too. I will def come back!! Highly recommend!!

Very authentic Shanghainese restaurant near school. They have a great lunch special where it's $12.95 for a noodle soup, xiao long bao, and your choice of a beverage. They have delicious xiao long bao where the skin is very thin and there is a lot of soup. The interior design is a good combination of modern and traditional and all the food is quite aesthetic and well-seasoned.

Overall very solid dinner choice. Came at around 6pm on a Sunday night and the restaurant was full but there was no wait line to get a seat. I love the interior decor with old photos and auspicious red colors. The xiaolongbao was soooooo yummy, and you could see how freshly steamed and made it was. The signature dish, Wuxi pork ribs was good and the meat was so tender it fell off the bone, but the only downside was that it was not completely flavorful throughout the entire piece. The string beans were cooked to perfection just the way I like it. But the main star would definitely be the beef noodle soup. The beef was so tender and the soup was light and broth and the noodles were chewy but soft. Portions are just right, but not huge, so we ordered 4 dishes for 2 people which was just right, and we finished everything. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!
The soup dumplings are really authentic from Wuxi area which a little bit on the sweet side. Only pork option. Strongly recommend the fried soup dumplings! 10% off if you pay cash

The moment I step into the restaurant, I was attracted by the oriental decoration, which is tastefully designed. Food is amazing! We had their signature dishes Wuxi Pork Ribs,  Pan Fried Pork Bao, smoked fish noodle. Yummy! The best in the village!

The food here is pretty gross. I ordered via Uber Eats and ordered the pan fried pork xiao long Bao, the spicy roast beef, and sweet and sour chicken. The spicy roast beef had absolutely no flavor and the sweet and sour chicken was undercooked (I bit into raw chicken). The best dish was easily the pan friend pork xiao long bao, but it wasn't good enough to make up for the failings of the other dishes. Perhaps it's better if you go to the restaurant but I'm not too confident...
No comment

Really love this place! I grew up in Wuxi and have been craving for my hometown food for a long time, and I have found THE spot in NYC! Every dish here reminds me of what I used to eat growing up. I came here for my birthday with my friends, and was welcomed by Chef Liu, who gave me a discount and personally prepared birthday noodles for me, which warmed my heart. In addition, the signature dishes such as Wuxi Xiao Long Bao and Wuxi style ribs are so authentic, the most authentic you will ever find in NYC. The ambiance is so cozy and intimate. I will be back!!

This place is one of the few places near NYU that offers authentic Chinese food. There are truly plenty of options, though most of the preferred ones land on the meat side (the Wuxi Pork Ribs are the absolute must try). I've come here plenty of times with friends and we've never been disappointed. They also offer a lunch menu with two options (one smaller option and one larger option)- the smaller option comes with a choice of dumplings and a choice of a noodle dish, while the larger option comes with comes with everything in the smaller option as well as a choice of a meat dish. The prices here are quite reasonable for the most part (lunch menu is probably the most worth it). The staff here are friendly overall and the interior of the place is kept neat and clean. In terms of the customers, most are Asian.

The environment and service is good. We ordered one pork ribs, one pork and one noodle. They are all great! Very traditional Chinese cuisine!

Their rent is probably a lot higher than the Chinatown Shanghai restos though. It's definitely worth a try!

The food is delicious, waitress are very friendly. I like the Wuxi pork rib and Xihu beef soup! If you add a little bit white pepper, that'd be perfect!
Good, traditional shanghainese food. Got the soup dumplings, shrimp with crab meat and ribs. So delicious!

The food here is very authentic. The environment is comfy and cozy, nice place if you want to hang out with friends, chat and maybe discuss things.
The food tastes very good. Very nice lunch place. It's very close to NYU and is very quite. The membership card gives 10% off, great.

Very good restaurant and good food. We ordered the bao, cabbage and stirred fired rice. Tho it is kind of hard to find the location. It is located in the basement and it is a bright and clean place to go on weekends.

Have been coming to Tipsy Shanghai since their opening. Probably most authentic Shanghainese and Hangzhou food in the village. Delicious, hearty and always remind me of home cooking. Staff doing their very best to offer the best service during COVID.
Food was okay, not the best in NYC area but good enough if you want to have some food not too american style.

Pretty average to be honest small portion reasonable prices   not many plp but i like the music they are playing

This is the most authentic Chinese restaurant I have  had in NYC so far. Literally any dish I ordered saitisfied my picky flavor. I will definitely come back again.
This restaurant serves very authentic shanghainese food. As an international student, it satisfies my cravings.
Really nice place and Shanghai atmosphere. I ordered sweet and sour ribs, assorted gluten, fried green beans and pan fried xiaolongbao（小杨生煎）. And I highly recommend the fried xiaolongbao.
