The restaurant offers very authentic Shanghai food at a reasonable price. I like the fried rice with sautéed meat and Yanduxian. Definitely will recommend to my friends.
Very authentic shanghai food. Decent dining environment and friendly staff. I dined in this time but their delivery is really good as well.

One of my go-to Chinese eateries in the town, reasonable cost with great nourishment. Normally the hold up isn't excessively long and the administration is neighborly. Suggest for an easygoing lunch or supper

TS offers the best pan-fried pork buns in the city - though not exactly the same as the ones in Shanghai, it is way better than China Blue, Shanghai Heping Restaurant which only serve fakers. I have to admit that not every course here is perfect, but the style is typical shanghai. All the mains - buns, fried rice, noodles are strongly recommended! Ribs are fine but I have reservation regarding veggie courses.

Came in on a Thursday night around 6:30pm and it was PACKED, but luckily we were able to get seats. Right off the bat, the place looked really cool. It was colorful and bright and the design felt thoughtful and appropriate for the cuisine. The menu was a bit of a mess to navigate, but we found the dishes we wanted. We got soup dumplings, salted duck, pork rib soup with radish, bok choy with tofu skin and osmanthus flower with rice ball dessert. The price of the food is way more than I would normally pay at a restaurant in Chinatown, but the flavor and service at the restaurant made up for it. The soup dumplings were hot and juicy and had a hint of sweetness to the soup. The duck was clean and easy to eat, minimal mess with the bones. The rib soup was just like how mom makes it, so extra points there and the bok choy with tofu skin was fresh and clean too. Our waitresses were also on top of the water, warm lemon water, perfect for the cold day outside. We finished it off with the rice ball soup which was slightly sweet and very warm, a very refreshing dessert. It was a good experience, definitely a good date spot, but personally not the kind of restaurant I would visit regularly.

Came back tonight with my friends for party of 6. We ordered Wuxi rips, Xiaolong Bao, Pan fried soup dumplings, boiled green vegetables, dry-fried green beans, salted meat and vegetable rice, famous assorted soup, and a desert with alcohol! We were so full and satisfied! Best dinner party ever! Wish they had more dessert options (owner said dessert menu was not completely ready at the moment). Average price per dish was under $10! The boiled green vegetable was recommended by the waitress. They used chicken broth with Ceder nuts. It was so delicious and a delightful surprise. The Wuxi Rips and Xiaolong Bao were as great as the first time. We were fighting for the rips! Will come back with more friends when school starts.
The place is fantastic. Very traditional Shanghai food vs. everywhere else only serving Sichuan food... they have outdoor seating which feels safe. Friendly staff

Very authentic Shanghai cuisine, not expensive but have good decorations and flavors. Would recommend to people who are interested in authentic Shanghai food. Their Wax Ribs are absolutely the must-try.

It's a nice little restaurant. Service was better than average Chinese restaurant. As for the food, it's just average for someone who are from Shanghai or surrounding regions, but it is better than average Shanghai restaurants in US. We had the crabmeat soup dumpling. The fillings were ok but the covers were too thick. The wu xi pork rib was not sweet enough. And the soup in the ao zao soup noodle lack in flavor.

I don't normally leave reviews on Yelp, but when we found this place to have no wait, we decided we would try it. I lived in Taiwan for two years (non-consecutively) so I'm a picky person when it come to Xiao Long Bao. I was honestly blown away by the flavor of the steamed XLB. Yes, I suppose it might be a bit sweeter than others' but the flavor of the soup in these dumplings is bar none. I enjoyed them so much I ordered a second batch. Absolutely delicious, and I will be coming here for all my XLB in NYC for the future!!!
No comment

My boyfriend, two friends, and I came here for a nice traditional Christmas meal, and we were astounded by the high quality of the food. My favorite was the delectable, sweet, and savory Wuxi pork. I also loved the juicy soup dumplings, and I even tried a sour fish soup with pickles that turned out to be excellent. The service was good, too. Overall, we had a great time!! Merry Christmas!
No comment

The Wuxi and Shanghai food here are so authentic and delicious. As a girl whose hometown is in Jiangsu province, this place really amazed me. Recommend: Drunken chicken Suzhou, west lake fish, Sauté shelled shrimps.

The food was really good here! Delicious ribs, soup dumplings and general tsos chicken. Attentive & friendly service, nice atmosphere and decently priced. This is during the soft opening so I can imagine it will only get better from here!
Best and most authentic Chinese food from Zhejiang/Jiangsu region love the place so much that brings me back to my hometown
Loved eating here today. Clean, excellent tasting food. Only issue is not too much pork free items. Would otherwise come back.

Tipsy Shanghai is an authentic Chinese restaurant. It is a cliché that an indication of a Chinese restaurant's authenticity is the proportion of Asian patrons. This restaurant is popular with Chinese customers. The cuisine and service are excellent; prices are moderate. The music is pleasant and at a low volume (important factors for me). I particularly recommend the "signature dishes," such as the steamed dumpling appetizer, which are called Steamed Pork Xiaolongbao, and the Wuxi Pork Ribs entree. The wait staff are friendly, courteous and helpful. I highly recommend Tipsy Shanghai.

One of the best experiences I have had for Chinese food in the city. The restaurant was clean and the decor was beautiful, and the food traditional with a modern twist--exactly what I was looking for. I highly recommend the orange beef, garlic eggplant, and fried rice. The waiters were also great and very accommodating....all in all, a must-go for Chinese food in NY!
Love this place!!! My friend is a regular here and he loves this place so much. Love their spare ribs and soup dumplings. Definitely get these.
The food is four stars, above average. The pricing is okay for what they serve. Would be better if the staff would be more professional.
This is the best 江浙菜 in Manhattan! I really love it and am glad to find this spot so that I don't have to go to Flushing for good food!

Tipsy Shanghai is one of my defacto places for Chinese food in the Village. They have a large selection of Chinese soups (with the pork and daikon soup being my favorite). They also excel at less healthy options, including General Tso's chicken (deliciously crispy) and fried, meaty dumplings (which I prefer over their oddly sweet xiao long baos).

So freaking good. In terms of authentic Chinese food in Manhattan, I'd say this place is definitely top 10. They've put a ton of thought into both the decor and menu, making this restaurant and its offering easily accessible by all. There was another location in FiDi but this location just recently opened up and I highly recommend it.

My friend and I ordered beef noodles, pan fried buns, and wonton soup. They are all so delicious. They use thin noodles for the beef noodles, and the noodles have a great texture: not too soft and they stay chewy for the entire course of the meal. The pan fried buns are the best! The meat inside is so juicy and delicious. The soup for the wonton soup is chicken broth, which has great flavor. Overall, a great experience!
The food taste really delicious. The service is really nice. Waitress Jimmy is really nice and friendly

Very authentic Shanghainese cuisine. Service is attentive and welcoming and food is top-notch. Not a fan of how sweet the soup dumpling is but everything else make up for it. Get the Wuxi Pork Rib, it's sooo good! Have been coming back at least a handful of times since I discovered this little gem so close to WSP and will definitely be coming back more.

The food here is delicious. I first came here couple days ago for a beef stew noodle and a Pan Fried Xiaolongbao, they were absolutely amazing. The Pan fried Xiaolongbao was savory and juicy every bite. And now I brought my friends back here again, and enjoyed it once again. I would definitely recommend this place.

This restaurant has some of the best dumplings I've ever had. The soup dumplings were to die for, and their signature Wuxi ribs were fantastic too! I definitely recommend this restaurant, they have a friendly staff and comfortable ambiance.

Probably the best shanghainese place in New York. Can't really go wrong with anything here...try their Wuxi rib, soup dumplings, bok choy, and spicy beef..everything is light on oil and sugar etc but tastes so good..
Ordered drunken chicken, gluten, red cooking pork. very authentic.
Very authentic Shanghainess food, would recommend Wuxi pork ribs, my favorite dish. had a great time hanging out with my friends
Very nice and authentic Chinese food. The portion sizes were pretty good for lunch time too. The dumplings were a little sweeter than I would have expected but overall very tasty!!
No comment

I like the noodle here. It's very authentic and home style. The taste is gentle and comfortable. I feel like I am returning my hometown. Especially the price is pretty reasonable comparing other Chinese cuisine restaurants in NYC.

As someone born and raised in Nanjing, I have to say: this place is so delicious and authentic. Every signature dish was made on point and tasted just like home. Thank you so much for bringing legit Huai Yang cuisine to New York.
Very good. Authentic. Like dessert and salted duck. Great place to get things from my hometown but can never be found elsewhere in NYC
It's a really good Shanghai restaurant near New York University. The food is super!!!! The environment is good!!! It's really a lovely place for students and faculties to enjoy their lunch
This is great! Came here on a Saturday night. Service was good and got to try plenty on the menu. Would recommend the Xiao Long Bao and the noodles

This restaurant is super close to NYU's campus and the staff is super sweet. The food is reasonably priced and tastes really good! Their lunch specials are crafted well and Id definitely come here for comfort food.
No comment

For a soft opening these guys are doing a great job! The ribs were especially good and it was a great priced place!! Also Jin was the cutest, nicest, most attentive waitress ever. She honestly took the experience to the next level. I lived in China for a few years, and my friends and I went here to try the newest 中国菜 in the village and reminisce about our past lives there. The decor is nice, and I just really loved those ribs, gotta say that again. So yummy.
Excellent new restaurant with great service on a busy Saturday.  I recommend the soup dumplings and ribs.  Shanghainese food is excellent but seemingly rare, so check this place out.
No comment
Very authentic Shanghainese food. Strongly recommended dishes: anything with crab meet. Noodles. Braised pork belly. Bamboo shoots

Amazing food and excellent location! It should be the best choice to enjoy Chinese food, especially Shanghai style food for NYU students and faculty. I really love the Aozao noodles. The soup dumplings are quite amazing because it is a little bit sweet which makes it different from soup dumplings from other restaurants. The best Chinese noodles and soup dumplings in NYC! Next time I would like to try Wuxi rib and Dongpo pork which looks so good. And thanks for the opening discount!

This place is super nice! Very authentic shanghainese food and very good service! Also the environment and decoration is good. Price is reasonable. If u wanna try good shanghainese style food, come to tipsy Shanghai

It is a great restaurant that I usually went to when I was working at Wall Street. After they move to the new place, I tried it again today. They are still great with good quality food, delicious favor and very friendly welcome . Will definitely come back again.

Beautiful decor and excellent service. But the food was not authentic... it felt like they were trying to make the pan-Shanghai style food with a Cantonese chef. We had a good experience there, but probably wouldn't come back.
I come to this restaurant all the time. The food is authentic and the service is very warm too. Usually no wait and they have good lunch specials.
No comment
Really enjoyed this new discovery. Great xiao lum bao, hot and sour, babao la jiang and great service
I really like this place, the have my hometown food 扬州煮干丝。I always come with friends and family!

Came here with a friend for lunch, for the lunch special (Monday-Friday 11:30am-3:00pm).  Very affordable and you get a solid variety of food for the amount of money you pay.  If I recall correctly the two options are: appetizer, entree, and dumplings or appetizer, entree, dumplings, and veggies.  The dumplings were very delicious, but the noodles were a little underwhelming.  Overall a pretty solid experience, very cozy atmosphere and good service.  The interior is very pretty and pleasant.  If you are looking for a quick bite of chinese food around Washington Square Park this place will fullfill your needs.
No comment
This is a really good restaurant! The food is authentically Shanghainese restaurant. I feels like going back to Shanghai and eating the food that grandma cooks for me. Hahahahahahahahaha
This is my favorite Shanghai restaurant in town. We love the braise ball soup. It is so delicious reminds of my childhood memory.....

I'd say this is my favorite Shangainese/Zhejiang/Jiangsu restaurant in New York among a few restaurants that market themselves as such. I especially love their wonton soup and stir-fry rice cakes -- taste close to what it's supposed to be. Just avoid all the fish dishes.

Food is quite authentic Southeasten Chinese Style. If you are looking for Shanghai or Jiangsu cuisines, I would recommend this restaurant. The seasonal dishes are highly recommended because of the fresh vegetables they are using.

Wonderful food! Ordered braised chopped pork ball in vegetable soup, boiled shredded dry bean curd w/ chicken and shrimp, and pan fried pork xiaolongbao. They use high quality pork and the flavor is very authentic!
Good Chinese place at a convenient location. One of the most close-to-genuine Shanghai cuisines.
great experience, food is reallly good. I really like their buns, and soup is light good for health guy
Dishes are not so good as Little Valley and China Blue, where you can get really typical Shanghai food. The service is good though.
Been coming here for nearly two years now while a student, really great food! Love the xiao longbaos most of all.
Very authentic Shanghai cuisine. Healthy and delicious, make me homesick. I can come here and eat every single meal, lol
Great place to get real Chinese food. I come here frequently. Their lunch special menu is great value. I recommend the XiaoLongBao here.
The rice cake and the Shanghai dumpling are super good, we like them a lot. And the service here is good, the people here are very nice. The environment here is good too. Recommend it!

To start with, this place's interior decoration is on point, making the restaurant very expensive looking. Surprisingly, the price is very reasonable and the portion is good. Everything we ordered was authentic and delicious. The service is really good and the restaurant provide complimentary dessert for the mid-autumn festival! Highly recommend this place to people who are looking for shanghaiese cuisine!!
Juice dumplings are in good flavor. Clean and friendly.  Will come back again. It is in low level of building but it is still easy to find.
The braised pork belly is bit on the sweeter side, and a bit too fatty for my liking. This being said, the service is good and the food is decent overall. Definitely a place that worths coming back.

Three star for good Shanghai food. But, the offering amount is so small.... Just like sushi offering. I won't be here again because $30/person is not full. But $30 spending could have equal or better value meals in same level restaurant.

The steamed soup buns here are to die for! Hands down the best soup dumplings I've ever had in NYC. The decorations were peculiar and very interesting to look at. There were even USB wall outlets everywhere which made it easy for me to charge my phone, plus the staff were super friendly. Can't wait to come back and order more xiao long baos. I totally recommend trying the food here!
No comment
No comment
Very authentic Shanghainese food place and their price is very reasonable. Visited 3+ times already
Very delicious!! I like the Chinese food here and the environment is great! A great place to hang out with friends!

Tasty Shanghai cuisine. Never close during Christmas. If you wish to visit them often, register a membership and they will offer you a 10% discount from the second order. About $25 per person. Recommend: 小籠包、陽春麵、水晶蝦仁、左宗棠雞、奧灶面. One bad thing: 小楊生煎 is very different with the ones I had in Shanghai.
Authentic Chinese food! The fishes with pickled cabbage  is super delicious
You must try it. The most authentic shanghai food in Manhattan. Must try the xiaolong bao

I really like the food here. They have great Chinese traditional food. The restaurant looks great inside. The decoration is very fancy. If you like Chinese food, you should come here often! I ordered Yangzhou fried rice and it tasted amazing
One of my favorite Chinese restaurants in NY. Very cozy environment, nice service. Pretty authentic Wuxi dishes offered. The price is also very reasonable.

I passed by this restaurant last week and thought it might be a nice place for me and my sister to try for our hang out today. However, we order the noodle soup with the salty duck and the vegetables (can't remember the name of the veggies). My sister was quite satisfied with her noodle except the salty duck. It wants what we expected. The meat that cut down was all the bad part of the duck. We will not recommend this place to our friends next time.
First time here for a group party. Elegant environment, delicious foods, especially the fish and ribs!!
Went to restaurant for a friend's birthday and it was really tasty!!! We had the rice cakes and Shanghai dumplings. Those were our favorites! Tasty restaurant and good price! :)
Love the famous Assorted Soup, the pork belly is not greasy, meat ball with tofu skin is good too!    Very authentic
Absolutely awesome food and the decor is so nice too. Right in the heart of NYU. Real authentic Shanghai regional food.
The wontons are really good. Service is great and the environment is really good. Price is also fair. Near to NYU. Good place to have lunch.
No comment
I especially like Yuxiangrousi. The food is delicious and tasty. Also, it is affordable. Highly recommend!
Just have a dinner with friends. Pleasant atmosphere, friendly people. Quick service. Food is delicious and mild since I ordered a lot veges. But they serve you with small plates.
No comment
Absolutely stunning. The wu xi pai gu was exquisite and made me feel like I was ascending to  another spiritual plane. Who needs a girlfriend when you have wu xi pai gu?!??
This is my third time here. Good here is Very delicious. Very authentic shanghai cuisine. Will come back again.

I came across this restaurant while visiting family at NYU and was truly amazed by the quality of the food. The food was very authentic and service was very friendly. The 盐水鸭 and 酸菜鱼 were  especially good and better than most restaurants I've visited in China. Overall, highly recommend this place!
Went there for a lunch. The food was not so special but the xiaolongbao was decent. The cons is that the service is very slow.
Good ambience and service. The food was tasty, but people should understand this is not a place for salty and spicy food.
Traditional Su Hang food. Didn't really find anything spicy. The rib soup is pretty good.

Pretty good place, recommend it shen-jian and hong-shao-rou. The price is reasonable as well. They also have private dinning room, which is good for party and people who value private of their conversation.

This modern authentic Chinese restaurant has great food and decor. Walking by I was worried about the prices, but their dishes are all reasonably priced for the high quality and authentic Shanghai flavored meal. We had the Xiao long bao, eggplant with mushrooms, and beef noodle soup that came within 5-10 mins. Wait staff were extremely courteous. Would definitely recommend to a friend!
Delicious orange beef, yummy vermicelli noodles, and tasty dessert!  The service is excellent and it's such a great way to spend a relaxing evening in the city! WOW

Terrible restaurant and service.  Speaking about  delivery only.  Ordered food at 8:30 PM.  There were no updates for over 2 hours and had the delivery cancelled on me at 11PM.  This is not the way a restaurant should conduct business.  The worst service, and there are better establishments in the neighborhood.
This is the most amazing Shanghai food I have met in New York! You must not miss the baozi and noodle here! I will definitely come back again!

I ordered Crucian with scallion and osmanthus flowers with rice ball soup. It was fresh and delicious. I enjoyed the environment, and the waitress (Vicky) was friendly and able to help with my questions about the menu. Highly recommend you try them out.
Delicious, healthy dishes. The waitress taught me to use my soup spoon to catch the juice that escapes the yummy dumplings when you bite into them.
Must-go shanghai food in Manhattan! Friendly and quick service. Food really authentic and tasty. Sometimes they offer seasonal menu. Must try crystal shrimp(水晶虾仁).
Great restaurant, very authentic. I'm Shanghainese and I definitely feel like home whenever I come here. Really recommend all the dishes
Great dishes, reasonable price and good service. Not too loud inside with good decor. Would come back.
Easy to find, good environment, delicious food. Wuxi pork ribs pan fried xiaolongbao are my favorites! definitely will come back again!
Very good shanghai restaurant with nice staff and tasty dish. I recommend this place!

This is one of my favorite place to eat out around NYU. When I don't know what to eat, I always like to  go there. Both the food and service are excellent. Definitely try the restaurant if you like Chinese food.

y'all... I've lived in Hong Kong all my life and have spent a summer in Shanghai studying abroad, the waiters here are the absolute sweetest and this restaurant has the menu that makes my heart so full for food back home. Their soup dumplings are a STEAL for $5.95 and is probably the best broth I've had in New York City. Yes, it's a little sweet, and the skin is a little thick, but if you want "high class perfect Chinese soup dumplings" just go to a 酒樓 in midtown or the soup dumplings place on St Mark's that'll give you that with the appropriate higher price tag. Tipsy Shanghai though is so homey. Will become a regular here for the rest of the time I'm here in NYC.
The food was so good! Love the baozi!!!!!!!!!!!! I brought my bf here today to celebrate his birthday and they offered him a free bill on his part!
Overpriced! No rice! Small amount of food! Purchased $23.24, but I'm not full. Won't order again!
Very good experience here! The food is great and I'd definitely come again. I highly recommend the soup dumplings and pork ribs for anyone coming.
Food was quite good! I got quite a few things and not having paid an arm and a leg for it. It's reasonably priced for New York standards. The location is nice, and its a nice decor as well.
Super disappointed with the xlb here as it tastes way too sugary like a dessert. Definitely a bad recipe here. Besides that the noodles were really small portioned. Overall not worth.
The home made spicy souse tastes really good. I like the yangchun noodle and xiaoyang shengjian.
Super yummy! Reminds me of the real, good Chinese food in China! Chinatown ones mostly are just like fast-food version chinese food(lame). This restaurant is aweeeeeeeesome!
No comment
I have never been to Chinese restaurant that serves with such small portion. Also the dishes are bit too sweet. I am from Hangzhou, this place's food is not a good representation of my hometown food.
This is my third time here. Perfect place to hang out with friends. Delicious authentic Chinese food but also laowai friendly. The vibe is great and decor is nice.
The food is amazingly authentic! Feeling at home back in China! Location is good, very close to W4 and NYU. If you are a big fan of southern Chinese food, I highly recommend you to come here!

An authentic Shanghainese place. We ordered a couple of Shanghainese dishes, such as the braised pork ribs, braised fish and fried pork buns. All of them taste good. I guess I will come back and try more
First time being here, and the food tasted great! Service was fast and friendly and all of the food was reasonably priced. Definitely coming back soon.

Tried today but it's really disappointing. The one star is for the nice decor but that's about it. Food is very salty. The waitress was rude. We two only ordered one entree to share because we were too full. The waitress gave us the usual Shanghai attitude of looking down on u because we only ordered one entree. "Dog eyes looking down on people."

Came here on a Tuesday night with my boyfriend for dinner after seeing this place on Instagram. Ordered the fried pork soup dumplings, auntie fish stew, and the shredded pork. Overall was very impressed with the freshness, flavor, and price! Would definitely come again
Great Shanghainese restaurant with classic vibes. Would definitely come back with friends!
It's hard to find authentic Shanghainese food in Manhattan. Glad that I found this place. Waitress are all very friendly. I'll definitely come back.
Delicious food and excellent service. Will come back again soon! Make sure to get the soup dumplings.
Very traditional Shanghai food. I love their pan fried pork buns drunken chicken and sweet sour ribs

Coming from the region that represents this cuisine, all dishes taste really good, especially the Wuxi Pork Chops and the Dongpo Pork. We wanted to get the stir-fried shrimp but they ran out of stock today. Guess that dish is pretty popular too.
The food is so authentic and delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant. The noodles the soup and xiaolongbao are so good. The food is healthy for sure!
delicate and authentic south east Chinese dishes. highly recommend rice wine and ask them help you warm it.
One of my favorite Chinese restaurants! One of my favorites is the pork rib and fish. Salted duck is also very delicious. The environment is faltering and quite. Good place for date.
One of my favorite Chinese places downtown. I come here weekly since they have more authentic flavors compare to other Chinese places. Highly recommended if u are looking for real Chinese food.

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: I feel like I'm addicted to the place. The Wuxi pork rib lives up to the expectation. They made the noodle themselves in the spring noodle, so it's also super good!

This place has very good service. The decoration is  nice. The food is authentic. I have been here multiple times. The most amazing thing is that they have Yin Er Gen and Cai Fan (cooked in real Shanghai style!), which is not available in many Shanghainese restaurant. I will give this restaurant five star.

The ribs was very tender however a bit costly, the wine chicken was not a lot of wine compared to others I've tasted but still good, the soup dumplings soup had a nice tad of sweet, the noodles soup was homey but I don't prefer the noodles they use, the hot and sour soup was hearty and good.
The food here is amazing. Very authentic Southern Chinese dishes. Try the shrimp and pork rib!
I went for a meal alone and the waiters were super friendly! It was also very nice and quiet
Foods are very mediocre. The dumplings are even not good as good as those I got from Trader Joe's. Service is not good either. I don't get any reason of giving higher rating.

Cute little place with great decor and ambiance. We split two types of soup dumpling (try the crab!!), short ribs, and beef noodle soup. Would be a great place for a group to come and split a bunch of things as well

Stumbled upon this Chinese restaurant near my apartment and I am so glad that I did!!! It's hands down the best Chinese restaurant in the area and maybe in the entire city. The food is delicious, authentic, and super affordable. The service is amazing as well. Can't ask for much else from Tipsy Shanghai...I'm definitely going to be a regular here.

We ordered Spring Noodles, braised beef noodles, Wuxi pork ribs and crab dumplings. The noodles dishes were very tasty, the broths were flavorful and the noodles had a nice texture. Would go back for the noodles. Our waiter Jimmy was very attentive and friendly.

I live in the neighborhood and was so happy to see this place open up. I feel like most Chinese restaurants are Cantonese or Sichuan so it's nice to have somewhere that serves traditional Shanghainese food. So far I've tried the pan fried pork buns, the minced pork noodles, sauteed string beans, and a few other specials - all of them tasting very authentic. Definitely recommend!

The exquisite fitments was impress me, the interval of tables are just right .We order the wuxi rids, they was totally surprise me. Some of dishes are not exactly look like what we see in the menu, but the food still tasty.
First time here, food is delicious here and authentic, good place to go with friends!
Great food, I had the Spring noodles and it was very tasty and comforting. Price is on par with other restaurants in the area. Would definitely come back!
Tiny portions, inattentive service, mediocre taste. No real reason to come here when there are options in Chinatown which are much better value.

Probably one of the best "real" Chinese cuisine since Joe's Shanghai, everything we ordered were spot on, they didn't adjust any flavor into any kinds of western styles, the soup dumplings and tofu are my favorites, we hope that we can ordered one more fried dumplings but we were full, definitely will come back really soon!

Had a late lunch and it was quite tasty Shanghainese regional food. My wife had a chicken broth noodle soup dish and we shared had several appetizers (xiao long boa soup dumplings, deep fried dumplings, and the Wuxi spare ribs). All were pretty good/decent (be prepared that the dumplings are really hot and can burn your tongue though). My favorite is the Wuxi spare ribs which are very sweet and tender. For those familiar with Shanghainese cuisine, it's similar to hongshao rou but better, IMO.
this place is bomb，if u want to experience authentic Chinese food definitely come here
No comment
No comment
No comment

A self-service Chinese restaurant with a decently sized sitting area. It is a fast-food style in that you order at the back of the restaurant, pick up your own food and tidy up afterwards, and thus they also do not accept tips. Got a bowl of rice noodles with stew beef on mild spicy, well cooked beef and noodles, the broth is relatively light - but I actually liked it, especially on mild spicy it is comfy and warm, but not so rich that would be heavy on your stomach. Would be a great comfort food choice for a weekend lunch.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had lunch with my co-workers at this place nearby to our office. Even though I got a mild rice noodle soup, it was still hilariously spicy which definitely speaks to the authenticity of the place. The food was delicious and a good size portion!

All week I've been trying dumplings out from different places near my job. Even though it took a while to come out I wasn't disappointed. The plating needed some work though. I was really happy it came with 6 pieces.
Omg .............  Found plastic inside the dumplings that I ordered   please be mindful!!!
No comment
No comment

We got takeout for dinner and the food came insanely fast. I got the braised beef rice bowl and my friend got the braised pork bowl. Food was solid and the beef was super tender. I'll keep this short but sweet.
No comment
No comment

Delicious and authentic Hunan style rice noodles! I have only gotten takeout here but they've always been quick and reliable. I usually get the dry mix egg and pepper noodles (medium spicy, which is still plenty spicy) which makes for a great lunch or small dinner, it's a nostalgic and comforting meal.

I got the pork and vegetables noodles and the food was ok ! The broth was alright but seemed to be lacking a bit of depth in flavor and the meat and veggies stir fry was standard. The food came out quick and could definitely see myself coming once in a while if wanting a quick bite.
No comment

Delicious quick service Chinese spot. The restaurant has a fun vibe and was pretty busy for a Sunday night. I got the stir fried chicken with chili paste and I opted to not have the chili paste but spicy warning: even the mild is pretty hot! It was really delicious and filling and I would definitely recommend for a quick and easy dinner.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I ordered take out from Silky Kitchen and absolutely loved the food. I tried their hot & sour fish soup noodles, hunan style sauteed beef, and stir fried string beans. The portions were good and the food had just the perfect amount of flavor. The prices were also pretty reasonable for a restaurant in Manhattan. I can't wait to come back to try other items on their menu sometime in the future!

This place is the perfect example of why NYC has the best eats in the country.  Just 10 years ago, it would have been impossible to find this style of Hunan fast casual like you would have in Taiwan or Beijing.  Tasty, relatively healthy.  Nice balance.  You walk out of there feeling like you are ready for anything.
3.75 stars. Very little seating during 2021.  Mostly was sectioned off for staff.  Beef was a bit hard and dry.

Loved the spot. Quiet restaurant tucked away from the busy bustling area of Union Square. Food is delicious and comes out fast. Dumplings were great with chilli oil. Great spot for quick, delicious, inexpensive meal.
No comment
No comment
No comment
这条我一定要用中文写！！所有国内来的朋友都不要错过这家，感觉一秒回到高中时期逃晚自习去吃的那家粉，是的，是怀念的味道，是十六岁的我在重庆嘈杂的背街小巷享受青春年华的味道！而且我之前只是随便在谷歌搜了一下去哪里吃，没有看任何推荐，以为只是一家美式中餐，没想到居然会这么惊艳，后来连续吃了好几次也完全不踩雷！！而且信价比好高，求求你们都去吃！不吃后悔一辈子！太好吃了，我的天！

Super overpriced and subpar. Thought it would be kind of Sichuanish, but it's basic and bland, like food court Chinese, and very expensive. There's not much variation from dish to dish -- lots of celery and tasteless oily sauce.

Highly recommend the braised beef noodle soup. The beef is so chunky, tender, and juicy. It melts in my mouth literally. I also added some vinegar in here to have an extra kick. Great price point too since they do give you a lot of beef.

Their shrimp, chive and pork dumplings were delicious and juicy. I would definitely reorder but I would pass on the beef noodle soup. The beef was not tender at all. The beef was so difficult to chew. The broth of the soup had great flavor though.
Very authentic Hunan food, taste really good! Especially the rice noodles. Definitely will come back again for that.

It was so so delicious. The veggies taste so fresh and crunchy, and the beef is really good!! It's pretty spicy though and I only got medium so be wary. The workers were also so kind! 10/10 Recommend.

Okay, I've eaten silky kitchen two days in a row and plan to continue ordering from here. I got the Hunan style beef with dry noodle, which aren't dry at all and have an oily and smoky grill taste which is heavenly. I ordered mines Mild but there is still a good kick to them, like Spicy Hotpot level spice and even resembles that flavor of chili. The serving size lasted me two days and the greens and bok choy on top was superb. I ordered the shrimp, pork and chives dumplings today and was not disappointed at all. 5/5 totally recommend and don't be a wuss abt the spice.
No comment
Bright, clean , fast casual but super authentic bowls. Spicy! Hot & Sour veg was as advertised especially hot red and green peppers. Fish Soup fresh and flavorful. Excellent stir fried string beans.
No comment

Silky Kitchen has a fun menu offering a variety of noodles served either dry or soup-based. The noodles are decent and the available spiciness levels cater to different taste buds. I'd skip the dumplings as they are quite underwhelming.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow! Outstanding. Had the S9 - Stir Fried Egg with Pepper. Went with soup noodles. Just delicious. Definitely has a kick even when ordered up as mild. Also enjoyed D3 - Squash, Mushroom & Tofu. Great with the sesame oil, vinegar and soy sauce. Quick and tasty. Highly recommend.
Love this spot! One of my go-to takeout restaurants. The Chairman Mao's Favorite Braised Pork is a must get. Closest to my Grandma's that I've had!
No comment
Tasty,  fresh food, very cozy and clean place.  Our family really enjoyed the dinner.  Stew beef and Pepper beef noodles were amazing
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Very glad they are open. Yummy noodles like always. I got chairman Mao noodles in soup - extra spicy ; and they delivered. Huge portion - impossible to finish in one sitting.
No comment
No comment
Excellent food - hunan tofu is fresh, hot, wonderfully spiced! The staff are always accommodating and enthusiastic! Noodles are delicious and broth is flavorful!
Tasty food, although the overwhelming majority of it was celery.  Additionally, the price for lunch was a little on the high side for what you get and the ambience of the cafeteria style eatery.
No comment

Delivery ONLY - I can always count of Silky Kitchen for affordable, yet delicious noodles. I love how there are many ingredients in their dishes that average ~$12. The delivery is always quick and the  people super friendly during drop off.

Waited for 20+ minutes in the store for a pick up order that I placed 10 minutes before arriving the store. They made other orders that are all placed after me, and there were no updates while I waited, and I had to go check on the status myself. My order was only made after notifying them..... This is ridiculously slow and horrible service.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I did takeout from here during COVID, and it was a great experience. I walked in, and you place an order through the Seamless app. I got the "dry" beef noodles, and the wait was only around 10-15 minutes. The noodle texture was good, and I'm actually glad I did not get the broth since I think it would have taken away some of the spicy flavor I liked with these noodles. I also took this to eat at Stuy Park nearby, and the dry noodles were the easiest to eat. I noticed a sign after I was leaving that showed steamed rice rolls (?), so if I were to go again I would definitely ask about that. The space seemed very clean and the person who helped us with our order was also very nice.
No comment

Loved the pork and pickled vegetable noodle soup!! I got it spicy but probably could've gone extra spicy... I like heat from real chilies!!! This place brings it w flavor.  The pork dumplings were also good.  Everything had flavor.  Relatively clean and not too oily for Chinese take out too!

Delicious! Silky Kitchen does not disappoint. The staff are quick and very nice. I ordered the Hunan Beef with dry mix noodles and an extra coddled egg. I also ordered the dish in medium spicy. The Hunan spice really does hit you and the peppers are not to be played around with!! It is really spicy and I usually can take the heat, but found myself drinking over 4 cups of water! Delicious though, just know if you order the spice that you will get the spice! The noodles, beef, and egg were all done perfectly!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We got the braised beef dry noodle bowl with pickled bean toppings on the side. The noodles were the right amount of tenderness and not too mushy. It was very flavorful with a combo of spicy, sour, and savory. I did feel the price was pricier than I was used to for the quantity given but besides that, it was a yummy experience.
Great meal every time. Food is so hot, and spicy and delicious. Served very fast. Very authentic, i have gone here numerous times.
No comment
food was close to inedible. Noodles were so oily we couldn't pick it up with a fork. Flavors were sort of there but the oil diluted everything. Had to throw it out.
No comment

Had high hopes for their Mao's favorite braised pork, since the reviews are stellar. I can understand why it's not authentic Hunan food (a rare find these days); growing up eating Hunan food, I was quite shocked when I saw that the dish was an odd pink color as opposed to a rich soy sauce braised color. Taste is all right. Not the best bang with your buck.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Came here for a bowl of noodles. Got the hunan spicy beef and it was absolutely delicious. Will come back to try the other items they offer!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Okay taste - but why did I get a bowl of cut noodles that couldn't be picked up by chopsticks, fork, or spoon? Couldn't finish because it took me half an hour to get halfway through the bowl, one...noodle...at...a...time.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've gotten taken out from here twice. The first time was really good. I got the dry beef noodle with a soft boiled  egg on the side. However, yesterday I got takeout from here and it was trash. I got the the pork and peppers over rice. It tasted super inauthentic and it was really oily. They were also pretty light on portion size (i.e. meat to white rice ratio), which translates into 75% rice and 25% meat. I get it, times are tough out here for restaurants, but you can't have that ratio and expect to survive.

Very solid fast casual Chinese place. They have a "bowl" option with dry noodles, soup noodles or rice. I had the Chariman mao braised pork belly. A lot of more meat than I expected (very pleasantly surprised) and it was quite good. Not that expensive either, would be a really good lunch option. You can choose your spice level (the spicy level is seriously super spicy, the cashier warned us). There are also a few add on options for the bowl. They also have other options like dumplings, side dishes, and a few dessert options. Quite a bit of seating.

I like 米粉 so I have to give 5 stars. So many options and it is very good! I didn't try soup so next time I will try soup rice noodles!

pretty good food, quick service, decent pricing, nice space, good location (especially for nyu students near palladium, 3rd north, uhall, & founders). not mind-blowing by any means but still a great spot to visit over n over again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Simply amazing. Authentic, healthy, and so tasty. If you like spicy, give their "spicy" option a try.
No comment

dumplings were always my love. shrimp, chives, and pork dumplings. Love them all. The dumplings themselves had good flavor. They were seasoned well, crispy drizzle of batter that I saw in some of the other pictures from here, I really liked the dumplings and want to try some more dishes at this place.
No comment

YUM! Second time here and loving this place. I've had the pork liver and now pork and peppers dry style over rice noodle. Rice noodles are silky and tender without being overly soggy. Love that they really don't skimp on the toppings - always a generous serving of meats and veggies. The spice level is pretty high, the medium was making me cry so I would recommend playing it safe. The pork was tender and flavorful and the celery gave it a nice crunch. Mustard greens were a nice addition of flavor as well. Kitchen was nice enough to give me a little bowl of broth when I asked!
I love their dumplings and noodles. I go here every time I need a break from studying. The dumplings are very delicious! I've gotten them a lot of times every time I'm in the city.
No comment

If your a noodle lover (which most people are) then you'll love Silky Kitchen. Their noodles and dumplings are made in house and everything I tried there was really fresh.  I strongly recommend trying their most popular dish judging by all of the photos on fellow yelpers pages is the S1 stewed beef. You can have it over rice or with noodles. It was Hefty, fresh and delicious. The pork and peppers was another good dish just wish they added more meat. The pork and celery dumplings were good also. Heads up if you add chili oil to this dish it's really spicy for those who can only tolerate mild spiciness. Overall it's a solid spot I would go back again.

If you are able to handle the spice level, it's a nice spot. The people who work there are friendly. So it's not the cashier's fault that "medium" was almost unbearably spicy. Almost. I did manage to finish it - after plucking out as many hot peppers as I could find with my chopsticks. So if you're a white girl with a relatively high spice tolerance looking to clear out your sinuses, this is plausible. I personally would have to stick to mild if I came back. The style of rice noodle is not my favorite but that's just my preference, so not something to dock them for.
No comment

This spot just opened in the winter and it's steaming noodles dishes were perfect on a cold rainy April evening. Everything was prepared fresh and had good authentic flavors and ingredient balance, not Americanized sugar coating. I'll definitely be back to try more dishes.
I keep coming back to try more dishes. What's not to love? Hot, spicy soups as the weather starts to cool off, fresh dumplings to round out the soupy goodness

Yummy noodle soups! Came here for an early light dinner with some coworkers. I don't quite remember the name of the dish I ordered, but it came with thick rice noodles along with bok chooy and some grilled pork on the side in a mildly spicy soup. The spiciness added a good kick and the rich pork flavors contrasted nicely with the light noodle and vegetable flavors.
The noodle is good, but the pork is too oily. Overall, it's a nice place but all the dishes are added too much oil
Hunan beef is pretty good seasoned to perfection ratio of cumin and spice. The place is nice for a quick bite for lunch or dinner.
No comment
No comment
Ordered the stewed beef with soup noodles. Tasty meat marinated with enough seasoning and a smooth broth. I wish I had added toppings to mine, next time
They offer very tasty noodles. While prices are a bit high it is very delicious. I had the pork feet noodle and I loved it including the spices. I would recommend this place

I recently visited this spot because I heard great things about it, and it sure didn't disappoint! The noodle soup is a must! I got one with pork belly, and the flavors are relatively authentic. Being Chinese, it hit my flavor palate right on and got me wanting more. I also enjoyed the sweet and sour pork ribs, sautéed veggies, and mapo tofu. The tofu was a little too spicy for me, but the flavors were on point.

Tried silky kitchen for the first time. I ordered S1 - Stewed Beef with Dry Mix Noodles and medium spicy. This place is very efficient. I got my food less than 10 mins after I ordered it. I have to say that stewed beef was very flavorful and good but what kind of noodle do they use? It felt like a bouncy spaghetti noodles. I really didn't appreciate the texture of the noodle. I thought it was all hand made? I don't think noodles were hand made. Don't think I will be returning to this place anytime soon..
No comment
No comment

This was our second time coming here (almost a year apart XD) My friend is from Hunan and she said the rice noodle soup here is very authentic and reminds her of home. I had the hunan style beef rice noodle soup and ordered the extra spicy version. The serving size was very generous and they put a shit ton of beef on top (happy happy). I was very satisfied. Highly recommend this place if you want some cheap eats.

Simon the owner was kind enough to reach out to me, asking me to give Silky Kitchen another try, as their menu has changed since the soft opening. I tried the Hunan fried tofu, chive and shrimp dumplings, beef stew dry noodle, and shredded pork with pickled mustard greens noodle soup. The noodles were definitely much more flavorful. The highlight of the meal was the shredded pork and mustard green noodle soup. The dumplings were delicious as well. I will definitely be returning in the future. Thank you Simon for reaching out to me to give Silky Kitchen another try!
Ordered the Chairman Mao's Favorite Braised Pork, which was a disappointment. Not very well seasoned/the ingredients could be better incorporated into the dish/with each other.

I ordered takeout from here, fantastically authentic Hunan cuisine! The only thing I wish is that they had outdoor seating, other than that the food itself is top notch and I look forward to dining here again!

Fast, delicious food. The beef and daikon dumplings were to die for. I asked the cashier if she recommended those or the shrimp/chive/pork dumplings, and she said said the beef dumplings were juicier. They were some of the best dumplings I've ever had. Also tried the mapo tofu and chicken gizzard with dry noodle. Make sure if you're a first-timer to specify what level of spice you want - the default level of spice my friend got was way too spicy for her.
No comment
Very satisfied with my experience here. Ordered pork and pepper and the food was great. I happened to leave my phone there. The employee kept it safe at the cashier for me to pick up. THANK YOU!!!
No comment
No comment

Wow they really did a good job to create authentic Hunan fast food, it's the first time that I go somewhere in the city and they have food on the level of spicy that would make me teary which proves that it's authentic. The noodles are around $10-$20 which is not bad at all, the portion of the noodles are quite large. If you don't like noodles you can substitute to rice or vegetables. There are a variety of different kinds of flavors to choose from including chicken, beef, pork and vegetables. I had the vegetable noodles and my friend had the chicken noodles, it seemed like his came out spicier than mine although we ordered the same level of spicy. Might be because meats absorb the taste better? They also have plates to share, unfortunately we didn't try that since we became quite full from the noodles.
I got the pork belly (S3) dry with medium spicy and it was plenty spicy and so delicious! Would come back again to try the other things on t
Small and clean restaurant with ample seats. Food is served in a fast manner and it's delicious!!! The pot stickers are pretty good too although they didn't turn gold n town on one side.
No comment
No comment

This place is a hidden gem. The interior of the restaurant is very beautiful. The staff are very friendly and I had the chance to try their beef and daikon dumplings. The moment I bit into one, I could tell these were handmade as they were really juicy and cooked to perfection. The cucumber salad was very refreshing and delicious the cilantro and chopped garlic in the salad really brings the flavor to a different level. The braised pork belly noodles were delicious... I could never have enough of pork belly. The pork belly cut just melted in my mouth, the dish itself had the right amount of spice and was very easy to it.
No comment

I just stopped by for a quick bite, but the dumplings were surprisingly good. I got the shrimp, chives, and pork dumplings. The dumplings themselves had good flavor. They were seasoned well, had good balance between the 3 fillings, and the dough had a pleasant, slightly chewy texture. I wasn't a fan of the thin layer of batter that connected the dumplings together. I'm usually a fan of the crispy drizzle of batter that I saw in some of the other pictures from here, but thin layer of batter I got just tasted like paper. Overall, though, I really liked the dumplings and want to try some more dishes at this place.
Very delicious rice noodles from Hunan! Definitely come back again! Quick. Clean. Friendly.
No comment

once i opened the container, the savory smell of pickled vegetables and pork instantly filled my nose. the smell and visual appeal was too strong so i quickly dug in. it was delicious and reminded me of home. it was until after 2 bites did i realize i forgot to take a picture (so here is a half eaten bowl of noodles.) The noodles were perfectly cooked. they weren't too soggy or hard and they were the perfect vessel for the soup. i ordered s8 and it tasted exactly like the noodles i could get at taiwan. i highly recommend coming here!!
Food was fair, I expected the soup to be more flavorful. It looks good but I've had better before. The fried tofu was good and really soft. Chinatown has the same food and better priced.

Authentic Chinese rice noodle place! So happy I found this place. Mi Fen (rice noodle) is a go to for me and my mom back in China and honestly all the Mi Fen I've tried in NY has been a little bit disappointing. Silky Kitchen makes it perfectly with classic and interesting toppings! Loved the braised pork dry mix Mi Fen and the liver one! Both are so nostalgic for me tasting like food from my mom! The liver is thin sliced and stir fried with different vegetables including peppers so it's more spicy! Still really good tho
A wonderful spot for lunch and dinner! Make sure to try the amazing dumplings and the brown sugar mochi!!!
Tastes really good. I ordered dumplings with Shrimp Chive and pork stuffing, Stir Fried Chicken Noodle soup and Cold Sweet Flower Jelly. The dessert is super refreshing, a must-have.

Can't believe I have not found out about this place sooner. When you order spicy, you will get spicy (not the black pepper type of spice). The food here is amazing and will definitely come back again soon. They also have a variety of sides and drinks!!
I ordered the beef dry mix noodles and, unfortunately, it was very oily and not flavorful at all. Only the beef had some taste, which is a shame, because it's actually quite good.

My friends have been telling me this is the best hunan food in NYC. They weren't wrong! The rice noodle dish is super good with subtle spices (and you're able to adjust spiciness). The cucumber salad appetizer is so refreshing + crispy. The veggie dumplings are some of the best I've ever had in the city, and they're made fresh. I also loved the sweet dessert because it was warm, gooey, and perfect to end a spicy meal. Definitely coming back! The restaurant is fast casual, but there's lots of room to sit - incredibly large space for NYC.

This is a fast causal noodle and dumpling restaurant. The noodle bowl was good, but very one dimensional. It was spicy, but lacked a depth of flavor. Overall the service was very good and the staff was very helpful. The food just lacked the umami.
No comment
No comment
Came for some noodles after a company happy hour. The noodles were pretty good. A little oily, quite spicy. I would come again if I had a hankering for Chinese and was in the area.
Nice little eatery.  Fast service.  Tasty soup, tender noodles, well seasoned and well cooked beef and a nice kick in every bite.  Perfect on a chilly day.

Most affordable yet authentic Chinese restaurant in East Village. Hunan style is similar to Sichuan style but without Sichuan pepper. Both are popular unless you can't handle spicy food at all. Place is very clean and never crowded. Food is always served without waiting for more than 5 minutes. My favorite Chinese restaurant across the city.
That is so amazing!!! I have been addicted on it~hahhh~I eat it every week! One dish contains vegetables, meat and noodles! It values~you have to go there, u deserve it

You're probably walking around Greenwich Village cold and hungry and looking for a warm place to sit and have a bite, if you're still reading step foot into Silky Kitchen and you won't regret it. They serve up authentic Hunan flavors whether that's the noodles or amazing appetizers. I loved their beef noodle soup, tofu appetizer, and string beans. Choose the spicy level from mild to hot, if you're Asian like myself you can handle the regular. The owner Simon is a great guy as well. Get off your phone and enjoy some excellent food here.

I like this restaurant indeed. I ordered hot and sour chicken gizzard noodles, fried tofu and sweet jelly, all of which taste authentic and delicious. I would definitely come here next time I walk around.
No comment

Their rice noodle is pretty good. Pretty authentic Hunan taste. It is really spicy and really tasty. The unsatisfying things is the rice noodle is not chewy enough. Besides, the dumplings are okay, juicy.
Definitely worth the price! I had the dry noodles with  medium spice, and it was just right for my taste (medium is a little too spicy for those who don't eat spice).

Needed something to eat after getting off the subway and noticed this. It decorated nicely and service was great but the food wasn't anything to crave about. Dumpling were the best part. Small portion size.
No comment

I had a great dining experience at Silky Kitchen. I tried the Shrimp, Chives and Pork Dumplings, Hunan Fried Tofu, Hunan Style Sautéed Beef Noodles and Sweet Rice Cake. Everything was super flavorful, fresh and came out in lightning speed. I really enjoyed the service and the food. It was unlike anything I've had at other Asian restaurants. Simon (the owner) was very courteous and helpful with suggestions. I'd definitely go back to try more dishes.

Best rice noddle I had in the city!! I ordered chicken gizzard with sour string beans, pig ears salad and cold sweet flower jelly, just tasted so good! I felt I was eating in Hunan, exactly the same flavor in my memory. If you like rice noddle and especially spicy rice noddle, you should definitely try here.
It was alright. Nothing special if you're not into spicy food. Had the braised pork noodles which was way too fatty
No comment

They made me fall in love with hunan rice noodle! It's so rich and delicious! My only suggestion is that I ordered the least spicy one but it's still pretty spicy. I can imagine that a lot of Americans will think it's too spicy
Got the pork liver with pepper today, it was very good just a bit greasy.  Will try something different next time.

I have to be honest, when I first tried the beef noodle soup, I didn't love the flavor. I thought it was kind of sour and unpleasant. However, when I heated it up and served it piping hot it was DELICIOUS. Something about the flavors become entirely more pleasant and comforting when it's super hot, which is how I imagine it is served when you dine in.

Really delicious spot for a quick and filling lunch. Love the noodle soups! I've tried the beef, chairman mao pork, and the stir fried bamboo shoots with pork - not sure which is my favorite, as they're all delicious. The beef and the bamboo shoots are my usual go-tos though. Highly recommend this place! Note - the spicy is pretty spicy.

Good for go to quick Asian fusion. Ordered the extra spicy Stir Fry Chicken w Chili paste over rice. Was very delicious and lived up to the spice. This would be a good quick sit down spot during the week. Food was cooked fresh with good flavor. The staff was quick with the order and the prices are reasonable for the amount of food. Overall would be back to try other menu options
No comment

I'm so happy to have found authentic Hunan food in Union square!  Cute restaurant, efficient services, delicious food at great prices.  You can choose whether you want noodles with or without soup or rice with your entree.  We tried the beef stew, braised pork ribs with brown sauce and stir fried chicken with chili paste.  We also had sides of mapo tofu, string beans and cucumber salad. Can't wait to go back to try their dumplings!
No comment

My wife Debbie and I ate a wonderful dinner at Silky Kitchen. The simple surroundings are misleading as the food was delicious and made to order. I highly recommend this restaurant for terrific Hunan cuisine!! We'll be back again and again!!
No comment

Cute new spot by Union Square. Plenty of seating, so I would def recommend coming with a group of friends! Casual dining. The beef dumpling were delicious! The original order comes with 6, but just for $1 more you can add 2 more dumplings...great deal! We also had stir fried chicken with red chili oil soup. Was going to go mild, but the girl recommended medium if we were fans of spice (which we are!). It was far too spicy. It got to the point that we couldn't even enjoy it, which was a bummer. They tried to fix it by adding some broth, but it didn't really help. All in all, I would def go back! Thanks silky kitchen!

The food was really good and they place bomb af music. The only ting was I had a really bad stomach ache like 2-3 hours later. Idk what happened but it was defs the food
I thought this place was a bit overhyped - good food but nothing incredible like the reviews make it seem.
No comment
Hands down amazing food!! My usuals are the hot and sour fish soup, the pepper pork with rice and the woodear mushroom salad!

Solid rice noodle place with generous servings and great flavors! Be careful though that the dishes here are quite spicy. I can usually handle spicy foods quite well (think the most spicy option for xi'an famous foods with extra chilli oil), but I thought the regular spicy level here was actual above that.
Really authentic food, big portion, and not too expensive. Very clean and great service.

The food is pretty good here. One of the few places that has authentic homemade noodles. I think they have the potential to go big like Xi'an famous food. I only hope they start investing in permanent bowls and utensils. Having to use plastic everything is a big put off.
In the area and found this Authentic Hunan cuisine! Love the Spicy Stir Fried Squid. If you love spicy food, this will be a fantastic place.
They're taking great precautions in light of the coronavirus. Their food was amazing. Great dumplings and great noodles! Get the dumplings
Simon reached out to me via email and made things right. Had a great second time experience there and wish a brach will come in Philly soon!
No comment

It's a solid place to eat. I got the medium spicy chicken dish, which was quite spicy and savory. Make sure you grab a cup of water. The restaurant has limited seating so it may take a while to grab seats for over 4 people.
This place is awesome! Great authentic and spicy food with good seating. Good quick lunch and dinner options.

This place is bomb.  The noodle soup is flavorful and delicious. The portions are filling. I have always visited at non peak hours so, there was no queue and the seating area has a really good ambience.

Inexpensive and super flavorful noodle dishes. You have to get the noodles. They are soooo silky and smooth. I was beyond full but still kept eating. Their dumplings are great and I love how you can mix and match the dishes. Cant wait to come back.

I go with my friends came to this place for the first time this Friday.We are waiting for an hour,just standing there without any waiter served for one hour. This is a very small and crowded restaurant.We all waited till 7:05pm but were suddenly told that they did not accept any order. So we asked can we ordered some appetizer,we had waited for one hour yet,but they still rejected.The restaurant shows their business hours will till 10:30pm,but only 7:05pm at that time,.Actually without any notice, suddenly told people no accept any order. Still have so many people waiting there.Never go !Never!Forever!
Authentic hunan cuisine! We ordered the super spicy pork belly bamboo shoot noodles and love it. Rich in flavor without overpowering the palate.
I ordered online 30 mins in advance and waited in the register line for another 15 mins to pickup my order... the pickup process not make any sense

Really tasty. The mild even has a kick, so beware if you're sensitive to spicy food. They told me that upfront, though, so I was fully prepared. The noodles were perfect and the squid was delish. Will def be back.
Loved their soup noodles, actually in that area around Union Square there are almost no places where you can get a proper big bowl with meat and everything in it for that price.

Walked by and decided to try this new place still in soft opening. Was SO glad I did. I got the Pork & Pepper over rice and it was the most authentic tasting Chinese meal I've had in a while. I spent a month in China a couple summers ago and this meal totally brought me back! And I only got medium spice and was delighted to find it still spicy enough to make my lips burn a lil. The atmosphere is modern and basic, and the music playing was great. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone working on the area looking for a fast place to grab some amazing Hunan food. Felt compelled to leave a review bc this place deserves more than 3 stars.

Best dumplings I've ever had wow, we had the beef ones and it blew me away! It just pops in your mouth and is cooked to crisp perfection. Not sure why all the low reviews- because people were waiting in line? It's a new business with a soft opening, people need to relax. The food itself was very delicious

If you would like to be the first one or two to share some amazing experiences here on your social media, it's worth to wait. It's understandable that how crowded would an excellent restaurant be during the opening days. Rice noodle is not just my favorite food but a represent of my hometown. Silky kitchen is the best rice noodle place undoubtedly, love it and do not accept any negative comments. 嬲塞
Not great, especially given the prices. I got the dumplings along with the noodles and neither tasted particularly good. My friend got the soup and had a similar experience.

Had dry mixed rice noodle with pork & pepper last time. Super disappointed for a resturant with this high rating. The pork has very strong pork tastes (very normal for pork killed without bleeding first and not got washed enough times) that should be covered by the pickles and pepper but didn't.
Very modern noodle place. Good place to take your friends to chill. Try the beef+daikon dumplings!

I usually don't write reviews for Chinese restaurants but this is definitely one of the most authentic places I've ever eaten at that has a hip, modern vibe. Would recommend the noodles with pork liver.

Elegant and traditional, a perfect place for rice noodles. With limited room in Manhattan, the tables made very good use with the space. Food and flavors were very authentic. Price is right. We were lucky to grab a table on a Friday night with two other friends. The cucumber salad was addictive, with crisp and bright cucumbers tossed in a spicy sesame oil-vinegar and spicy combo. Rice noodles were perfectly cooked and topped with various kinds of meat, eggs and veggies. Can't wait to come back already!!
Cute noodle place. The decorations are very cute and trendy. It's like a noodle cafe. I took my fiancé there and we loved the beef dumplings and the homemade herbal jelly!
No comment

This place is super good if you like spicy Chinese food. I am a huge fan of the Hot & Sour Chicken Gizzard. It seems really empty on Friday and I waited for only 2 mins to get my order done. Nice and clean environment, try it and you will not regret! 这家店太赞了。以后就是我食堂了

The real deal! Ordered Hunan style beef and everything turned out quick and excellent. It was spicy, beefy, seasoned goodness. Cleared my nose right up

Went last night and was totally impressed. Authentic Hunan rice noodles and Dongbei dumplings, we got the octopus one at mildly spicy, chicken intestines at medium spicy, and vegetable dumplings, very delicious. The 2 dessert options are refreshing too. I can't wait to go back.
No comment
Great food with lots of spice, good portions, and pretty decent prices. The Chairman Mao pork belly and the pork liver are my personal favourites, the stir fry chicken is really good too.
Super good, the noodles are so spicy. I have the gizzard. Tasty.

I had such an amazing meal at Silky Kitchen! To be honest I'm so familiar with Chinese cuisine and they were so helpful with helping me make decisions on what to order. At Silky you order wait for your name to be called and grab your food when it's ready. The short rib with dry noodle dish I got was fantastic! Perfectly spicy and the noodles were so so good, the meat fell of the bone. The dumplings are also a must try. I can't recommend this place enough, prices were very reasonable and everyone was so nice!
The dumplings are great and interesting. It comes with thin a pan fried thin layer, which adds some flavor and crispnesss. The beef quality and portion is also great and generous.
Really tasty and heavy on vegetables which I love!  Was perfect for this freezing cold day!  I had chicken stirfry with soup noodle. My daughter had sweet and sour vegetarian which she loved!
