Great dumplings , loved the presentation and the variety, quick service and very clean place. Try it, you won't regret.
They now have flat rice noodle, which represents real authenticity of Changsha style rice noodle. But still, the regular rice noodle is unquestionable.

The most amazing rice noodles you will ever have! The fried fresh toppings on the dry noodles are just the right spice and perfectly smokey. Try the pickled cabbage and pork or go exotic and try the gizzard.
No comment

The noodles are an interesting texture - a bit too chewy for my preference and the broth for the braised beef noodle soup was definitely too oily. The food came out really quickly, but overall I think you could find better noodle soup elsewhere in east village
The hot and sour chicken gizzard dry mix noodle is amazing! Very authentic Hunan style. Dumplings are juicy and flavorful too. My friends and I enjoyed everything we ordered here. Highly recommend.
Taste is not bad but not totally worth the price especially very small portion of each order. Can try it but would not really recommend it and would not revisit.
No comment
Now it's becoming my favorite restaurant in the city! Silky kitchen is a place for people who are into Hunan food~! Highly recommend stewed beef with soup noddles!! Try fried tofu if you can.
So SO good. This place is as authentic as it gets! Sk's noodles are so chewy and delish. Definitely try this place out if you're a noodle fan!!

I order the stewed beef noodle in soup, first the soup and noodles have no taste and so watery.i ait was awful please promise me don't go , you will regret!!!I  also order the cold spicy chicken omg even worse ！omg never come bad for truth and lifetime!
The food are really delicious and they also support good service. I definitely will came again!
Best Chinese rice noodles I've ever had in the city. Seriously try it! I'll definitely come back again!

Their food over rice is simply amazing!!! Really reminds me of street side fast serving restaurant in China. Besides having great favor, the food also comes in great portion under a reasonable price. Delivery is also fast. I can have lunch here everyday!
Nice restaurant and good service! I like the stir fried shrimp with bamboo so much~! Will recommend to my friends.
Love this Hunan tofu and vegetable dumplings!!! If you are veggie, this is definitely a good choice!!!
The food here is very delicious, my friend and I really enjoy here, also the environment is pretty

First time try while all my friends love it. The service was wonderful. The food was fresh, healthy, house made and delicious. Definitely a place that you should drop by right next to NYU in Manhattan.

it is the best rice noodle I ever tried in new york. The food might be a little bit spicy, but they taste great, especially the 农家小炒肉（pork and pepper). The pork and pepper taste like the taste in China, it's the best 农家小炒肉 I ever have in USA. The fried tofu is also great.

Easily THE BEST lunch i've ever had in Manhattan. I ordered Pork and Pepper with Dry Noodle - Medium level and hell it was worth every penny. At first I ordered Spicy level, but the cashier politely asked me if I was sure of having it Spicy ("are you used to eating spicy? If not I wouldn't suggest"). Coming from a Spicy food lover, even I knew she wouldn't exaggerate. Pork was tender and tasteful, spice level was perfect. Free wifi and charging points everywhere-- perfect for traveller :)
Spicy, true spice, but so, so good. The dumplings are AMAZING!!! The soup noodles are better than the dry, at least for the vegetarian version. Great for a snowy or rainy day.
I would like to share to everyone. Their food is so delicious. This is my favorite restaurant. I like the Spicy food. Yummy yummy!

I love hot, spicy Asian food.  The dishes I had were Stewed Beef, Stir Fried Chicken w. Chili Paste, and Woodear salad.  The heat was right for the first 2 mains unfortunately both were wayyyy greasy.  I loved the woodear salad, it was light and really delicious, I give a star just for that.  I don't think I'll return for the main courses but will definitely try other apps and dumplings next time.
No comment
best rice noodles in New York! It's paradise for spicy lover, I love it so much! Dumpling, stewed beef and tofu are my favorites! Yogurt is also very good

Absolutely love noodles but not an expert on Hunan noodles. Ordered the pork soup noodle, medium spicy. Generous amount of meat and the noodles were indeed very silky though did not hold much flavor. I was a bit disappointed as the soup wasn't very flavorful either, just spicy water. Also had dumplings and they were very good, saving my meal.
Great bowl of noodles with soup vegetables and meats. Really really good. And big portion. Super lunch or dinner. Very nice counter people. Definitely try this if you like Chinese noodles soups.

Everything is delicious, today is my first order, a noodle bowl, dumpling and crab tofu.  The taste is so good and the price is reasonable. Cannot wait to have another trip.  Thanks to those NYU Chinese students, it gives me the opportunity to get more authentic Chinese food in this area. Have a true feel of blessed.
super spicy which was a plus but the noodles were a little overcooked....but they honor their check-in deal which gives you a free topping!

Through recommendation of my friend, I went there with her  last night. that was my first time! The restaurant is so clean and comfortable! This gives a very nice first impression! I also love their restaurant creative logo! I ordered stir fried chicken w chili pasta and it is so delicious ~ it deserves going back again! next time I will order my friend' favorite dish-spicy stir fried squid
It's just amazing there's a hunan rice noodle shop here in nyc now--and the food tastes delicious. Will definitely be back!

This is a great restaurant at a great location! Every dish tastes sooo delicious and authentic that literally reminded me of China! Highly recommended! Very clean and great service! Will definitely come back for some hot pan fried dumplings again next time!
Awesome rice noodle! Authentic and so flavorful~ delicious dumpling is a must try as well. Real large portion though, could be a little smaller so I can try deserts
The cucumber salad is divine, and the dumplings are legit. Delicious food all around. Eat here!
Also recommend the beef and daikon dumplings..This is authentic Chinese Hunan food.  Next time, perhaps I'll try one of their dishes with noodles! They look great.

Everything I've tried here so far tastes amazing. Only thing is that their spicy is very very spicy. Aside from that, I love it. I think it's just replaced Xi'an Famous Foods as my new favorite noodle spot in the neighborhood.

The flat rice noodles (扁粉) are not really authentic Changsha style-- it is too chewy and with a texture similar to Udon. Despite the disappointment , it is still a great spot to satiate your soup noodle cravings.
Excellent food and even better customer service! Enjoyed both the shrimp/chive/pork dumplings and the pepper/egg soup noodles. Will definitely be back for more!

Delicious and authentic Chinese food for real -- spice and taste is on point. I've eaten of Chinese food in my lifetime and this qualifies as noteworthy. The Mapo and Sweet and Sour Vegetables are dank . Will definitely be back again to try more stuff on the menu.

It would be better if this place can serve noodles in proper bowls and not plastic containers. Its a lot of waste and feels super cheap. The noodles arent bad but the lack of proper serveware isnt great
Pricy, but very fresh, very delicious food. Staff was helpful in highlighting dishes to try on my first visit. Had an incredible shrimp dish with great heat
Really good food. I told my friends that the food here tastes like what my mom makes at home. It quickly became me and my friends' favorite restaurant! Love the spicy taste
Delicious food, but watch out for the heat! I ordered mild and it was super spicy. Would definitely go back again.

This is one of my favorite authentic Chinese restaurants in NY! From the chicken to the pork, almost all the bowls taste amazing. The quality of the ingredients is a rarity in NY. I've even stopped eating most other restaurants jn the area.

Welcome to the East Village Silky Kitchen! I ordered takeout for my holiday party and it was delicious. My favorites were the veggie dumplings, Woodear Salad and cucumber salad. The inside of the shop is super cute too and the staff is very friendly.

If you are in the area looking for authentic and delicious cuisine and a calm and welcoming atmosphere, then this is the place to go!!! The food was incredible. It was beyond tasty and the service was super fast as well! The sweet owners put so much hard work and talent into creating this lovely restaurant and it shows! I will certainly return in the future!

The Chinese Food here is really tasty. If you love spicy food, noddles and dumplings, this place is perfect. And if can't have spicy food, you can also order not spicy or mild spicy flavor. The price here is affordable. I have been here for twice. The service here is good and Chinese and English are both available. The shrimp chive pork dumplings taste great.
The pork and pickle soup noodle was so delicious and the sweet rice mochi thingy really got me! A really nice place and I loved the food.

What a lovely noodle house. So its basically "build your own noodle" type, you choose whatever you like as the toppings, and this is the best part of the Hunan rice noodle. It's kinda like a street food but restaurant' environment will make you feel home, while the price is still at street food level. Came here twice, and would like to pay another visit later this week.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: A vegetarian friendly spot which I loved. I would definitely get their eggplant in garlic sauce and the vegetable dumplings, both were so good. I thought their spiced tofu skins was a unique thing to try but I would pass on the chili cucumber salad. Their vegetable fried rice was good but their watercress mushroom dish was a little under flavored. Space is huge you could probably get seated right away.
No comment
No comment

I initially paired down my expectations for the 6 month newbie Steam. Reading the reviews on Yelp I picked up on the XLB ones and had to try. Ordered the classic pork/crab as well at the truffle XLB. VERY impressed by the size, marble color and clarity of the wrapper, very juicy interior that wasn't too fatty. Would gladly come back just for the XLB.  Szechuan Style Wontons were spicy and sweet and the wontons were plump. Also tried the pan fried Shanghai dumplings that was juicy and excellent with sweet soy sauce. The Shanghai style noodles with beef were delightfully chewy. Not pictured was the pepper steak. Would have liked a bit less peppers but overall again quite tasty.  Rarely do you go to a restaurant where all dishes were a hit. Service was attentive and welcoming.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here recently with a friend and we had a fantastic experience! As soon as we walked in, we were seated even though it was during the Saturday dinner rush. The service was prompt and friendly. The interior was bright and cozy - the perfect place to find yourself on a chilly winter evening. I had never had dim sum before this, so this was a great introduction. We started off with scallion pancakes, which came out fast and were delicious. The sampler combo of dumplings was so good, we had to order another. We also had veggie fried rice on the side. We were able to sit there for a while having some wine, and it was the perfect casual dinner after a day in the West Village/Flat Iron District. I highly recommend this place!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I'm so happy to find good Shanghainese in Greenwich Village, as there aren't as many Asian restaurants in this area except for St. Marks Place. I walked in for dinner with a friend on a Wednesday night, and was seated immediately to about a half full restaurant. We ordered the xiao long bao, beef noodle soup, and cha chiang mein. The xiao long bao could compete with Din Tai Fung - thin dumpling skins, perfectly folded, delicious filling flavor and piping hot broth! The cha chiang mein had a rich savory sauce (with a hint of sweetness and spicy), and perfectly cooked chewy udon noodles. I was also impressed by the service, as we were very well looked after throughout the meal with frequent check-ins and beverage top-ups. Overall, very comforting authentic food, clean interior, and attentive service - would recommend to anyone in the area!

Heard about this restaurant through a friend and decided to have dinner there tonight.  We ordered pork soup dumplings, pan fried dumplings, wine chicken, sweet and sour whole fish and braised pork ribs.  It was the most enjoyable meal, and the service was excellent.  All the dishes were tasty.  The pork soup dumplings were superb.  It is the best soup dumplings I can find in NYC so far.  Will definitely return to try other dishes.

Lovely and modern Chinese restaurant. Tasty food and awesomely priced lunch specials. I love the chicken & broccoli and all the soups. five stars!  Staff is so friendly. Efficient and friendly service. Many healthy options.

Tried this restaurant for a weeknight dinner with friends. Nicely accessible between subway or path train. The seating is a bit tight and I felt like we didn't have much space at all between our table and the group next to us. We ordered a couple appetizers and some mains. It was nice to see a vegetable section too. The food was good, but could use a little more flavor. Also, I was quite surprised that you have to order rice in addition to a dish, unlike many places where it comes with automatically. Overall a good experience for an easy meal out with friends and well priced for the portions.

I went on a Saturday night with my roommate - glad we made a reservation because it was pretty full. We ordered the soup dumpling sampler combo with crab, pork and truffle dumplings (2 of each). Our favorites were the crab and truffle. The soup dumplings were light and juicy - really delicious and I appreciated that it was easy to tell which was which. We also got the scallion pancakes, which came in 6 pieces and were pretty light and not too greasy. Finally, we ordered the general tso's chicken. The menu indicates it's spicy but neither of us found it spicy at all (depends on your spice tolerance!). It came with broccoli, but we had to request rice on the side (it never came, but they apologized profusely for forgetting and we were stuffed enough that we didn't need it!). Overall, really cute and delicious!

Regular food, nothing special, sub par. Wouldn't come back. I was charged for a dish that I didn't touch. I literally bit a small piece in which the server acknowledged and still charged me. Do not buy the red bean pancake, please don't.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very rarely do I have an A1 experience at a restaurant, and this was one of them. Every single item we ordered was a fresh, vibrant, and delectable experience! We started with the soup dumpling sampler combo, the truffle dumplings were the truth! They were delicate and just the right size. Next we shared the Cha Chiang Mein, it was savory with the perfect chew and hit all the right notes. The watercress with enoki mushrooms was a symphony of flavors and an unexpected winner. I'll need to get this dish at every meal here, going forward. We finished up with the Dai Pai Dong rice, which had shrimp and Chinese sausage, it was very satisfying. Needless to say, we were so stuffed we could not order any more but I'd like to try everything in this menu! The establishment was clean and nicely decorated and the waitstaff friendly and helpful. We WILL return!

Every dish at @steam_nyc was really good and the people there were super friendly! Chinese food in the US is usually too salty, oily, or heavily seasoned, but none of those was the case here! It almost felt like eating in Asia. My favorite was definitely the wuxi ribs - super tender and well seasoned. Xiaolongbao was pretty good too! Would definitely recommend coming in groups to try their food.
No comment

Very reasonably priced and the soup dumplings are amazing! Probably cheaper BYOB but you can not go wrong with anything on the menu. Staff is very attentive and service is fast and friendly. The rice was missing some flavor but overall I loved the meal.
No comment
Delicious food and ambiance, my Shanghai lo mein noodles were amazing!! The service was nice but a bit of a wait for our food. It was worth it though because everything came out tasting amazing.
No comment
No comment

Loved loved loved this place. Sister saw it on instagram and TikTok and was like we need to go. We enjoyed the beef wrapped pancake, soup dumplings, the gua bao and many more. Staff was great and good delicious. I will definitely be back to try more items from the menu !
No comment

A gem! Fiancé and I were craving dim sum last night and we gave this place a shot. Service from the moment we arrived was outstanding, and everyone working there was so helpful and gracious. The restaurant is also nicely decorated and clean with 2 gender-neutral bathrooms. Shared 5 dishes for 2 people and we were stuffed: pan fried pork dumplings, pork XLB, aromatic beef wrapped in scallion pancake, scallion pancake, and Szechuan style wontons. Loved all the dishes and would recommend. Fiancé's favorite was the XLB. Bring a crew so you can try more of the menu. We got a free sweet red bean pancake to go because we checked in on Yelp, but haven't tried it yet. Adding Steam to our rotation!
Bland, Americanized food. Basically on the level of a takeout place. Servers were very nice and friendly to their credit.

THIN soup dumplings my kids fought for!  Truffle bits for a perfect soup, nothing overwhelming.  Chilled pork & garlic sauce that was delicious with the balance of the cucumber.  A forgettable bamboo dish and the Szechuan wontons that were surprising delish - just needed a splash of vinegar.  Other than that, great service and cannot wait to come back!!!
No comment

Delicious! Delicious! Delicious! Food was amazing and the customer service was on point. My husband and I shared everything. Lo Mein were cooked perfect, beef shumai great especially with the hint of tangerine, bao was bomb. Overall great spot with fresh flavorful food and great staff. Definitely will come back again.
Various great items to pick from on menu. Although my husband still has his favorite soup dumpling place he will come here just for their black truffle and pork soup dumplings! They're are the best!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Everything was so good. Decorating is warm and cozy; staffs are super nice. Truffle soup dumplings and silken eggs with shrimp are must try! Highly recommended!!!
Outstanding in every way:  good food, excellent service, reasonable prices, attractive decor.  A great addition to the downtown restaurant scene.

Delicious! My favorite was the wine chicken and truffle soup dumplings. The truffle dumplings were fantastic and full of flavor. Service was great, I was attended to regularly and our waitress was quick and friendly. Would recommend!

I had high hopes for this place, but found that most of their entrees are breaded and fried (including spicy chicken). The batter used for this was thick and not very flavorful, taking away from the meal. Also, I loves me some spicy, and the "spicy chicken" was pretty bland. Went back a second time to see if it was just a one-off miss on the food, but the second instance was the same - for me and my guests.
I love this place! I've done both dine-in and take out and have no complaints. Food is amazing and inexpensive. Highly recommend the Dan Dan noodles

Not one to ever write reviews but this place is DELICIOUS! I got the crab and pork XLB, the shrimp dumplings (har gao), and hot and sour soup. The shrimp dumplings is the best I've ever had! The dumpling skin is so chewy yet thin and the shrimp is fresh. The XLB is so perfectly crafted with perfectly thin and chewy wrapper that holds the soup very well. My fav meal of my trip to NYC so far!
No comment

New restaurant and came here for lunch on Saturday, where they have lunch specials even on the weekend. We had mabu dof, Szechuan dumplings and sweet-and-sour soup.  everything was excellent. Having traveled to Hong Kong, China and having lived in Asia for a number of years I can absolutely say the wontons are authentic and delicious. Come early before this place gets crazy popular. The people are very nice and the interior dining area is beautiful. Perfect for village not over done and neighborhood like
We loved this place.  The lunch we had was excellent.  The owner chatted with us throughout our meal and the food was terrific.
We ordered crab meat soup dumplings, pork dumplings, fried spring rolls, fried pork buns, Scallion Pancakes, everything tastes so good! And watch out everything is so hot too!

Went for lunch today. Beautiful, clean and tasty restaurant. I ordered the wonton in chili oil, shrimp and chive dumplings, general Taos chicken and noodles. Everything was delicious. Will definitely be visiting again. Also the staff is upper friendly. Great neighborhood restaurant.

A friendly neighborhood restaurant has the best soup dumplings in town! Love their decor and food presentation! Their cozy party room can accommodate small to midsize gatherings. Their selection of wine will be my next try.
Great soup dumplings and the spare ribs were fabulous. Strongly recommend this restaurant
No comment

Great food, comfortable atmosphere, quick and attentive service. My companion and I ordered the soup dumpling sampler, Shanghai style lo mein, bok choy w/ white wine sauce, and pork buns. The food was excellent. Lo mein noodles were delicious- great texture and delicious pan-fried flavor, but we enjoyed all the dishes. Would certainly return.

This restaurant has only been open a few months and they already have a loyal following!  Food is incredible and the staff is friendly and super efficient. We tried the soup dumplings and the scallion pancakes. Both were incredibly delicious!
Wonderful Food, Professional Services, Excellent Quality, Manager Ben is so nice and professional.
No comment

Came here for lunch on a Labor Day Monday and was seated right away.  Order 3 dum sum dishes (XLB, Beef Siu Mai and Har Gow).  They were all very good especially the Har Gow.  The skins on the dim sum were then and good fillings.   We ordered shrimp rice cake and tomato braised oxtail.  The rice cakes were good but was small dish.  The braised oxtail was full of flavor and had grape tomatoes but can be cooked a bit longer.  Meat was definitely not falling off the oxtails.  The Shanghai Bok Choy was cooked perfectly as well. We will be back when in Manhattan again.  There was a line when we left!  Service was good.  The waitress was soft spoken but very tentative.
Best place to eat at, this place is a hidden gem no cap. All the food tastes amazing and the service is incredible stg...

The food here is very authentic and delicious. The menu has half authentic dishes half Americanized dishes. The soup dumplings are great. Very thin and stretchy wraps are filled with juicy and flavorful filling. The crab in the dumplings are quite fresh. The wine chicken is very nostalgic and delicious. The beef wrapped in scallion pancake is freshly made and very crispy, without being greasy at all. Amazing new spi
Amazing food and service! I will be coming back here for sure  dumplings and the noodles were so good.
No comment
Great staff - super friendly and helpful. Food is always good. Reminds me of home cooking. Will be back.
Nice ambiance, very friendly staff and most importantly great food. Loved all the dumpling dishes. Will be a regular here!

What a nice addition to the neighborhood especially with so many Chinese restaurants gone since the pandemic.  Certainly more upscale than typical restaurants.  We've done take-out but eating in is a very nice experience as well.
Good food nice place in the town! Love there dumplings, Will go back to try another dishes

My favorite Chinese restaurant (Charlie Moms) was two doors down from STEAM  and when I heard from a cousin that this new place was just as good I had to try it. WHAT A FIND !!!! This new restaurant is so wonderful that I have been there 3 times in 2 weeks and every one I went with feel the same. The menu is very diverse with dim sum, noodles, rice dishes, dumplings, and different touches to the old regulars. I recommend everything I've had so far......all kinds of soup dumplings, especially truffle and pork, vegetables dumplings which had the thinnest covering I've every seen, cold sesame noodles (really peanutty) , fried noodles with beef (so crispy) and silky eggs with shrimp and truffle -exquisite, But I've saved the best for last...scallion pancakes wrapped around beef and vegetables and the baby bok choy....TO DIE FOR. Besides being beautifully designed with interesting touches, I recommend this wonderful new find in the village.
Came to this place for lunch, everything was excellent. Ordered the scallion pancake, pork soup dumplings, Wuxi spareribs, and red bean pancakes. Food was very flavorful. Would definitely come back!

Extremely good, new addition to the neighborhood. Service was fantastic, and recommendations provided by our server were spot on. Got the Pork Soup Dumplings, Beef wrapped in Scallion Pancake (a must get), cucumber and woodear mushrooms, Dan Dan noodles, and Taiwanese beef noodle soup. All were very flavorful and good portion sizes. Bonus was they have a very tasty chili oil to add to dishes. Will definitely be back to try their other dim sum and menu items!

The service is really bad. Got the order wrong 2 times. They fixed the first order, but for the second order, we order pan fried pork buns, and the server gave us dumplings instead, then told us they don't have any pork buns anymore and forced us to have the dumplings. They act like we don't know anything about Chinese food. Why would I pay for something I don't want, should've told us earlier.

The dishes we ordered from Steam were as good as it gets!  I highly recommend the meaty fall off the bone spareribs in a perfectly balanced sauce as well as the beef lo mein. I can't wait to sample other dishes on the  menu.

Just happened to walk pass this restaurant and decided to try them out. We ordered the soup dumpling sampler, beef noodle soup and the spare ribs lunch set. Every dish is so good! Soup dumplings were sooo juicy. Spare ribs were so tender. Beef noodle soup was so therapeutic. The dishes were all reasonably priced as well. Recommend!

My neighbor recommended this new restaurant in the neighborhood, so I figured I'd give it a try with the lunch special. I was pleasantly surprised. The quality of the food was excellent. I ordered chicken with broccoli, spring rolls, and hot & sour soup. I loved everything! The interior of the restaurant has a clean modern aesthetic. The staff is very friendly. I'm looking forward to trying the curry chicken or the pepper steak next time. Definitely recommend.
So pleased with this new restaurant.  Really delicious and fresh.  Great design too.  Can't wait to return.

I've nearby and have been waiting for this place to open. Area did not disappoint!  It's clean, bright, and the service is great. The food is fabulous. We got the fried pork dumplings, scallion pancakes, general tso's chicken, and the shirt ribs. Everything was so f good!  Will def be back soon and I'm looking forward to making this my regular spot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The worst! Waited a decade for host to come and get me seated. Shashlik wasn't properly cooked, meze plates wasn't tasty at all, waiters were inattentive.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Another outstanding meal. The meat is absolutely delicious. The sides are to die for and the drinks have a kick! Come here if you want to enjoy a delicious, unique, fun experience for your mouth. You can savor every bite.
Great restaurant in the mall. Each kabob comes with 8-10 sides including an excellent babaganoush. The whole grilled fish takes top honors.

Naked Tomato is the more formal restaurant of the Miznon chain. While the food is very good, the service is actually more in line with a fast casual chain restaurant than the formal restaurant it is supposed to be. The cocktails are good, but the wine list is very limited. The meal starts with a selection of mezze (hummus is extra) and then you order skewers. The mezze are good, not great but the skewers are excellent.
Delicious food but very slow, not so friendly service. A great option if you're already at Hudson Yards but I wouldn't travel specifically for the restaurant.

Awesome choice for a quick workday lunch in Hudson Yards. Great deal on endless mezze and skewers (if you don't order an entree per person, there will be a $25 charge for the mezze). So delicious and the pita is amazingly fluffy.
No comment
No comment
Great ambience.  Food was good.  Just got the pita.  Was not a fan of how they drenched it in sauce and food sliding all over the place.  Would comeback though.
No comment
No comment

I love the concept - like many restaurants in Israel, the meal at Naked tomato starts with a ton of small dishes - like different kinds of eggplant, peppers, labne, beets, cabbage, etc. these come with THE most delicious, warm pita.  You can get all of these small dishes refilled.  The small dishes come with any choice of main dish.  I tried the lamb kabob, which is usually the most delicious dish at eyal Shani restaurants, but here the lamb was really undercooked.  Husband got entrecôte and also didn't love it.  We agreed that the small dishes are the show here.  Great service.  Anyway, we would definitely come back! Didn't give five starts only because my husband and I both had issues with the meat preparation.
No comment

Food was very tasty and interesting different concept. A bit pricey as others reference. Servers are very friendly and bubbly but what I found a bit frustrating, it was not uncommon that they were out if things or no longer making them. Either that night or its been removed. Or maybe I just asked for the wrong things? So they will ask you which sides you would like refilled, and then too often the response is, "We don't have any more of that. Is there anything else you would like refilled? Sorry we are out of that one. Is there anything else...". How abt start out saying what you are out of? This happened with my cocktail choice. And also the request for the shrimp. And many of the sides. When you hit on something they had it was like a buzzer went off. So unlimited refills sounds great but....

One of the best meals I had in NYC!!! Besides the abundant number of small dishes/mezze provided (all free and refillable with skewer orders, mostly veggie based), the skewers was delicious and had a good portion. The service was amazing as well - our hostess led me and my partner to see the skewers in a display case before ordering to get a sense of what they are. I order the Abu Jasmine cocktail - definitely on the sweeter side (orange juice) and had a lot of alcohol content. Would 100% go back and recommend!

You order two meat skewers at this place and with them come like 20 side dishes. We thought they were going to be small dishes but they were all fairly large considering how many there were. Everything was tasty but we felt like the amount of side dishes was overkill (at least for two people). I feel like they should warn parties of less than 4 that it's a literal ton of food. Otherwise great meal. Felt bad a lot went to waste though.

The naked tomato is built for groups and sharing.  The waitstaff is energic and extremely enthusiastic about the joys of the naked tomato! The menu is simply (and is actually called "Simple Menus").  You order a main dish and they take care of the apps.  I was with a party of five (Baily, Claudia, Charlie. . . (any 90's pop culture peeps out there?) ).  We ordered 5 kebobs, all of which were delicious -- with the duck being extra special.  The real prize, however, comes before the main dish, when warm pitas arrive accompanied by countless small plates of delicious goodies, all designed to help you make the perfect pita.
No comment

Insane. I can't even describe the food... the tahini... the hummus and THAT PITA! Service was meh but the location decor atmosphere and food made up for it! Check this place out for sure, the menu changes Eve try day!

Absolutely delicious seafood, beef, or chicken skewers. And with the price of a skewer they give you all the veggies you can eat and the veggies are incredible and make the meal. Don't order extras because they bring you as much veggies as you can eat and there's so many kinds it's delicious. Beads, potato salad, spicy cucumbers, spicy carrots, hummus, everything is delicious. Two thumbs up!
No comment

We visited on a quiet night, only two other groups in the restaurant. The staff member who seated us and explained the menu and then took our order, etc, was a very pleasant young man.  After that the service went down hill as the young woman assigned to service our table was virtually absent and we had to seek her out to get our small plates replaced. We waited  more than 10 minutes for Pita (surprising in an empty-ish restaurant). We felt like she was doing us a favor, a 180 from the 1st employee we dealt with. Food was good, particularly the mezzes but only 5 pieces of grilled octopus on a skewer for $39 was a surprise.   Please note that when we were about to pay the check the 1st employee asked how our meal was and when we discussed our disappointment with service he offered to bring us a glass of wine but we were already about to leave.  Would we go back, let you know after we try Laser Wolf in a few weeks.

Came to this establishment yesterday with my family.  We have since been extremely sick due to food poisoning (symptoms includes shivers, fever, "the runs", loss of appetite).  While I've been a fan in the past, this experience makes me question the cleanliness and preparation of their food (specifically the small plate salads).

Great spot to stop while shopping in Hudson Yard as there is both a cafe and sit down restaurant. Great service here and the food is incredible. With one entree, dishes of appetizers decided by the chef is included in your meal with fresh, warm pita bread. However, each member in your party must order at least one entree as the amount of apps given per party is extensive. Definitely would recommend the lamb main entree :)
Great Israeli food. Brazilian was amazing. Great salad. Grest service and presentation. Good drinks but very very weak on red wines.

Outstanding food & it would be darn near impossible to leave hungry! Unique setup of many tasty appetizers brought out at the beginning of the dining experience and then followed by excellent shaslik (chicken or lamb skewers). Service was very good and the location in the Hudson Yards complex is wonderful! Enjoy!

I'm in nyc with a customer and we had a great time. Service was great and attentive. Menu selections are  diverse - ordering small plates to share and then kababs with a selection of meats. Awesome quality of food!

We were accidentally running into this restaurant while looking for a place for lunch after visiting Vessel.  This was our first time to have Israeli food. Everything was so good, it took us by completely surprise. Besides the unbelieved amount of small dishes they offered, we ordered octopus shishlik and duck breast. Octopus was excellent but duck was a little bit over cooked. This place is built for sharing so next time I will definitely bring a big party to here.

This place was very disappointing. Their system is ass backwards, as well as their service. Solid advice - please examine your itemized bill.  They implement false charges and the little saving grace was, they were able to rectify that potent problem without having to escalate the erroneous issue further - in my situation fortunately. The quality of the food was okay ; Definitely not delectably out of this world and not the polar opposite, feces on a platter.  The ambient concept was suppose to be a "hip and classy" vibe but the place provided "empty energy" and was a bit vacant and desolate. We couldn't wait to leave - it was just repelling, unwelcoming, unwanted energy. As I finish this review, I also was not encouraged to generously tip as well as I normally do (22-25% in most cases) based on my experience.  Lastly, Naked Tomato is a fucking stupid name for an Israeli/Mediterranean restaurant/eating establishment.  (Due diligence was done, and we did not blindly dine at this spot expecting Italian food).
No comment
No comment

Condescending rude manager. I'd say stay away from this restaurant, especially if you're local New Yorkers. There are so many Mediterranean restaurants in the city that can serve as great tasting food as this one. However, this is the one that ruins your experience with their operations, services, and to top it off, with the manager. After our meal, we went through 40 minutes of 5 iterations of bills as they could not figure out the exact charge for our table. And when the manager finally came out, she was extremely arrogant and her first question (not an apology!) was, "there is only $1 overcharge we did on your check, what is the problem here?" although this was after their 3rd bill that overcharged 4 more drinks!! So it really did it for us. When she added further to say "we have 2 servers covering all tables so there can be confusions but this is how all restaurants are nowadays" we were thrown off at how arrogant and unprofessional she is as a manager. And she asked us to take out our own calculators, yes!! she did!, to confirm her last bill was correct, we were very very upset. This is not what you want your customers to experience at your restaurant. I do not recommend this experience.

No seasoning on the skewers and just bland. One skewer is $40 or more with like 3 unseasoned pieces (I ordered the octopus, which were 3 small pieces), and the rest on the skewer are just onions and jalapeno. My friend and I were the only customers, but waitress lacked any service and was drinking on the job, not even trying to hide it. Had to remind her about our drinks several times. Did not mention that the skewer stick was super hot. So I burnt my finger. Would never come back.
Delicious food and I love the concept of having a variety of dishes. We will definitely be back and bring friends

On our way to the Naked Tomato, we read the 5 reviews that added up to 2.8 stars, and decided that it's probably out of jealousy. We came in, wanting to give the place the best reviews possible. Unfortunately, the food was really not tasty, the mezzes were unsalted, lacking flavors and really disappointing. Service was one of the worst ever!! Definitely not in Eyal Shani's league!! The pita bread was wonderful, I'll give it that, but I'm NEVER repeating the experience..!!!
Spectacular drinks and the rice sanwiches were incredible. Cannot recommend this place enough. Yummy!
No comment
No comment

The lady at the desk was so nice and helpful when I ask for suggestions. Got a matcha latte and two of the sandwiches. Miso tuna avocado and spicy fried chicken. Reminded me of little Japanese cafe. I really like the matcha latte very authentic and flavorful. Of the other two, I like the chicken one better!

Ordered through Ritual for two onigirazus and a matcha latte. The pickup time was accurate. The veggie tofu nugget one was very tasty and a great snack. The matcha latte was very good as well. Everything was packaged really well and secure. It's worth the trip as it is a bit of a walk from the train.
No comment
No comment

Had matcha latte and salmon and eggs. The drink is standard, nothing special. You could taste slight bitterness of the matcha powder, which is good and authentic. Now comes my biggest gripe. The texture of the rice used in onigirazu is not soft nor sticky enough that would supposedly bond all the ingredients into one harmonious ball! I understand that you are not supposed to squeeze the rices in onigirazu. Nevertheless, It seems the rice were left in the rice pot overnight. This would have been perfect to make fried rice but not acceptable for onigiri. Because of that, the whole onigirazu falls apart when trying to bite into it and making a mess all over. In my opinion, I would not give a passing grade to it. Hence a two star for onigirazu. 3 stars when considered holistically.

The two onigirazu options we tried were pretty plain tasting. They are filling because packed mostly with rice so if one is hungry I guess it's a good option. The ones I could get at 7-11 in Japan and other East Asian countries are much better flavor wise. Almost every savoury dish has refined sugar added so not very healthy either.

Such a cute cafe. They make their food fresh to order and the tea was delicious. Only have one table outside to sit, but luckily it was available for us. The two people working there were very kind and helpful to explain different items. Definitely want to return.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I love this place! The best quality matcha tea drinks. They add the perfect amount of each ingredient (e.g. matcha, yuzu and ginger). I crave it! The onigirazu is made fresh to order and there is a good selection to choose from, including vegetarian options. I also like that there is the perfect ratio of rice to ingredients in between and it is not too salty. Always hits the spot. Finally, the service is always pleasant and helpful.
No comment

I travelled to Hawaii recently, and began craving a SPAM musubi. So, I tried an onigirazu, basically the same thing. It was a large, filling portion and very delicious. Friendly staff, and super quick delivery. I will most definitely be ordering again, and plan to stop in their East Village location eventually. Yum!

Walked in and noticed a group ordering at the register, so I decided to place an online order to speed up the process. After the group had finally finished checking out, the employee asked if I needed help, to which I responded, "I've placed my order online" (showing her my phone). Instead of completing my order once they were done, she proceeded to follow the group outside and continue their conversation, leaving myself and the customer behind me standing there waiting. About 5 minutes passed by without being acknowledged at all (mind you, there were 2 other employees prepping food in the shop. I ordered ONE DRINK and the woman was still outside talking to the group. Finally someone in the shop asked what I was waiting for (once they noticed me standing there awkwardly). One of them grabbed a ticket that had been sitting there for a while, and proceeded to make my drink. She handed it to me, and there was over an inch of empty space left in the cup. I didn't pay $8 for a latte just to be served a cup that wasn't even full. Between being ignored and not given the value I paid for, this service is unacceptable.
No comment
No comment
THIS PLACE IS THE BEST!!! I inhaled it before I had time to eat the rice balls. And it's the coziest ambience
A bit on the pricey side for what it is. The onigirazu does make a great light lunch at the Tompkins Square Park nearby. The cold brew is pretty good.
No comment

I really wanted to love this place from the high ratings that it got from other reviews. And there were plenty of things to love - a wide array of onigirazu, other types of desserts and drinks, a nice staff member taking our orders. But I had gotten a chicken karaage and I was somewhat disappointed. The rice to filling ratio was really high (i.e. too much rice), and both onigirazu tasted bland (not sure if intrinsically bland or because of the disproportionate amount of rice). And it took us about 15-20 minutes just to get the 4 snack-sized orders. The prices are decent so it didn't feel like a huge loss, and I would go again for a snack or something, but overall it was neither bad nor impressive.
No comment
My favorite lunch spot in the neighborhood! Croissant sandwiches, onigiri, bento boxes... all delicious. Their iced coffee is also fantastic, and they are the nicest people. Love it here!

Good lord I just ordered the Curry flavored Cheese Teriyaki Chicken with Fried Egg Onigirazu (spicy) and it was 100% absolutely DELICIOUS!  I live not 2 blocks away and yet had never ordered from here although I had heard of it.  Well, it arrived warm and fresh and I can't say how much it hit the spot, we loved it!

Tokuyama is the best kept secret in the East Village. It's tiny so it's very easy to miss but the onigirazu are so delicious. The staff is extremely nice and we go there almost once a week with our dog and eat outside. Only downside is it takes forever so definitely place your order in advance. However it takes a while because each onigirazu is made by hand and is very well balanced with just a hidden bit of wasabi and you can tell they are made with care and patience. 10/10 definitely get their blue moon milk as well it's soo good and their chai!! Thank you Tokuyama!
No comment
super cute little find.  great rice ball sandwiches (onigirazu) and great coffee.  so good.  def recommend.
No comment

Tokuyama Salon Cafe is a little tiny cafe that is famous for their Onigirazu. I ordered a plain one with egg which they made to order! It was perfectly warm and so delicious. Overall a great time! Next time I would try the salmon onigirazu which sounded amazing.
No comment

This is a very nice coffee shop/cafe with friendly employees in a really laid back by. Locals frequent the small space with it's cute, vintage cafe decor, but most take their orders to go.  Those who stay are also friendly. It was nice to know they have non-dairy milk options for your beverages is well is sandwiches and pastries. Not a bad spot to grab a quick bite or a beverage.
No comment
No comment

It almost hurts to share this spot with other people but they deserve the business. Try the rice ball combo with miso soup and edamame and also the hibiscus matcha. It's just the right amount but they do take long to make it sometimes because of high demand. I suggest ordering in Grubhub if you don't wanna wait.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Finally found a chance to check out this adorable Japanese cafe that I have been following on IG for quite some time now. The staff was very friendly and thoughtful. My friend and I each had the onigirazu plate sets, which consists of 2 onigirazu (I chose Chicken Karaage w/Garlic Oil and Aloha Spam), miso soup, and a side of edamame. It was a good portion size and very tasty, satisfied my onigiri craving. Unfortunately, I did not get to try any of their popular matcha drinks, but I will be back soon. Definitely worth the trip.

The creamy matcha latte is so good! It has cream added to the regular matcha lattes I could really taste the deep flavors of the matcha, unlike a lot of other places where it's much more milky. They also have hojicha, golden turmeric, and a seasonal pumpkin spice latte. I'll definitely be back to try their desserts.

My favorite local cafe! I discovered them on Caviar over the summer and was super happy when I figured out they were walking distance from my apartment. I go about once a week for a delicious matcha latte (the creamy one is great!) and a baked good. Their almond croissant is incredible! The staff members are incredibly friendly and make me feel welcome every time I visit. We'll be back next week!

Gotta hit this place before you go to the park - I really love the croissant sandwiches.  They are substantive too. And very fresh.  No made in the am and waiting for you hours later.  They se to have a lot of matcha but I also go for the dirty chai which is a standout amongst the many I've tried in EV/LES.   Plus the place is really cute inside. I wish they had indoor seating.  Oh and the onigiri and the bowls are great too. I don't know if the veggies are local but they taste like farmers market finds imho.  Fast delivery too!
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite neighborhood Mom & Pop shops in Alphabet City, run by a hard-working family!  This Nihongo cafe's version of made-to-order Onigiri is not only scrumptious but packed full of unusual ingredients like warm shiso-rice, burdock root, salmon/chicken/beef, eggplant, etc. and all of this can be eaten there (outside) or to go.  The coffee, matcha, and golden milk hot drinks are the perfect accompaniment to the onigirazu.  And best of all, freshly made almond croissants.  Sweet and savory...Oishii desu yo!
Japanese cafe owned by Japanese. Their salmon shiso Onigirazu was sooo yummy!  Maccha latte is also my favorite.

This place is a must try! Tokuyama Salon Cafe is known for their onigirazu, which is a fancier version of the more common onigiri. So far, the flavors I've tried are: Salmon Salad, Salmon and Shiso, Japanese Fried Chicken, Spam Aloha, and Imitation Crab Salad with Avocado; they were all very fresh and delicious! I have also had the Guydon Rice Bowl with Scallion and Egg and that was full of flavors, I absolutely loved it. Tokuyama Cafe Salon is also extremely reasonably priced, so please try it out if you haven't! They also do delivery, which I have been super happy about because that means I get to enjoy their food more often!

I was looking forward to trying this cafe but was underwhelmed by the food. I ordered an iced coffee and a pressed star avocado and cheese sandwich. The coffee was fine but the sandwich came out soggy, not at all like the cute pictures of the pressed star sandwiches. The sandwich was so salty that it became unappetizing; I could only eat half.

Oh my God, Tokuyama Salon Café was actually great. Best service, clean, and nice ambience. Every single thing was very delightful and I can not wait to go back already. Workers are incredibly nice and service is really fast. Yum!

Visited this gem recently and I have to admit it's one of the best cafes in East Village. The food and coffee are things you can't get in any other coffee shop because as you're working & drinking coffee, you can order small portions or something big/fulfilling to satisfy your hunger. This is something you can't find in many coffee shops. Also, the owners are very kind and actually speak with customers which is something you don't see often. Appreciate the time spent here and would definitely revisit 10/10

I never ever write reviews but this place is simply incredible - best onigiri in town - hands down. This authentic Japanese cafe had matcha way before all the basics discovered it. Places like these (and there remains very few of them) make East Village truly special!

Great Chai tea latte! It's hard to find chai, and since i gave up coffee i have to go on missions to find chai, let alone a good chai, so i was so happy to find this place ! Food was yummy too, very good croissant just wish they had a little bit more food options on display. Overall great little cafe !

We are visiting from Chicago and stumbled into this lovely and quaint cafe. This is such a lovely little Japanese cafe with good snacks. It is around the NYU neighborhood with beautiful music  & decors and just super relaxing. It is known for its Matcha  and their sandwiches are lovely and tastes really good. I would strong recommend a visit while you are in town.

column3: ブルックリン, ブルックリン, NY
column6: I had my very first Onigirazu here and loved it.  I tried Salmon egg and Kinpira and I must say both exceeded my expectation.  Not only are they tasty but also decently priced considering it's so filling and you won't need anything else.  also, their matcha latter is a real deal.  it is definitely one of the best I've tasted in the city!!

Cute spot, good decor, limited but nice seating with tables, enjoyable classical/oldie music playing. However, matcha latte was basically just warm milk with some matcha powder - disappointing. Didn't order anything to eat so can't speak to the food.
No comment

I just happened to stumble upon this little cozy café as I was wandering the streets of East Village. With no hesitation I was greeted as I walked in and was recommended a variety of options to try. I had a matcha latte and it was soooo good. It even had a little panda drawn on top made of matcha. They made fresh rice balls on the spot and they were just as satisfying as the latte. Great customer servers and a chill vibe! I 100% recommend checking this place out!!
No comment

I was overcharged for an iced latte on purpose here at Tokuyama Salon Café. The price was clearly $5 and was charged $6.50. This wasn't a mistake as the person with dyed hair put a dollar from the cash I handed her into the tip jar right in front of me. I asked for a receipt but I could not be given one. Maybe I'm in the minority here but when I get coffee I prefer not to be swindled out of a buck and a half.

I came across this spot walking home one day. The staff is so incredibly kind (trust me, i'm southern and don't just say that) and I inhale the onigirazu like air. They are operating during COVID, I will go here just to support them! ugh so good

Highly Recommend this cafe. Last week I went this cafe. It was my first time. Actually I've learned to speak Korean. Fortunately, there is one staff speaks korean. He taught me how to speak Korean as well. And he made coffee for me, explained to me about coffees and very kind. It was fun. Actually I went today too. He remember me also he made coffee for me. Coffee was awesome, very kind and relaxed! I will visit again soon with my Korean friends. Can't wait!
I really like it here. I always get the iced chai latte. The people who work here are so nice! I haven't tried the food yet but it looks great.

Hidden gem with delicious traditional matcha and handmade rice balls. I got the plate with miso soup, quinoa salad, and two rice balls- one with salmon and egg, the other with fried chicken. Everything was delicious. It is honestly so hard to find places that give such a personal touch to their food and drinks, and the tiny cafe is the perfect quiet low-fi hip hop getaway to get a meal alone or share with a special friend. I will be coming here often!
The guy who works from Friday to Sunday , you need to try his coffee ! That s the best so far I tried in NYC , and he is with a warm and sunny heart and always makes your day !

Went for my usual coffee run and found out they now have Matcha scones and muffins! They're vegan and taste delicious. I personally like the muffin more as it's perfectly paired with banana, which gives it the right amount of sweetness. Their new addition did not disappoint!
I walked pass and saw this lovely cafe place in East Village. It was a nice place and a guy with glasses working here was so kind and very helpful. I will definitely coming back here again.
This place is amazing. The service is really great. Jun was very nice, patient and knowledgeable. The ambiance and sitting is great. Highly recommended!

Stumbled upon this adorable gem one Saturday afternoon. Tucked away in one of the side streets of Alphabet city it's truly a charming little spot. Jun, the barista was welcoming and offered friendly conversations. Above all, the coffee was great and so were the lattes! If you're looking for a quiet and relaxed place to meet with friends or catch up with work visit Tokuyama!

This place is a treasure! Beautiful and charming decor (I wish I could steal the wallpaper!), makes you feel like you've stumbled on a little secret. Delicious onigirazu and great coffee as well. If you've visited cafes in Japan it will feel like a little trip back there.

I love this gem of a spot! It's super cozy and cute inside. Although it is a small space, I still enjoy how relaxing and lovely the cafe is. My favorite drink is the iced matcha latte which tastes super authentic and refreshing. I replace it with almond milk because I don't consume dairy, but it still tastes delicious. I usually go on the weekends when it gets a bit busy but the barista is still really friendly and accommodating. I definitely want to try the pastries next time as well!!!
Best coffee in Alphabet City - amazing crema! The decor is very homey and it's conveniently located opposite from the community garden. Will be coming here regularly!
Found this place while walking around Tompkins Sq Park. Totally a fan of the matcha latte and chill environment. Ask Jun if you need a recommendation for a quick eat to go with your drink.
